reviews.review: A visual feast. This second visit was better than my first. Compared to the first there were many more stalls open and less people also, both of which allowed a better appreciation of the work and effort that must go into setting up the stalls. It makes Selfridges food hall in London look like a second rate untidy mess. This is how to present food, some of the fruit stalls were extraordinarily laid out with fabulous displays of colour and layer upon layer of magnificent huge voluptuous fruit and veg. The amount of different empanadas on sale was amazing too, and its almost impossible not to buy something no matter how determined you are. I doubt there are many bargains to be had, but who cares when it all looks so magnificent. The only irritant is the amount of dumb tourists doing nothing but waving selfie sticks and their cameras around and who clearly have no intention of buying anything...oh well

Overhyped. Really waited to visit whats the hype is all about. I found out a regular tourist market, nothing special. Bought myself a fruit shake for euro and a half, took some pictures and that's it. For my opinion, Jamon is cheaper at local grocery stores.

Marketing at its best. A delightful market place filled with a multitude of stalls selling everything from candies and herbs to meats and fish. Something for everyone to try and taste. Fairly crowded on the weekends but very visitor friendly.

Pretty cool. After visiting the Cathedral we walked around Barcelona and stubbled upon the Mercat. This is a pretty awesome place to grab some excellent fruit, fresh seafood, or amazing candy. There are several vendors that are set up for you to try and buy some of the locals best. I wouldn't say this is a tourist destination must see, but we really recommend visiting the Mercat

Fresh food - an amazing amount.. A fabulous place to just visit but also a great place to eat with choice of meats, cheeses, fruit, vegetables, fish galore. We ate at a food counter having baby squid, a cold dish of cod, tomato & onion - very enjoyable. A crepe from another stall to finish. We have a very good market in Adelaide which is a major tourist attraction but this really tops it.

Very nice place to be . This area is mid big food market. Many place and market in the world copy the idea and Athmosphere. In one case you can find all fresh food, sea food, also small snacks, bars and restaurants. For sea food trenders it's very nice. Recommended, to have afternoon, there's many exotics fruits that sells in plates, papaya, cocus, inoa, ananas and it can be a real good snack meal mid day.

Not to be missed. We visited this market off la Rambla at lunchtime. It was very crowded with not many places to sit and eat. Many stalls selling the same or very similar products. Fruit salads, fresh juices, nuts, fresh meat and seafood etc. Great atmosphere and good for spending 30 odd minutes if you do t plan to eat there. If you are one of the lucky ones to find seating around one of the bars serving mainly seafood then lunch is worth it. We ended up spending 30 euros for a plate of scallops (3 in total) with a mushroom mix which was very tasty and a grilled sea bream that was delicious. As the bars were very busy they were only serving part of their menu of main courses only which was a shame. Customer service was rushed but still friendly compared to the U.K. Don't buy the coconut for drinking as it's a rip-off. We paid 1.50 Euros for 4 small sips.

Food market . Amazing! So much choice in fresh and other foods, seafood, meats, cheeses, fruit and vegetables, sweets, pies and cakes. Wow! Crowded with tourists and locals alike. Don't miss this if you like food. Who doesn't like food?
Fresh juice for 1€. This is a MUST to visit in barcelona, a few mins from Rambla, you ca buy cheap fruit,drinks,seafood and have a nice linch at one of the food stands.

Wonderful market. A wonderful,colorful market!You can find here almost everything you can imagine:vegetables,exotic fruits,all kind of meats,sea food.There's also a couple of little restaurants.Even if you don't want to buy something is a good idee to take a walk there.The place is spectacular!

Colourful and Interesting. We were attracted to this Mercat by the colours of the displays of fruits and vegetables. Did not regret walking in as the place was bustling and great for people watching. There were shops selling fruits and juices which one should try. Very refreshing and reasonable priced.
Wonderful place for street photography.

Great and busy food market. If you like food markets, a stroll around the Boqueteria is a must in my opinion. It is very colorful and busy, and the best way to enjoy the market (after strolling around it), is to have something to drink and/or eat from one of the bars.

The colors. A must see in Barcelona, very easy to arrive either by metro or hop on, hop off. The colors and the fruits are wonderful, make sure to wear comfortable shoes though. Very nice place to take pictures and eat local food. Good vegetarian food available as well.

Go for the variety but know it is a tourist trap. So if you like Pike's Place market or any large scale farmer's market you will appreciate the variety. I actually bought some fruit here and was underwhelmed. The fruit I bought from the local farmers on the edge was outstanding. Seeing as how there are tons of markets in Barcelona, go see first and then it ought to peak your interest for more.
Tourist market. This is an old market selling Spanish produce. There are a few food stalls as well. Lots of tourist and price were high there.
Very busy around noon. This mercat was very crowded and with many tourists at our visit, a Monday around noon. Prices are 50-100% higher than at some of the local markets in Barcelona.

Nice to see. This Mercat is very interesting. It offers many different types of food from fruit and vegetables to meat and fish. Food looks very tasty, especially fruits. What I liked the most are fresh 100% natural squeezed jucies. They are so so tasty you must try it. The only thing I didnt like is that it was very very crouded, full of tourists, locals and vendedors and I felt little pressure because I had to watch on my bag whole time. But nothing happend and it is worth seeing and trying something. There is food for everyone tastes.

Fun open market concept - feast for the senses. Right in the heart of Barcelona is a bustling marketplace. Your eyes, ears and nose will be inundated with all kinds of experiences as you walk the aisles between the stalls. Go just for the experience, and you may end up buying more than you planned!

Great. Great experience to visit the market. Be aware, market is closed in Sunday's... Food, spices, delights... you can find anything inside.. Tapas bars inside are great. Watch for pickpocketers cause it is very crowded any time of day/week.
City Break. Really enjoyed walking around this bustling vibrant place. We had breakfast at a cafe on the outskirts of the market and just watched the people come and go, well worth a visit.
Market . One of the best Market that I visit in my life, friendly people. Really tasty spanish food perfect to eat something for lunch.

Colourful and amusing . With an entrance from La Rambles, the place is packed with tourists, with their appetite and camera. There is a large variety of local delicacies. More important perhaps are the fruits and ice pop sticks. They are so beautifully and colourfully displayed that you perhaps just want to photo them, concerned that your purchase would disrupt the lovely picture! Certainly worth a visit.
Really cool market with soooo many yummy things. You have to try the fresh fruit and vegetables and really good cheese. It is a great place to snack around and spend some time.

Food everywhere! . A lively market with fruit, seafood and spices everywhere. A great place for market lovers. We ate at the Pinotxo Bar which was great for people watching. Fun to walk around a snack as you go!
Fun!. We went to the market the 3rd day we were in Barcelona. We got some fruit, cheeses, olives and meat for our flat. We went back one afternoon and had lunch there. Great environment.

A great stop for breakfast. A fascinating market to wander around. The selection of foods is unbelievable and the many of the displays are works of art. Lots of places to get a full meal sitting down or a snack to take away. Try the eggs with mixed mushrooms.
Food food food. Try sitting down at one of the tapas bar in the market for a good taste of the market. A lively busy market worth visiting.

Wonderful Market. La Boqueria Market has an entrance on La Rambla. It is very crowded and touristy, but it is a wonderful market and worth visiting. Go hungry, there are so many small eateries within and around the market that you will find something that makes you happy. The fresh fruit juices are definitely a highlight. For 1-2 Euros you can have a glass of blueberry coconut juice or mango orange juice, or one of the countless other creations for sale. There are stalls selling candy, dried fruit and nuts, fresh fruit, vegetables, and seafood, including Bacalao.It is less crazy in the back of the market, which is also where you can find a food kiosk with organic vegetarian food and a felafel stand. If the weather is nice, make your purchase and head out the back where you can find places to sit and eat your delicious food. Definitely bring your camera, your appetite and your patience. Enjoy!

Exciting and overwhelming. High season was about to end, the place was still packed! People for all the world visit this place, I probable heard 10 different languages surrounding me in my 40 minutes visit. All the good are beautiful displayed, the prices aren't that bad, but a lot of things can be bought cheaper outside, the demand-offered formula no rocket silence.Go and grab a snack or two to experience it, it is wort it.
Stunning!. Colourful experience and prepare yourself to enjoy smelling lots of nice things. I particularly loved the fruits and the general athmosfere that only that place can offer you.

A great market. A colorful market with fruits, spices, fish and other Catalan specialties is a great place to go right in the middle of Las Ramblas. Mainly a tourist market since the city has over 30markets not as colourful as this one but for the same purpose and a lot cheaper.
A must for foodlovers. The smells from fish, meat, vegetables etc. are overwelming. There are lots of places too eat and drink, but we preferred to have our lunch elsewhere.

Well Worth A Visit. A really good food market just of Las Ramblas so you can expect it to be pretty busy. We were there mid morning and it was pretty crowded, so I would recommend going earlier in the day. The food on display is very colorful and the building is old and quite atmospheric. Definitely worth a visit if you are in Barcelona

Overhyped market . Nice to visit and look at the different fish mongers and butchers etc. Not that many places to eat. A few bars serve hugely overpriced tapas. Nothing compared to the markets in Madrid. Can only assume all the good reviews are from people who haven't been to many good markets.

A market with a buzz. This market is alive from early to quite late and so colourful that you get the feel UK markets are dull. It's a place to see local produce and people, and to buy. It's also packed with places and things to eat.

Best fresh food in Barcelona. We started to use this as our food market as this place has everything you need and it's all fresh. Stop by for a quick lunch and make sure to taste the Catalan sweets! Incredible!

Wow. What a market! It is crowded and bustling but the food and goods on display are amazing. Grab a bite at a counter or just get snacks here and there as you go either way you can't go wrong. There is a huge variety of vendors, colors, smells, tastes, sounds and sights. Do not miss this place it is easily one of the best markets in the world. It certainly puts my hometown Pike Place market to shame.

Good fun!. Very busy market, very touristy though!We happily munched through everything from padron chillies to fresh fruit all portioned up so you can eat and shop at the sane time There are several tapas bars within the market but they are incredibly busy.

Amazing. So many varieties of fruits , fish and any food you can think of . Everything fresh . I would totally recommend for people who would like to explore more about the Spanish cuisine . I like places like this :)
Eat your face off. Great food at every turn. If you like food, it's a must see. I can't remember the name, but there was a seafood bar in the back left corner that was incredible.

Food Galore. Whilst a market, place seems like a gastronomic wonderland. Be prepared to queue for everything but worth it. Located on La Rambla, its heavily frequented by tourist and the different languages you hear with people struggling to order dishes adds to the charm. You can get Tapas cheaper at heaps of places but no where has the atmosphere.

Amazing but crowded. I went to the market and it was a cultural experience to see everything likeAll the seafood and fruits. The only complaint is that it was very crowded as many tourists go to take photos. The food at the local restaurant stands was ok but a little expensive compared to other places. All the way to the end of the market there's seafood that is worth looking at!!!

Go hungry leave happy. Come hungry! This place has so much to offer for you eyes and your stomach. I was thrilled to try some Spanish samples and local twist on traditional quisine. We ate our way through from queso, verdudas, jamon y vino! Great for all ages

sensory overload!. I've been in very few places like this. Endless stalls offering fresh meats, fish, fruits and vegetables. My wife and I had breakfast inside the market, and it was delicious and filling. Watch fishmongers cut up fish to order for the locals. See all the marvelous legs of Iberian ham for sale, and watch them slice it for your order.

You will be starving:D. Even if you just had a meal, when come in the mercat you will see all type of food and fruits in there, for me i just wanted to try every single thing in it. The mercat is full of tourists and the prices are a bit hight.

Quite expensive . This market is really nice but very busy! There are lots of interesting stalls - fruit, juices, pic n mix, ice cream, meats, cheeses, baked goods, dried fruit and nuts and fishmongers. I enjoyed walking round and looking at everything on offer. However, when it came to buying something, it was rather expensive. For a tiny bag of cashew nuts we paid about 5 euros! One small sweet at a stall was 2.50!The fruit juices though are yummy and can be found for 1 euro and some of the fruit and veg is good value. It seems to me that this is a bit of a tourist trap and the stall owners take advantage of it
Curiosity. Great place great food great variety and fantastic opportunity to try good spanish food. Thoroughly recommend that you visit

One of my favorite places in General in Barcelona. The colors, the food, it's all so breathtaking when you walk in. This market has everything in mind. From candy, to nuts, meats, cheeses. I bought some delicious pre-made juice for 2 euros. It was delicious. Also there are bars and stools where you can eat while there.

Fun & So many great food options!. Loved this market. It was lively, colorful and offered so many easy-to-sample foods at fair prices that we were able to try bits of everything (oysters, iberico ham, cheese, gazpacho, seafood on a stick) There are also excellent counters offering full meals / tapas / traditional dishes that are well worth waiting for a seat. We were fortunate enough to get a seat at El Quim de la Boqueria. Super friendly and just excellent dishes all around. Best gazpacho I had in Barcelona, actually!

A taste of Barcelona!. I always like to visit the local market when abroad- and this is a gem! All the food is displayed to its best advantage- meat, fish, fruit, veg, dried goods, cooked/prepared foods. Plus there are cafes and bars selling ready to eat food and drink from the market.

Bustling market. A huge array of meats, cheeses, fruits (with a variety of fresh juice blends) and other goods. On our last day we went late in the day (many stalls closed) and got jamon, bread, cheese and fruit for dinner back at the hotel. Couldn't face another big meal! It's a great slice of culture.

Visit the meat stalls where you will see all kinds of "interesting innards"!. Visited La Boqueria while I was walking the Ramblas down to the water.
As with any great market there is always something to see and consider especially for those of us who shudder at animal innards.
knd

Awesome!. This place reminds me the English Market in Cork but in a Spanish way, which means pressed juices and Iberian ham. The products provided are of good quality and we were coming here from time to time

Best part of Las Ramblas. If you like a good farmers market, you'll love this! Every possible food you can imagine is here and ready to eat or carry out. We had good intentions to sit and eat lunch there, but it was so busy, we never found a seat ( actually I did find a table about the same time another lady spotted it, but since she was ready to fist fight for it, I gave in)! Anyways, it was fun just to walk around and taste a variety of samples and people watch.

fruit, fish, fruit, ham, fruit, fruit and fruit again. I'm not a pure vegetarian but I like fruit, I have found my place for eat and restore. hundreds of boots where you may eat fresh fruit, drink fresh smoothies (everything was very good). tested also some ham, very tasty. suggested to everybody, be careful that it close quite early in the afternoon.
Amazing must see . It's marvelous location for the real way of shopping and tasting the real sea food in Barcelona , must see

Seafood and fresh fruit. This market is renowned and due to the fact that it is on La Rambla also well visited by tourists. You can eat seafood or Catalan specialities. We only spent € 10 for our evening meal, seafood followed by fresh citrus fruits and with a fresh fruit juice to drink.

Favorite Go To Place for Seafood. We enjoyed our daily visits to the Boqueria. We had various flavors of fresh fruit and fruit juices and a vast selection of sea food prepared right there before your eyes while you sit at the counter. Plenty of things to try and satisfy any craving! Definitely worth the visit or two.
Disneyland for foodies. A great visit, just off La Ramblas. Food and goodies in colorful displays. Beautiful for the eyes and temping. Spend a half hour or so.

Interesting. The market was great to see if you have extra time in Barcelona. It's expensive inside and very, very busy. The things available in the market are available everywhere in Barcelona, at cheaper prices. But it's still an interesting sight!

Vibrant colours and hectic. We went there for a walk. First I loved that there were cheap fruits that were cut up and ready to eat - I got a around 250 grams of fruits for 1 Euro. The fruits were puneapple, papaya, strawberry and mango. What I did not like was that there are a few bars that you can sit in and eat, but there were no prices metioned on the menu. This for me was a no-go, but I liked the idea of choosing fresh seafood and they cook it for you.

Massive and Fun Market. The Mercat de Sant Josep de la Boqueria is massive and absolutely fabulous. You could spend hours in it looking at everything from fish, fruits/vegetables, tapas, desserts, pizzas, etc... It is colorful in many different ways. A must see!!!

A bit overrated.... To be honest, I wasnt so impressed with this market. Most of the sellers offer the same things exactly and the prices arent that cheap either... I enjoyed the fruit juices but didnt find anything else worth buying. We visited during the afternoon, which i think was better because there were less people and mess all around. I didnt feel like we missed something important because we came so late - just saw 15 fruit stands instead of 30.

Not great. I was less than impressed by the Boqueria than others. If you actually want to look around w/o tons of crowds, you have to go at off hours. We had read about two places we “should try out”, but we couldn’t find them. We tried to go down several aisles but there were just too many people during the lunch hour – on a weekday. We ended up just eating at this Mexican stand and it wasn’t great. My husband’s chorizo burrito looked gross and he barely ate any of it.There also isn’t any place to just sit or even have high top tables to stand and eat, so unless you get something that is wrapped up and easy to eat on the go, you’re out of luck. There are so many other better places that we found in Barcelona to eat, I would skip this one.

Vibrant must see. Been there three times in my life and is as vibrant as ever! The foods are colorful and so many people (at times too crowded depending on the season). You basically will be able to buy fresh food and a perfect place to go if you are staying in an apartment during your stay in Barcelona. Wear comfortable shoes and not new ones. There are wet areas. This is a market after all and a tourist stop.

A very busy market. Full of life...full of people....full of wonderful produce.....and in the heart of the city. There are lots of wonderful things to see and eat and drink. And noisy....lots of buzz. Worth a visit.

Just go there!. The food market is amazing to walk through and to look at. There is no chance that you can taste that many goodies, however, you should certainly try. It is an amazing atmosphere and there are many amazingly tasty foods to have.

Walking around eating & drinking . Walk around and stop at any place for a small bite and a drink and move on the next place.It's a fun market to visit, also they have allot gourmet food to take home if you want.

Like an oasis in a desert!. It’s probably the best market I've ever been in my entire trip around Europe. This place offers a variety of fruit, sweets..which is so cheap and delicious. Fresh smoothie is 1 euro, fresh fruit is 1,50 euro. Chocolate, cake, candy..are mouth-watering. I bought so much the chocolate that has nut inside.Please consider before you buy pastry there (I’m not sure if „pastry“ is the right word) because they are so so so cold, not fresh and tasteless (I will note down in my attached photos).Also, you should go to the market in the morning when everything is just made and fresh. Once we went there in the morning, the smoothie were amazing. But when we came back another day in the afternoon, there weren’t much left. They were all from the morning, didn’t taste good anymore.If you ever need a restroom after stuffing yourself at this market, there is one inside Palau de la Virreina, next to the market.

Cool market but getting busy. I remember coming here a decade ago how pleasant it was to wander through the market aisles. Today it is extremely crowded with tourists taking photos and blocking the way. I believe most of the locals go to the other markets due to the overcrowding of this place.
Amazing. Fruits from all over the world are everywhere! Perfect place to refresh yourself in the morning with some watermelon juice right at La Rambla.
This market is bomb. They are so many eats there that you mind will be blown. I eated a ton of stuff there and it was Awesome! You gotta go here.

Hustle and Bustle. There is a certain energy surrounding the market. Just walking down the Rambla with all the stalls and people has the exciting energy of an ebb tide. Then when the market appears just off the busy street, there is a sense of something even bigger. The market is a sheltered area of stalls squeezed together just for the purpose of stimulating all the senses. Even before you can see it, the aromas make your stomach growl, but then the distracting blur of shapes and colors, combined with the din of buyers and sellers can be off putting. The abundant choices of fresh foods and drink can be overwhelming, especially when it becomes necessary to compete at a counter for a purchase. We took our time and wandered and looked before choosing our treats. Inevitably prosciutto was involved, along with fresh seafood, cheeses and eventually churros. Most stalls do not have a place to sit, however, by strolling behind the market, we discovered a "park" area with benches, also at a premium. It was a great place to savor our picnic, and found it so relaxing, we decided to purchase yet another local beer.This is a great place to eat, people watch and become absorbed in a local tradition.HINT: It is easy to point to something interesting and new in order to experience a novel treat.
Must see. When it comes to markets you must go to La Boqueria! So much to see and eat! Fish, meat, fruits and veggies and local specialties you will find it all.

Rip off chocolates!. There are lots of lovely stalls here and it's a great place to grab some lunch but beware of the stalls offering sweets, candied nuts & chocolate. One near the entrance tried to charge us €10.50 for 6 chocolates! And when it looked like we would pay the sellers (not Spanish) starting squabbling over who had given my friend the bag. Ask prices upfront or just avoid stalls that don't display their prices!
Amazing marketplace!. Don't miss this bustling market that is full of fresh fruit, vegetables, seafood and meat. A treat for the senses!

So tempting!. A lovely place to wander round with beautiful displays of fresh and colourful food - also so very tempting! We went at around 10am and it was quite quiet - not so when we went back to get some lunch at midday. Good luck choosing what to buy.

Do not visit when hungry!. Whether you're looking for local cured meats, fresh veg or spices, the Mercat de Sant Josep de la Boqueria will have it.With small eateries and stop of points dotted both around the edge of the market and within, your mouth can't help but water. Be sure to haggle, the locals are accustomed to tourists and their hankering for a deal.
Must see. You have to go to the market and eat what they offer, it's really nice to just stay there and have a chat.

A true pleasure to the sences. A bit pricier than elsewhere. However it is an emblematic place in Barcelona. Not visiting it would be a shame. 1 euro natural juices, fresh fish, cheeses, torons, prepared meal and others share custody of this antic open market. I am a fruit lover and had my taste bugs worth every visit. Everything tasted so fresh and good.

Amazing !. We discovered this place by mistake just walking on Las Ramblas. OMG what a delight! This is a place full of color and tastes.. you just walk and stop by to get another snack. we enjoyed our lunch at one of the bars where my husband said he had the best lamb chops ever! i always went to the fruit selection and the jamon. Beautiful and a must to go!

Absolutely a must see for foodies AND eaters!. This place is food wonderland! Fruits, sweets, veggies, fish, and meats all arranged like you are in a jewelry store! Walk in "for a look" and you are gaga for an hour. You can eat at several places here but for a tourist who likes to cook--all I could think was f is how great it would be to shop here for a dinner party. You can pick salad or a cup of fruit and walk with it or you can dine at a counter or a restaurant. Walked through all the fish and no smell at all! The fish is FRESH!

Beautiful Displays of Food. After visiting the markets in Madrid, I was expecting high end and expensive food for tourists. However, the prices were much lower and there were many more stalls. It can be very crowded, but we went a couple of times, early in the day and late. Much more enjoyable. Fun to try the different types of food.

Excellent market for fresh food and packed meals etc. This is just a few metrers from our hotel. WE called in for some veggie food. Found a smasll stall which provided orange drinks and nice food. Busy, smelles of fish etc, but nice for a quick visit. Beware of pick pockets in confined places and a lot of people.

nice to visit and buy special goods. Located in the edge of La Ramblas square, it is a public market of food goods, such as fruits, see food dishes, oils, cheese and more! Don´t miss it, it´s worth at least a little walk. Always crowded, so watch for pickpockets!
Amazing!. La Boqueria is definitely the best market in all of Spain. Every review on here could never express how amazing this market is.

Fresh Everything!. We went for lunch: impossible to find a seat anywhere, I think, if you go on a busy day. We got lucky and had a magnificent, fresh meal. Aside from that, good especially to see the wealth of fresh food (fruit, vegetable, fish and meat) but also the delicacies (foie gras, rare mushrooms) that are for sale.

A great market to vidut. Fabulous produce. Wonderful small restaurants. Terrific seafood, interesting gifts, great people. What else can you say except to come hereThe best market I have ever been to bar none including France , the us, and Italy. You need to go here

Packed tourist trap. Sounds harsh, but that's what it is.We went mid morning, it was packed with folks like us, visitors who are spending a few days in the city. Sure, it does loads of local business too I'm sure, but it seemed odd that three quarters of the visitors were day trippers like me. And it was absolutely heavingSeems like prices reflect the type of clientele too.Today we found the smaller, but much more authentic Mercat Santa Catherin, not too far away, just off Laietana and it was a much less fraught and authentic experience. Loved that. Try there instead for authentic.

Eat what looks delicious. Favorite market so far in Spain. The zucos are 1 euro! We had so many just because they were fresh, yummy and cheap. We also got one of the olive vendors to sell them to us as a mixed bag, and they only charged us 1 euro as well. I don't even like olives, but the olives in Spain are super delicious and meaty. We did try El Quim de la Boqueria and that did seem to be super hyped. Instead explore and find yummy things to try. You could definitely find yummy cheap things to eat here.

A food market. This is a must if you are visiting Barcelona. Situated on the right hand side of The Ramblas on the way down to the port. Stalls selling allsorts, fish stalls, vegetable stalls, spices, nuts, fruit stalls where they have fruit on ice to buy in little pots, or sticks. Very busy, the atmosphere of the hussle and bussle of tourists. Toilets were immaculate and manned. Also paella stalls, refreshment stalls. Well worth a visit.
Fruity. Now this is the place to visit.Amazing produce on offer.Always get my cheeses and jamon.Fruit to die for and so fresh.

Smelly. I can't get over the stench. Once you're over the initial 'wow' factor of the fruits and nuts and meat, the smell will overpower and you will feel the need to bolt. Good for one time but not more. Also I was super mad because I got a fruit cocktail for 4€ when the other stands had the same exact one for 1€. So buyer beware.

Always packed. This place aside LaRambla you can not miss, just follow the stream of people pouring in. Do not go direct at the main corridor, start your way from eather side of the market and work your way in.Many small bistro's with pinchos(small bites) also normal portion food can be servedRaw meat and fish are down the line and front is reserved for show off, bright colour fruits and best off dried smoked meat and cheeses.Not to miss because this is the one of the best markets in the world.Advise: your carry bag keep in front of you with zippers turn towards you and have a go at this beatiful place

ARGUABLY ONE OF THE BEST CITY MARKETS IN THE WORLD!. Sights, sounds, smells, tastes. All of your senses get involved. Easy to spend way more time here than you had allocated. Quick takeaway food is everywhere, but if you have the time for a good meal look into one of the numerous seafood restaurants that ring the market or better still, pull up a stool to one of the counter restaurant/bars and let your eyes and nose lead the way. All is fresh. All is good with generous portions ( the razor clams are a must as is the jamon Iberico). A company with wine or beer.....of course!

Foodie heaven! . I absolutely enjoy strolling and eating my way around the market. Breakfast at Pinotxo Bar is a must for their Cortado coffee and whatever's on display at the counter. Señor J, as I call him, dressed in his signature vest makes the best coffee in town.

A Feast for the Senses!. Making time to go to the Mercat is a no-brainer for Barcelona. It is easy to spend more than an hour walking the aisles between the meat merchants, fish mongers, fresh produce sellers, and other various vendors. Impossible to not try something, even if it is as simple as a nectarine or peach (which were both delicious). There are several places to eat fresh sea food, and you can see by the lines which ones are likely considered the best. We were able to get a small table at Kisoko Universal, and share it with another couple who were also trying to get a seat. All the fish small plates were fresh and delicious and inexpensive. Just go, walk around, and look for something appealing, then figure out how to taste it! There was even a fabulous gelateria where we sampled several flavors... all were amazing!
Sensory overload. Be hungry when you visit so you can sample some of the goodies. It is very crowded, but there are literally dozens of stalls with an incredible variety of foodstuffs.
Love it!. I love it here and no visit to the city is complete without a visit. Wander around the stalls taking in the sights and sounds and people watch from one of the bars.

Heaven on earth for foodies. A heavenly open market for foodies… We tried to enter in the afternoon but because of the heavy crowd we couldn’t make it. So we decide to come early at 09:00 in the morning, we spent almost 2 hours in the market… Later that day we returned for the lunch and hardly find a place to sit… We had freshly cooked baby octopus, mushroom and green peppers with 4 glasses of wine… It cost us almost 40 €… Enjoyed every moment… As it is very popular, beware of the pickpockets…

A worthwhile visit in Barcelona . Just off La Rambla is the Boqueria Market recommend a walk through earlier the better after 12 noon crowded
Excellent foot spices and fruit and vegetables market
Beware of two things pickpockets and not all stores allow photography

Fruits market to try. It is good while in Barcelona to try the type of fruits they have, and this place is the best to experience. It is so close to La Ramblas (almost part of it). Inside you will find all types of fruits you want to have and go.
Recommended.

Perfect local experience . If you are wondering in la rambla you must swing by this place. The market is really huge a provide you with a glance of the local food stores. Meat, fish and freshly cut fruits. An amazing experince

Iconic Market. Situated at the top of las ramblas this must see market is a hive of activity and full of hustling and bustling tourists. Wouldn't consider it a market where you'd get a bargin but even if you buy a freshly squeezed fruit juice or a snack to eat it's a pleasure to be part of Barcelona history

One of the best markets in the world. This market is an exciting place to visit when you travel to Barcelona, Spain. It has a very special vibe and the food is beautifully displayed. The bars and restaurants in the market use the freshest of ingredients from the stalls in the market and can satisfy any gourmet appetite. Whenever we visit Barcelona we always stop by La Boqueria.
Lots to see. The food there looked really good but it was very busy and long lines to get a seat. Stalls sold fruit, chocolates/ candies, meats, seafood,breads and pastries.

A must place to go. A must place to go when you visit Barcelona!!! There are so many fresh foods, fish, fruits, meat , etc., but its a little bit pricey over price for something but you can go there just look around its quite nice to go there

Go Hungry . Fantastic traditional market, fresh fish, meat and local delicacies! Sadly we had a large brunch so didn't sample much of the food but it all looked great! Many of the stalls do juices which are really nice! I'll be returning, but returning hungry and ready to eat!

Nom nom nom. This market is a must see. I would recommend going for brunch/lunch and doing a once around to scope out which stalls interest you the most first. You can then pick up small bites from a variety of vendors, instead of eating at the restaurant like stalls that are pricier. Afterwards, you can make your way into the Gothic Quarters with a happy tummy.

Turistic place but worth to visit it.. Its located close to the La Rambla Street. Great place to grab some sandwich with some Spanish ham or cheese, drink some fruit juice (if you want to save 1euro buy it not in the front of the market), you can see the fish market there. Most of the people here are the tourist unfortunately.

It is worth a look for sure. A walk through the markets is definitely worthwhile.A big part of travel is food and this market will give you an insight on some of the items that make up meals in restaurants or general home dining as well.The kids were more fascinated with the types of fish people bought. Some similar to the ones we by/eat at home but some quite different as well.

Always busy and good food!. After we dropped our luggage, we headed straight here. It was mid-day and we knew it would be crowded....WOW, was it! We enjoyed walking through and sampling (by purchasing) the fresh squeezed juices and other items.Definitely worth a visit if you are staying in a condo or something similar with a kitchen as there all types of local fare.For us, it is something we would do every visit.

Grab a juice and enjoy the crowds. This is an impressively massive market. We traveled throughout Spain and never saw anything quite like it again. Yes there are hordes of people. Just go, buy a juice to sip on, get lost in the aisles. Maybe eat a cone of fried food. Then pick one of the many little bars to drink some wine and nibble on tapas.
Must see. Cool market! Must see to either walk through or sit down to grab a bite to eat! Food and drink is expensive there but that's to be expected just because it's so busy!

Definitely worth a visit. Hidden away just off Las Ramblas, this market is definitely worth a visit, has a really nice atmosphere with a few little cool stalls that you can stop to eat and drink at too.

I loove it. I already did this type of market in budapest and i love the experience. U get the chance to see all kinds of local shops and food stands and restaurants. U can easily find many things to buy

Worth a visit. I've been to Barcelona twice and both times I went to the market looking for cheese, fruit and spices. It has great variety specially when it comes to seafood. Don't hesitate to eat there. I'll be back every time I get the chance.

Tourists Local market stalls. An open type (under a roof but not indoor) fresh produce markets that open early for locals daily needs. Beyond that it mainly caters to tourists.I came around lunch time and I don't really see many "local" people, just throngs of tourists. I estimate 30% fruit and juice stands, 30% meat-cold cut-cheese stands, 20% eateries, and the rest splits among produces, meat, fish, sundries, and others.It's comparable to the Los Angeles Central Market on Broadway. It has the same vibe but just more crowded and offering different type of food. The main difference comes from the type of foods available. Cured meats, cheeses, and sundries make up the major offerings here. The meat and sea foods are much more fresh and less "produced" here than USA.

Crowded with tourists but a variety of foods . I have to think the majority of pedestrians in the market were tourists. It's hard to imagine who buys the beautiful produce and meats. We bought a few odds & ends. Would have bought more if we could have brought back to the States.

very crowded. This market was great for people who want to buy things like fresh fish and cheeses from scratch to make meals, but we were here mainly for on the go food and for something to pass the time! There seems to be a variety of food but then you do start noticing that a lot of the stalls are selling the same product- some cheaper than others (prices tended to drop the further into the market you walked). Me and my boyfriend bought some lovely fresh fruit juices for a euro each even though theyre 2 euros at the entrance to the market. I also got a crab claw and calamari kebab which was quite pricy at 6 euros fof 4 items but still nice. My boyfriend had a lovely chicken wrap bought from a popular stall right at the bottom on the left hand side of the market! Would recommend going here at about 2pm although it was still pretty busy.

Colourful vibrant market . This is a blend of tourists and locals all hustling and bustling together. There are great sounds and smells with sellers being animated, locals buying fresh produce and many tourists (like me) taking pictures and saying "oh look at that". This is a place to grab some fresh fruit or a juice whilst walking around in the heat. Or grab a cone filled with meat or cheese to munch on from one of the many ham stalls. You can even buy tripe if that's your thing. There are plenty of tapas bars around as well, most seating approx 10 people so you might have to wait. I did find these tapas bars very expensive and we did choose to go elsewhere. All in all though great place to wander around and enjoy the locals tourists blend.

A food experience, go Hungry. A must see and do,.. Go hungry and have patience. You can go a few ways.. Just walk and experience, Walk and grab take away food on the go.. Or try and find a seat at one of the food places and get the Full experience.. your choice but either way have patience and enjoy the food and smells. We bought some very nice wine in the market at the back end from a very knowledgeable wine guy to take on the cruise ship.. well worth visiting him.

A feast for the eyes and stomach!. I visited La Boqueria as it was on my bucket list. I am so glad that I went as I had a great time sampling the fresh orange juice and mango and coconut drinks (1-2 Euros each). I also went to a stall manned by a very knowledgable Asian man who talked me through the various fruits on offer and I ended up purchasing a variety of fruits and some Barcelona chocolates. I also stopped by the vast array of seafood stalls and let me tell you that the food is so fresh it's still moving, a bit of a strange sight seeing crabs moving around and prawns scurrying their legs in the air but a great experience nonetheless. I went at 11am and it was busy but not annoyingly so. Highly recommended.

Great selection of meat, cheese and fruit . It is a great place to stock up on fruit, meat and cheese. I rented an apartment for a week so I am able to eat breakfast in have a late lunch then at the end of the day I can make a snack before bed. There are restaurants inside where you can get something to eat. Prices are not that bad.

Walk, eat, shop, repeat! . This market was fantastic! Beautiful stands displaying all sorts of fruits, veggies, flowers, teas, sweet treats, meats and prepared foods. We spent a few hours walking around shopping/ taking photos and trying different prepared foods. Bar Central was the place to eat unique seafood, I loved the mixed seafood platter.
Loved it. Such a variety of sights and sounds and scents! Great place to wander around and try a few different things

Market to end all markets!. Holy Cow! I didn't know such things existed. More fresh food than I'v ever seen in one place. Great snacks like jellied candies, nuts, and dried fruit. Several sit-down restaurants inside serving the fresh food cooked in local dishes. Very reasonable prices. We spent several hours there shopping for things to take back to the hotel. A "must see" for Barcelona visitors.

A foodie's delight!. From fruit and vegetables to meat , fish and offal, this is the place to see, buy and taste the biggest range of fresh food in the city.The huge range of fresh seafood alone is an absolute delight and you cannot fail to be impressed by the quality of the food on offer.
Unique . A typical spanish food market where you can find all type of food from typical dpanish and catalan to exotic. Don't miss it ! It's really worth the experience.

Fun to see, great food but a bit pricey. Of the two markets this is definitely the one to visit. The food was great. The candy displays are impressive. We had a late lunch. Note, most places do close early and won't seat you too late. Lunch was rest however it was a bit pricey. 50€ for just 3 tapas and two waters. We didn't mind the price and would do it again but in comparison to the other restaurants in The city it was a bit overpriced.

A crowded market place. Beautiful market place with colorful food, tasty fruit juices and cute little shops that offer mostly fresh sea food. The only problem is you have to be very careful with your bags, keep a close watch on them, and also it tends to be a bit overcrowded with tourists.

"Foodie Heaven". Wonderful food market located right off La Rambles, plenty of food selections from Northern Spain. I particularly enjoyed the small portions which allowed me to try many different food items. The market is crowded and full of tourists taking pictures some vendors don't permit or like the photos being taken. I found the vendors to be helpful and the food was a real treat. Make sure to get a fruit drink and some of the charcuterie that is available. We spent about 2 hours and felt that was plenty of time to enjoy the offerings.

Not to be missed!. When traveling we always try and visit the local market - this one has them all beat! Amazing place with the freshest produce, breads, seafoods. It was a picture lovers dream! I think I took a picture of every stall. We ended up buying some fresh fruit, cheese, ham, and bread and had a wonderful picnic back at our apartment.
One of the best Barcelona attractions!. Sensory overload of fresh fruit, vegetables, meats and Tapas stands. Great chocolates, fish mongers and people watching. DON'T MISS IT!!!

Is this the best?. An amazing market. Many vendors sell small samples in either fruit cup, or a paper cone for ham, or sausage or other delights. Yes it's busy, but that's part of the charm. Walk all around. I've found that seating for a coffee or beer is easier on the south ( seaward ) side of the market.

ode to eating. I've visited many different markets around the world, and this has been a pleasant surprise. the shops in the market take pride in the products they sell. it can get quite chaotic, depending on the time of day. there are many food items to choose from, just make sure to come on an empty stomach.

Mercat de Sant Josep de la Boqueria. Well, when we visited in August, it was so crowded and congested that moving around was almost impossible. That also means that if you're hungry and want to eat Tapas, you're going to have to wait for someone to leave, which more than likely, someone is already waiting too. Unlike markets in the United States, this market was expensive and really didn't offer anything that you can't find in the bodegas. Nothing exotic or unique that you won't find locally. I guess it's a place to stop by to say that you went there, but the crowd made it less than enjoyable.
Crowded market. On a weekend was very busy, though its small enough to tour it in15 minutes.. great place for chocolate and fruit lovers.
Quick viist. Wonderful if you love food!!! Every kind of food available.Like a farmers market with a roof and plenty of Jamon Serrano etc available.

Most colourful market!. Quite the sensory overload here but in a good way! Lots of stalls all selling fresh food in the form of meats, fish and savouries. Plenty of eateries inside too. Really enjoyed it - we visited at lunchtime and it was busy but not overcrowded. If you're not eating then I think mid morning would be the best time.

Food for all tastes. This is a very interesting place as you get to see all the different types of food that are common in Barcelona and the wider Catalan region. Some of these shell fish and so on might be difficult for the uninitiated to get to grips with, but the locals and the adventurous all seem to enjoy the experience, while there are lots of other choices for those who are squeamish. Plenty of fresh fruit choices, bars too, and a lovely bodega where you can get a nice glass of wine for a measly 3 euros. Definitely worth a visit for the sights and smells.

Fruit smoothies for good price. You must visit this market because it is full of amazing, mouth watering foods and drinks which you should try one by one. One thing to keep in mind is not to buy at the entrance because it's more expensive than other places if you walk inside the market little it. Smoothies are 1euro. There are also bars with seafood where they make you delicious food although the prices of that can be quite a expensive and also you might need to wait to be served because it is busy.

Cool. This is with out doubt the coolest market I've ever been in, talk about fish I don't think I've ever seen so many types in my life... There's all sort of meats and fruits aswell would highly recommend a visit to this market..

Fun for foodies but crowded! . Felt like walking thru an encyclopedia of food - from fresh fish to candy to poultry to tapas bars, every type of food you could want was here. Would recommend not going during regular dinner or lunch hours, as can get in uncomfortably crowded.
A foodies heaven. Took my wife to see this, the produce was fantastic. Nothing like it in Birmingham. Perhaps the EU should relax the regulations and allow the supermarkets to sell more product

Brilliant. Huge fresh food market selling everything you could want. We chose to eat at one of the few open kitchens, which have seats all the way round so you can watch wherever your sat. Fantastic paella and shrimp, tasty sangria, friendly staff too. A lot off fresh fruit/vegetables, fish/shellfish/crustaceans, cured ham and many other baked and sweet treats. Definitely returning next time! Only downside is it's too difficult to make a decision on what you want.. It all looks too good!
Fantastic!. Great market and great little restaurants. We had breakfast at a few places and they were all really good. Must see.

Crazy, must do in Barcelona . We visited la Boqueria twice while on a recent trip to Barcelona, the first while taking a cooking class and had the benefit of our chef/teacher telling us about the history, stall layout, etc. We went a second time on our own just to explore. It is a sensory overload experience! Crazy crowded (watch your wallet), loud, amazing odors, and more. There's a few restaurants that were always overcrowded that we skipped.

World famous, but super touristy!. Great market to tour around, but a bit of a victim of its own success, it's a working market at the end of the day - but super touristy, but in a modern world of supermarket packaged fruit, veg and fish etc - it's probably something very special if you have not seen these things on a market stall!! Some decent tapas bars on the edge of the market (don't get too drawn in having to eat inside the market!)

Outstanding. I went there every single day during my stay yo get the fresh juice and extremely tasty food.Few restaurants are available in the area if you prefer sitting setup.Watch out for pick pockets though

St Josep Market. Loved this food market, it was vibrant and appealing. The stalls varied from fruit to meat and everything in between. You can buy and eat the food whilst walking through the market. There are also places the sit and order food, but we found these to be very busy. I particularly liked the grout stalls where you can buy a container of fresh fruit to eat on the run .A pity there isn't a place to sit and eat what you have bought!

Very enjoyable.. Not as good as the Mercado de San Miguel in Madrid but it is interesting to walk around and see what vendors are selling anywhere from vegetables, meat, fish, cheese and ready cooked food. We tried few empanadas but they were not the best.
Amazing!. Everything you can imagine, fruits, spices, sangria, vegan friendly ❤️ its a little bit crowded but the atmosphere is very good, will definitely come back

Tasty and joyful . If you like eating and local foods must go there and try what you like, too much to taste and try . Fruits, meat , cheese, seafood... Must go there and enjoy at least twice for an hour
Good place. You must enjoy to eat and drink all interesting foods exotic juices. You can buy olive oil or nuts or cheese or ham etc. One of the interesting places in Barcelona.

Best cured meats in the world!. We visited the market having read about it in various Top 10 lists, We were not dissapointed. The variety and quality of produce on display was fantastic. It is a very busy market and i would recommend trying to avoid the normal peak times, The cured meat pots you could buy for 3 euros and carry around with bread stick were amazing and the olives were outlandish. We tried the fruit juices at a couple of different stalls, One was very good the other poor. It is definatly an experiance for anyone who enjoys spanish food, The spice stalls were a particular highlight for me.9

A must for foodies. This is simply one of the best food markets in Europe. You can wander around and try little portions especially ham but also seafood. Gets very busy during lunch time.expensive but excellent produce.

Interesting place but don't buy things. It is always a pleasant thing to look around local market in traveling. I also expected a lot. I thought that I could buy fresh fruit and seafood here, but the tour guide told me that this market became a place for tourists not for the natives, which is naturally not cheap anymore. So I just did look around and then ate somewhere else. It was fun, tho.

Worth a visit if you are a foodie!. Visited here to have a wander around and it is purely a food market! Full of lots of fresh fruit, veg, meat and fish perfect for locals but not so good if your hotel suite doesn't have its own kitchen! However, there are lots of bits you can still buy and have for lunch etc! Mima icecream is totally worth a visit! Their macaroon icecream sandwich is amazing! There are lots of smoothie stalls too for €1.50 which are amazing! Recommend if you are a foodie and want some lunch on the go - if you wander out the back there is a seating area too!

Fresh live seafood among questionable fruit juices . We bought fresh seafood (lobster and crabs) to cook for dinner. The fruit juices were questionable, the chocolate coated strawberries were awful (poor chocolate quality although I guess you get what you pay for).It's worth a walk around nonetheless!

Must go!. You must see this market and experience all it offers to the senses!
The vendors are very friendly and will answer all your questions.
The prices seemed higher here than other markets we saw in the city but that's not surprising.

Fabulous market . You should definitely visit this market if you go to Barcelona. Just off La Ramblas it is a riot of colour and noise - and has just about every fruit, vegetable, fish and meat you can imagine. Not to mention all places you can eat and drink and just sample some of the wares. Oh and the ice creams, lollies,sweets and soft fruit drinks - so many you are spoilt for choice. Amazing.
One of my favorite places!. If you like colorful street food, this is the place for you. The sights, the sounds, the tastes (mainly jamon, salamis and cheeses)..

Great stop for real tapas. Awesome food market, mix with the locals, grab a stool at one of the market bars selling tapas, definitely stop here for proper Spanish tapas. Very interesting place to walk around people watching where locals go.
Boqueria food market. What can I say, fantastic!!!!!!!!!! Everything was as fresh as could be. We had smoothies every day and variety of meals. An absolute MUST!!!!!

Interesting Market. if you're into cured meats - this is the place to be! jamon iberico at every turn! seafood, cheese and fruits can also be found here. a bit noisy and crowded but that all adds up to the ambiance. Definitely worth checking out!

Fantastic location and Awesome seafood!. Must stop by the Market! It was very casual dinner, fresh seafood and friendly people (they speak English). We were in Barcelona for 10 days, we ate there at least 4 times for lunch and dinner. Best Market!

Great ambience as well as great offers. The market is located in the middle of the Ramblas. Behind the beautiful iron gate you will find a very lively market with great products. We have visited the market almost daily and tried many of the small snacks that were offered.

My favorite food market!. I was so incredibly excited to visit this food market. I love food and love trying new things. I saw the pictures of all the fresh juices ahead of time and could not wait to try them. My only regret is that I did not visit this market daily to get a fresh fruit juice! The market is crowded, even close to closing time. There is a huge variety of things to look at and buy and eat. I had a fresh papaya and coconut juice and also had some dragon fruit while walking around. My husband and I also decided to eat at a seafood counter for some tapas and they did not disappoint! We had 4 dishes there and all were tasty and affordable. My only wish was that there was somewhere to use the bathroom in the market - if there was, I never found it. I would have spent longer there if there had been but when nature calls, you have to answer! As previously noted, I wish I had returned here daily for a fresh fruit juice. I had a large juice for 3 euros and in the States, that would have cost me somewhere between $6-8!
Really visit this place!. It think it's really a must see! You can eat here very good for not a lot of money. The juices are delicious. I drank there a few of them!
Street market with extraordinary things. Clean enough, with many choices of food or many things. With competitive price. They also very friendly even you do not know spanish.

Amazing local market in the middle of La Rambla. Must visit market while you are in Barcelona. We went in the first half when the market just opened and could see all the fresh produce. Try the different varieties of juices. Very reasonable and tasty. We picked up lots of cut fruits and other eatables. Gets really crowded by evening so for tourists it's better to go in the morning or afternoon.

Best Market!!. When in Barcelona I always head for this market. It is very central, lively and full of colour. I always visit the dried wild mushroom stalls to stock up as they are so much cheaper than home. An absolute must visit!!

A Barcelona MUST. If you're in Barcelona, love food and authentic cuisine, you must visit La Boqueira market. It's located on La Rambla, one metro station from Placa Catalunya. The station is right next to the entrance to La Boqueria. We've went there on a Saturday, tha place was packed, like all markets are on a Saturday, but I suppose it's like that every other day. The crowd, however, doesn't bother you, you just go with the flow, and have plenty of time and space to explore each food stand. Fresh meet, ham, prosciutto, fish, fruits and vegetables, spices from all around the region are there for you to have a sample and buy. A big hit are freshly squeezed fruit juices that cost around 1-2€ and keep you going. What I strongly recommend is that you have lunch there. There are a lot of stands that are actually little restaurants. Prepare to wait for a seat for about 10 minutes since it's very popular. In some you have to wait in line, in some it's who spots a free sit first. The cuisine is Spanish and Catalonian, it's delicious and the prices vary but are very reasonable. I'm definitely returning there when I go back to Barcelona again.

Touristic but must see. The colours and variety of foods are fabulous! You can pull up a chair and one of the bars (if you can find any space) and enjoy a drink and some tapas. It is VERY crowded and touristic but you may as well pop your head in for a walk around whilst you're walking along La Rambla. The entrance is just there.

Clean shopping experience. This is a lovely covered marketplace right in the heart of town off Ramblas. Olives, meats, cheeses, juices, affordable prices, hygienic environment. We bought freshest of olives here, packed very nicely for our journey back home.
Foodie alert. This market has something for everyone- gourmet to quick snack. People watching shopping tasting you can do it all here. I think this is a must do and a definite detour on las ramblas
Fantastic . Great place to wander around, drink wine, eat great food and overall feel like a local. It's a must visit when in Barcelona.

Not bad. I don't agree with some reviews, this market being the best in the world. Sure, if you are in the area anyway, its worthwhile a visit. Otherwise a lot of repetitions...Jamon y fruita at every 2nd stall.

Very crowded, but the food's still good. Very famous market, so it's just obligatory to visit it. For better price you shouldn't buy things exactly at the entrance, try going in a little bit. A lot of fruit, vegetables and jamon here, also a restaraunt where you can eat freshly cooked fish and sea food. Fruit smoothies are also great and cheap!

Great farmers market !. We stopped by here on several occasions. Don't get here to early, because there still setting up. You can purchase all sorts of meat, cheeses, nuts, candies, seafood, spices, fruit , and smoothies . There are also places that serve hot dishes. If you're in Barcelona and you like to try new foods, definitely give this place a visit.

ALL THE FOOD!. Super fun market with all kinds of great things to eat- fresh foods and prepared foods. They have a lot of fresh fruit that is affordable and hard to find in California without paying an arm and a leg. Ate a delicious half dragon fruit! The fruit juices are also pretty amazing.A lot of fresh and wonderful seafood, if you're able to take it home and cook. We opted for a shrimp stick, cup of jamon, and some empanadas. Everything was delicious and it's just a very fun place to walk around while snacking.

Best market in Barcelona and one of the best in the world !. This is a must if you are in Barcelona ! Seafood, produce and local Catalan fare abounds in this colorful market from razor clams to jamon Serrano.This market is within walking distance to everything in Las Ramblas, Barrio Gotico and Born- so this can be integrated in any activities there easily.

If you can visit only one market, let it be this one!. As the title says, this one is a MUST! The market is huge and has everything you want, from great meat to tasty fruits and seafood and fish. You can just walk around for a hour and just taste stuff.If you intend on getting lunch there then don't, all the sitting food "restaurants" in the middle of the market are usually packed with people.

Vibrant. What a vibrant place to wander around in the morning. Get there as early as you can when there are more locals than tourists. We went at 8.00 am when it opened. We passed it later in the day and it seemed very crowded...well it is off Las Ramblas! It is a foodie's dream . And a photographer's too, only the lady on the chilli stall had a NO PHOTOS sign on her stall. A great place to eat too.

the market gallery. a sightseeing in Barcelona, La Boqueria -Mercat de Saint Josep de Boqueria the whole name and its story goes back to 1217 and then constracted like now at 1914- awakens all senses, more than an open market, much more than a place that you can shop, taste, eat, stroll, it is a gallery of tastes and colors, where you can found all fresh products, in perfect decoration, all people tourists and not mixing between fruits, vegetables, sea food, tapas, wine and hundreds of colors

Packed with good stuff!. Awesome visit. It's kind of like your picture of Spain cramped into one place. Crowded, loud volume and plenty of quality food, tapas, meats and fruits. Have what you want and just sit down and look at all the people.
Great place to eat. Amazing place food was varied reasonably priced and very tasty, atmosphere was great very busy highly highly recommend paying this place a visit

Wide choice of food and drink. We stopped here while in Barcelona, one of my favourite spots on holiday. There's so many food stalls serving a huge variety of items - I'd recommend grabbing a fruit juice, some dried meat, and a waffle!

Fish Galore. A walk through the market is a pleasant diversion from the streets of Barcelona. And on a Saturday morning you encounter the locals doing their regular shopping. Types of mushrooms beyond count, a vast array of Galician and Mediterranean seafood, and many other things await you. It's always interesting just to watch the regular choices of vegetables, poultry, and other foods that the people in other countries enjoy as well. And, if you'd like a little saffron to take home, you can find it here.

Late lunch after touring city. Arrived at 2.30 to have lunch. Was met by girl at front (she was touting us to come in) looked at menu and thought it sounded ok. This was the big mistake we made as the rest of our lunch visit was our worst lunch in Barcelona. Took ages to get a waiter to attend us. Silly us ???? Why, we were only showed a food menu because by the time we got our bill which was a small bottle of wine and two beers and some disgusting food we were very suprised. I will mention this at the last bit latter. Ordered some drinks and a pepperoni bacon pizza and a hamburger. Finally got our drinks, they were cold... Good start. Our meal arrived, looked ok, had a bite, noooo it was so wrong, no flavour, too much cheese, not cooked enough, bun was stale and no sauce or butter on bun. I had to ask where we were. Seriously this was not a good meal. Went to toilet and on the back of the door was a message scrawled on to say the drinks were over priced.... Finished our meal and asked for Bill. While we waited we noticed a Couple who was siting next to us and they left, this was when we really decided to write about this place here. They were walking down the last of the steps when we noticed they had left there wallet sitting on the table and the waiter was watching them leave as he hovered over there wallet. So appalled he did this and with the bad food this is why we would not recommend visiting this place.
Busy Market. Not so much a flea market, just a covered produce market, lots of meats, fish, fruit and cheese. Very very busy.

All I can say is ' WOW'. This has got to be the best food market I have ever been to. It is not just the variety that is on display. It is the way it is presented. I could have stayed there all day long. There are also a number of places to eat here as well. This is a ' must visit ' even if you are only in Barcelona for one day.

Depends on what you are looking for. Was advised to visit by someone who had been there previously. If you are going to La Rambla (which most people do) then this is not out of the way. If you are looking to buy some cheap food or just taste then you will be disappointed. If you are going for the smell of so many different foods and the atmosphere then this is a must.To some it is a smelly over priced market - to me it was rich in the senses.It is really a tourist area now and I would suggest about 60% of the people there were tourist browsers and not buyers. Just off to one side there are smaller stalls with produce brought to market by more local producers and there you could so no tourists, only locals shopping.

Fantastic for matket. The food market is more than just a market. There are stalls selling prepared food to eat, in tapas style on stools. The fish is worth trying. For more market type food there are ingredients to take home and cook. The fruit and vegetables are well presented. The sausages and meat products can be tasted before you buy. The Spanish ham was a hit with the whole family. The fruit juices are delicious. You can haggle, but in most cases the prices are reasonable so it's may not be worth it.

A beautiful place. If you want to see every colour, smell lovely foods, hear life at it's most vibrant, taste anything from fresh fish to chocolates all in the setting just off one of the busiest thoroughfares in Europe (La Ramblas) then you've got to come and see this. It is busy and bustling with plenty of distractions, loads of people bumping into you, so it is ideal operating ground for some pretty skilful pick pocketing teams. Keep you hand on your wallet & phone at all times, but please don't let it stop you enjoying a truly brilliant experience. The traders here are without fail passionate about their produce and that passion for food is contagious. Lovely place and a must to visit!

You simply want to prepare food... The fish, vegetables, fruits....amazing. Almost annoying that you are staying in a hotel instead and have no possibility to cook and amazing dish with these beauties.. left the place with a more than beautiful picknick...loved it.
See more. Great to visit, has everything more the. You can think ! Sweets , fruits, veggies, !meats, seafood(alive)Chocolate, spices you name for food it is there -a must see

Sounds, colours and flavours. I went to this market of la rambla on Wednesday and loved it. So many colours and flavours. It is a proper food market but there are also stalls to get things to grab and take away and also a few bars and cafes to sit in (although the prices in these were a tad expensive). Lovely experience and if you hunt around you can have a cheap lunch. You could spend 30 minutes or 2 hours in here. Depends on what you want out of the experience.

Busy food market. Wonderful market offering a wide variety of foodstuffs - fruit, vegetables, sea food, meat, sweets, chocolates, etc. Extremely busy but we found that the further into the market you go (away from Las Ramblas) it became a bit quieter. This market is a treat for the senses with vibrant colours supplemented by wonderful smells and the hustle and bustle of a busy marketplace. Well worth visiting.

Nice market and excellent food. Even a bit crowded, La Boqueria it's one of the best fresh food markets in Barcelona (don't miss El Ninot market, close to El Clínic Hospital).At La Boqueria you will find local products as well as others coming from all over the globe. If you want to eat onsite, do not miss Bar Pinocho. Ask them for they daily plates and fresh fishBenvinguts a Catalunya!

Local point of attraction . Crowdy and specific place to taste local food and have local experience. Here you can buy oysters, seafood salads and small ham and cheese packages just to try the taste or you can have have a lunch with drinks in small cafes just in the middle of overcrowded market.

Place to haggle. Very good market, with lots of variety of fruits, vegetables, pepper (I never imagined that there are so many kinds) and fresh seafood.If you arrive early, you can see the shrimp and crayfish still alive!

Must go. This Market is more like to eye feast rather than filling your shopping basket,You will find fresh fruits and vegetables, sea food, not common animals, eggs, also sweets, and many other delicious stuff.You won't find clothes and shoes sold here.the Juices are not completely natural as they are mixed with water and sugar.C U Around.

Such an interesting place to visit. I do consider this a must-do for tourists who visit Barcelona for the first time. Such an interesting and vibrant place, noisy (in a good way), full of energy, crowded with people and numerous shops. It is a paradise for foodies as there are so many food choices, from fresh fruit and vegetables, to candies, chocolates, ice cream, pastries, to raw bacon and ham, to fried/grilled sea food and meat dishes ........ My family and I planned to have dinner there, but changed our mind as it was too hot a day for outside eating and the dishes seemed to be quite heavy. Instead, we just bought fresh peaches and cherries and pastry.
Good quality nice place. A bit crowded, but absolutely worth a visit!Mind your belongings in this busy market, but other than that a nice culinary experience.

Incredible market - perfect for an interactive breakfast, lunch or dinner!. The fabulous Boqueria Market has drool-worthy displays of fruit, vegetables, seafood, candy and so much more! Officially known as Mercat de Sant Josep de la Boqueria, there have been historical mentions of this public market since the 1200’s and I can see why it’s still around! My husband was obsessed with the Spanish oysters (which are super pricey), and all of the tapas options throughout. You can order a snack to-go, or sit at one of the bars to enjoy a meal. Either way, make sure to get there early, as the good stuff will go in the AM! (Note: we originally tried to go on a holiday and it was closed! Be sure to check your dates and local holidays before planning a visit.)

Wonderful jambon. Markets are always wonderful to visit. The array of foods is mind-boggling. Besides the stalls of jambon of all types the fish stalls had a vast array of all kinds of fish and shellfish. I love to take pictures in markets
Funky market. After doing some less known markets in our sleep area, it was a pretty good experience. Lots of very good products, fruits, meats, fishes, vegetables, but a bit touristic for our taste.
Very nice. Its a very nice market clean with a lot of fresh juice fruits tapas and many many other things. There is also a seafood market its a must see in bercelona
Great Market. Bustling. Clean. Good food and variety. Well worth a visit. Easily accessible from Licieu Metro station.

Almost overwhelming!. Every city/neighborhood in Spain has a market where you can shop for food, but this one is the largest I've seen. It has everything! There are bars and cafes there too. I wish i had rented an apartment so I could buy food from there to cook!

Great produce and smoothies and great prices.. A really fun place to go to and see all the different kinds of food. I really enjoyed the fresh fruit which was only 1.50 euros and it was so ripe and sweet. Also the fruit juices were so good and only about 1 euro. Great sweets, candy, nuts and fudge. Bought some fudge which is a little different from American fudge. A fun place to explore and something for everyone. I have to say the meat part is pretty gross so I chose not to take any pictures of that.

Must Visit. What a great market. Try to go here in the morning since some places tend to start closing at 2 pm. If you're staying locally in an AirBNB place and plan to cook a meal or two, this is the place to buy your products. They have everything for sale....I mean everything. It's a large market that sells uncooked items, as well as cooked ones. There's also multiple tapas bars contained within the market.As tourist heavy as it is, I highly recommend it. Even if it's to just take a walk through it and buy yourself a juice or small sandwich. Don't leave Las Ramblas without stopping in.

A must. I know there are other opinions about the Boqueria, but I strongly consider it a must visit. Sure at certain times it's packed and one therefore have the impression it's touristy. But if you get there in time (morning) you can avoid the big crowd and stroll through the aisles more relaxed and absorb the spanish lifestyle. In fact I remember those times when my grandma went to the market bought fresh ingredients and we enjoyed superb meals. Anyway, it is interesting to see and you can spend a few hours trying to get see all vendors and their offer. Especially should you decide to enjoy a meal with one of the multiple bars there. Again, we agree compared to non-touristy places the prices may be higher, but for once and having the opportunity to grasp the special atmosphere, one can spend a few € more.Highly recommended are the fresh juices. Multiple vendors have fruits & juices, so don't go for the first you walk by. Stroll around and check out the offerings of the others. There is a vast of combinations of mixtures to choose from and they do differ from vendor to vendor. Prices for a juice range from € 1.00 - 2.00 and the fruit boxes are available from € 1. Careful not all juices are natural.Personally I was disappointed to realize that the bars offering tapas is limited. Furthermore the bars having tapas have a small selection of tapas. And at some bars the staff tries to talk you into pricy tasting dishes. Best is to study the menu and be determined towards them. There are also restaurants to the side of the market, but in my opinion you are better-off pick a bar in the market as you can watch them preparing your food.

Brilliant market with everything you could want!. Must see in Barcelona! Heaps of fresh produce as well as cute little stalls selling juices, cut up fruit, empanadas and more! Will definitely be back.
Great market. Great place to visit but the cooked food prices a little steep. Well worth a visit though. A vast array of fresh produce on offer. Try one of the smoothies for 1 or 2 euros.

A rainbow of every type of food you can imagine. We loved walking around the market halls and marvelled at the beautifully presented and very tasty food of every kind. Meat, fish, vegetables, fruit, juices, spices, olives, nuts, sweets, bread and cakes, ice creams and I am sure I have forgotten stuff. Colourful, vibrant, gorgeous. It is an iconic Barcelona place to see. Don't miss it. And try some of the fresh fruit juices and prepared fruit!
The best cover Market. The Bocaria is a nice cover market near the Rambla , it 's a touristic place , but you can find some fantastic atmosphere with colorful stand and all fresh food !

Ea with your eyes.... Not only fish and seafood but every kind of food and delicatessen are on display here. Many, many stands will show you what Spain can offer to the hungry tourist. Display for sale and for immediate consummation, too. Crowded as any place can be, it is worth seeing... and trying too!

Excellent for foodies!. A must-visit in Barca! Our tour guide for a food tour earlier in the trip recommended visiting here and said that many of the restaurants in Barcelona source their food from this market. My fiance and I had a great time wandering the many vendors here, sampling jamon iberico, fresh fruit juices, and we tried a delicious seafood paella here as well! Great place to pick up food souvenirs; we picked up some Spanish olive oil to take home. Food is more authentic towards the back of the market. Lots of places to sit and eat at the bar as well! Highly recommended!!
A must see!. A vibrant display of foods like I've never seen before- beautifully displayed! People eating at the counters - superb buzzing atmosphere!

Why haven't all restaurant in a 5km radius gone bust yet?. You are in Barcelona? You are hungry? Look no further. Epic, life changing gluttony. No, seriously. The bad news: They are closed on Sundays. So, perhaps some restaurants still stand a chance.

A MUST!. The market is absolutely fantastic! Situated next to La Rambla, it's a popular place swarming with people at all times. The choice of foods and drinks is tremendous.
