Everyone will find something tasty for themselves. It's definitely better to go and grab a bite there instead of choosing expensive restaurants nearby. What we did together with my hubby was to buy some food (ham, cheeses, olives, fruit) and wine and headed to the beach to have a little picnic. :-)

Well worth a visit, even though it's heaving with people.. Our online searches of what to do mostly said avoid this place it is too busy.Bah, humbug.We went along anyway, and it was well worth it to see all the wonderful food stalls and buy some delicious treats.Many people seem to just do the first few stalls, but we went all the way through - which was great because there were much better bargains near the far end of the market, as well as all the fish stalls, which our kids loved to look at.Some of the things for sale were around the 70 E per kilo mark, but we just got small amounts to try.The far smoothie stall was fantastic and we must have all had at least 2 each!The colours, the foods, etc wonderful!
Surprised . A colorful outdoor indoor food and flavors market. We found there one of the tastiest Falafel ever call "Shani's Falafel" or "Falafel Vegano" (and belive me I ate a lot as an Israeli)

LOVE IT ! ! !. That place is just amazing, actually beyond the amazing. The offer is huge. When you come there, (and you better come, I promise you will not be dissapointed) you will not know where to look first; all the fruit you can imagine,some odd pink smoothies (that btw look amazing), salamis as snacks...The best market ever!

Fun. Huge market. It has about 6 stalls that appear to be repeated throughout the market. Bread, cheese, jamon, sweets, coffee, fish/meat. Had a lovely coffee. Bought a jamon cone of sausages and meat and ate it walking around the market. Nice atmosphere. Stall holders are patient with a non- Spanish or Catalan speaker.

Everything I Hoped It Would Be!. This is one of the places I was looking forward to visiting the most during our recent trip to Barcelona. It was everything I hoped it would be. The colors, the sounds, the smells - it was sensory overload but in a good way! There was so much interesting food to choose from it was hard to decide, so we got a little of a lot of different things such as olives, chorizo, fresh fruit cups, greek salad, empanadas. Needless to say our eyes were bigger than our stomachs but everything we had was delicious. We took our little smorgasbord outside and had ourselves a little picnic right in the middle of Las Ramblas. It was very fun. Also a great place for souvenirs for your foodie friends (or yourself). Brought home local paprika, honey, olive oil and assorted vinegars. My foodie friend was very happy! I would definitely recommend visiting this market at least once and definitely try some of the food, the variety is amazing!

Great markets for Spanish delights! . Colourful, lively market. If you're in Barcelona, make it your mission to visit this market. Great for families, lots of things to try so make sure you come with an empty stomach.

One of the best Markets I have been to in Europe.. I thought it was just amazing all the juices, meats, fruits and vegetables, and so much more. We went there every day of our trip and tried something different. It is also cheaper than on the main strip of Las Ramblas. I recommend it.

Pretty working market. I am always delighted when I see a working market that is not only there for the tourists but the locals.
Tip- if you want juice turn to the right as you go in and a couple of rows down, it is cheaper there

Must Visit. This experience was fun. Lots of things to see and try. From meats and cheese to spices and nuts. You can find it all at la boqueria. Just know though that it is a market after all so there were crowds of people . Other than that I really liked it.

Don't miss it out. Amazing market. Forget the stalls that you can sit and eat at as they're far more expensive than the other stalls. We went here for breakfast and ate like kings for less than €10. A cone of Serrano ham and slices of Manchego cheese for €3, a tub or fresh watermelon for €2 and a fresh glass of passion fruit juice for €1 finished off with a potato and meat pasty for €2.50. Tip would be not to eat from the first stall you stumble upon. As delicious as it may look have a quick look round first.
Wow! . Like food ? Must see , beware some things can be expensive . Have a self catering apartment ? Get your key ingredients here.
Lots to see and eat. Very busy wee market and not open on a Sunday. Worth the stroll around for all of the sights and smells and lovely wee bars to sit at for fresh tapas.

Phil Australia. Amazing. Foodies heaven . Fruit. Veg. Fish. Meat it is just a feast small resturants tapas chopped fruit. Gelato . JUST GO. And see for urself walk around and sample u cant describe it you need to GO !!!!
organized market. very organized market you can find fish , meat , nuts , fruits , juice and sangarai colorful natural area every where , must be visited
Eye opening. This is where the locals buy their fresh food. There are also a few restaurants inside that are less expensive than the restaurants outside in Las Ramblas.
Foodie Paradise. Just go. Trust me, JUST GO! Amazing food everywhere! Perfect for grabbing lunch, you can buy food from any of the stands and then find a seat to enjoy it.
amazing to walk through. the smells and shops are the best...you have to go and experience if you are in Barcelona. Can't wait to go back.

beautiful market, tastes, sights. an amazing place ! a lot of food, tastes, fruits, fish,
very organized, not too crowded,
a "must" place to see !!!

A great place to visit. There are so many places to eat and try different foods. It's really colorful. Many fruit drinks and things to try. I didn't spend that much time here because there was so many people. It's nice to go and try a few things and leave. The prices are good as well. A definite walk thru.
So much choice!. Amazing food market! Almost too much choice. One could spend days sampling all the different offerings! Visited 3 times in 8 days!

Very Cool Place. Went there with family while in town and loved it. Seeing all the fresh seafood of different types was a treat. Loved seeing the freshly butchered meats as well.
Good time and is definitely worth a walk through. We didn't eat but would like to try it next time.

Bon moment /translated into English at the end. ,poissonnerie et magasins de fruit et légumes et épices .il y a tout les prix
En anglais
you have wanted to see and walk very pleasant surprise and colorful and diversity. delicatessen, butcher, fishmonger and store fruit and vegetables and spices .there are all prices

Wonderful place to visit. A must go in Barcelona.
Traditional, colourful, funny.
Lots of places to see and some good flavours to taste. It's not expensive and definitely a good experience.
Will come back!
Market place. Interesting to walk through. I was not interested in spending much time here. Suggest a walk through on the way to/from another activity.
A photographer's paradise. Busy, bustling, multi-coloured market combined with mediaeval architecture. quite stunning. Also very busy. Great place to buy dinner if you're self catering.

Cool Market. We stumbled upon the market as we were strolling down La Rambla, so we decided to go inside. It was a little late in the day, and some of the stands had closed down. There were still plenty open, displaying fresh fruits, vegetables, and fish. It was a nice way to get out of the sun and try a new fruit or two.

Shopping galore. A very busy market place full of fresh fish, vegetables, fruit and meat. They also have these juices on display that are lined up in all different colors.
You definitely feel like a local walking around but it is very crowded.

Eye tantalising . Great place to visit with lots to explore and see on all the stalls. The market is always very busy and there are lots of types of stalls in different areas- fruit, fish and all different types of fresh fast food as well as little tapas bars. The colours are vibrant and the best thing is you do not get hassled by stall holders

A wonderful, mouthwatering, colourful display. Whether you intend to buy food or not, you may find yourself tempted by the scrumptious colourful display of charcuterie, fruit, sweets and dried fruits. There is also fresh meat and fruit for those planning on a proper shop. Wonderful Art Deco venue.

Nice market with high prices.. Enjoy your visit to Mercat de Sant Josep de la Boqueria, But be sure that you will pay at least 30% more any other place out of the La Rambla area.For example if you decided to eat there a mix seafood dish for 2 persons you will pay about 60 euros that costs about 40 euros at the port restaurants "which also considered as touristic restaurants prices"

So much to see! . It's so great to see all the merchands selling the fresh fish, fruits and vegetables. I wisten I had a kitchen in my hotelroom. May be next time I look for an appartement and do my shoppen on the market.
Wonderful place . Wonderful place all turist should visit it for sure .you can see a fruit guice and fresh fish stores and you can have a diner in one of this resturant

Beautiful colors, lovely to see!. For someone pressed for time with only a few places to visit, this should definitely be at the top of your list! Charming market, very peaceful, unlike markets you visit in touristic cities where vendors shove and shout for your attention or even grab you! This is a lovely , colourful market, easy to walk through as it is not too big, very well maintained and clean despite the fact that they sell seafood! You will also find veggies here, meat, tapas, a chocolatier, tapas bar, a fantastic crepe place, fresh juices and fruits,what a delight after long walks on the streets!

Lots of vegetarian treats! . Me and a friend stopped in a hotel next door to the market so had a wander through twice a day while leaving and returning our hotel. Try and go early as it gets silly busy later on....(not good for anyone who is claustrophobic) I strongly recommend visiting the market while you are hungry, so many delicious things to eat (even for a pair of fussy vegetarians) lots of meat free empanadas, potato dishes, pastries and gorgeous fresh fruit juices and pots. The sight of the meat and fish wasn't pleasant for us, but it's all to one side so easily avoided. There is a vegan falafel bar on one side of the market which was surprising! Photographers will have a dream as the colours and arrangements of food are so lovely - especially the fruits and juices!

Busy, fantastic, magical marketplace. Wow, I wished I was self-catering when I visited this busy market. Little side street off La Rambla leads to this sprawling , fantastic place, selling meat, fish, nuts, cakes and deli food, all under one roof. Each stall selling something wonderful, with places to sit and eat and have a drink, from Spanish fare to fish and chips. Stalls piled high with macaroons and cakes, clothes, everything. Try and buy from the stalls at the back, the ones at the front are more pricey, aimed at the tourists, but the back stalls are cheaper yet the best quality.

As always, beware of pickpocketers 🖒. I love the market. Went here 3 times with my boyfriend in our mini BCN holiday. At one moment 2 ladies tried to keep on pushing to go past me (it was very crowded), and i saw the 1st lady wearing a scarf on her right hand. Next thing I knew my boyfriends' mini bag (on the side of his shorts) had been opened. The 2nd lady (also wearing a scarf on her right hand) then tried to reach the opened mini bag, trying to get something from inside. I grabbed the womans shoulder and moved her to the side making her stop what she was doing. Luckily, my boyfriend didn't put anything (variables) on the mini bag apart from his cigars and lighter.It may be not a big deal, but the fact that the mini bag was really small and nowhere to be seen they still find opportunities just to get your stuffs.Apart from this, i really love the market. Food and drinks are awesome!!

A must when visiting Las Ramblas. Imagine a market with fresh fruit, seafood, fresh juices, tapas... Barcelona style! It can feel overwhelming with the amount of people everywhere, so try to choose a time when it's less crowded (if possible!).

Great place to buy food. We ate here a few times whilst visiting my brother the food was great and the price was OK we understand we paid over the odds a wee bit but the atmosphere is fantastic. It was great to walk around and look at all the foods wich made you even more hungry.

Nice place to walk around . For food lovers it's great place to walk around. I found it a bit pricey but it is located in the tourist area.
I would recommend to go there and have an early lunch before it gets packed. Grab a beer at one of the pubs around the market.

Tourist trap. Very crowdy place.Lots of thieves so pay extra attention to your pockets and bags.
The food is good,the prices are okay.

Amazing market. A lot of stuff in here, food are amazing fresh, from cheap to expensive. You can eat here or take it away with you. Yes it's crowded but what do expect a will organised famous market, would you visit a market with no one in it...

Incredible food market. Our family loves food:-)Our kids like going to markets and grocery stores to pick produce etc. It was a great opportunity for our 3 year old to remember his fruits and veggies and learn about others. Our older one learned about all types of seafood! We couldn't get enough of the amazing assortment of juices and shakes. We tried a few! (Tip: keep going to the back areas because the vendors sell theirs for 1 euro instead of 2 euros near the front)La Boqueria is a vision. A colourful, stunning display of food (that we wish we could take home and cook. everything looked so fresh! )We ate pizza, crepes, empanadas and had the best fried artichoke with chiperones (baby calamari) at this bar/counter in the market where they were quite nice to children. They gave them a lolly as we left:-) so of course they were impressed! We spent about two hours eating and wandering around the market, (always be mindful of your belongings) and we couldn't be happier. It was a great way to spend a morning there with kids!

Food heaven . If you go to las ramblas you have to visit the market, the displays of food are well thought out and lovely to see. I was expecting it to be very expensive but I was pleasantly surprised, the smoothies, sweets and ice cream was amazing. It is very busy which is expected but it was worth it

Go there hungry . There's lots to eat. Not all of it good. Fresh fruit cups, tapas bars, cured meats stands, sandwich stands, but there's also butcher shops n fish markets. Prices are reasonable. I heard so much about this " must go" market. But it was crowed, I felt it was a tourist trap. Same repeated theme stands in every aisle. If you r a tourist, what are u supposed to do w fresh meat? Avoid sangrias, it is made w Fanta to hide the cheap yucky wine. My teenager hated the place. Go hungry, then everything will taste good.

Fun if you like food and to cook. The Boqueria is not for everyone though it is a huge tourist attraction. You can get almost anything there to snack on or take back to your house or apartment to prepare. There are some good stales to sit and get a bit. Fish is always fresh. Be prepared it is packed and sometimes there are lots of smells.

True shopping in Barcelona. The mercat was the highlight of my trip, I loved wandering the stalls sampling the offerings. Everything was beautiful, the merchants entertaining, the food spectacular. Mediterranean produce is the best and the best of it is offered here.

Absolute must. This is the market. THE market to visit in Barcelona. With sights, sounds and smells throughout the market, Boqueria is a perfect place for lunch, but you don't need to eat here if nothing takes your fancy (unlikely!) It is worth a look around in itself. The outside of the market is surrounded by more commercial places to eat.Whatever you choose, the Mercat de Sant Josep de al Boqueria is a fantastic experience, and is definitely worth a visit.

must go. I loved everything about this market!! It was very affordable and delicious. I got fruit cup and a smoothie juice! I loved it so much. It was very crowded with many people, that's the only bad thing but other than that it was fun and so colorful

Best place for Tapas in the city!. The place is like a treasury heaven for people that love food and tapas. Scrolling around different stands may find a place to sit down for a lunch or late afternoon snack to enjoy the vibrant eating experience and drink a glass or two of sangria. I have discovered this place during first day in Barcelona and was back over and over again for the rest of the weekend to have lunch there. On the way out of the market can buy a freshly squeezed juice and some great chocolates to enjoy when you stroll further the city!

Don't visit the Ramblas without visiting this market. Although I'm not a big fan of the Ramblas, I do visit them just to get to this market. Lots of fresh vegetables, meats and fish with the possibility to eat and drink at the market. It is always bustling with activities and although there are a lot of tourists hete, I doesn't feel like a typical tourist trap.Worth a visit if you like some good food.

Really Amazing!!!. I stayed with my girlfriend and the experience was amazing!!! Really confortable people and customers! The place is big, really big and it's full of different shops!! You can eat fish, really gooooood fish, good meat and juice, a lot of diferent kind of juices and fruits!! You must visit it!!! Really amazing!!!!!!

Colorful, abundant, traditional, free but too crowdy!. The Mercat de Sant Josep de la Boqueria is a pretty known attraction of Barcelona, since it is for free, located on the Las Ramblas street, near the Placa Catalunya metro station and the Liceu station. On foot is accessible from other metro stations and bus stops. A great variety of local products, vegetables, fruits, fish and meats is available for the visitors. Small restaurants and tapas bars are also available and is recommended to spend some time there, try out some fresh fish maybe. The place is too crowdy though, be careful for your bags and maybe you shouldn't try out the fresh juices. During the last years the fresh juice thing has become so popular and if you have tried it before you will understand that the quality was lost, the juices aren't really fresh. Pick up some fresh fruits by yourself instead from the stalls!

Must Visit when in Barcelona. Beautiful place to spend an afternoon and have a meal there. The food stands are all exquisitely arranged and the variety is excellent. Some of the items are overpriced, but still worth a visit. We went there twice during our 4 day stay in Barcelona, and everyone enjoyed their time, kids and adults alike.
Foodie!! . Love it!Great food, love the smells.It's the kind of place you want to get your groceries from every day.

Astonishing! Eye-popping!. Step aside from the main drag and enter another world of vibrant colours sounds and smells - a veritable assault on the senses! This covered food market has stalls selling everything from fresh fish (and still-living crustacea!) to 1000 types of olives. Wander the aisles or pull up a stool and partake of fresh seafood with cava. Top tip! Head to the back where juices and fruits are cheaper than around the entrance.
so reasonable and great variety. great varietyvary reasonablehave seen many markets like this in Mexico so was not that new to us, but great food.closed on sundays
Food experience. This place welcomes everyone with it various dishes and lovely cultural atmosphere. If u are at ramblas and dont have any eating ideas, u should let this place inspire u.

Great for street food. Definitely worth a wander at lunchtime to grab some street food.
Gets very busy, so keep an eye on your bags and small children.
Tourist maeket. Open air market with food, fruits and juice. Useful when you don't have time to eat, so you can take some take away, not that good, stuff to eat. Good point : fresh fruits.
This is what a market should look like!. Loved this market! Really busy, almost too busy to buy anything - so many people. The fresh fruit looks fantastic and many stalls sell ready to eat snacks.

Many different flavours. A very crowded and busy place with tastes from all over Spain. There is ham, seafood, drinks, paellas, everything. It can even be a convenient and cheap place for a light meal.
Amazing!. Brilliant market. Lively, friendly and very exciting. No idea what half the stuff is and the other half looks delicious! Will be returning at breakfast/lunch to get stuck in!

Amazing variety of produce, meats, seafood, ready to eat meals. What an exciting, bustling place in which to find yourself immersed in Barcelona life!
If you are a gourmet chef, or just love to cook, THIS is your Nirvana!! There are crowds, so keep your valuables close.

Lots to choose from!. A vibrant market with fresh fruit, veg, nuts, juice and seafood! We arrived 11:00am and it was very busy but it picks up even more later on in the day. Definitely have a look around the market before purchasing anything. We purchased fresh juice, fruit pots and ice-cream but prices appeared cheaper in the middle and at the back of the market. In saying that, they are much cheaper than stalls offering the same product on the main La Rambla strip.

Mostly Food but Variety. Before arrival, I thought this would be a flea market. I was initially disappointed but the food variety made this an interesting adventure. It is mostly food but large clam shells were bought as gift. There are many food choices to purchase. I was surprised to see Chinese Tamale and Bao. Fruit drinks, coffee, tea, chocolate candy and tacos were typical choices. Shopping is available along San Rambus outside the food market.

Love this place! . A real taste of Spain. Grab some fish / fresh espanadas/ crepes / paella /olives / nuts / fruit - literally anything at this market. It's very popular and crazy busy - but well worth it. Some stall owners are rude and cheeky but that didn't put me off!!

Shop around before you choose lunch!. The Boqueria market is a must-visit stop. We went there three or four times in the week we were in town. Some of the places selling juice at the front are a little more expensive than those further in. Don't come too late in the day or you'll miss the fish which look spectacular.It's worth wandering around once to see what is on offer before you choose something to eat or you'll buy something and then see something else that you also want and pig out!

Incredible!!. I've been to many but this is the best market I've experienced!! Everything from meats to fish - pizza - sandwiches - veg - fruit - sweets - nuts - fudge, name it and it's there! It can become very busy but that enables you to enjoy the experience more.

Fantastic place - but avoid like the plague at 2pm in August!. A vibrant and extensive array of fruits, vegetables, extremely fresh (i.e. breathing) seafood, sweets, nuts... I could go on forever. As they say, if you can't find it here, it is not worth eating. As no doubt the locals know, don't consider coming here after 10.30am if possible during tourist season, the crowds dispell its charm. Venture towards the middle to back to find better prices.

Great food, amazing colors, fresh produce!. Don't miss this amazing place to shop, eat and ENJOY! Next to las Ramblas. We specially enjoyed eating lunch and savoring turrones and other SWEETS. Many options. VERY NICE!

Crowded and noisy but you need to see it. This market is considered to be one of the most attractive places in Barcelona but it cannot be different than many other markets. It is really place where you have a big choice of goods. Many of them are Spanish and the quality is good. Most of the time it is crowded and noisy. You cannot hear each other. If they offer you 2 juices for 2 euro, don't buy. They are fake. Find something more expensive.If you like to try inexpensive and great Spanish champagne which they call CAVA, just go to the real supermarket (SupermarCAt) and buy a bottle of Cava for 2 or 3 euro. Put it in the fridge (if you have it) and drink! It is amazing - tastes great, no headache on the morning. Supermarkets are available at any central streets. Just look for the sign (Supermarcat).

Loads to see, and loads of people. One of the outstanding markets, with every sort of fruit, vegetable, herb, spice, fish and meat imaginable. Many stalls selling fresh fruit juices and gazpacho, excellent quality and good value. The main entrance on the Ramblas is horrendously busy, partly due to people taking photos of themselves in the entrance. But there is plenty of space in the market itself (and quiet side entrances)

Nice. it's a market where you can find meat, fish, vegetables, fruits... and can be visited once you are in Ramblas Street. you can buy a cup of fruits or order fresh fish. it will be prepared in front of you.

Nice place if you love the markets. If you really love markets, fresh fruits, fishs, etc... you need to visit it if you are in Barcelona. We were there 3x times and there are lot of thinngs to buy and taste.
very happy to have found this place. Every time I passed by, minimum twice a day, i enter there grab e fresh juice and continue my walking through La Rambla to whatever's next.

Mesmerising . What a fantastic place....a food market of fantastic diversity....incredible smells, colours and sizes. If you love all things food, this is a must. Only drawback is the gangs of pickpockets that roam the whole area. Be very vigilant.

Must see!. This market is a happening place filled with locals and tourists alike. When we were there you could barely walk through the aisles at times. Great food options. Tons of fresh juice options and other things to snack on. Definitely worth a walk through.

Amazing market . This place is awesome. While staying in Barcelona we would start our morning swinging through for fresh fruit and then walk around and do whatever we were doing that day. It's incredible to walk around, taste, and meet people -- both locals and visitors. The fresh juices are beyond compare but my fave is a half pineapple and fork. You really don't need anything else!
Too touristy. Place has become too popular as a tourist destination. Too many people. Ham, fruits and other food are expensive.

Awesome. One of the city sponsored markets. Great place to walk around and buy some fresh fruit drinks or fruits. Also some classic Spanish butchers with whole pig legs to buy. Not expensive and good location.

A delight. Very busy, but a pure delight at lunch time. Be patient and grab a seat around the busy food stands. Menus available in different languages. The tapas are simply divine. Afterwards try a frozen fruit lolly from one of the many fruit stands. A must-do in Barcelona.

Colour and smell. I have been several times but it is still great to go and see the vast array of food and colours. Like everywhere in Las Ramblas it does get busy so if you want to take your time and have a good look go early.

A smaller version of Seattle's Pike Market with a Spanish twist. You will find lots of yummy food stands, from raw calamari to local hams, fresh fruit cups to vegetarian smoothies...a great place to have lunch without breaking the bank. There are benches at the end of the market, so don't feel like you have to eat on the go.

Great market in Barcelona. I rented an apartment near the Boqueria market so we could shop and eat there. It is a fantastic market with some great restaurants and endless amounts of fresh fruits and vegetables, juices, cheeses...The crowds were challenging (in July), so I would recommend getting there early.
Wow!. This place is just amazing. For its restaurants and also for the quality of market to buy good ingredients. It is not expensive at all. And we got good stuff to take home.

What a place to tempt all senses!. When visiting this wonderful city, a visit to the La Boqueria market is a must.The sheer mix of sounds, smells and colours is a phenomenal experience. Fresh it all is! And you can have the most lovely food and drink at the market. And on a hot day, it is a relatively cool place.But... this time being there in August it was very, very busy. Too much to sit down for lunch, we thought.We'll be back in October and probably eat here.

It lives up to all expectations!. The market has a reputation as one of the best in the world and a visit whilst in Barcelona is a must.The stalls and their displays are food art and there is a terrific atmosphere. The food available ranged from basic vegetables to Iberico Jamon at €198/kg!Although we had already eaten, we couldn't resist buying some nibbles to eat while we wandered round.

Come humgry. Although called a farmers market, this is mostly food heaven. Yes, there is also produced, cheeses, fish and meats; but come hungry to eat all the wonderful prepared foods and smoothies.They are closed on Sunday.

A top attraction: a feast for your senses. About two-third way up the main tourist road, Ramblas, on the left (west side), you will find the Boqueria market. Full of vendor stalls selling vegetables, fresh fruits, fish & seafood, meat, and tapas bars. It is a full working market so don't expect it to be super clean. It smells like a fresh market. You will find lots of tourists and locals alike. You can get a cup of freshly squeezed juice for 1-2 Euros. You can sit down at a tapas bar and have lunch or a snack. It is not cheap, as the price tag is similar to that of a full service restaurant. Lunch for two ran about 60 Euros. But the experience of full sight and smell of this market is worth it. The Spanish ham, roasted green peppers (not hot) with sea salt, olives, sardines are all excellent. We went there once on our own, and a second time with a cooking class chef buying ingredients for our paella class.

This is Barcelona!. If you want to really enjoy Barcelona life, you have to stop here! Since we discovered a magic of this place, it was our stop every day – for a small bite of ham, cup of fresh juice or fruit. You can just grab a cornet of freshly grilled sea food and continue walking by the Ramblas. This is Barcelona for us.
Nicely surprised.. We came in here for lunch and it was so much nice food everywhere. You can eat a little hear and there. A tip: further back the prices are even more affordable.

My favorite place to go in BCN. I can't say enough about this amazing market. I don't know if it was the beautiful colors or the amount of fresh produce and treats to try, or the fun-and-crazy hustle-and-bustle atmosphere, but I couldn't stop coming back. Because of this place I have discovered (and am obsessed with) fresh coconut, chocolate covered macadamias & almonds, and deliciously super-stuffed empanadas!! I will return to Spain JUST for this market.

Highlight of our visit. This is not a tourist attraction, it is a working market providing fish meat and veg for locals as well as juices snacks a experience for the visitor. Its authenticity is what makes it special coupled with being bungled full of people, and aromas and busyness. Definitely the best place in Barcelona for the visitor to experience.

Great place to eat!. I knew this was a market for fresh foods, but I didn't expect this. Not only can you buy raw ingredients, but you can buy pretty much anything you could think of when it comes to food. I saw a lot of smoothie stands, seafood, kebabs, falafel and others. Great place to go and try out some delicious new foods!
Grab a bite. An amazing market with so many different foods on offer. Visit here hungry and have lunch while you soak up the atmosphere
Great market. We loved this market, which is a feast for eyes and taste buds, great fruit juices, great food, we stopped there every day.

Torn since there are pros and cons. I'm torn in writing this review. Some of the huge market is very good but we've visited much better market in other big cities. Pros: huge variety of food (fresh fruit, veggies, seafood, beef, nuts, and some really adorable candy). There are several bar-like eateries - some are highly rated. Cons: expensive, crowded, unpleasant smells. We purchased a very small bag of chocolates and almost fainted when she rang it up ($15) but we also purchased a box of fresh delicious strawberries for only 1 euro. I suppose the moral of the story is to ask prices first. Worth a quick look if you're a foodie. In the middle of Las Rambles. Prices at a little grocery store 1/2 block behind the market are MUCH more affordable with excellent quality.

Choices, choices. This mercat is huge! If we lived in Barcelona, I'd be there daily. There were meat, fruit, nut shops and so much more. I was so happy with the fresh figs and mixed nuts that I bought. The Iberico ham Bocadillos were good as well.

Feast for the eyes. A little too crowded with small children. But always a feast for the eyes. There are other great food markets just like this all over Barcelona but if in the area it is definitely a must see and do especially if your a foodie. Worth sitting in a side tapas bar to relax and watch the buzz of the place. Also gives a little relief from the crowds of las ramblas.
Food galore - senses overload. If this market has not got it, you might not find it anywhere.Huge market under roof with allsorts and miscellaneous foods and ingredients.Brains anyone?

Delicious local food is an authentic market setting. We visited La Boqueria on a recent trip to Barcelona. The food from the restaurants/stalls in the market is fresh, flavorful and delicious. There is a variety of food on offer. Most are small portions, so you have the opportunity to walk around and experience different foods from different stalls. It adds to the wonder of the market. A real taste of Spain.It's located on Las Ramblas, and I would definitely suggest a visit. You won't be disappointed.

Ate my way through. We decided to go here for lunch. It's just so hard to decide from all the wonderful vendors. My daughter had a burrito wrapped like a cone in paper. I had some prosciutto and cheese followed by some paella (portion is for two). Then we had some gelato of course I highly recommend a stop here for great food and very good prices.

Look for side bars. It remains a real market but more and more produt offers are aimed at tourists. Some times it is too overcrowded by tourists, so if you decide to go, you are warned and try to go to the bars at the side of the market ...

Love on side cooking. We were looking for some great Catalan food for lunch, the Market was bulching with people who had the same idea :). So unfortunately we sat down at the restaurant close to Bar Central. The seafood was awful, skinny, not even sure if fresh, we paid 60€ and our stomach was not even 1/3 full. When we spotted a free table at Bar Central, we immediately paid our bill & moved. This time = bingo, fresh seafood, ordered only 2 mixed plate, but OMG, so good & we paid less

I used to love this place. This was going to be one of the highlights of our trip. I was last here 15 years ago when it lived up to the hype in the travel guides. Now there is way too much overpriced rip off tourist stuff. Pride of place went to an Organic Taco store in the corner ripping off tourists at 10 euros for a plastic takeaway of salad. Go. Look. Marvel. Then buy your food at any of the other places you can find in this lovely city. It was an embarrassing rip off.

Overcrowded, overpriced. The place was packed with people and it was difficult to move around. There were nothing special, more or less the same stuff you can buy from any market, but prices are much higher. Great place to use the toilet though (costs 50 cents, no lines).

What an experience! . This " open air " ( it is under roof) market is spectacular, with the selection of ice cream, fresh fruit, sweets, nuts, sea food, and of course the ever - present hams. There are a number of wonderful little food stalls where fresh food is prepared for you ( breakfast, lunch and supper) and it has an amazing vibe. Come hungry!

A busy, bustling & bursting market with colors and smells. Our visit to the market was on a Sunday afternoon. It was VERY busy. But, what a place! Any kind of food you want. Sweets, fruit, juices, ham and list goes on and on. It was great to just walk around and sample the food. Some of the best chocolate I've tasted. There are more formal restaurants on the perimeter with tables and a few counter-like sit down eating places in the midst of the stalls selling all types of food. At most of the shops you just purchase and keep walking. People watching is fun. But do be careful of pick-pockets. Space is tight so hold on to your belongings. Tight quarters for walking.This is a must.

Loved this place. Went here many times through out the week. Love the fresh fruit drinks. There is also numerous restaurant you can go to within the market and many goodies and interesting food that they do not have in North America. It is usually super busy and can be a little difficult to walk around mid day. I went to Pinotxo for breakfast and it was very tasty.

A Foodie's Paradise!. I had read so much about La Boqueria, that I was very excited to visit. I was not disappointed, it is so much fun, so colorful, the smells are incredible!. I'm a HUGE fan of Iberic ham, and I got a snack size container, so very fresh and delicious!. There are a lot of different kinds of food, fish, vegetables, chocolates, nuts and breads and my husband and I bought a little bit of everything. I highly recommend to visit La Boqueria, just make sure you go hungry!.

Rude people!. We were exploring the market and decided to do a take away as there was no place to sit at the tables. So while waiting, the shop keeper next to us shooed us away!!! Yes, she actually said "shoo"!! I was not even standing in her shop! Wow! Anyway, go in if you are curious about the market, but go eat somewhere else where food is so much cheaper and the staff more friendly like Taller de Tapas.

A "Foodie's" Paradise. A trip to "the Market" is a food lover's paradise! It's also a fun place to experience the local "flavor" in a large outdoor market filled with vendors offering fresh food, beverage, locally made honey, Iberian ham and cheeses fresh produce and so much more! I took my teenage daughter there for lunch, in between activities, and we had a blast! She ate fresh crepes while I enjoyed the sights, sounds and aromas from the various vendors. Be prepared - this is not a place where one sits down for their meal but who has time to sit when there's so much to see!?!

A buzzing market of goods and culture alike. Attached to La Rambla, the Mercat de Sant Josep de la Boqueria is a beautifully traditional, hugely popular and incredibly succesful market. me and my partner visited during our visit to La Rambla and we were blown away by the thriving popularity of it, with a huge, almost maze-like size with many stalls selling a range of goods such as sweets and candy, fruit and vegetables, meat, drinks, ice-cream, herbs, spices, gadgets and the range is almost endless. The Mercat is also sheltered by a large cover above so on the off chance the weather is bad, its a great way to pass the time.Truly a testament to the intact culture of Barcelona that fuels this Mercat, a beautiful, must visit for anyone wanting to experience some culture.
Bouceria . Bouceria is a must see market in Barcelona for fish and meat lovers. Very fresh seafood & shellfish can be found in most of the places in the market. Great

Freshness, variety and colour. You will get a wide variety of both ingredients and prepared food here. Come with an appetite and enjoy all they have to offer, including fresh juice, fruit salad, cooked foods and international dishes. Casual, eat-as-you-walk atmosphere.

Lovely, busy market with great food!. Must visit when you are in Barcelona. The market is busy, but it has a good atmosphere! We were lucky to get some seats at the 'Barcentral la boqueria' (located on the right when entering). The food was all delicious. It's a bit expensive but worth your money. If there's no seat available you can wait in line (which didn't take long).

A colorful and authentic market parallel to La Rambla. A market made up of many stalls which sell fruits, fish, meat, spices, candy, drinks, ice cream and more. Stop by here for a quick refreshment on your stroll through La Rambla. However, it is very crowded which can be slightly frustrating.
Perfect for lunch. Plenty of choice, and some wonderful street food, but nowhere to sit unless you dine at one of the restaurants. Look for the guy selling the hot savoury pastries!

Best place for lunch. You have to be there to feel the vibe, the colours, the noise, the smells. Best of all are the food stalls in the market which served excellent tapas, sangria and seafood. You can also buy yourself some fruit or fruit juice to cool down during the hot summer days. Like all market, the stalls at the front can be slightly more expensive.

Amazing market. Me and my friends enjoyed the market a lot, as we had so many quality options to choose from for lunch. Vendors are nice, the variety off foods is huge and the prices are good. It is a very crowded place and caution is recommended when it comes to your bags.

Authentic Spanish market. Just walking around takes 10-15 minutes but there is so much to see and there are several places where you can eat. Don't be fooled by the juice sellers at the entrance, keep going for the real Mercat.

An amazing market. This market is incredible, probably the best we have seen anywhere. The hustle and bustle of people among the amazing array of stalls is not to be missed. There is fruit, tapas, drinks, groceries, cooked meats, fish, spices, sweets and more. It takes about an hour walking around to appreciate it all. Definitely worth seeing.
Great Food and Atmosphere. La Boqueria is close to our stay. We went there for our lunch and dinner on the first day in Barcelona. We could try most of the tapas there.

Colorful and tasty visit. This interesting market is easily found just off Las Ramblas.We enjoyed wandering around the market looking at the many stalls selling a wide range of goods from fresh fruit salads to cheese to sweets to seafood to jamon. The jamon and fresh fruit salads were tasty too.A great place for photographers as this was a most colourful market!

Best market. Go. Well worth it. The fish section is mindblowing. They have loads of stalls selling fried squid, whitebait, lobster, really good for a lunchtime snack. The fruit is delicious. You just need to have a kitchen to go home and cook it all!

Favorite stop in Barcelona . This market blew me away. The sheer size and level of activity is nearly overwhelming. It took at least an hour just to wander through and even longer to decide where to eat. We ended up getting sandwiches, smoothies, and baklava, and every bite was absolutely delicious. This might have been the best food I've eaten in my life and the prices were amazing as well. Another great part of it is the location; as soon as you're done you can walk to the beach or wander around the surrounding area which I found to be very pleasant. Definitely make time to go here!
Beautiful market - must go! . Definitely worth seeing - so many fruits, fresh juices, pastries, chocolates, nougats etc! The market is just off the las ramblas on a side street.
The best part of La Rambla. Go here for a very cool cultural experience. Don't order anything on the edge as it's more expensive than things inside. But definitely stop here.
Amazing. A lot of stalls with a lot of different goods. Never seen something similar before. Jamon everyvere ...

Foodies Paradise. Spent a magical couple of hours meandering through this food and produce market, eating tapas style as we went. Everything from nuts, cheese, jamon, sea food, olives, fruit, pastries, to coffee and wine. Quality was excellent.
A really vibrant and colourful place. Our 5 & 8 year old girls loved it too.

Attention: Calling all Beach Bums, Jet-Setters & Food Lovers!. Do not pass go, do collect $200 or less & go to this public market place! I went there by myself as my friends work in Barcelona and told me to hit this place up for fresh food.Well, I had a €2.50 (2,50 €) Sangria there and it about put me on the floor. Seriously, it was delicious, but I had to find a place to go and sit after because I was lit up. My Barcelona friends laughed at me. They called me a lightweight, but I am not. I drink IPA's back in San Diego, CA, but hardly any wine.I went back another day and asked the guy what was in it besides wine and fruit and he would not tell me. He said, "We have the best sangria here at the market." I have to agree with him. Another example --Don't judge a book by its cover!I think it had just the right amount of brandy or some other liquor in it to hit me so fast.If you think this place is like Pike Place Market in Seattle you may be right but this place is on steroids in a good way. Maybe it is smaller in area size or the same, maybe, but it is dense with an array of food displays. It is a dizzying array of lunch counters, mini restaurants, and bakeries, etc. around every twist and turn. It is like a cool maze. I went there several times and I know the places I like, but I am always seeing interesting entertainment on my way there.Go early (8am-10am or so) and avoid the crowds is my best advice or go later in the afternoon. It's entertaining to walk around and gaze at the tremendous amounts of diverse selections of food displayed and there are places to eat there too. Be prepared to do some serious walking.You must try the best sangria (and patatas braves, very inexpensive too! I bought some Spanish Smoked Sweet Paprika also known as Pimenton de la Vera, Dulce to bring back to the US. It is a popular ingredient in many Mediterranean recipes. This stuff is excellent for a salmon fish rub recipe. Bon Appétit

Perfect market for lunch!. If you're looking for a venue in Barcelona to try the variety of local food and delicious delicacies Barcelona has to offer, then look no further than the Mercat de Sant Joseph de la Boqueria. A classic market with a huge variety of food on offer and a must if you're visiting Barcelona. It's cheap, busy and has so much delicious food to choose from you won't leave hungry or disappointed! My recommendations - the Catalan speciality store and any of the cured meat stores

Beutifull . This is market that can compete with any market in the world .it's a must for anybody that loves food and loves to see it shown in the best possible way..colourful abundant varied and clean.check out the eateries to .The only reason to visit Las ramblas.

By far the best attraction on The Ramblas. This absolute fantasy of a covered market really does please all the senses. The colourful and often mouth-watering displays of spices, cured meats, fruit and veg, seafood, sweets and every other commodity imaginable create a photographer's paradise. Interspersed with these stalls are bars, cafes and restaurants offering everything from great coffee to full-blown meals and the wonderful aromas certainly tempt the speculative shopper. A lunch sitting at one of these counters can be a great experience, not only for the taste buds but for the sheer vivacity and bustle of the setting.Some tips:- Try the fruit licquados which are delicious, smoothie-like drinks made from fresh fruit. They come in a hundred kaleidoscopic varieties and are cheaper, healthier, more refreshing and a lot tastier than a bottle of carbonated drink.- Choose your moment. It can get extremely busy and crowded, especially around meal times, and getting a seat at a popular eatery can be a challenge.- Buy edible gifts to take home here. I think the fact that things are a little pricier than elsewhere is more than compensated for by the sheer concentration of quality gifts all under one roof.A must.
Love this market. Great market. Don't jump in buying from the first stand you see, chances are that you find the same thing half the price in the back.
Vibrant. Must do when in barcelona. Good local food - probably pricier than other markets but the whole experience is worth a visit. Gets very busy, keep your belongings close

Great place!. Fantastic place to buy fresh food, fruits, juices, and of course sea food!We had lunch in "El Quim de la Boqueria" OMG, best food ever!. We tried the wagyu, which we only tried once in South America!, great selection!, the tapas were amazing and the staff at this tiny place very amiable!Do not miss this place in your next visit to "La Boqueria"

Do not choose blindly. Should have been a great experience, but Bar Central was too expensive and seafood wasn't great. You definitely should ask a local or search here for tips, maybe there's some not overpriced and yummy place to eat!
La Boqueria. Great place to see all the typical food and fruits from Barcelona!Beautiful and colourful place , where you can see and taste all the different food !

A taste of Barcelona. The most famous market of Barcelona & one of the oldest one in Europe. I could finish my review but small advice for visitors so you could escape my mistake - be aware of your cash, 'cos you might want to buy everything you see.

Visually beautiful. The most visually beautiful presentation of food we have ever seen. Them market is very impressive and features fish, fruit, vegetables, meat etc. Although it is very touristy, it obviously serves as a local market for the locals. In typical Barcelona style, everything is done in a spectacular fashion and not necessarily for the benefit of tourists; we get to enjoy what he built for themselves.

A must in Barcelona. Colorful rich, fresh market like I never saw before! La Boqueria is a must see in Barcelona and a must taste too I would say! I advise to have a cup of juice, taste some fresh fruit and eat a fish snack on the go. Totally worth it!

Don't miss La Boqueria. Fresh food, fish, vegetables, meat, flowers every way you look every thing is fresh and you want to buy it all. We stop at one of the many small restaurant and eat there. Prices are good...
Best place ever! Have lunch there! . Gorgeous food and amazing stuff to try. The tapas looked great but so so busy- instead we picked up an amazing deal: salad, fruit bowl and fresh juice for 5euros!

My very favorite place in Barcelona. I decided to write another review, because this is my favorite place in the city. I stay a block away from here and go every day to buy fresh everything. There are few places on the planet like this market and the more the merrier.If I had a kitchen, I would buy just about everything. I don't really eat at the restaurants inside, have but it's more about the market itself.Colorful, friendly, crowded, and fun....

Wonderful. We visited in July and spent half an hour or so looking at the variety of stalls.It seemed that there was everything imaginable available, from fruit, meet, seafood, confectionary and everything inbetween.It all looked so fresh!Obviously, it wouldn't have been practical to carry a fresh lobster or an Iberian ham around Barcelona with us, so we made do with the small samples in cones which were on sale for €3.00. Totally worth it!

amazing local market. for travellers not familiar with local Catalonian cuisine and customs, this market located directly off La Rambla de Catalunya in downtown Barcelona is an excellent way to see local flavor up close. A wide selection of vendor outlets offerring all kinds of fresh produce, meats, fish, and vegetables. You can also sit and sip wine and tapas made on-site at some vendor stalls. Or, if you're in a hurry, their are take-aways as well. Well worth a visit. Since its a permanent, covered market, it's a good rainy day activity
Have lunch here. Whatever you like - you definitely will find it in this marketplace.Have a glass of fruit juice, or cut fruit, fresh bread... anything. It's delicious.

A delight to the eye and the stomach!!. Do not miss this marvellous and very busy market. So many beautifully laid out stalls offering all manner of Spanish foods and delicacies, from fish to meat, plus a number of bars in a nd amongst where you can rest and recover from the thronging crowds. If you go back to the same stall every day, you van eventually negotiate a nice discount from the friendly lady at No 1897!!

Fantastic. A must visit market. Bought a lot of Jamón. Prices were OK may not be the cheapest but weren't too high either. Lots of choice to eat and drink. Market is not open in the evenings so plan you visit time.

Must visit! . These markets are located on la ramblas in the middle of the road. Even if you don't want to buy anything it is worth a look around just to see the huge variety of foods they have. There is many stores selling fresh fruit juice in many different flavours and is very cheap so I recommend you try at least one juice. Also within the markets itself is one of the best tapas bars in Barcelona! It is always jumping with people but after tasting the food selection they offer you will know why. A must visit if in Barcelona!

Passed by chance when I was in Ramblas. My visit was not planned. Just found the place while walking in Ramblas. It is one of the best food markets I've seen. It is similar to West Side Market in Ohio USA. Loved the experience and the Catalonian almonds covered with chocolate. The food is a bit pricy but the experience is worth the visit. I love food so this is my place ❤️

It's a must in Barcelona. If you go to Barcelona, La Boqueria is a place to visit at every cost, it's always crowded so take the time to visit it more deeper than only the entrance of the market. You can buy everything here, fried fish is at a real top level, you can taste the tipical spanish dishes and some fruits to take away. It's perfect to buy take away food or some meal and fish to prepare at home.P.S. American friends, why you buy pizza in market where you have tipical spanish fresh food prepared in site? sorry guys but this is crazy!

Worth a visit . I visited this market during my stay in Barcelona because I needed a few ingredients for cooking. I had lunch in here with the typical Jamon serrano y queso, but also tried some juices. The average quality is very high and the prices are not exaggerated, even though you can easily find cheaper stuff elsewhere. The place is very touristic and crowdy, even on Monday when half of the shops are closed. If you like to go shopping food and trying different typical Spanish dishes, it is definitely worth a visit. You have to put a little effort in the communications as most of the merchants don't speak a word of English, but they do their best to understand the request.

Great mercado, went here every day. I loved this place. It was near my hotel and I went every day to get some breakfast or lunch. Too bad the place isnt open at night, they could do some cool things. You can find just about any food here. Prices are OK, a little high but it is a touristy area too. The main entrance area can get really packed with people. Definitely recommend at least one visit though.

Bring Euros for at least a snack.. Definitely worth the stop! Make sure you have at least a few Euros to spend on a snack. If you have access to a kitchen during your stay (e.g., rental apartment), you might even want to get some groceries here. If you are someone who finds the smell of seafood overwhelmingly repulsive or nauseating, then stick to the perimeter.
Busy but wow. . Just off las ramblas, really great street market. Selling lots of meats, fruit, juices and everything food wise in between. Was busy, but certainly wort a visit

Astonishing place . Astonishing place, I loved this market where you can find all the fresh & delicious goodies with lots of choices, many shops do refreshing freshly fruit juices, I'd like to visit this market every time I'm in Barcelona

Nice juices. We went in the afternoon so not everything was open. We particularly liked the juice stands (1 or 2 euros for a juice) and enjoyed getting freaked out by the various cuts of meat in the butcher stalls. If you've ever been to the borough market in London, this is similar but comes second place. Worth a visit though.

Had to come here. What a fantastic place, was told to visit here by a friend, great experience amazing food stalls, to buy for home or places just to sit and eat. The euro a time crushed ice fruit cups sold at the entrance are fantastic...very busy area and you need to keep an eye on your bags and pockets etc.

Interesting place to see all kind of fishes. This place is definitely for tourists. It has all kind of food stalls: meats, fruits, vegetables but the fish market is the one that defies your imagination. The vendors do not mind when you take pictures and that's great!
Everything is fresh but very pricey!

Excellent fresh produce. . I loves me going here early in the morning to pick up some breakfast. All the food is unbelievably fresh and there's a good vibe throughout the market. Stalls around the edge tend to be a tad pricier, so head into the middle for some bargains. A small note - whereas in the UK you can pick what you like up, some of the stall holders won't let you touch the produce and will hand it to you themselves!

Awesome market!. Great place to grab some food to take as a picnic to one of the many parks in Barcelona. Lots of great tapas and seafood. its an experience you should check out if you are in Barcelona.

Colourful market. Standard market in Spain, similar to Valencia. Good for buying meat, fish and fresh fruit or some sweets. Lots of colour, smells and people. Interesting to wander for an hour at most.

Excellent place. Is and excellent place, you have to visit, a lot of products means food. Meat, fruit fish Different products from around the world. Colors, smells and teast is my favorite description of this market.
Culturally Interactive Market:) Fun & Taste... . Plan one hour here. Take photos. Buy fresh and ready to eat fruits or drink a fresh juice of your favorite fruit. Try some bites here and there.

Touristy, But Still Worth A Visit. Although this market is filled with tourists (it sits right off of La Rambla in the middle of lots of touristy shopping), it is still worth a visit. It has an amazing display of meats and produce. You can also purchase items to eat and drink along the way.

Visit la boqueria markett.. Fine and delicious sea food , veggies , and especias from all around the world . You can have breakfast , lunch or even brunch there.Jamon Serrano or The famous Pata Negra jamon you can buy it by pound make sure if you buy it is packaging secure to enter US if your coming form here.Don't forget to eat at the Cochinillo Loco a small place al the way to the left of the market the plates are just amazing fresh and delicious try the Long try of all sea food is just surreal.

Amazing fresh food . I have seen many chefs from around the world rave about this market on television so to visit and see for myself was exciting!The market had a great atmosphere and buzz, with displays on each stall absolutely beautifully arrangedWe had tapas at one place and a seafood platter the next dayFantastic food and so fresh

Excellent selection of produce. This is a beautiful market with lots and lots of excellent Spanish produce. You can also have nice shops to eat something while on your way to Barceloneta via La Rambla.

Must visit when in Barcelona. I can only assume those don't rate this highly had a specific bad experience, or are a bit jaded with travelling generally! This place was wonderful - filled with delicious food! The fruit was amazing and incredibly cheap (punnets of blueberries for $1.50E!) the juices were wonderful, we had jamon and manchego in paper cups, and you simply must trek to the back of the market and find eslice pizza - YUM!

Dont miss it. Dont miss it. Although its a tourist trap, it is still interesting and nice. You can find different kinds of food, tapas, drinks, fruits, desserts. Really interesting for lunch and to look around. Good luck!!!

Crazy & Amazing. We stopped in Barcelona after our cruise and stayed a few days. Our hotel was centrally located in The Ramblas and we of course stopped at the much talked about Mercat de Sant Josep de la Boqueria. It was crazy, but in a great way. The amount of food options is overwhelming. You can pick from fresh meats to fresh produce, seafood, etc. We stopped here for breakfast almost every day and pickup a little bit from here and a little from there. Prices are ridiculously cheap (at least compared to where we live). My husband who loves to cook said he would go nuts if he lived near this place and would go there everyday to pick out his fresh food for the day. It really was a great place.
Nice tourist trap.. Quality, but expensive. Upmarket souk v london market. Expensive but very stylish produce, from fruit stall to meat and fish stall. Tapas stalls etc. All for tourists.

unbelievable. Just off la rambla this market just sucks you in, the place is a bustling place and you find yourself walking round and round trying to take in the stalls whether it be frsh fish, meats or the fantastic food stalls that are plenty. we were spoilt for choice but ended up with tapas to take away and even returned later in the day for seconds. the prices weren't what youd call tourist prices given its position but great value for money. give this place a visit

If your a foodie fan, check it out.. All I can say is that this place is awesome! there is so much to see and eat that its like a kid lost in a candy store. The stuff we tasted was really good and the flavors.. omg delicious. Just watch your pockets. Its crowded and a place for folks to try to nab your cash.

Wow, food as art!! Two hours just looking, so beautiful here.... This is a must do, foodies HEAVEN!. We may have walked right past this beautiful market, but the skies opened and we dashed in to find shelter. We walked in and after a short distance we both stopped, our jaws dropped and we looked at each other, wow.....said low and with respect..... This is something that has to be seen to be believed.... The way they present food is amazing. Beautiful paper cones of dried meat, the to die for Spanish ham on the stands, take a slice or five.... The fish all lined up in art form, the fruit looking like a photograph, everything, every single little thing is a design, an art piece, this is beauty made from food, inspiring, well worth an hour or more. This is NOT only or even 'simply' a food market, it HAS to be seen to be believed. Want to try the amazing Spanish breads? Do it here! The cheeses, omg! Foodies heaven!!!
Such a great place. If you are looking for healthy foods with a low price this is THE place. You can choose a juice from 838473 options and the same with the fruits
Barcelona mid-week city break . A must for all foodies... incredibly fresh produce and a terrific insight in to Spanish/Catalonian culture. The pictures say it all...

Come to visit. If you are in Barcelona, please, come to visit it! My mome said, she would come again just to drink one more fresh juice, because there are plenty of it!) any fruits you want! And cheese! I love it!)

Great Market. The food is great here. Lots of fresh fish, meats, bread and produce. The Fresh made fruit drinks are delicious and a lot cheaper than in the restaurants and cafes. If you want to take home some local favorites like the Serrano ham better known as Iberico ham shop owners will package them for you for transporting.

Fun and Exciting. This is a definite must see. An open market where people sell their goods, mainly focused on foods. Also has great little restaurants throughout the market. The area is exciting. Be sure to watch your time...the first day we went it was closed by the time we got there (by 8pm) But no one had mentioned there were certain hours. Lucky for us, we were there 2 days so we went back the second day. Definitely worth it!

Colour and movement. If you like visiting markets as we do,this warrants a visit. The colours and fresh fruit and takeaway ham, cheese and bread on offer make it an interesting and exciting venue. Lots to see. We ate at the universal kiosk which was good and there are lots of places to sit bar style and eat. We went around 5pm on a Wednesday and while stalls were closing down the crowds at eating places weren't too bad. Enjoy!

Supposedly a tourist market, but the old market still zings with fun and energy.. We found here - following a little guidance, of course, a great restaurant in the middle of the market, souvenirs from stalls, lovely spices, nuts,fresh fruit, cheeses, olives and meats. The meal we loved? La Quim de laboqueria. YUM and terribly fun to watch 5 people working with grace in the space of a bathroom. Remember its best to come outside of the siesta hours.
Wow!!. This was a visit to remember!! The energy of the place was spectacular as well as the range of foods and produce available. Get there early though as it gets insanely busy.

Love food & cooking? One of the best food markets, anywhere!. If you love food and cooking, you don't just visit the Boquería - you make a pilgrimage there. Yes, it's packed with tourists and priced accordingly (especially the stalls near the front entrance), but so what, it's a food lover's paradise. Makes you want to move to Barcelona JUST so you can shop for your produce there and go home and cook it. Or pick one of the many delectable restaurant counters and revel in high quality, fresh food cooked in front of you. You have no excuses not to go!

Touristy and average. After hearing so much about this market I was really looking forward to my visit but I felt rather let down. The quality of the stalls looked good but the entire market was flooded with tourists- not surprising considering its location. The prices were decent though- perhaps just not the most authentic place you can visit in Barcelona. Worth a visit if you're in the area.
For breakfast. A must see. Lots to eat and bring home, if you have a kitchen. Come early or late. It gets hot. Easy access from La Rambla.
One of the bet markets. One of the best markets I have seen.Very colourfull,great food,good quality,good prices.If you are on a low-budget trip you can go and eat there with a couple of euros.

Best thing in Barcelona for people that love food. My family and I absolutely love visiting this place. This is a foodie heaven serving almost anything you can think of. I had one of the best kimbaps at this stall called Mikkita, and we always grab a juice for 1.50 to 2 euros (my favorite being anything with coconut). Fresh cut fruits (coconuts, watermelon, papaya, pitaya, etc.) are served in many of the stalls. You can't miss coming here if you enjoy eating.

Amazing marketplace. This place is right off Las Ramblas and is a "Must see" in Barcelona. They have an amazing variety of things to eat and drink. Get a smoothie. Buy a sandwich. Just wander and look. It's super. The only negative is lack of seating. Go all the way to the back outside and hope for a spot.
experince the culinary history of barcelona. best place to see what a city is about is through its market and this place is a barometer, also good tapas bars too.
Interesting. If you have time you can visit it it is a very big market full of everything; but be careful with your Bags rucksacks etc. There are lots of pickpocketers

Sense the pulse of Barcelona!. The A-Z of marketing edibles....a place buzzing with activity not just by tourists but equally by locals. Makes you feel the pulse of the city since its just off La Rambla. To top it all, you can have an experience of tapas and wash it down with fresh fruit juices
This place doesnt open on Sundays. I hadnt been there because the market doesnt open on Sundays... Pay attention when you plan your trip.The market stay located on La Rambla easy access.

Great market but so crowded!. This market is fantastic - lots of fruit, juices, meats, seafood... Great for all things local and edible but very packed with people. Have your money ready in a safe but accessible spot.

A must! . You can't visit Barcelona without visiting le Mercat Boqueria. Whether you're a foodie or not, this place will astound you with its range of produce on offer.Fresh juices, empanadas, meats and cheeses in little sample cones of waxed paper, the freshest seafood and shellfish you are ever likely to eat.I don't remember the name of the stand where we ate scallops, huge prawns and white anchovy (as big as tasty as the sardines they had run out of) but it had a queue which always looks like a good recommendation. We only waited 2 mins and then were seated at the bar on stools, watching the chefs prepare meal after delicious meal. This place, along with a hundred other things, makes me want to live in Barcelona!

Amazing market. This market was highly recommended by a local friend and she did not disappoint. What an amazing market to have. The array of food, sweets, seafood and meats is outstanding. We sampled marzipans, ice cream, juice, chorizo just to name a few. We left with plenty of goodie bags and a happy heart. Would recommend this highly to anyone visiting BCN.

Colourful market. Every morning I used to visit the market. A couple of the stalls sell ice cold fruit juices which on a hot day were very welcome. Also tubs of fresh fruit I bought to snack on during the day exploring Barcelona

It is impossible not to visit this place. It is impossible not to visit this place.Market authentic middle Ramblas pedestrian street.Market has everything you want and most importantly do not buy, the most important thing just to go to this special place.Warmly recommended.

very interesting!!!!!. don't hesitate to go there!! take a walk and eat there with a good smoothie! Tasty smells accompany you throughout paths and fruits of all the colors for the delight of eyes! And it is very good!!

Fabulous. You can spend the whole day in this market! You can find everything: fish, meat, fruit, dessert, bread.. I suggest the traditional salami. You can buy 10 different kind of them in a mini box just for 6€. Another typical food is the jambon. You can taste it as a tapas in lots of stand. You can always drink the juices that you can buy for 1€. This is a special place!

Full catalan style!. Take a moment to visit La Boqueria, one of the oldest mercados in Barcelona; plunge deep down in the unique atmosphere, you could find incredible local treats batidos and fresh fruit juices!

Full but nice. There are fresh fruits, sausages and sweets. If you want to try different things you should visit the market but there are a lot of people in there. We had problems to see everything because it was so full. Still you should go there and have at least a look on all the good things they sell there.

Totally Eye Candy. This was a great free experience for my family. We wandered off the la Ramblas into this open market. The food variety is so fun to look at. This has been an open air market ever since the 12th Century. What a fun place to eat lunch. You must stop and try something from the vendors. We loved the empanadas and you can't go wrong with the fresh fruit juice.
Side trip ftom Ramblas... A vegetable and meat market...nothing special...take a few minutes to check it out but dont linger....

Colorful market. La Boqueria is a beautiful market on Las Ramblas where you can find everything you need- meat, fruits, seafood, chocolates etc'. It can be a little crowded so I would suggest going early morning.

Best market in Barcelona. Situated halfway up La Rambla, this justly famous market offers everything to both locals and tourists alike. We were not self catering so did not take advantage of the produce on offer but the fruit, veg and meat looked wonderful - especially the section of the market devoted to fish. Instead, we concentrated on the refreshments stalls, which did not disappoint! Crowded and noisy, this market has a great atmosphere - definitely not one to miss for any visitor to Barcelona. As ever, all visitors need to be careful of their belongings while enjoying the market - but if I ever do decide to go self catering during a visit to this lovely city, this will be the first place I come for supplies. In any case it is a great source for both picnic supplies and gifts for people back home.

Amazing! You must definetely go there!. As we were walking through La Rambla we randomly entered the market. It was the most lucky thing we did in Barcelona! We were amazed by the atmosphere and how the catalan easy going nature reflected on this place. It has something for everyone! Fruits, fresh juices, meat and fish in everyway they come! For photographers it is a must-visit attraction

A Must See Market in Barcelona. My wife and I went to the Saint Joseph Boqueria twice while in Barcelona from July 6-11. This is the kind of European food market you read about or see in the movies. Very colorful with a wide variety of meats, cheeses, seafood and desserts. Pretty much anything you could want you will find at the Boqueria. While there we tried many different fruits, candies and hams. I liked the fact that you could buy smaller portions from the vendors to try as a snack. If you find yourself in Barcelona, you need to go to the Boqueria. You wont't be disappointed.

Beautiful market!. This is one of my favourite places to visit in Barcelona. La Boqueria is an absolutely beautiful market on Las Ramblas where you can find everything you need under the one roof. The effort that the stall holders go to is beyond expectations, the presentation of the fresh food, fruit, chocolates, fruit juices, nuts, meat and seafood is truly amazing. The market is a great place to mix amongst the locals going about their daily shopping. It can get a little crowded however it's all part of the fun of visiting. I would suggest going early morning to get the best look at all the produce.

Not only fruit and veg but entertainment as well!. Fruit stacked beautifully, so colourful, meat and fish being cut up in front of you, olives, cheese, cakes to purchase. Then take a seat in a cafe or inside the market at one of the stalls serving food, have a wine or a beer with lunch and be entertained by wandering minstrels. Be amongst the locals and enjoy the vibe.

One of the best food markets in europe. There is a reason why this market is rated one of the best food markets in Europe - that it because it is. This place is amazing and it is all about food. Every thing from fresh fruit and vegetables to meat, fish, cold cuts, nuts, sweets bars and cafes.It is very clean, crowded but in a pleasant way and you can get some great.

Enjoyable experience . This market is a very enjoyable experience,here u can find fresh food and vegetables and enjoy them on the spot.The kids enjoyed seeing the variety of food there especially big sized fish and crab,lobster...A nice place to visit while on the go

Beautiful market to visit as part of your trip in the city!. The market is in the middle of the city Rambla but it is not the main attraction, so you must be carefull to find it while walking the crowded streets because the entrance, being as flashy as it seems in the pictures, at first sight and with the entrance crowded, can be confused with all the beautiful buildings around it, more . But after you find it and you get in, it is a showcase of colors, aromas and flavors you must add to your itinerary even if you only want to take some pictures and continue your trip. If you go to the bottom of the market you will find some less crowded restaurants and a plaza to have a break eating a gelato, fruit salad or slices of jamon Iberico...

Amazing experience ! . Fresh everything ! If you want to cook yourself or grab some take away tasty morsels this is the place. There are a few bars located to sit and eat inside we hear pinotxo is the best but it was full so we tried bar central which was ok but not worth the price. We got some fabulous take away tapas for later and was a sensational experience.

A shame I don't like fish. A vibrant, busy food market with plenty to see, just off La Rambla. Great if you want either a snack or a bigger meal from one of the cafe type stalls. Plenty of fruit and veg too, and lots of fish and sea food.

Vibrant and colourful . A really interesting place to see
Amazing selection of food and drinks with places to sit and eat and try the local specialities.
A great atmosphere but very busy
Colourful and a good buzz

More fun than a museum. Wandering the market stalls was absorbing and fascinating - many are more like food works of art! More fun than a museum! Stallholders are friendly even to (polite) tourists and you can often buy a small sample (1€) as a taster. Most of the tapas bars and restaurants within the complex also look enticing - we tried several, including El Quim and Pinotxo, both super and better eating than many other restaurants outside the market. Pick the busiest, let the staff know you're waiting, and they'll look after you. A real highlight of Barcelona

Amazing long weekend. Is this the best food market in the world?Borough in London is good, but for sheer vibrancy this is better.Multiple displays, especially fish and fruit/veg help create a backdrop of colour that is ramped up by the theatre. And then you can eat!Best lunch in Barca. Go. Enjoy.

Magnificent place, mandatory to visit. The market is very big but also very crowded. I recommend not to go in the eating hours as It's difficult to get around and look at everything. The price depends, of course, on what you want to buy, but by rule, it's not an expensive place and I would go there again.
A truly great market experience. Loved this place. Busier than heck but tons of new foods, great displays, friendly people. Great spot for lunch and break from the hustle of La Rambla.

Fresh and colourful food fiesta that is just so charming. If you are staying around the Las Ramblas then this is one place you must not miss. Start your day with a breakfast which is being right in front of you by some very friendly people who while struggling with spoken English will make a valiant effort to communicate effectively yet. The food is tasty, home cook feel and variety around you very sumptuous. You can buy ham, cheese, fresh cut fruit,bread, pastry, coffee, olives, fresh juices, cooked breakfast and the rest. It is also a great place to walk through. It is a pity that they do not remain open for dinner service or shopping. I would have rated it 4 star for that, but immediately felt remorse at the very thought for the charm it brought to us during our repeated visits.
nice. Recommend this marketVery beautiful and where there is everythingMeat, fruit and vegetables and chocolate and other pretty things

A must visit in Barcelona!. The Boqueria Market on La Ramblas is a large covered market that sells cheap food, drinks, fruits, vegetables, meats, sweets, snacks and souvenirs.It is open from Monday to Saturday 8 am to 8:30 pm and draws a huge crowd during lunch time when we were there.A must visit when you are in Barcelona!
