Busy markets with lozof ppl. Mayb we went there too late, there were pack of ppl wait and sit for lunch. we couldn't actually sit down and enjoy the lunch instead of stood at no where corner and ate our snacks, beautiful ham, yummy.

Wonderful Market. You can find anything and everything fresh here in this old world market. Each vendor has an unique set of goods for sale. There are meat vendors, seafood vendors and tons of vegetables too. Even if you aren't in the market to buy, it's worth a trip to see it.

This place is great fun and an essential part of any visit to Barcelona. Every time I go to Barcelona I must have a wander around this market. Yes, it is really busy with tourist's and locals, Yes, it can feel a little claustrophobic but that is part of the buzz. The food you can buy it really fresh and lovely. I love this place and think if you don't visit La Boqueria you are missing a quintessential part of life in Barcelona.

A good detour from Les Ramblas. Loved the stalls and sights of food of sorts. It was busy in the morning and we could not find seats to try the tapas bars. Managed to do some takeaways and chorizos. Not overpriced despite being a popular tourist attraction.

Yum!!!!!. A feast for the eyes as well as the tummy! You can get a delicious reasonably priced lunch or take food home: roasted nuts of every variety, exotic fruits, freshly squeezed juices, cured meats, really good cheeses, freshly cooked seafood, candies etc etc etc. Some places have seats, but most likely you will be standing. The only real negative is the pushy vendors that borderline harass you to buy and have no patience for your picture-taking. My experience would've been greatly improved of they had been a little more easygoing and less annoying.

Great indoor market to visit. . It's right off the las Ramblas avenue in the enter of Barcelona. The market is amazing and huge. There are many restaurants in it to experience all the great seafood Barcelona has to offer.

Fun.... Extremely busy place,with great variety of food and drinks.There are some fruits and vegetables I've never eaten.Lot of delicious things,mostly beautifuly displayed.Go there for a snack or just to enjoy that lively place.

Fun, crazy place. I have been here a couple of times. It is a fun place to grab a few things to eat. There are a couple of sit down places, which are nice, but on this trip with a family of five, we just went around to different stalls, getting a bit here and there and eating as we walked along.It is very busy, so finding those sit down spots can be challenging.
It must be visited. What wonder me more, it is the ofter prices are lower than other market in town, while I was expecting the opposite.A place where to find fresh juice, fruit and a lot of food.
Loved this. Just loved this market with local food, amazing stalls! we walked around and if I stopped at every stall to check all the offers amd try everything it would have taken me allweekend :-)

Best place in the world to get inspired for cocking. . I visit this place every time I am in BCN and stay in an apartment where I can cook a great meal.The only downside is thatIt gets really crowded. So go early to get some power shopping done.

Must be one of the best food markets in the world !!!. A visit here is a must when in Barcelona!!! Wide range of vendors, food stall, Fruit, Fish , meat.
get's busy so go early. breakfast on a mushroom mix ,, fried in olive oil and garlic. to die for !!!
Respite for the Weary. After a few days of traveling, eating out, and sight seeing this was the perfect place to land for fresh fruit, fresh juice, sampling of Turon, Calamari, and even wine!
Great fresh food. Lots of fresh fruit, juices, nuts, empanadas, charcuterie meats and much more. Is a great option for snacks and drinks or for a light meal. Lots of varied and good quality food.
Visual delight. Worth a visit for the assault to all of your senses. The colours, beautiful displays, the smells and the taste of the food. Great produce and excellent range.

My happy place . Go here. Eat everything. Be happy.
The meat and cheese shops all have little to go samplers so start with that.
We went here our first afternoon in Barcelona and just sampled everything. Finished it off with amazing ice cream.

Vibrant Markets. One of the Highlights of Barcelona. Lots of fresh fruit, juices, nuts and other snacks all very cheap. If you want to experience authentic Paella or tapas i would recommend coming here. In the middle of a shopping strip so be sure to check out all the clothes shops however be careful of pick pocket's as its particularly bad here

A must!. We visited here numerous times as our hotel was fortunately very close by. The fresh juices, fruit and food is so fresh and tasty. To wander around is a real pleasure enjoying the smells and colourful sights of the fresh produce. We had breakfast (churros) which were very tasty at a cafe here one morning and tapas dinner one evening which was the best tapas we have ever tasted. Strongly recommend a visit here when exploring the Ramblas. Would love to return!

Snacks and fresh products. Despite the market being located in a street that I really don't like (Las Ramblas), it is a great spot to visit. Make sure to try the juices, dried fruits, sweets, jámon, everything. We snacked on a lot of things and it was delicious. We also bought a lot of dried fruits to take home.

Cheap juices and fruit salads.... Only €2 - €2.50. And they are fresh. So if you are thirsty and sun stricken, go and have something cold inside. You will also be rewarded with some excellent presentations of meat and fish stalls!

Interesting and vibrant msrket. This market is great if you're going for a snack, drink, meal, nuts or candy, or just wishing to watch the people go by. Bring your camera and careful with your things.
Must come and spend some times here. A very organized market in a very central location. You don't only see many local foods, but can also stop at those mini bars and taste many of them.
Pleasure before business.. Large shopping grocery market with vegetables, fruit, meat, fish. Very popular and centrally located. Areas within to get tapas and drinks. Worth seeing.

A hidden treasure. Random / simple late breakfast option. Love the market setting and the interactive staff. Very big portion served (at least to Asian), and all freshly prepared. Pan con tomato was provided together with the main dish so it appears that we over ordered, again. lol.

Cool place to visit. Very nice and traditional attraction in the heart of Las Ramblas. The natural fruit juices nice and cold are a refreshing surprise under the hot sun. Trying the many different tapas is also a must!
Gorgeous markets. Great little markets with fresh fish, fruit and veggies, chocolates and much more. Another Barcelona highlight.

Worth a visit!. This place is very busy and tight quarters (so zip your purse and be aware!) If you go towards the back there are very good tapas places, less crowds, and places to sit. Friendly staff at the main bar in the back. Look around before you decide what to eat. The gelato is slightly better on the street though.

Must see !. Hello there tripadvisors. We (young couple) went in May in Barcelona. I strongly recommend to go to Mercat de la Boqueria (it`s easy to arrive there especially if you plan to walk on Ramblas). It`s the biggest and crowded market in Barcelona with many products for sale and fair prices (we bought 2 crabs ~ 2 kg for 10E to cook and some fruit salads ~ 2E /300g).

Fresh food at its finest!. A great place to tour or catch a seat at the dining bar for freshly prepared seafood or ham. The prices are reasonable, the stalls are clean and well stocked. You can find wonderful nuts and sweets too.

I really wanted to love it, but left unimpressed with quality of products. With its charming aesthetic and super convenient location of La Rambla, I was really expecting a wonderful experience. Perhaps I didn't know where to look, and there's certainly no shortage of options, but I was at no point compelled to buy anything. Definitely better food to be had around town, better charcuterie, etc., but at least you won't have to veer far off course.

Interesting place to visit. While we didn't purchase anything here, it sure is an interesting place to visit! So many vendors and different foods. It was quite crowded when we visited so we didn't spend a lot of time here. Definitely worth seeing!

Great.. Amazing market with loads to see and loads of foods to try. The little places with small bits of food to try are great. I'd highly recommend the little fish stall where you can purchase a cone of different types of fish all cooked differently ..so yummy! Massive selection of fruit, fish and meat. Lovely experience.
Yummy!!. You can have seafood tapas fresh and delicious. And not expensive at all! Lots of markets selling sea food and also fruits of any kind.

Lots to see, like big prices..... Staying just off La Ramblas, naturally we checked out this market. The open hours on the website are not accurate. We went twice when it apparently should have been open and it was closed. Note that later in the day lots of the stalls start to close. Prices are high. Pretty sure there are lots of "special deals" for tourists. One bargain hunter tip: if your kids like real fruit smoothies, hit the market about 15-30 min before it closes in the evening. The fruit stands are trying to get rid of all their smoothies and you can usually get deals like 2 smoothies for €2. Interesting market to see. Don't plan to shop there for your produce and fresh food, unless you don't care about prices.

Fresh!!!. Great place to start your day with fresh fruits and juices, to see many colors!!! Off course you can go later to eat lunch, seafood! We tried mix fruits with coconut, energy to get started for an all day walking... Just choose from whom you will eat because some of them are a little bit dirty!

Tourist trap. We came here thinking it is the largest and best market in Barcelona .. well it is large, but definitely not the best in terms of quality. Fruits were old, nothing looked fresh. 90% people walking around were tourists. I don't think locals shop here. A few days later we found a more "local" mercat and it was great. Smaller but the quality was much better. Maybe we went at the wrong time of the day ..

Food lovers paradise . We visited this market around lunch time and wow what an experience. Fresh fruit, seafood and empanadas galore. We wandered around the market and were able to try food from a few different market stalls. Really tasty food and a must visit when in Barcelona!
Amazing. 10/10 Amazing everywhere you look there are interesting colourful food stalls would go back for sure. Amazing fruit stalls

Foodies Paradise!. It's a big and colourful market with big variety of seafood, meats, fruits, smoothies and traditional Spanish cuisine products. There are also places where you can eat for lunch or you can eat a small tapas of different vendors. It's a must visit place in Barcelona!
Food . Who doesn't love food, go get sticky fingers with some saucy fruit or buy a big old dead fish head

A Cacophony of Sight, Sound and Smell. Just steps from the Rambla, this indoor/outdoor market for fresh food, especially seafood, is busy with teeming humanity.Sometimes, it's hard just to navigate thru the crowds. But count on getting fresh food!Plan your visit for mealtime, but expect to spend a good 30-45 minutes to discover the choices before selecting your meal, then settle down to enjoy it in the adjoining plaza.
Plenty of fruits, sausage and seafood!. There are so many choices in this magnificent market! It's always crowded there, but it's closed on Sunday. The fruits are very fresh and good value for money!

OMG!!!!! My favorite. This market is amazing!!!!! You can find delicious fruits, vegetables, meats and everything is super fresh. We were tourists so we didn't need groceries or anything like that, but we had an amazing time. If I ever come back to Barcelona that will be the place that I will definitely repeat. BTW the food from the restaurants inside the market is really good and very affordable

As good and varied a food market as you'll find. Divided into sections for fruit, meat, veg, wholefoods, fish & seafood, food & smoothie stalls... you'll wish you were self-catering if you're in a hotel!Snack, drink, perch on a bar stool and have Tapas, take pics ...... a vibrant and mouthwatering place! Go early with the locals or be a sardine with the other tourists!

The place to eat!!. Great place to go with friends. Lots of small vendors and restaurants is an open market. Fresh sea food, steaks, fruits, meats and cheeses. Check online for opening hours most places closed by 8pm
Fascinating!. A must visit to this busy atmospheric market. The food on offer is of high standards and some of the best stuff Ive seen in a market before so much variety and colour.

Lovely!. Amazing market, so colourful and full of amazing things! It's full of tourists and super busy but definitely worth a visit. So much fresh fruit, veg, ham, fish, sweets etc! It's a good idea to go and get some goodies for a little picnic. There is another market near the cathedral (big colourful roof), we went to both and found la boqueria to be better.

Like the dinner scene from the movie Hook!! :D. Brilliant!!! Sorry, had to get that out of the way!As a diehard foodie I have sniffed out markets in every country in Europe and a few further a field, this market was however on a completely different level!The variety, vibrancy, colours and aromas make it a fantastic way to spend a morning/lunch/dinner/secondsies! The stalls and decorations are fantastic, with plenty of options to pick up and nibble as you go. If I've not sold it to you by now then go to the market and prove me wrong [see what I did there]!
Super Mercado!. Amazing market in the heart of the city combining real meat, fish and produce dealers with stands to feed the tourists

Foodie Heaven!. This is my favourite market in the world! Busy and used both by local and tourists, this market us vibrant, colourful and boasts an abundance of choice for the traveler on a budget or who is looking for a healthy meal. We ate here every day for lunch and ate fish cooked on the spot, calzones, fresh fruit, juice, nuts, olives, fresh bread, noodles and more.

Fantastic array of food to delight every taste. Visited on recommendation from my brother and so glad we did. Plenty of market stalls to eat hot or cold foot as well as drink. If you're after specialist fish or vista of meat or even rare veg and fruit come here. There is a great buzz so well worth visiting on your walk down la rambles.

A good place to visit . Always have a visit to the market when walking down La Rambla.
It has decent fresh food and drink; and plenty of places to eat as well.
That said, it always seems very busy.

Amazing - A Must To Visit. I have not seen a market like this anywhere. Sure it caters for the tourists but primarily the locals use it so well. The food displays are great - a photographer's dream. If I was staying somewhere with self catering the food choices here are incredible and everything looks so fresh - fruit, meat, fish, confectionery etc. it is only a food market. As a traveler the best part are the food/drink bars dotted around the market - this is where you come for breakfast and see how many locals are there chowing down on many Spanish delights while sipping on a glass of Cava, wine or beer - great start to the day! Colourful, buzzing and very exciting - do not miss this place, visit often; so much to see.
Senses. All senses of the human body come into action only and we feel like it puts them all in action. Delicious and fresh products. I advise juices and delicious fruit.

Super Crowded- but fun. This is a great afternoon activity. However to warn you, it is super crowded and the aisles are very small. It's great just to walk around and marvel at all of the fresh food on offer.

Foodies paradise. Great place to spend an hour or two. Everything to do with food. Fresh fruit and vegetables, fresh seafood, fresh meat of all kind, beef, lamb, pork, goat, rabbit, offal of all kind, also poultry os all kind, delicatessen lines, processed meats, cheeses, herbs and spices and nuts. Even prepared meals ready to eat. Get there early to take advantage of the freshness.

Homenaje for Tapas. There is a wonderful little tapas place in an alley next to the market, Very much worth looking for. We tried the sampler plate which gave us a variety of local specialties. Very good server and reasonable prices.After or before your meal, you can explore the sights, sounds and smells of the market.Several other small restaurants on the same street looked interesting as well

Farmer's Market On Steroids!. Amazing! This place is a cornucopia of deliciousness...seafood, meats, spices, fruits, veggies, breads, and olive oils all beautifully displayed. Some of the vendors have counters where visitors can sit and order meals and drinks. I think I could live there. Go early - it gets a bit warm.

Even if you do not buy anything it is a must see.. I was impressed right away by the color, sights and smells. You can wander and look. Do not touch the fruit. Vendors got upset when my wife wanted to squeeze the peach. I enjoyed it.

La Boqueria the right place for quick Lunch. La Boqueria is an oasis of good, reasonably priced food on Las Ramblas. Not amazing deals, but good enough you don't feel taken advantage of. Market is great because you can see the food you want, and point to what you want (at most shops)Any other place along Las Ramblas will either cost a lot or have a great deal but poor food. La Boqueria is a fun market, with probably over 30 vendors, with all different kinds of food and drinks, including desserts. It's fun to just walk around and look, but way better to buy a few interesting things to snack on. Problem is most places here at La Boqueria don't have seats, so you would need to buy and then go find a place to eat if it's anything more than finger food. Much of the food = snacks, not a full hot meal, but a few places do cook and serve it hot. Almost always crowded, but that is half the fun.

Grab some food with the locals. Wish we had found this place before we had lunch, what a great atmosphere, fresh food eaten right in the middle of the market. Fresh Fruit smoothies, stirfrys and seafood, all smelt amazing.

It's a must!. You have to go there and grab something quick to eat, or maybe a glass of fresh fruit or some fruit juice, or some sweets. It's and expensive place, but it's something you have to do when in Barcelona, at least once.

Don't miss out on a snack or meal here. Amazing market full of the sights sounds and smells of Spain where you can eat, drink buy wonderful local produce, fabulous displays of fruit veg, fish, meats and cooked food, absolutely fabulous and mouthwatering, also gets you out of the midday sun, don't walk by

Large market, fun to wander . This place has pretty much anything food wise I think you can need for meals...Meat, fish, veggies, fruit, oils, condiments, seasonings.....Gets super busy in the weekends with tourist since it is right in La Rambla, but we went earlier in the day, 9am or so, and had a great selection and less crowds.There are also coffee bars & places to grab a quick bite.A little bit of everything...

Always a pleasure to get lost in it. I love to get lost in la Boqueria. I've been in many markets in the world, but la Boqueria keeps at the very top: the smell, always busy, the way products are exposed, the singularity and the quality of the goods,... A must see place in Barcelona: all kinds of people will enjoy it!

Mercat de Sant Josep de la Boqueria: An Refuge of food and friends!. I ran into this attraction by pure accident. I was walking down Las Ramblas when I saw little ladies with basket full of produces, chesses, eggs, meats and more. I walked down from where they were coming from and I saw this huge market full of life…people and food. I visited three times and enjoyed a variety of foods every time.I was lucky enough to meet some members of the association responsible for the market. There are mostly traders and experts in their fields. The result of this is that you would eat high quality and mostly locally grown foods!! In La Boqueria you can buy fresh items to cook with it, or you can simply eat there. The small stands offers, over 300 of them, offers a series of pastries, candies, cut up fresh fruits, sausages, sandwiches, tapas and drinks! The prices are reasonable as this is a locally visited market. Actually I did not see to many tourists. I bought some candy, a cup full of fresh fruit, ice cream and tapas. I spent about 12 euros’. I recommend that you walked around and take in the vendors, the people and the whole daily activity. You can stop and sit and drink a refreshing drink and eat something delicious, such as a ham sandwich. Or walk into one of the many restaurants and bars inside the Market. There are many of them ready to serve!La Boqueria is located within Las Ramblas 91 08001, Barcelona. Wear good shoes and walk slowly. I am sharing another fact with you. This market was once a convent. The Convent of San Jose was founded in 1586…not sure when it became a market. See? You can find out when the convent became a market…and let me know.Please be aware of your surrounding. Though the people are friendly and I suggest that you practice Spanish, this is an easy place for pickpockets. Meanwhile all these talking about food reminded me I bought a book in a bookstand in the market and I am just might cook some tapas today! Happy Eating!

Vibrant!. Even close to closing time, this market continues to bustle. After dinner at Nuria, we rambled down o the Mercat and picked up some fresh fruit for dessert. Cherries were scrumptious. Buy from deep inside the market if you can.
This is the main Barcelona market. Huge selection of any foods. You can chose jamon, fruits, cheese, etc. After then you can drink cold beer and eat percebes or navajas just here.

Such a wonderful place!. Oh, the wonderful and unbelievable offerings at this market! Our favorite was fresh squeezed juice of every kind imaginable from Orange to strawberry, coconut, papaya and even Dragon fruit. Hundreds of colorful glasses lined up €1-2. Then the beautiful huge fruits and vegetables. We bought the biggest macadamia nuts like we never even dared imagine existed in Hawaii. The meat and seafood was unbelievable as well, fun to just see. Restaurant type food counters as well. We went to the market twice but I would love to go back every day! If you love food, or just like looking, you must go!
Wonderful smells, colours and food. Lovely visit for the day at this market. Lots of food, smells and food to show and definitely one of the better food markets I have been to before.
Amazing. The Market was full of fresh produce at reasonable prices. It had its own food bars where the seafood and tapas looked anazing
Beautiful shopping spot . This is a great experience, the variety available here is part of the experience. The people wandering around add a degree of wonder and take your time.

Good food. The Mercat de Sant Josep de la Boqueria is free to everyone and is located on Las Ramblas. It is a market and the fruits, vegetables, fish, meat look and taste sooo good. Move around the market a bot cause some merchants will sell you at touristic prices and some will do it at a local price.It is a great place for lunch or just passing by and having a snack. It is also great to do some shopping as there is so many good products to enjoy.

week end break. If you are a foody and love food a must. Such a treat for the eyes an nose, best selection of exotic fruits meats an fish displays. fantastic place to try tapas but expensive watch out for the tourist traps there ask for prices first. but definitely great choice an so fresh.we had coffee there each morning with the fresh chuchos memorable

Jamon Iberico - go for it!. Joan sells the best Jamon Iberico - pata negra, go for it! Also great cheeses. Lots of tourists. Not so many places sell fresh fish anymore, so becoming more for tourist trap though than a real market.

Colorful. Plenty of space with many shops for different tastes. You can find almost everything concerning fish, dry nuts and fruits. I did not like the fact that everything is closing almost before 20:00 so if you are hungry at that time you will have to go somewhere else.

Fun market to walk around. This market is tucked away on Las Ramblas and was fun to walk around. It has everything from vegetables and fruits, fresh meats and fish to candy and nuts. There is prepared food to buy and eat there or raw food to take home. It was very crowded when we were there and my guess is that it is always crowded.

A place that you can't miss!. This is a place that make us return thrice within a short span of 5 days we were in Barcelona! Everyday seems to be a new discovery for us. Luv this place. Beautiful product display that can't stop us from taking more photos! You will be spoilt for choice here. Skip having your bfast or lunch anywhere else. Have it here!
Colorful . This is one of those places you have to stop by when in BCN. Colorful, beautiful, tasteful... Fruits and fish appear to be plastic but they're not...

Bustling market. La Boqueria contains a huge variety of different food and drink market stands. We wandered around and chose some bits and pieces for our lunch and were impressed with the quality of the food and the friendliness of the vendors. Do go right inside as everyone gathered at the front entrance stalls but missed out on the great stalls inside/at the back! It is absolutely rammed though so we paid extra careful attention to our bags and pockets.

Wonderful experience. This was possibly one of the most colorful fun places to take a child and an adult who has never seen an indoor market. The displays by the vendors are very clean professional and eyecatching. I wish i could take the entire market back home with me. There are soooooo many varieties of olives....

Sensory overload. Wonderful mix of meat, fish, vegetables, fruit and nuts. The displays are second to none with the variety being something we can only dream of in the UK. Wonderful to look round and definitely worth trying the cones of cooked Iberian ham! Fish heaven!

Feel and enjoy the real Spanish life. A must see when visiting Barcelona, this traditional and famous market has it all, food, wine, tapas, fish.
ideal when feeling hungry, choose, be seated and enjoy either the real Iberico ham or for the fish lovers oisters, krab, squid.
Taste Spain in all it's flavors and look around you.

What a market!. This market not only sells the freshest produce but also is a place to eat and drink. Had we been in here first, we would have taken our lunch in one of these tables serving cooked food and wine located to the left side as you enter from La Rambla. It is also the perfect place to see what the Spanish shop for in terms of food, many types of hams, wines, cheeses and I even saw some fresh tropical fruits. Great place to wander around but prepare for the crowd especially around lunchtime, beware of beggars and pickpockets too.

Great food options. Not that big though. Salivate while strolling through the aisles and aisles of ham, chorizo, empanadas, nuts, dates, cheese and fruits. Feels a bit touristy than say, Queen Victoria Market in Melbourne or similar markets though. Most of the ready to eat food there so so.

Look&feel moment!. La Boqueria was just the perfect place for me...we were in Barcelona for few days and we return twice to La Boqueria. We dring wine in the small restoran on the left side of the market and eat very fresh fish in great kiosk Universal. Great place!

Fresh, Beautiful Food. The market is an upscale farm to table sort of place. The fruit was mind-blowing and inexpensive. Several stands also sell delicious fruit drinks for a Euro or two. It's easy to see why so many Spanish cooking tours start here. If you're doing any of your own cooking -- or want some snacks, this is a good choice. Also, if you want spices to take home -- there are a few outstanding stands here.

Great market, and excellent food. If you visit Barcelona there are probably five places to see that on your bucket list - Gaudi's church the Sagrada Familia. La Rambla. The monastery at Montserrat. Parc Guell. And la Boqueria market. Its among the best in the world for meat fish and vegetables. It is jammed with locals and tourists from early morning till it closes late afternoon and in addition to the stalls selling produce there are many of restaurant/bars serving some of the best food you'll find in the city. Grab a free stool at the counter of any of them and either point at what you want or check out the menu. It's like sitting at the chefs table and all the food is cooked right in front of you. Razor clams, mixed vegetables, deep fried baby calamari and the sweetest freshest anchovies you'll ever eat, mixed seafood plates with giant prawns and crayfish, they are all amazing. With a couple of glasses of wine and beer (ice cold Estrella) each at 2.50 euros a glass expect to spend around 15-30 euros a head. Two I'd recommend. Bar Clemens's towards the back of the market. And Bar Ramblero to your left as you enter the market from La Rambla. They open around 9 am and close around 8 30 pm so good for a meal any time and perfect for non European jet lagged passengers!

So much beautiful food to purchase, wish we weren't staying in a hotel. Located on Las Ramblas, this market is full of wonders. All kinds of food are beautifully displayed and sold here, from meats and cheeses to fish to fruit and vegetables to chocolate and candies. The fruit and vegetables are all polished to a high gloss, you don't see produce that looks like this in the US. The candies were especially well presented, with marzipan in every shape, size and color imaginable. We only wished that we had cooking facilities in our room so we could purchase some of the food and take it back to prepare for ourselves. We have seen many markets throughout Europe but I think this one is the best.

Good food. Ate at la bodeguita. good food. I had prosciutto and a toast with tomato. Very yummy. and bacalao croqueta was very good to. Just one thing that I guess you can expect in a place like that. Saw a small mouse.

Loved it!. Loved it here! So easy to find and so much to see. You'll see everyone with a cup of the delicious fruit juice, a lot of stalls for €1.50 however if you search round I found about four stalls where they were only €1. Toilets right at the back are kept very clean only €0.50 or if you show a receipt then free to get in. There's plenty of meat and fish stalls to look at, just make sure you don't get hit by a flying fish scale! Great place for a walk around and to find a bite to eat, I came by myself a few times and never felt out of place.

So much tasty food.. Lots of stalls. Fruit and veg, meat, fish, sweets, alcohol, cafes, flowers. Spoilt for choice. We went in afternoon. Some stalls already closed by the time we visited. All products very well presented. No clothes in this market only food. Normal prices. Plenty of tourists as well as locals.

Foodie delight. If you like your food fresh don't miss this market. its just off the Ramlas through a stone arch. Lots of bars and eating places as well as fruit and vegatables,a large fish market, hams and cheese.Plenty of tourists of course but plenty of places around the

Good deals. If you like the atmosphere of markets and open air eateries, this is a place for you. Although a bit compromised by tourism good food is still served here. After the appropriate wait for a table you can enjoy the nice attitude of the waiters and the freshness of the food. Enjoy1

Need to experience . What an experience this was. There are 40 food markets in Barcelona where people can go and do their shopping with the freshest most beautiful ingredients. However this is a little different with the many bars and places to eat where you can eat freshly cooked food using ingredients from the market. I would say do not go on a weekend as it was so overwhelming busy it was hard to get around and hard to get something to eat. So we went on another day and got to sample everything this place had to offer. A great experience

Feat your eyes and palate. La Boqueria is an institution, not a market. It is where you should go every morning of your stay to get fresh juice, fresh fruit, fantastic jambon and fresh bread. If this market was a film it would be Moulin Rouge with Ewan McGregor and Nicole Kidman: it opens up your eyes and makes your body sing.If you have the fresh juice look for the stalls that are kept clean (most are but some are OCD clean) and make the juice fresh. At the back there are few bakeries that also sell fresh bread, pastries and sandwiches so if you want a great breakfast for few euros then this is the place (much better than is a lot of the 5* hotels I stayed in, by the way).To see this place is a must when you visit Barcelona. I go there every time I am in town and it never ceases to show me another angle, another new facet, and bring another smile to my face.

Wonderful market, must visit in Barcelona!. This market was one of the highlights of our trip in Barcelona. We loved seeing the fresh fruit and vegetables, juices, pastries, nuts, meats, seafood and the list goes on. There are also a number of small bars selling tapas which looked amazing (we did not try so can't comment on taste). Great experience!!

Insanely vivid. This is how it looks on a Saturday: vivid place, lots of tourists taking photos with every tomato and coconut they will find... :), insanely colourful, a lot of varieties of fruits, vegetables, sweets, tapas, fresh fish and seafood... everything you wish to eat.. it's right there. Also, photographers will love this place.
Beautiful. Lovely market, so full of colour and authentic foods to buy. Every time I visit Barcelona I can't resist it.

a ''must see'' place. It's an interesting place where most of the tourists are visiting. We went there because we wanted to see local people and how they spend their tapas time. But it seems that most of the visitors were tourists. You can try sea food, different types of meat and various fruits, fruit juices etc. here. Try to allocate 1-2 hours and get inside to try something since the places on the outerside are much more expensive compared to the places inside and it is more difficult to get a seat outside!

Another market, but definitely worth a look. Right off of the Liceu Metro stop, this market is like many of the others throughout Spain. Lots of fresh juices, tapas stands, bars, meat/fish, etc. It was nice going early when the crowds haven't woken up yet. Unfortunately, that also means that a lot of the stands weren't open yet. There were interesting stands with ornate marzipan, which my wifey enjoyed. The empanada stand also had a wide variety and the tomato one made for a good breakfast in combination with a large fruit salad and a juice for 5 euro.In the end, it's another market, but if you're on La Rambla and looking for a quick bite or drink, you could do worse

Authentic but tourist trap!. We visited lunchtime on a Saturday which is NOT wise, it was the weekend of the Summer Solstice, incredibly full, could barely walk from one end to another, however there is some good food (incl tapas) to be found as well as fresh groceries. Worth a visit but pick a non dining time!

Yum Lunch . Had an amazing selection of seafood and fruit which were bought at various locations in here. Wonderful range of fresh food. Atmosphere is very Mediterranean and it's a wonderful place to taste browse and buy for later

yummy!. This market really is a jewel in the centre of Barcelona. We went there in the late afternoon, which is when you can get the fresh fruit juices cheaper. There is a variety of food and drinks and you can either eat there or take your food home.
Busy market. So good. Packed with people, food and photo opportunities. Has more than one good meal at the market, all good... But leave the stroller at home!

A must see when in Barcelona. This place is amazing, they have everything here. You can easily buy a few items from a variety of vendors and gave great meal. We had fresh seafood, ham, cheese, fresh squeezed juices, a lot of fun to go check out all the vendor offerings.

Great place!. Located in the Ramblas, this is of course a must in Barcelona. It's a great way to see the fresh ingredients of Spanish food and also try some dishes out. Try the embutidos inside a paper cone. The building itself is also very beautiful
Lovely. Don't miss this on las ramblas. Great architecture for great food. Chocolate covered strawberries on a stick--yum. Great for people watching

Colorful Food Carnival. La Boqueria Mercat is situated on Las Ramblas going from Plaza de Cataluna to the seaside. It is really a feast to the eyes and stomach as a reviewer writes. The colors, freshness of the foods take your mind away. There are many corners to taste what you see. It is crowded though. If you want to enjoy you have to give time and wander around. Prices are moderate. I strongly recommend to all Barcelona visitors.

A must see & a mustvtaste. Indulge in the smells and colours of the foods.The market is separated by types of food.Fruit/vegetable/meat/fish,..Try the tapas in the little bars doted around.Overcrowded by tourist nowadays but still a well functioning Mercado where you find the locals going shopping and going to have their midday tapas. So as they say, go where the locals go so you won't go wrong.

Best lunch spot in Barcelona. This is the greatest spot to really get in touch with the spanish flavours. You can choose from a variety of food stands, with great quality food and snacks like cheeses and prosciutto. Even the fresh fish and fruit looks amazing. I recommend also the "pinchos". It can be cheap (and delicious!) to buy luch here, the only downside is finding a place to seat.

Never lack of surprises. I was in Barcelona last year for 4days and out of it, i went to the market twice.La boqueria market is like a heaven to me.5j iberico ham, seafood corner, cheese selections. There are restaurants/cafes surrounding it and you will be spoilt for choice! It is a place i will recommend for anyone going to Barcelona and is a foodie.

Fascinating and Colourful Market. A feast for the eyes as well as the stomach.Great colourful displays of all types of food.It appears that you have to queue to get a seat in the cafes.Closed on Sundays - beware of buying on a Monday - e.g. coconut was off.

Too crowded couldn't enjoy properly. Everyone says that this Market is amazing. And the little amount of time I spent there it looked great. The locals buy there and it's not expensive (they say). But it's so touristic, it has so many people I felt I couldn't enjoy it as I should. It's a pity.

A place to visit in barcelone. If you are a foodie like me , you can't miss La boqueria marketIt is a show of the best product available in Spain, we spended all the morning, we had lunch outside in a terrace , they are all goodWe had the fish parillade which was a must , percebes and, and....Don't miss it

Bustling. Mercat de Sant Josep de la Boqueria is always busy with tourists taking photos and not buying anything. If you visit please buy something out of courtesy as these stall holders have to make a living and can't if those wishing to make a purchase cannot get to the stalls. It is a market !
Fantastic market. Wonderful display of fresh food everywhere - fruit, meat, smoothies, cheeses! Prices are good! Definitely worth a visit
bustling place. extremly crowded but with great food and filled with positive energy. However, you have to be cautios of your belongings.

Enjoy it. Probably the best market in Barcelona, amazing, spectacular, magical, if you want to enjoy the best fresh food, do not hesitate, this is the place.The experience of many years guarantees them as relevant market, and if we add the restaurant is inside, because the place is exceptional.I will recommend the fabulous restaurant "El Quim de la Boqueria" not miss it.

Unbelievable Open Market. A feast for the eyes as well as the stomach. This is the most beautiful open market I have ever seen. Gorgeous displays of fruit, candies, spices, veggies, meats, cheeses, and the fish... Stunning! Everything fresh! We took a cooking class and our chef brought us to the market to get our ingredients for the food we would be preparing. We sampled fabulous Jamon! Could have stayed there and tried everything. Don't miss this amazing adventure in food!

Foodies delight. Off the side of La Rambla, this food market is a must see for foodies and tourists alike. The place is bustling, with plenty of carry-ready foods to choose from. I recommend a cup of cheeses and cured meats, as well as fruits and fruit juices. If only I had a kitchen nearby!

Amazing juices. Don't be put off from how busy it looks on the outside. This is definitely worth a look around. The markets serve the best fresh fruit juices and lots of fresh fruit to take out, and for cheap too. Also worth a look at the stalls selling spices and other food.

Food glorious food. If your a foodie even if you are not this place is amazing. Fruit, veg, meat, fish, even sweets and chocolate, the smells were fabulous, there was also ones just for herbs and spices.

Eat, Drink And Sniff Your Way To Gastronomic Oblivion!. Amazing collection of incredibly fresh everything ... Seafood, meat, poultry, fruit, fruit & coconut juices, candy, cheese, fine wine, shoppers, characters, sellers, beggars wheeler-dealers, etc. The sounds, the tastes and the smells are unforgettable. The prices are amazing. Cones of anchovies, cones of sardines, cones of cheese, cones of salami and on and on. Skewers of shrimp, octopus, fish, squid, chicken, steak and veggies. Paella, Paella, Paella!!! Coconut drinks, fresh figs, sweetest watermelon, humongous cherries, gigantic strawberries. fantastic persimmons. You can hear every language walking the lanes. Sensational Rioja and Tempranillo. Be entertained watching people try to figure out how to insert 1/2 a Euro into the bathroom gates. The crazy lady working the gates is hilarious. We want to go back. We need to go back. You would be foolish to miss the place.

Colourful & Lots of food to try. Definitely a place that shouldn't be missed. It is pretty easy to get to this market by train; from Passig de Garcia station, take the green line (L3) to Liceu station (as you exit the station, you will see the market).Take out your cameras/cellphones and start snapping because the variety of desserts, meat, fruits and seafood available in this market is just too good to pass by. I hate the smell and dirtiness of markets but this one is exceptional; it is clean & the smell is bearable.

Very central, but very touristy. The front part of the market greets you with stalls full of exotic and colorful fruits and juices and bites ready to take away, while the back of the market, is more for locals, and tourists are a bit of a nuisance that just get in the way. While Sant Josep de la Boqueria does have a lot to offer, there are many other markets in town that are a better display of what local markets are.

I love this market! 😍. Just the fruit displays alone amazed me. And those juices! Soooo good!! I came here a few times. It is a definite must if you're in the area. Also a nice place to pick up some things to bring home.

A veritable smorgasbord of sights, sounds and smells . We arrived just before 11 am and it was already crowded. The sights, the sounds and especially the smells were amazing. Anything you can possibly imagine in a farmers market you'll find there. All kinds of meats, pork, seafood right there up front in your face. Whole sections of various animals are there even heads with the eyes starring right up at you. All kinds of fresh vegetables and fruits are there for your pleasure. And plenty of sweets as well, chocolate, nuts, pastries and much more. Some of the vendors are small restaurants where your selections are prepared right in front of you to enjoy. It's definitely worth an hour or so just walking around seeing it all.

Fantastic photo opportunities in this fresh food market. Of course as a tourist you are not really interested in buying fresh produce at this vast well organised and laid-out market. However as a visitor there are numerous photo opportunities. The locals buy their fresh fruit, vegetables, meat and fish. If you are squeamish then stay away from the meat section where you might see "skinned" animal heads with eyes "looking" at you. Also fresh fish and seafood galore. The vast market is divided into various sections with stalls of same ilk side by side. There are huge varieties of fresh fruit and vegetables (some of them I had never seen before), cheeses, poultry, meat and fish. There are also some eateries a-la Food Court but unless you are really early it might be hard to find a chair or a table. All in all a wonderful experience seeing what the locals buy but mostly fantastic opportunity to take colourful photos in this giant market.

Stunning covered market with outdoor feel.. Saw this place featured on cable food show and had to go there when in Barcelona. Fabulous, fresh, fish, meat, Hamon, a feast for the eyes and palate. Try the fried eggs eggs with octopus at El Quim.
Food. Amazing place, love everything there and good food! You can also find good places for drink and eat.There you can also find gifts and spices.

Barcelona: Mercat de Sant Josep de la Boqueria. Visit early in the morning before the crowds become overwhelming. Fresh fruit, juices (prices vary from stall to stall), meats, nuts, anything you crave can be found in this colorful, delightful market.
Food marcet . The smoothie in the beginning was delicious, but almost everything in the market is 3 times the price from supermarket and not any better. I didnt like the baklava which had cloves.

Oh yes, very very good. . Everything here is a taste sensation. Lots of high quality produce - hard to choose what to have. We settled for a fresh juice €1, then sat at the bar for an incredible seafood platter including just amazing razor clams off the grill with a kind of caramelized juice. €23, and then a great coconut ice cream, some jelly sweets made from fresh juice- so good, and chocolate nuts. All amazing in a fun atmosphere and lovely old building. Highly recommended.

Must See. An overwhelming array of food products, to drive you crazy. Produce I've never seen before , this is a delight for any person. One can eat a hundred varieties of chocolate and fruit juices, meats and nuts! A live market out of some dream, with restaurants around it. Buzzing with energy. A must for everyone . Even people who dislike crowds should just see it once for the sheer raw energy it evokes. They can always go and cool off round the corner at the peaceful and beautifully simplistic church.

Beware. The prices are considerably higher and the quality is lower than elsewhere. They are openly dishonest and deceptive with the pricing for products and try to cheat you at every turn. The "juices" are just water with fruit syrup sold at an exorbitant markup. They refuse to give refunds and don't give receipts. That's about it.

Packed, smelly, brilliant!. La Boqueria is an experience: basically a load of different stands and bars selling all types of food. Some places you can sit down and eat with a beer, others you just buy and walk while you are eating. Loved the various jamon stands, they are carving it straight from the leg and it's delicious. You can also find pretty good tapas here, along with fish of all varieties.

Not anymore the landmark it used to be. I go to La Boqueria almost every time i am in Barcelona and i travel there often; even today I ended up buying small green Peppers (Pimiento padron), asparagus, nuts and raisins, a big papaya and mangoes; but the market has changed and is not anymore worth visiting unless you rent a nearby flat in an apart hotel and you need something to cook; half of the market is CLOSED on a wonderful Tuesday afternoon, you can count way too many units selling same products like juice and precut fruits (with no fruits nearby sometimes), except for a few Jamon producers most of the products are imported and are mainstream commoditized goods, not local flavors and great findings as it should be for a tourist attraction; soon we will see a made in China exhibition instead of what one should expect ??? A note for the (missing) eateries, some lousy ones avoided by many, than Bar Central in 2 locations (one inside the market with really rude waiters and another on the upper edge with nice people) and this is it, more a tourist trap than the boiling place it should be.

Fantastic Open Market. In La Boqueria, you can find the freshest produce and food! Whether it's meat, fruits, vegetables, or candy, everything to please your palate is available! Fresh juices you can sip on while browsing the market. Definitely a must-see when visiting the Las Ramblas area of Barcelona!

Expensive busy but you must go there. Of course is Expensive, what do you expect?, busy but you can find really intersting food there, yes I know, ypou can go to the port and find similar things but the environment is impressive.I recommend to go, not very often but at least once.

Amazing. This market is fabulous beyond belief!! Every spice, nut, fruit, vegetable, meats, fish the list goes on and on. Clean, friendly!! Wish I lived in Barcelona. I would definitely buy for the family there

exciting market with lots to offer. This is an exciting market with a lot of hustle and bustle which offers a variety of different goods. There are some really good fresh fruit stalls that offer fresh juices

It's just a market..... Not sure why this is so popular, it's just a market. We spent 2 minutes walking around, that was plenty. If you like to walk around looking at fruit, vegetables, meat and fish, you'll love this place.

Poor tapas-just good for a stoll.. Although it is a must see in your trip to barcelona, tapas are the worst I had in all my trip. I did purchase fruits and torron, but high priced compared to other spots in Barcelona. My recommendation- visit to stroll around, buy food elsewhere.
Live like a local. Best way to experience Barcelona like a local and enjoy all the best Spanish treats at a great price :D
Wow. Definitely got to go here if you love food. Place is amazing, full of locals buying and plenty of food tasting and tapas bars to try.

Very busy. I love going to markets and local places to really feel the city. La Boqueria was a very nice experience. They have fruts, cheese, spices,fresh juices everywhere. The bars are crowded, lots of tapas, drinks and delicious food. We could not find a place to seat so we gave up and went to eat somewhere else. But i had a delicious fruit juice ( passion fruit and mango )... So good!
Tasty . Great food inside! Sat down at one of the small food shops and ordered amazing meals. Delicious juices and plenty of fresh food stands to choose from.

Best Market in The Universe. When entering the market the smell of fish, jamón, paella hits you. Hits you hard, and you can not help yourself, you want to try everything. I highly recommend the Tasta-Ho! for firs oyster experience, staff is alwasy smiling and you can have the best price/quality ratio, an open oyster with tabasco/limón is €2! Dont be shy and buy jamón and chorizo at the market they slice it for you and forget the vacuum-packed version!

Enjoy La Boqueria Mercado!!!. The Market "La Boqueria" in Barcelona is very well known. You can really find everything here and...the speciality is very fresh seafood straight from the harbor. Nice to enjoy a longer stay in Barcelona!
Not to be missed. This is a fabulous place full of delicious food to look at, buy to take away and also great places you can eat at with a glass of Cava. The seafood is delicious.

Eat & Shop With The Locals. This market has everything from sweets to fish and everything in between as there is an opportunity to interact where many locals go to shop.Examples of offerings range from traditional sweets to fruit, hams, olives, coffees, tapas, wines and more basic staples such as seafood.There is a lot of people at all times at all times of the day given a good amount of people are tourists.

Fabulous Market..a Must See. The food on sale is so fresh and colourful you really should see it. There are stalls selling everything from various fresh fruit and vegetables, herbs, spices and nuts to meat of every variety including sheeps heads!Be prepared for crowds though as it's always packed with tourists.Lot's of places to eat if you can find a free seat.Recommended.

A Gourmet Paradise. What's not to like about this marvelous market stacked with fresh food to get your mouth watering, your stomach churning and your eyes feasting on all the delicacies available, with enough variety to satiate even the most pedantic vegetarian or pescetarian who in turn will be glad they paid it a visit. However, if your someone like me, a total carnivore, then you won't be disappointed either, as there are a great selection of meats to choose from as well. The market is vibrant and busy at all times, with plenty of people savouring their favourite dishes at different bars around the market. If you are thirsty, juice bars abound and if you have a sweet tooth, make sure you visit the dentist after you have gorged yourself on all of the naughtiness that is available to you, all of it tempting you into sinning. Were I Catholic, I think I would have to spend a week in the confessional. Since our Hotel was just two minutes walk from the market, we visited it twice daily, because all our hedonistic food needs could be met without having to go anywhere else. This market should be avoided at all costs if you are on a diet, because you simply cannot walk through it without giving way to temptation. Moreover, you won't break the bank if you do indulge yourself a little, as an excellent meal can be had for as little as seven euros. The food is superb, the atmosphere sparkling and the wine delicious. It is like having 50 restaurants at your fingertips and after tramping around the streets of the Gothic quarter, this is definitely a place to contemplate visiting if you can stand the hustle and bustle. I don't mind gorging myself in surroundings that are packed out with other people enjoying their food too, and it simply adds to the charm and character that is uniquely Barcelona

Excellent Brunch + dietary fibre . Price to quality of items sold; 6/10, though it's tourist-centric-market, prices of fresh fruits/juice and stalls selling food are still lower than other places so this is definitely the choice breakfast/brunch place to fully charge your body for the sight seeing and shopping ahead of you.Reach before 10am; Walk to inner quieter stalls and you will be rewarded with €1 fruit juice and yes that's the same as the €2 or €1.5(most stalls) from the other stalls.

Divine!. Colors, smells and tastes. This place is just unique. You cannot go to Barcelona and don't visit it. Amazing place, amazing fruits, vegetables and food all offered by our nature! Breathtaking!

Probably the best market in the world. I've been coming to La Boqueria for 40 years and it never fails to make me smile. The quality and the variety of food is incredible- beautifully fresh and sparkling fish and seafood, tumbling piles of perfect fruit and vegetable, any cut of meat or offal you could want, bread, spices, nuts, juices and you can stop for a lolly, a cornet of jamon or sit down to a delicious tapas and a drink. All this and just off the Ramblas, it could not be more central. Just wonderful. I cannot recommend it highly enough

A feast for all the senses. A great food market situated halfway along the bustling La Rambla. Bursting with fresh fruit, vegetables, fish and meat the market throngs with tourists and locals stocking up their kitchens. Small eateries and bars provide great spots to stop for a bite and a drink and soak up the atmosphere. Get there before noon to see it at its best.

Way cool, tons to eat!. This market was a fantastic trip! There are booths galore serving fresh & local meats, cheeses, fruits (whole and in ready-to-eat portions) and juices--all at alarmingly low prices. Also some booths sold olives and olive oil. I even spotted a nacho bar! Makes for a very inexpensive snack in the middle of the day, or you can shop around and make a meal out of the various foods. Some booths have seating where you can enjoy a meal. Begins to close down around 5pm although some took their time closing as people were still eating.

Great seafood and tapas. Fresh seafood, tasty tapas and bubbly cava - that's all you needs on a hot summer day! Then just walk through the market and buy some jamon, cheese and olives for later, grab a freshly made juice or smoothie on the way out and continue to walk along Ramblas toward the harbour - what a great way to spend an afternoon in the hart of Barcelona!

Good breakfast/lunch place. Avoid shops in upfront and go down aisles to get the same stuff cheaper. . This place is really fun as they sell variety of food and you can buy for souvenirs or snack food. Generally stuff there are pretty fresh I think. A lot of fruit salad and juice bars seem to attract a lot of tourists. I purchased a bag of sweetened almonds and it was 55 euros/kg and afterwads walked down aisle to go deeper into the market and saw the same stuff sold at 38 euros/kg. I mean, sure I'm on vacation and all but nobody likes the feeling of getting ripped off, right? Also they'll try to sell you a lot if it's sold by measuring so make sure to tell them just how much you want it.
Beautiful market. The most beautiful market filled with delicious fresh,local produce.From fresh fruit and vegetables to sweet pastries and meats.Well worth a visit even if its just to browse.

Great day out to taste spanish food.. The market has to be the best place to taste different spanish flavours. From jamon to artichokes tapas it's all here. Different stalls sell their speciality dishes which wont break your bank.There is a fish market where I had some amazing oysters at a bargain of 3 euro per oyster. The market is always busy so be prepared to wait to be seated. The tapas bar took 20 minutes for seats to be available. The staff at the stalls are all friendly and they give you their expert advice. Be prepared for a big feast.This is a must do in barcelona.

Jamon! Jamon! Jamon!. La Boqueria is a feast for all senses. Sit have a cava. People watch. Buy food. Go early so as to try and catch some of the locals that still brave la Boqueria. Most apparently feel pushed out by tourists - which are heavy in the afternoons. The produce is of great quality and the stall holders happy to help. Presumably there are some mark ups at some stalls - but if you persist further in they seem to be pretty reasonable and in line with pricing across Barcelona.

Slice of the continent . This bustling food market is a must visit whilst in Barcelona! There are all kinds of traditional Spanish fare to sample and the atmosphere is great to soak up! We also ate at the market at one of the stalls that serves food and wine, and what an experience! The seafood was fresh and cooked in front of us and there was also a lot of locals eating there which is always a good indicator of the quality of food.This is far superior to one of the many chain tapas places.

Very touristy but plenty of locals too. Cool market to visit. I would suggest that you walk deep into the market as the prices are better towards the back, there you pay €1 for juice and fruit compared to €1.50 to €2.50 in the front or close to the entrance.Its full of tourist, very crowded so keep your belongings close!

Great for a cheap lunch or snack. Interesting. Great place to grab some snacks or a quick light lunch. Where else can you get two mangoes, peeled and sliced, for a euro? Really shop around though - there are huge price variations.
Amazing produce and spices. We visited this market in Barcelona in April 2016. There're so many different kinds of fruit, produce, meat, seafood, jamon & spice stands. We really enjoyed it.

Great lunch spot!. The sights, aromas and tastes in this market are unforgettable! We had two great tapas lunches here!The fish, nut and sugary confections displays are awesome and tempting. Octopus, squid, roasted vegetable tapas are to die for.

A Real Food Market . Now, this is what a real food market should be like! This place definitely gets crowded so be prepared to squeeze through the crowds. This place has all kinds of food stalls from desserts, to meat, veggies, spices, seafood, etc. Lots of life and culture! A must-see for the experience and the variety of food.

Fantastic market. Local market, selling fruit, meat, all sorts. And you can sit down for an amazing lunch. Walk through the stalls and admire the setup each of the sellers has on their display, and do some shopping! It wasn't too crowded, so no mad pushing or barging, which made walking around there much more enjoyable.
Great market!. Rustic, vibrant food market with lots of tasty cafes/bars/vendors! I would highly recommend the market as a lunchtime option but even if you aren't hungry it is well worth a visit.

La Boqueria Market. This market is like no other. It is large and has very high quality foods. You feel like you want to taste everything you see. The fruit is so fresh and the Iberian ham is to die for. They also has several counters where you can get food made to order. Very fresh fish dishes as well.

Great place for a visit & lunch. Fantastic local market. All variety of food. A lot of tourists mingling with a few locals. All sorts of local delicacies to try. Some really good places for lunch as well.
Increadible !. What an increadible place ! You wonder round this amazing market with your mouth gawping open the whole time ! Perfect place to visit for the foodies out there !

Amazing But Rude Vendors. Do not touch the fruits. I'm used to touching and picking my own fruits. But here they will yell at you if you try to pick up or even touch the fruit. But besides the rude fruit guys, the market is filled w/ amazing kiosks of delicious tapas places and a real fish markets. When it gets busy it's hard to get a few chairs at any of the tapas places. Most of the fruit and fish vendors close at 6:00 pm but the tapas places close at 8:00. I suggest maybe going around 6:30/7:00 if you want to avoid trying the crowd. There are also other vendors that sells other types of food that you can grab and go. Must go here!

Must see . The fruit market is very cool and the best time to go would be in the evenings when the vendors give u a good deal and discounts . Try the strawberry banana juice that's awesome . It may cost You €1

La Boqueria - No.1 dissapointment in Barcelona. In fact, I was recently in Barcelona the third time. The first time La Rambla seemed to me one excellent experience, it was a mixture of African and European spirit, full of tourists also, but not in a bad sense of meaning.The first time and the second time, last time two years ago, I bought very good and tasty cherries (it was always in June when the season is high).This year, beginning of June, I was terribly disappointed with the quality of cherries I bought. Even they did not allow me to taste them. They were very expensive and very bad quality, but they looked good.My advice: go to La Boqueria market, browse around, take pictures, but - do not buy anything!

If you like food, culture, atmosphere and chilling, come here. Just off La Ramba towards the Plaza Catalunia end, is this amazing market that's been here for years. Every time I come to Barca, I come here. Eat breakfast, lunch, snacks, whatever. Take photos, take it all in. Just stunning food and visions.

an interesting combination of market and food court. the Boqueria as it shortly is called by locals is located approximately at the middle of the Las Ramblas;when coming from the Placa de Cataluna it is on the right side and when coming from the port it is naturally on the left side;however,if one comes for the first time to Barcelona,he has to be very attentive,as there is no big logo with the name,you just see an entrance and at the end of it one can see the tables of a restaurant;the grocery,meat and fruit stands are not directly on the main street,but after passing this entrance;in fact it is a covered market ;on the four outer sides there are all kinds of restaurants,but the interesting part is the core part in the middle,where there are alternatively food stands (fruits,meat,fish,vegetables,etc.) and some cubic eateries with bar chairs and where the dishes are prepared in front of you;these eateries were pretty crowded and as there are many of them,the owners try to attract the customers with more special dishes and meat and fish specialities,including seafood;prices are medium range but I think people dont't go there just because they are hungry,but because of the friendly and joyful atmosphere,sitting on the higher bar chairs,chatting and eating at the same time;prices seemed to me medium range and everything is prepared in front of the customers;a visit at the Boqueria can't be missed under no circumstances as it is an original and interesting market-food court;

Vibrant and buzzing . This market is so full of life! Busy and noisy, but an amazing atmosphere.You can buy fresh fruit, veg, fish and meats, freshly made fruit smoothies and real fruit ice lollies, there are places to sit and order tapas, all prepared in front of you.I purchased some freshly cut jamón, and some little pastry tarts filled with spinach, pine nuts and sultanas, which were absolutely amazing.
Nice building and interesting. An interesting building, near the Casa Batlo. I wasn't inside but I am sure it is fantastic. I saw that people can go up also on the roof for siteseeing.

Colorful and vibrant market. La Boqueria is a foodie's paradise with everything from fresh fish and dried hams to prepared foods and drinks. It is a bustling market full of sights and smells. You can eat at one of the stalls with counter height seating, but they are very crowded. It's a very interesting experience and not to be missed on a visit to Barcelona.

Love it. I always feel sad that I'm in a hotel when in Barcelona & can't take advantage of buying lovely fresh food to,take home & cook. Having said that you can happily graze for hours eating what ever takes your fancy.

Lovely Market. Great location for the market, some amazing stalls and overall great experience. Lots to look at and buy. Be careful of pick pockets if visiting! Did not do a tour, found busyness added to market atmosphere.

Vibrant slice of life. Although it's mainly tourists and local businesses purchasing for catering to tourists, it's amazing. A great place to pick up picnic ingredients and great snacks at siesta time. If taking photo's, get permission and buy something from the stall. If you want a higher quality local market, try the Mercat de la Concepcio.

Interesting . A huge old type Bazaar bang splat in the middle of Las Ramblas. Apparently the locals come here to do their grocery shopping. Just looking around you'll find a myriad of interesting things being sold all around the market. It's definitely worth a look see.

Wonderful but crowded. The market has a lot to offer! From a big variety of exotic fruits over fresh seafood to classic sandwiches - there is everything a Spanish market should have. I would recommend going more to the middle and buy fruit smoothies there, because it's cheaper than the stalls right at the entrance. The fruits looked fresh and the seafood tasted great! Paradise for foodies!

Too turistic. For sure it used to be a place for localBut now it is so touristic that the food is expensive, not tasty, crowd and full of homeless asking for money.After having some tapas there we had toLook for a real restaurant to have our lunch.I won't be back to food, just a place for sightseeing

Must visit. You haven't been to Barcelona without walking through this amazing market and trying all the various food there. Everything is so fresh and tasty. When you're stayingat a place that doesn't offer breakfast this is definitely the place to go!
Too crowded to enjoy. Great selection and variety but crowded to stop and browse.The city has several other markets with similar choice that are less crowded and cheaper

A unique experience. Mercat de Sant Josep is a visual delight. Lots of meats, seafood, cheese, and other good stuff can be found here. The place is crowded with locals and tourists, and is quite busy. The meat and seafood stalls present a vast array of local ingredients. The only seafood more fresh than what's shown at this market would be the catch that you make yourself and then eat immediately while it's still moving. Beautiful stuff—some of which is still moving! Given the dense crowding here, and in the surrounding Las Ramblas, I can see how pickpocketing is a problem. Enjoy yourself, but make situational awareness a priority, too.

Colorful market!. The mercat de la boquaria is an inescapable stop when you visit Barcelona. You can taste typical food from Catalunya and Spain, but also exotic fruit from all over the world. I tried sea food and bought some gifts like torrone and candies. I really appreciated the atmosphere of the place: it is very colorful, fascinating and joyful

This Market is a Vegans Paradise. This market has the best fresh pressed juices, vegan paella, olives, fruits, vegetables, and the list goes on. The great thing about eating at the mercados is that when a group of different types of eaters are traveling together, there is something for everyone. It's lively and fun and delicious. when in doubt head to a mercado is my new mantra while traveling in Europe!

Great food market with small Restaurants. Great market in downtown Barcelona for food shopping. Full of vendors and many small restaurants. Grab a seat at any of the bars and have some great tapas and some cava or vermut!

Exciting market. Bustling, exciting market, so colorful and interesting to see all the products, food and people. Fresh squeezed fruit juices for only 1 euro, what a deal! Lots of seafood and meats to try.

Come Hungry!!!! must visit twice to fully engoy. i would recommend coming here twice. the first time it so scout the ground. there are many food stands that you can choose from, so take a bit from each. by the time you finish you will be full. also' scout the tappas bar you want to eat in on your second time. in the second time go straight to the tappas bar and reserve a seat (it will take 30-45 min. depending on the time of day) and then you'll have enough time walk around... be sure to not order dessert in the tappas bar there are many places to buy it and they are better.
Amazing Market. Love this place. You can walk around for a long time just looking at the variety of fresh food, picking up a little snack on the way round or stopping at one of the bars.

Great for breakfast. We enjoyed huddle and bussle of market and sat down at one of many tapas places to have our breakfast, which was delightful.However later on came back for lunch at another bar and was not quite as good as before but the atmosphere still great. Worth a visit.

Wish This Market Was in My Home Town. I have been to a lot of markets in various cities, however, I thought this one was special. We were so enamored with it that my son wanted to visit again on our last day in Barcelona, buy food from the market and cook lunch and dinner. Of course we also grabbed some nougat and fruit and Iberian ham and etc. This is a market that has survived since medieval times which I find special and is also a place that locals shop for their provisions. The locals shop earlier and deeper into the market. Highly recommended.

Great food and atmosphere. A bustling market offering a diverse array of tastes and smells right on Las Ramblas. Several stands sell your standard marketplace items - fruit, pastries, juices, sweets, spices, cheeses, fish and meat - with some extra options thrown in between. Lots of prepared food as well as raw materials. Some proper restaurants in the area as well. If you arrive later in the day some stands start offering discounts.
Typical market. Pretty market in the center of the Ramblas. The food is delicious and the building is really interesting. You must visit it if you are in Barcelona.

Gourmet Paradise. From the moment you go through its crowded entrance your senses will explode in experiences! Noise, colors, movements, food and produce of all kinds, everything inside an old structure attractive itself. If you are a food-traveler, this market is a must. Clean and neat. Eat there and enjoy some of an every-day life in Barcelona.

Fruit Market. So much to see, smell and experience here!! The fruit juice is fantastic! If you want things cheaper then go later- about 5-5:30 but remember some stalls will already be closed or many of the produce gone.
Very colourful . We ate at the market but seafood platter was very disappointing and expensive for what it was. Enjoyed the colour and the bustle but not cheap as markets go. Very interesting.

a visual feast. Besutiful buildings in barcelona but for me im a foodie this was the highlight of my visit. Hundreds of food stalls and bar cafes to eat. There is skmething for everyone, lots of cones of food, kebabs of chirozos and jambon, temperus of fish, patties you name it you csn find it here, i spent a small fortune here buying bits and pieces. Make sure you Ask the price first as i found the nut and marzipan stalls just give you a bag and even a small amount csme to nearly 40 euros. We purchased a couple of bottles of fine wine and they ship it directly home. I cannot put into words how amazing this place is, put it on your list. Restuarants around it are very reasonably priced for city centre

One of the biggest covered markets in Europe. We love this market, we go every time we visit Barcelona. Its just off the Rambles. It gets very busy, but it's a great place to shop. There is also a little kiosk at the front entrance to the right as you go in. They serve fabulous seafood shellfish and vegetables and you can have a glass of cava or two.

Noise, Colour, Brilliant!. Visited on a whistle stoptour of Barcelona, well worth it. As other reviews have said don't get caught at the front, go deep in and it's a lot less busy. Although not a seafood person you can't help but be impressed by the quality and quantity of produce, as well as fruit, veg, meat, nuts and sweets. Plenty of small places to eat or on the hoof, there's something for everyone. Fruit smoothies are lush, again go to the back for these. There are toilets at the rear and a small courtyard if you need a break from the crowd.

Great place for food experience In the Centre . After reading some good reviews on Trip Advisor we decided with My lovely wife to visit Mercat De Sant Josep for some food experience;)Market itself wasn't very big as we expected , but was really alive and colourful with so many different fruits, meets , fish , seasonings , and some tapas places( bit pricy though ;) and few other stables with other foods !!!Defo worth visiting while in Centre of Barcelona !!!Bujo & Jola (;)

Magnificent La Boqueria. Markets are invariably the soul of a city.They are where locals often shop every day.Produce is fresh.Conversation is familiar and lively.They are the heart of European cities unlike Australia where supermarkets and bland price wars rule.The Boqueria is a wonderful example of a bustling Mediterranean market with that touch of Catalan insouciance!The sights and smells are wonderful, from rich dried jamon to fresh salty fish to an array of seasonal fruits.Around the columns there are small bars serving local foods and wines.A heady mix of pleasure and delights - do not miss it!
Interesting but too crowded. There's a great variety of foods here and the foods are good! beware of the smoothies stalls.. they don't taste as good as they look. Overall worth a visit !

A great market. If you like food markets, then don't miss this one. Many locals are buying fish, meat, and cheese - as well as other items. A fun place to go to look or even grab a bite to eat. Also, if you are in search of saffron - many places sell it ( I think all for the same price ) but it is VERY inexpensive here. I purchased 5 grams for 25 euros. In the states that would have got me 1 gram. I was told by a local that Saturday is the busy day, so try to avoid if possible- or get there early!

Wonderful market just off the Ramblas... Love markets and this has to be one of the best. A hive of activity ALL the time. Came 8 years ago and had to bring my husband who was in foodie heaven. Bars all very full, it was about lunchtime, but wonderful to wander and taste along the way. Fantastic atmosphere - you must come when in Barcelona..

A sight, smell and, if you choose to buy, taste sensation!. Was a little apprehensive about going here after reading a few reviews stating that it is overpriced and not any better than other local markets. Well we didn't find it to overpriced at all, admittedly limiting our purchases to tasty snacks/pasties and fruit smoothies - much much cheaper than the UK! 1.5 euros for a smoothie and 2 euros per pastry snack - they were really packed full of flavour. It really is an experience of sights and smells of a huge range of produce! Why oh why does the UK having nothing like this?! We loved ambling around and picking up tasty treats to eat on the hoof. The colours are radiant and the experience not one to be missed.

This market is great for a fresh lunch just as the locals would eat.. This market provides so many fresh fruits, meats, fish, cheeses, and other yummy treats. It is great to just walk around and see but would also be a great place to get a few snacks or grab some fresh lunch!

Amazing gourmet experience. Don't let yourself discouraged by the negative comments and the pickpocketing warnings. While most of them are true, this market is surprisingly authentic. Come on an empty stomach and try the food served here. The fruits, the paellas, the sweets and the different types of "jamon" will guide you through an amazing gourmet experience.

Awesome place. This market is truly a gem, not only is it smack in the middle of Las Ramblas, but its colors, flavors and people make the place something special. The fresh fruit smoothies are a main attraction, but to be honest all the fresh fruit and veg makes you want to try everything. Just don't buy from the shops anywhere near the entrance because you can get the same stuff for cheaper if you go further in. PS: If you like cooking and appreciate exotic ingredients, make sure you buy some saffron in these markets. Because its produced in Spain its dirt cheap here, however make sure you shop around and get the cheapest price from one of the smaller stands further in.

Flavors and Colors Galore!. This place blew me away. It is a foodie's paradise from the fruits, tapas, meat, seafood, dessert, candy and spices.
