We had the fruit, the ham, the fresh juice and best of all, seafood from Bar Quiosc Modern. I'll let the photos speak for itself. Next time we visit Barcelona, we're going to visit the market early in our trip so we could stock up on fruits and other snacks. Also, I suggest getting here late afternoon so you can enjoy lunch, walk around and get yourself ready for an afternoon snack and a drink. Food is very much a part of our itinerary when we travel!
Awesome Place. We got some fresh fruit smoothies and had a breeze over all of the cool products! Definitely worth a visit.

Enjoy a market meal. While strolling around this huge market you can enjoy a taste of all the products that are sold!! You can stop for some seafood or some "jamón", you can try some olives while sipping on a glass of wine (or a fresh fruit juice if you prefer)!! A really good lunch on the go in a really beautiful and lively place!!

Foodie must see. . Have seen this on many tv chef shows and only being there can make you realise how amazing this place is. It has every food and/or ingredient you can think of. The displays are so eye catching and the food so fresh. From tomatoes to a range of seafood that make the mouth water. You can buy food to cook at home or in your apartment. You can get fresh Tapa and a drink in a few of the on-site tapa's bars,and a drink to wash them down.

The best market in the world!!. Is a fantastic food market. Fore sure the best of the world. Much more than the Budapest , Paris or any other. The issue is most of the time is to crowded and you can not live the reality. I suggest going early in the morning ( by 9 a.m.) . Have breakfast there!! Is a real experience. This part is similar to the Fish Market in Tokio.

Calling All Foodies. I love visiting markets in various cities, and this one is a must for foodies. It's centrally located in the heart of the city, and will leave you with no doubt about the value Barcelona places on food. Pick up some saffron and paprika for your foodie friends at home, especially saffron which is less than 10 euros.
Wow!. Great market, so many lovely things to buy! There is everything you expect from a market and so much more! Fresh juices from sweet fruits, fresh fish and the vegetables so colourful.

Not to be missed!!!!!!. I took the wife and kids there and they loved it. Fresh fruit jucies for 1€ amazing tapas. Fruit. Meats and fish. Great place to have breakfast and lunch. But beware its extremely busy. We stayed in an Apartment so we took some fruit and snack home.

A feast for your senses. Vibrant buzzing atmosphere full of sights sounds smells and tastes. It's a must do in Barcelona. Getting to the many crowded bars is tricky ... Or just lucky but well worth it if you can get a seat.

Excellent seafood . We couldn't make it for lunch so we went there for dinner around 7.30pm and we were still able to get some fresh awesome seafood. My tip go further in the back of the market it's cheaper and better. I would definitely go there again on my next visit this market has so much good goodness to offer basically everything what u wish for they have it its a heaven for all the foodies out there.

Everything is overpriced . I went to this place regarding all good reviews found it here, but this is a normal market where you will pay double price in all the products, I don't think you wanna make this mistake. Close to this place you can find many markets with same things with the half or even less price. Believe me pay 8€ for 100g of candies is not worth it at all. The only good thing there is the exotic things you can find and maybe worth to try.
Good. Many people sometimes makes it difficult to move around but it is overall good. I love the vast variety of fruit and meats. A great trip. Also just off las ramblas!

Great market!. The variety of items here for purchase is incredible, and there aren't many stands that appear to be poorly kept or designed. There are some great tapas bars in here, including the outstanding El Quim. Of course, the stalls nearest the entrances are the most expensive; make sure you look around a bit before committing to buying something. Go when you're hungry - you will not be sorry! This would be a 4-circle review if it were not for El Quim: still a great market and a must-see, but the tapas bar really elevates the entire rest of the building (it's that good!) to five circles.

Go in the day! . A lot of things to browse and see! Visit the pinotxo bar (near the entrance on the right) for breakfast which is usually packed. If you can't get a high stool at the bar you can find a high table not far from the bar. Perhaps you might bump into Jose Andres (Michelin Chef) there for breakfast as well! You can find fruit juices at 1 euro but most of these stalls are at the back of the market. The front stalls sells them at 1.50euro so be sure to walk around first!

A must see and eat!. We visited here almost everyday as great place for lunch and browsing. The market sells everything and caters for all food likes and need. Found a fab vegetarian stall that also catered for vegan and gluten free. The sweet stalls were gorgeous and yummy fruit and veg. Some good little places to eat all around the market and a square at the back to eat your perchases. used by locals and tourists alike.

Outstanding. Words can't do this place justice you really have to be there to appreciate it. A foodies paradise, tapas stalls are really busy and you kind of have to hover in the background and grab a seat as soon as someone moves. The food is out of this world all washed down with a glass or two of cava

Crazy and wonderful!!. We went to the market daily, as we stayed close by. It is crazy crowded and apparently a place where pickpockets operate, do watch your wallet and purses. The food near the entrance is geared toward tourists, a lot is it up fruit, juices and bite size food to eat while strolling. The center of the market features fish and meat and is not so touristy. Right at the back is Bar Central where you can eat fish - fantastic!! Prices are lower towards the back.

Don't miss!. This market has so many stalls and is so packed with people bartering that we couldn't get through all of it! It was cool to see all the fruits, spices, meat and fish all displayed colorfully in every stall! It reminded us of the covered market in Budapest! I would definitely return!

Highly crowded and not a great choice for all the veggies out there!. Visited this market after hearing some great reviews but was not very impressed. Like any buzzing food market I admire the energy of the place and the unique 'food finds' but being a veggie you will not find enough options to keep yourself engaged and rather get knocked down by the maddening crowd!

Crowded but worth a visit. We visited the market in the evening, but many of the vendors were closed. So we came back in the morning. However, it was a Monday, so the fish vendors weren't open on that day. We got some tapas, fresh juice, and breakfast tamales. It was super crowded. A mass of wall to wall people. So much so that it was hard to really enjoy it. There were very few places to sit to eat our breakfast so we walked several blocks until we could find a bench to sit down. All that being said, I'd go back again!

THE ONLY PLACE TO EAT IN LAS RAMBLAS...........OTHERWISE I WOULD HAVE GONE HUNGRY.... Generally,the food in the restaurants&cafes, along this strip is shocking&over-priced,however,this incredible,traditional fresh produce market,is the saving grace,apart from the amazing range of fresh fruits,vegetables,jamon,spices,particularly pimenton&saffron,the most comprehensive selection of seafood you have ever seen,beautifully presented,you have the option of sampling the delicacies ,with a lovely glass of Cava.at the numerous bars&stands,the stall holders have been here for generations,no surprise,that it is frequented daily by some of the best chefs in Barca,buying produce for their restaurants,so...authentic,,the ambience is so exciting....

Classic and clean.... This is the classic market to come back and see. There are many around the world, but Spanish sounds and flavors is the classic market reminding the rest markets around the world
A bit crowded on a Saturday. Lovely market, but unwise of us to visit on a Saturday. Lots of meat markets, seafood, fruit and sweets. One star off for how crowded it was.

Vibrant, colorful and tasty. Great experience, great tastes. We loved the fruit shakes, especially Papaya coconut. Beautiful fruit and vegetables, very very fresh food. It's not only a must to visit this market, it's a place to return to a few times on your Barcelona trip.

One of the great markets. I love a market - whether at home in Australia (Adelaide Central), Asia (Bau Trang Vietnam,) or Europe, but this is one of the special ones. It smells and looks of Spain, from the jamon stalls to the chili stalls, to the vast variety of shellfish (many, many varieties) - this Barcelona market ticks every box for fresh local produce, reality (not just a tourist trap) and liveliness. If you are in Barcelona and like food, take an hour or so to explore. If you are renting an apartment, buy food and cook it. If not - buy snack stuff. ENJOY!!!!

Excellent Market with tapas bars and more. We went through the market several times. The second time we stopped for sangria and tapas and we were not disappointed. If you are looking for gifts, unless they are food/culinary related, this is not the place to shop. The produce, fish, meats and tapas bars are amazing. So hard to decide where to sit and enjoy the atmosphere. Best bet is to grab the first open seat you can find.

Lots of choice . You can find everything here from cured meats and cheeses, to fruit, artisan chocolate and crepes, or even have a seat at a bar. Some artisanal shops a little pricey but overall a great spot to explore and pick up some food souvenirs or fresh food if you are staying in an apartment in Barcelona!
Yummy. You can find anything to eat here. Fruits, meat, fish, spices.. The only negative thing is that it is very crowded. But the setting is just so nice and appealing
Fantastic produce . Great Meat, Great Fruit, Great Seafood.Restaurants serving quality food if you want to eat, or just a great place to walk around.If you like produce it's a must see.

Wow, what a place. The food is glorious and the market is rammed with people after the good food. We had fruits de Mer of: prawns, langoustine, clams, mussels, swordfish and all was very good. We also had a spinach tart which was very good also. You will walk past the market if you are not careful.

Wonderful, busy atmosphere and good food. We were lucky to get a seat on a busy day for lunch. Loved the croquettes and my daughter had garlic prawns. She said they were fantastic and is still talking about them days later. One of my favourite places to eat in Barcelona, a city in which food is truly an experience. Great fun place to eat. Vibrant staff and terrific atmosphere..

Amazing market! . This market just off Les Rambles is not to be missed! It's full of amazing food, people and an electric atmosphere! I think the best food here is the different types of seafood, something that Barcelona is very famous for. Of course you can also find fruits, nuts, meat, desserts and drinks. The Boqueria is the perfect gastronomic experience! Beware though, it is extremely crowded and nt exceptionally clean!

Fruits and Fruits. The market has uncountable number of shops with Fruits and Juices. It also has shops which keep other eateries but wherever you see in the market, you ll get to see fruits shop with all kinds of fruits.

Outstanding Gem. This market is such an eyeopener to life in Spain. The flowing tapas bars, market stalls, fresh produce and (my favourite...) fresh juice bars are not as you would imagine, but so much fun and interesting to be a part of.Walking through the market, you can't help but touch and smell the produce on offer, and interact with the stall holders. Its so much fun!And the tapas bars! Amazing! If you can get a seat that is- but its well worth the challenge of getting in there! The most amazing food and drink! I loved this place!

No visit to Barcelona for a foodie is complete without a visit here. Loved the market! The fresh fruit and produces per cut and in cups were divine. Bought fruit jellies from a chocolate vendor near one of the entrances off the Rambles and they were delicious. Tip: The prices get lower the farther back you go in the market

Great market. In the heart of Barcelona, near the Ramblas, you can enjoy 1-2 hours of food-sighting and tasting with fresh tapas, and a variety of other dishes. This place is not expensive, and it is highly recomanded that you try some Jamon, some beer, and a chilled fruit juice, which is heavan.

Excellent . Every great City has a beautiful market and this is no exception. You'll find great ham, cheese and olives which will make for a great snack with your wine. If anything you will enjoy the walk and the people watching.

Interesting place. Very nice market with frendly people and a lot to choose from specialities. Besides the normall products you can find in a market here you cand find also small restaurants at every corner. The dishes are divers and very well prepared. Also you cand find stands with take away tapas.
Very interesting experience walking through this market.
Enjoy!!

The best juices ever. La boqueria is the best market ever. Amazing colorful food presented in very pretty ways. The freshly squeezed juices are a must try- and before the closure hours you get them very cheap- 2for 2euros. Sometimes it gets really crowded during the day. Their tropical food selection is amazing.

You must go here. Fantastic place, so central halfway down Las Ramblas. It is a must see for foodies. The food for sale is beautifully laid out and so colourful. Vegetables, fish ,meat, cheese, pate etc and a wonderful choice of restaurants for tapas and wine

A great experience and good food. We found our favorite breakfast spot here, Clemen's Bar, it's towards the back.
The market place is fun and lively. A tip, don't buy immediately at the entrance, everything up front is pricier, go in further, explore and bargain.
We love starting our morning with breakfast and juices here.

A lot of food and other stuff. This is a good place for tourists and visitors in Barcelona.
You can buy some fish, some sweets but also some Pasta. The price is ok and the shops are open and freindly. We spend here some minutes and walked around for some tastings. We liked this place :)

Cool to see but rip off artists. This is a very nice market but everything except the meat/bread/olives is overpriced. We were disappointed to find that the merchants display "hot" items like empanadas, crab sticks etc and then microwave them when someone orders them.The beautiful marzipan treats are cute but an absolute rip off. The staff are rude and over charge. Go before 1pm - afterwards is mobbed and people are very pushy.If you've been to the St Lawrence market in Toronto feel free to skip it.

A must , fascinating, interesting , . A great place to visit, crowded,, so many things to be amazed at, the best market to visit!!!! It is a must!!! Get all your souvenirs from here, oil, Spanish saffron, paprika. Fruit cups, fresh cherry for 1 euro

A must see . This market is a must see, especially if you are a foodie. Some of Barcelona best icecream is served here, the fruit juice was also delicious. It's very busy but still great to walk around, try foods and take pictures. There are restaurants all around the market and in the market itself you can buy nibbles and snacks.
Nice. Nice market with many products well showed. The restaurantes are kind of expensive compared at the service that they offer. But you may buy fresh fish, vegetables and meats.
Just of the Ramblas. Stalls selling fresh fruit & juices,tapas.Great place to stop for a break while wondering around this area,real gem

Barcelona Marketplace. We love to wander thru here - very crowded but so much fun to see all the fruits, meats, cheeses and seafood - fascinating ! There are also some good deals for lunch and snacks. We had lunch at a bordering cafe and brought a sandwich from a nearby grocery too.

A must place to visit. Undoubtedly it is the place to which every visitor should pay a visit. Located conveniently at the downtown, a few minutes walk from Liceu station. I got some sovenirs there including ham and candy. If time allowed, I should have had a seafood meal there. A place allows you to understand the Spanish culture.

I expected it to be impressive and it was. If you like visiting markets then this one is right up there as one not to miss. We came early for a cooking school located right in the market so beat the crowds. We enjoyed a perfect little breakfast just sitting at a counter. The beginning session of our cooking school was to walk the market to but fresh ingredients, what a treat, I thought I knew a lot about food.

Special must see marketplace. This is one you have to visit while you are in Barcelona. Its easy to find, side street of the Ramblas and its bigger than you think when you first enter the square. The place is covered so no problem when it rains. You can find all kind of fruits, meat, vegetables, herbs,etc.. here. Smell the flavours, enjoy the taste...And few small restaurants at the sides ...or enjoy a glass of wine and see the atmosphere from a different point of view. A must see ..

Nice market. Nice but busy market, go during the week if possible. Go hungry, u can buy lots of snacks to eat and fruits and vegetables to eat then or take home. Tapas available too. Worth the visit for sure.
Full of colour and sound. This is a vibrant market within 100 metres of Las Ramblas. With a focus on food it is very popular and was somewhat reminiscent of the Vic Markets in Melbourne Australia.
Amazing. What an amazing market, all the fruits were fresh, fresh juice, so many types of candy, even had few meat and fish places and small eating area. Must see
Love the styles . A great place for some local food!! Freshly caught food and lots of farmers here selling fruits and vegetables!! I would recommend it if you are seeing it from a local point of view

Catalan food galore. As you enter the market, you will be met with so many food choices. There are a lot of Taps bar to choose from and the fresh seafood section has so many options. Catalan spices also abound and so are the fresh fruits and fruit juices. It's a pleasant place to enjoy a tapa or two

Fresh Fruit. La Boqueria is a place that combines all the assorted fruits, vegies, fish, cured meats, from the makers, farmers, butchers and fishmongers who provide the food.Who needs a supermarket when the freshest fruits and vegetables and meats can be bought here at reasonable prices.

Best food in Barcelona . By far the best place to eat in Barcelona! Fresh and delicious food at a reasonable good price. There are a lot of food posts and all of them are equally tasty. You can sit anywhere and enjoy the fresh sea food and a variety of Spanish delicacies. Accompany your food with a sangria and you will have the best meal you can find in Barcelona.

Grab a picnic and pop to the park . Have been a few times. Is very busy, but full of fresh fruit, olives, ham, and then also butchers stalls, fresh fish stands and food outlets. Is a must in Barcelona, whether you're there to buy, or just to peruse the various different things on sale... the butcher section is a bit like being on safari!

Bazaar european style. Like an open air market but located inside a hall with a number of stalls selling all manner of foods, fish, sausages, empenadas, vegetables and everything in between. Pretty good prices, considering the amount of tourist that are there. Nice to visit once.

Must do!. This very nice market just aside the Rambla offers a large number of food stands with fruit, vegetables, meat ( Iberico) and fish. The offer is both for people shopping to cook and for tourists wanting to eat. At the various stands you can get fresh fruit smoothies, fruit salads and tapas in various forms and shapes. Little people can resist...

awesome food choices and atmosphere . we ate here 3 times and enjoyed it each time. the seafood is fantastic and the hustle and bustle all around adds to the whole experience. would wholly recommended a visit.

A must see.. I have seen many market places around the world,this is one of the most attractive and fun place.if you can find a chair around the sea food bars emjoy a lunch there.It is closed on sundays.A must visit place also sample some of the fruit juices that they offer.

Amazing market place. This is truly a sight to see and experience. The shear number of vendors and options is overwhelming and interesting simultaneously. Bring small bills and a backpack for all the things you will buy!

Must see. You have to go there. No visit to Barcelona will be complete without it.
Experience the smells, the sights, and try to also enjoy the flavoures.
Make sure you don't arrive on a Sunday, or a holiday - since it's closed.

Very Hectic. Rhe market is off the Ramblas. You must venture inside. Be prepared though as it is packed. Beautiful stalls of hams and fòods. Fresh fruit and juices. Everythung is so beautifully presented. Be careful with tour valuables as it is so busy.

Fascinating and vibrant. Just off the main busy tourist shopping street this market is buzzing.
Go hungry and eat tapas at a barstool from a stall...we had amazing fresh fish and a wonderful chick pea dish...sublime.
Go down a side aisle to avoid the crowded main passage...allow a good hour or two to look and wonder....

Wonderful place for lunch. We arrived at the market just after 11am which was a good time as it was not too busy. There were wonderful stalls everywhere with fresh sea food which they cooked for you there and then. Sitting down to a plate of freshly grilled razor clams and a glass of white wine before 12.....what could be better?

A must see. The mouthwatering, beautiful displays make one regret that one doesn't have a kitchen in Barcelona.
Extremely crowded always.
Fantastic seafood, fish and butcher shops. Good for buying saffron and dried mushrooms if you're on holiday.
For foodies. Stock up your meats, nuts, cheeses or just go around tasting. Have the juices. An hour well spent if you are around the area.

Lots of things to see. This market by far has the most variety of fruits and veggies than anyother supermarket i've seen in barcelona. Enjoy taking pictures of the food items they sell in the boqueria. Prices are a bit touristy but you can get good prices for fruits as well. I was able to buy a kilo of strawberries for 1.99eur. Try and go towards the end..that's where the wet market is. There are also restaurants in the sides but...try to avoid eating here...the prices are for tourists and the quality of the food is not exactly that good.

Fresh Fruit Juices and Delicious Seafood. It doesn’t get any better than this market. Here, you can buy fresh fruit juices for 1 euro made from the most delicious fruit. You can buy delicious treats and desserts or buy some of the best seafood money can buy.My husband and I bought some razor clams and shrimp here. We prepared it in our hotel's kitchen and it was phenomenal. Even if you don’t buy anything, I recommend you walk around the market when it’s open. You may not intend to buy anything, but I’m sure you will leave with something. Bonus: It’s right on La Rambla.
Exciting areas. A place you have to visit more than once being in BarcelonaMany sales of meet, fish, Vegetables and nice fish restaurants.

Visit back to La Boqueria. Back here once again and the place never ceases to amaze me! From fresh seafood to brilliant looking fruits to the choice of artisan chocolates!This place captivates me time and again!
Great place! . It is a very crowded market offering hundreds of foods and drinks, very nice experience. The place is always crowded with tourists and it is quite big.

A must to see in Barcelona. The fruit , fish , meats are of top quality and displayed very attractively. You can eat all these products in one of the littlt bars and restaurants specially all seafood is very fresh tasty. We recommend that you visit it by all means.

Wow!. We spent one afternoon wandering around the market and dinner was sorted (We were full until the next morning!). There were so many local produce and fresh food to try. The market was big and amazingly clean.

Watch your step!. Or you will walk right in the spray pattern of blood from a very large fish being beheaded by fishmonger. Unlike the markets in France, Barcelona's market is loud and brash and colorful! All kinds of food to eat now or later!

Go Hungry; Respect the Locals. We visited the market on a rainy Saturday morning and made the mistake of eating breakfast first. There are so many eating choices in the market, though seating is very limited. But you can wander through the crowded aisles and buy small samples of items like olives, cheeses, and the famous local ham, as well as ready-made sandwiches and other "portable" items. The market was especially crowded on a Saturday morning and we tourists tend to gawk and wander without purpose. So please be respectful of locals who are there to do their shopping for their weekend meals and try not to clog the aisles. But by all means, go and enjoy.

Very interesting place and nice environment. Just by chance, I and my wife found this place and decided to stay for dinner. After some visits what we like most is the delicious pieces of grilled meat and the oyster bar.

Good for wandering & juice!. I loved looking at the food, and trying some of the different fresh juices. You have to have some while in Barcelona!!! The meat stands were very reminiscent of the meat we are during our stay in Barcelona - i.e. Lots of creepy animal parts that weren't very good. ;)

The Infamous La Boqueria... Whether you have had the pleasure of visiting Barcelona or not, you've probably heard of its infamous food market, La Boqueria! And with good reason!Upon spotting this market from the Las Ramblas strip, you are immediately drawn to it. Whether that be by its charming look or the vibrant colours coming from within. Upon entering La Boqueria it's charm and those colours are intensified, with merchants galore ranging from vibrant fruit stalls, tapas bars, bakeries.. One thing I highly recommend is trying the fresh smoothies, which at only €1.50 are a steal!La Boqueria is a bustling place, and I highly recommend that you visit here!

A Must Visit If In Barcelona. Even if you are not interested in markets or food this is a must place to visit if in Barcelona.The food and fish stalls are about as good and interesting as they get and frankly you will not find anything better anywhere. The tapas bars inside the food hall are also fascinating.

Busy!. We were told we had to come here and we were glad we did. Food overload, busy busy busy and fantastic vibe. I just wish we had more time to look around and purchase more food as it was really quite cheap.

Incredible . What an amazing place, the smells the produce the places to see and places to eat. Always busy, lots of street food to buy and take away. If squeamish stay away! Live seafood and offal that might put people off! Do visit if you can.

Good. It is a good place to by some local fruits and fish. The walking restaurant there are so tasty.
You love the taste of everything there.

Great food. On our first day in Barcelona, we came upon this market. There are varied produce here and some great food. I ordered grilled squid in one of its food stalls and I just love it! The taste is fresh, clean and simple--just the way I like my food. Othe stalls also sell different kinds of meat, cheese and chocolate. Definitely going back to buy some more!

Amazing. Simply the most amazing food market ever! Must not miss if in Barcelona. Watch people shopping, see all the fresh fish, seafood, meats and fruit and veg on offer, have something to eat from one of the kiosks in the market. It is something you will not find anywhere else in the world.

If you like food, this is heaven on earth. The Boqueria is the Mecca of foodies. Stall after stall of everything you can think of, plus restaurants dishing up what you can't make in your hotel room. It is located on the west side of Las Ramblas around halfway up the promenade. It is a feast for the senses. Not only the smells of all the wonderful dishes being cooked by the restaurants, but the visual of the beautiful displays of colorful fruits and vegetables. It is a terrific place to wander for an hour and have something to eat and/or drink. Be careful of your valuables here, the crowds make it a prime spot for pickpockets and thieves, but don't let that stop you.
Market. Didn't buy anything as those enticing chocolates and sweets cost an arm and a leg. Nice just to see what they sell as it all looks good specially the fruits!

Magic old atmosphere . We have been there during our trip in Barcelona and I have to say that if you have the chance to visit this splendid city, this is one of the place you should visit! Amazing food, incredible atmosphere and great place where to feel the real heart and soul of this eclectic place. Definitely love it! I hope you'll enjoy the smell and the taste of this incredible country, you'll never forget!

Not to be missed!. If u arrive by Metro at Liceu station, take the other exit that is away from the Gran Theater. Immediately at the ground level, u will see this market entrance. There r many good eateries near the end of the market. We thought we should try fresh seafood here but they have all sorts of tapas too. For those who had meal here, the recipe will allow free access to the clean toilet (or €1 each). We tried cups of fresh cut fruits too. When we went back the next day before 9am, many stalls were just starting to display their produce. Its quite interesting to see how much attention & details they paid to the layout & display!

WOW!. This Market is amazing, even if you do not want to buy anything it is a must see! The food stand are clean and well presented, if you are squeamish about innards, heads and brains on of every animal, stay away! Super busy on the weekends and watch out for pick pockets, we were lucky but I imagine it is a hotbed for this!!

Huge oysrers). I like the place. Each time I'm in Barcelona, I go to this market for big oysters at 2,5 euro which are sold and opened right there on spot. Also I adore fresh shakes with coconut milk.

Excellent food options. Mercat de Sant Josep de La Boqueria offers a cornucopia of culinary options. You can eat at various food stalls within the market, purchase food for take away, or buy Catalan food to take home. These are all good options. My personal favorite was the Serrano Jamon in a cup. It's tough to argue with ham in a paper cone paired with some amazing bread. Come to the market with your appetite and you will leave happy.
Crowded, watch your belongings, picnic fixings. Fun place to walk through (closed Sundays) and pick up snacks or even the fixings for a picnic. Public WC at the back (fee).

Great Place to visit for food lovers. La Boqueria can get crowded during the day but it is well worth the visit. Buy some ham, cheese and enjoy the amazing variety of olives and fruits. (My boyfriend would not touch olives here in the US but he loved the fresh olives from this market). Little more expensive than your local grocery store hence if you plan to cook daily while in Barcelona this should not be your everyday go to market (unless you don't have budget). Don't miss the natural juices and the bakery.
A must for foodies. If you are interested in food, you must visit this Mercat, enjoy the flavours and the colours and get a bite to eat.
Nothing special. Actually this market is not so special. Same 5 diffrent stand all over... Meat & cheese, fish, fruit, tapas bar and nuts. Prices are quite high.

Busy bustling full of energy. Go early for breakfast as it's easier to get a seat at one of the vibrant bustling fresh food stalls. Great value tortillas ,fresh seafood, and wonderful vegetable variety .Fruits flowers honey spices and almost everything goody you can think of. Not to be missed if self catering.F

Great lunch stop when walking La Rambla.....busy and fun!. Went to the Mercat for lunch after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor. So glad we did! Lots of delicious looking food everywhere in the market. We ended up near the back at a place that served good beer and food....we had steamed mussels (which were delicious) served in a garlic/olive oil. We bought small containers of fresh fruit at one of the fruit stands for 1.5 euros....which we really enjoyed, as we did not get a lot of fresh fruit in Spain. I think you could eat anywhere in this market, and have a fun time. It is very busy at lunch time, so wander around until you find seats at one of the counters.....I do think the further back you go into the market, the better are the prices. Just go for the experience!!

Wonderful . Not my first visit here and I consider it to be one of the places to visit in Barcelona especially for fish. The stalls are so beautifully arranged , it is a treat for the eyes. There are so many stalls,Meat, fish, fruit, olives etc. The fish is so fresh that there is no 'fishy' smell at all. We had fish for lunch perched on a high stool at one of the stalls inside the market. Yes, the prices were a little high ( depending on your budget) but I would say it was worth it as the prawns we had, amongst other things were delicious. We also had lovely juicy peaches, strawberries and gelato. Worth a visit if you like food markets.
Amazing sights and smells. A must see, full of sweets spices, seafood and ham. Plenty of places to eat and drink, far nicer than some of the restaurants down las ramblas.
Excellent choices. The market has excellent variety of choice from seafoods to vegetables to hams. Beware that SUNDAY IS CLOSED! There is totally nothing else on Sunday

So much food! So many colour and smells!. We found this by chance and went back twice to eat. Had delicious fruit, an amazing pancake, Nutella ice cream and delicious Argentinian savoury pastries.
Incredibly busy but so much atmosphere. So glad we visited!
Great market. Wide variety of foods available in this market. The prices are very reasonable and cheaper further in you go

New Places New People . Walking down La Rambla and I stumbled across this sea of people. The buzz is amazing with lots of friendly faces and welcoming for sure. If you're a sea food lover, this place has a lot of it to offer! Numerous bar/restaurants that are perfect pit stops for when you're looking for a break for bargaining and shopping. Definitely value for money in terms of item purchasing, restaurants and reasonably priced too. After visiting this place, one thing is for sure: the Spanish love their food and drink!
Extremely Busy. Massive crowds went in about 12pm. I would either go very early or later in the day. It's got beautiful colourful fresh food. Well worth the visit if you don't mind crowds.
Barcelona spirit . Awesome location, smell the fresh fish or the popular "jámon" is amazing. A lot of things to see and choose. Amazing.

Worth seeing if in the vicinity but not otherwise. Its a bit over-hyped in my opinion. However it may be because we visited at 5.30pm on a Saturday May evening. About a third of the stalls were closed, first disappointment, despite the stated opening hours. Second problem was the narrow gaps between the stalls force you to squeeze past each other, which is irritating after 5 mins. Thirdly I was very underwhelmed by the produce, we threw away our fresh fruit drinks they were revolting and the pies were half cooked half stone cold so ditto. The tapas stalls were daft prices, and cramped seating if you could find anywhere to sit at all. Chilii lovers will adore it, as will fish lovers who are very well catered for. Apart from that I wouldn't bother. There are so many fabulous things to do in Barcelona why waste time on a very cramped market?

A feast for all your senses!!!!. My husband and I were in a coking class and part of the class was going to this market to pick up seafood. We were blown away by all of the beautiful everything there! The way everything is set up is so artful. All of the fruit, veggies, seafood, meat, desserts, nuts and any other things you can imagine are just the most perfect you've ever seen. The market is the largest one in Spain and one of the 10 largest in the world! You can eat there too! So awesome, we didn't want to leave!

Must see. I brought there some customers. They really enjoyed the live of this market, there are many attractions in Barcelona and this is a must see one. The ham you can get at the entrance can be delicious.
Amazing market. La-Boqueria market is a very colorfull place, alot of fresh fruits, candies, and many kinds off Juice, food and more...

Busy colors in downtown Barcelona. Crowded by hundreds of people day by day, La boqueria is more of a tourist attraction than a local market. Do not let the amazing, vivid colors to steal your attention for too long, there is much to discover behind the touristy stalls. The seafood paella serving place at one of the last rows and the olive stall are definitely my favourites. The market is perfect for a short tasting tour or just refreshing with a fruit shaker; however, look out for tourist-prices!

Experience for all the senses! . This food market off Las Ramblas is like no other. Make the effort to explore the sensory overload with colours, smells and tastes like no other. Take your time and either enjoy a staggered lunch or purchase some take aways for a picnic elsewhere.
A must. The market just off Las Ramblas is a must visit, take no notice of the reviews saying it's too crowded, the people make the atmosphere!! Great fresh fruit smoothies
A must-visit!. Remember to get some iberico ham, fresh fruit juices, cheese. If not, just admire the colorful display of food.

Colourful palate of market life. This market is a glorious riot of bright colours made by the fruit and juicing vendors who present their wares so attractively.The fruit is not the cheapest but readily available in small quantities for snack and stroll You may be fortunate to find smaller stalls selling pockets of seafood or jamon.There are a few very occupied bars that thrive on the atmosphere but hard to get a seat if you are more than two.The confectionery stands are also worth a look as they are also beautifully presented. To purchase you'll be given a bag and some forceps as it is generally by weight. Most vendors wear gloves - keep an eye out.My favourite would be the icecream stands however. Gorgeous mounds of cheesecake Oreo or even avocado icecream.A lovely place to while away a few hours

Paradise of Tastes, colours and pleasant vibe!. We love coming here for a snack every time we are in Barcelona. We came here by Metro (Liceu, Mercat exit).Mercat de la Boquerìa also known as Mercat de Sant Josep. It is a large, bustling and colourful market just off La Rambla. It sells a wide range of products including meat, fish, fruit, vegetables, chocolates. It also has several cafes and restaurants around its edges.The fish market has a great variety and everything looks "today fresh”. Many of the seafood vendors have a small café section where the seafood you have selected will be cooked for you….which I find clever. However, we did not have time to do this. Perhaps on a coming trip. Many other stalls offer meals, whether it be fresh fruit, sandwiches, muffins, coffee or whatever you may like.

A Must go to experience. The love of than great food has no better showcase than la Boqueria. A madcap frenzy of a hundred stalls exhibiting or serving the most astonishing array of meats, fishes, fruits, nuts, spice etc. As crowded as the subway during rush hour, it is a must.
Too crowded to enjoy. Too many groups of gawkers blocking access to the vendors. Typical market stalls and categories. Stroll through if you wish.

A visit to this paradise of the food is necessary.. Even if you are not a fan of food products, you have to visit this market. For the mood, for the colors, for the traditions...So if you succeed to pass between the different shops (so many people like everywhere in Barcelona), you'll discover the most alive place of the town in the day. Don't forget your camera, there's so many occasions to take beautiful pictures.
Amazing. Look for the crowds off of Las Ramblas to find this amazing market. Simply incredible. I've never seen such a variety of candies, nuts, drinks, fruits, fish, and meats.

If you're hungry, DON'T come here!!!. There are so many choices that it's mindboggling! If you're mildly hungry, then this a good place to check it out. If you're super hungry, then have mercy on your soul because you will have a lot of difficult choices to make.Be aware that there will be a lot of people here. Some vendors will allow you take pictures (no flash) while others will have signs that will forbid pictures. This is a must-see in Barcelona, and it's free.

Gnam gnam. You walk at rumbla, and in your right sidr you will.find la boqueria. Enter inside please!!! Colours , food and smoothies of fresh fruits everywere!!spend a lunch overthere,u will.teast olives, croquettas,frishs, smoothies all just for fews euros...

James Martin and Rick Stein' s recommendation. Our main reason for visiting Barcelona and la Boqueria was based on the glowing reports by 2 famous British chefs and we were not disappointed ! It is one of the liveliest markets we have ever been too and the produce was quality. Trying to eat at one of the few eateries was a challenge but we managed to bag a couple of seats late one afternoon and enjoyed the experience. The prices are not cheap! However it was voted best market in the world so you can budget for this.

Food, food, and more food. We loved this place. Lots of fresh sea food, fruits, and spanish meats. You can wander around here for half a day, stop at a shop to eat tapas and even pizza (my son said this was the best pizza ever!), fresh fruit drinks and chocolates.

Food Lovers' Heaven. I love food, I love fruit, I love snacks and I love market. Therefore I really enjoyed the visit here! You can find everything eatable here, from spanish ham to deep fried squids. Definitely worth a visit! There're also souvenir shops on the road outside the market and makes the tourist part a bit easier if you want to pick up some postcards and other stuff.

Bustling market with eye-catching food items. A must see in Barcelona! . I had my first meal in Barcelona in the market based on the recommendation of a local. It was a good recommendation so I'm passing it along. The market is a much better option for a meal or snack than the restaurants in the area. The market was very busy, with beautifully arranged food items (fruits, veggies, chocolates, candy, etc.). There were many restaurants so you have lots of options for a hot meal - various types of cuisine (Spanish, Asian, Italian, etc.). I eat at Bar Bouqeria - simple, tasty meal of grilled chicken and potatoes.There is limited seating at certain restaurants (stools), but if you can't find seats, there is an open-air seating area to the right of the covered market. This is a market frequented by tourists so prices for certain items may be high. This is a must see in Barcelona even of you don't intend to shop!
Good bazaar. Must be seen. Very diverse and interesting stuff. Try the tropical fruit juices. Also tapas places are good

An excellent food market. Nearly as good as Valencia!. Spain must be the masters of food markets. La Boqueria had hundreds of stands, offering so much quality fresh produce, from butchers, to smoked meats, to many local cheeses, to all kinds of fruit and vegetables. If you search hard, you can find the best butchers you'll find anywhere in the world. I managed to find a 42 day aged piece of wagyu rib - delicious! However I felt the Central Market in Valencia had the edge slightly, where the meats and cheeses were slightly better.

Bustling market off La Ramblas. Exciting and busy market with an amazing array of shops. Fun to walk through and take in the sights, sounds and aromas from the energetic tapas bars and fresh food vendors. Go hungry and you won't be disappointed.
Stunning . What a wonderful market, you can't allowed your self to miss it.Fresh fruits, fresh juices and lots of fresh seafood.Go at lunch time when you are hungry do you can try it all.
Nice but crowdy. The market is nice but really touristic and crowded. Is has some charm but isn't really authentic. Don't expect to make a great deal.

Another great market. Treat yourself to a visit here lots to see & try
Busy and vibrant so interesting
Go for breakfast or lunch
If you are in self catering accommodation take a shopping basket

A must-see. And not necessarily to shop - it's also fun to just look around, although impossible to resist trying local specialties, beginning with Serrano, cheeses and a variety of fruit/veggies, and ending with Catalan sweets and delist snacks. You can also eat in local cafes and bars, though they are usually packed.

Best local market. If you really want to see local Spanish market. This is the place you should visit. Having some seafood there will be good experience. With fresh ingredients and you can see how they cook. There's queue for most restaurants. Just need to wait.

Full of interesting things. In this market in the middle of Barcelona, you can find anything from level 5 expensive jamon iberico, to prepared foods, to shellfish and seafood of any variety, t breads, candies, and olive oils. Its a great place to come for lunch, and a little shopping while in the city.

Fantastic atmosphere, really busy. This is a great place to pop into, especially to grab something for lunch! Sandwiches, pizzas, baguettes, sweets, fresh fruit, smoothies etc., it has something for everyone. Most of the stalls are food based, and there's a lot of sausage and fish sellers so the middle of it can get a bit seafood-heavy! It's a bustling market so hard to keep groups together, but the kind of place you can find some interesting stuff. Worth popping in if you're on Las Ramblas!

A Highlight of our Visit. The market is just electric with all the people and shops. It was a fascinating array of vendors offering local edibles - all of it displayed beautifully. Lots of little eateries at the back where you can enjoy some of the local treats. The atmosphere here is really exhilarating!
Nice market, you can even eat here!. Very nice market, beautiful colors for photographs. You can even eat some pintxos or tapas: very fresh, good quality, and not expensive at all.
so much to see and try. what can you say, everything food wise you could ever wish for is on offer here, a must see.just make sure you don't eat before coming here.
Nice. I don't love see thing like shreams and all this stuff . so that's why it wasn't cool to me to be there and to see kind of thing. Also I thought that them have clothes and them dosn't.
Highly recommend!. We came there each day. The food is good, the atmosphere is great, the people are nice. Lovely experience
A treat for the eyes. Lots of stalls selling fresh fruit, meats and cheeses whilst further down you can perch on a bar stool and enjoy a meal cooked in front of you. A nice way to pass some time.

One of my favourite places. This was a must on my places to visit.
Words can not describe the place.
It's totally wonderful...
It's a feast for the eyes as well as the senses...
A MUST......

Incredibly overpriced but nice to walk around. It is a great market with loads to choose from. But be warned, this is heavily aimed at the tourist wallet. One example is the chocolate stall that is charging €76/Kg which is three times the prices of a high end chocolate shop in our local town at home. If you want to mingle with the locals there are better options such as the Mercat de Santa Caterina which is about 10 minutes walk away down some lovely back streets. However if it's choice you want at any price then this is probably the place to be.
Vacation . A fun place to walk around, have something to eat. Only need about 30 minutes to look around. Closed on Sunday.
Beautiful food. This is a must do to see fresh produce, meat, and fish as well as other delicacies. Great photos as well. Tasty food chocolate strawberries and nuts.

main market on Las Ramblas. This is a top tourist stop on Las Ramblas. I came here early for breakfast as there were 3 spots recommended for breakfast. Two of them were closed and the third was okay but a little difficult to order. You had to ask for the food and I didn't know what to ask for. I ate something but later somebody sat next to me (he'd been there before) and was offered a completely new dish. The market also sells fruits, ham, seafood, meat etc. however the prices are higher as one would expect in a tourist area. Stalls were also not welcoming of photographers. It is a must see but I preferred the local Caterina market (also in the old district) instead. It's not as rustic looking but people were friendly and they had great prices and services on olives and cheese for my train trip. Markets are closed on Sunday.

Amazing experience. To feel the hussle and bustle of such an amazing market was great I love them, also to see the presentation of the items on all the stalls were exquisite. Loved every minute, great day.

Beautiful but expensive. It is a beautiful place to watch but not so cheap to eat at. You can try literally anything, but if it's not extremely exotic, I'd rather buy it somewhere else, cause you can always find a cheaper place. It is though a nice place to see weird things and take pictures.

Go hungry & nosh your way round!. Fabulous market - if you're a tourist you probably won't buy the fresh fish/meat etc but the sweet treats, especially the amazing marzipan creations are irresistible!

Wonderful atmosphere. It is lovely to just wander around this market and take in the atmosphere. The smell of all the different foods was amazing and everything was so fresh. Even if you dont buy anything it would be nice to have a look around.

Really something to see. When you first look at this from the street, it can seem a little weird and almost off putting. DON'T BE DETERRED. It it a huge marketplace with every type of food you could imagine. You want 30 types of mushrooms? They have that. You want chocolatey delights while buying a rabbit for your stew? They have that as well. While yes a lot of tourists go there, no tourist has the capability while traveling to cook many of the items they sell, so it is obviously frequented by the locals as well. Even if you have no intention of buying anything, definitely something to see.

Must-see. La Boqueria was as expected very crowded, so keep an eye on your belongings. The presentation of the food is outstanding and the prices for fruit, vegetables and snacks are reasonable. You can buy juices (sometimes 2 for 2€), pre-cut fruit (Amazing mangos!), bread, olives and lots other things. I personally avoided the fish and seafruit sections, the smell was a bit too much for me.
Great food market!. Very nice food market.. a great food , colorful stalls , we enjoyed been there and spent almost 2 hours just looking all that food :)

Amazing Market!. Be sure to visit the La Boqueria market while in Barcelona -- it is truly amazing. Such a variety of fruits and vegetables. Delicious fruit juices. Seafood so fresh that it's still wriggling. Pig heads, goat heads, intestines, brain --stuff you don't regularly see in market in the U.S.

A must see. Great market, a must to visit, always busy, just off Las Ramblas, never seen so much fruit, vegtables,sweets butchers fish etc, all on display, a great atmosphere, this is where the locals go, have food stalls but never been able to grab a seat, recommend a visit

A must for food lovers. This market is a must for food lovers , the stalls are groaning with fresh produce. For the squeamish avoid the butchery counters, the Spanish eat things never seen in a butchers shop in uk ( cows nose, lung , sheep head to name a few ). The fruits, breads , hams all looked amazing . Next time I'm in Barcelona I will visit this market hungry , buy a picnic lunch a bottle of wine and head to the sea front to enjoy .

Lovely market. Beautiful market with everything you can imagine on offer. It gets quite crowded and we were warned by our guide to be alert for pick pockets - they take advantage of the limited space and crowded nature of the market.

Really great experience!. I loved how there are so many fruits, vegetables, fish and other things that the market offers. I wanted to just try everything! They also offer tapas. Make sure to go hungry!

Lunchtime. Had heard so much about the market. We were not disappointed. Decided to wander and try a variety of foods and fresh juice. Everything delicious. Fascinating to see all the fresh local produce. Very busy around 1-30pm but enjoyable. Just watch your bag/pockets in the crowds.

Small but best market place.. Best place to try fresh fruits and juices. NIce place to try Tapas, Meat and we tried Mangoes which were as tasty as Asian mangoes, so worth trying it.Best time to visit is in the morning hours like 8:00 A.M. less crowded. Good place to buy spices like saffron, Pistachos and other spices, a bit expensive but worth the quality. Tip: Move around the shops and you will find some fruit shops with cheaper price. Its better to consume fresh fruits than juices. Stores inside the market are cheaper than the entrance stores.

Best market in Barcelona. Good for wandering around and purchasing something to eat on the go. Very busy but worthwile to visit. Lots of cured meats and fresh fruit and vegetables. Try the artisinal chocolates, it is very good

Best experience ever. The most lively market place where lots of venues presenting the best cooked seafood, meat items, sweets, desserts, tapas, paella...and many more. All excellent and very well displayed.

Meh. Beside the fish area in there actually they sell the same things and there is not much diversity.
The place is crowded and a great place for kids to get lost .

Overwhelming, crowded. A huge market but overwhelming, filled with tourists (like us) looking for an experience but not shopping for daily living. Try local markets instead, like Santa Catarina in El Born where we were staying.

MUST VISIT!!. Freshness galore. From Serrano ham to veggies to candy to dried fruits to fresh juices to THE FISH!! I suggest you get there about 10 am like we did. We went to the fish area and ate sashimi. Yes at 10 am. I gave to say ther best sashimi I've ever had. The fresh juices. My favorite was the pataya. The bread!!! The cheese!!! If you fail to visit before you leave Barcelona you just didn't experience Barcelona.

Food Galore. The famous St Joseph Market in Barcelona is the place every traveller must visit.At the market place is the the meeting place for the locals especially housewives.A most colourful place where daily necessities are bought for the families.Fishes,meats,vegetables,nuts,cooking oils,fruits drinks and local bread and pastries are available in great varieties.From this point of view,you can get a good idea of the local life of the people.Fresh seafood is sold and cooked to order here as well.Eat to your heart's content.

Picturesque food heaven!. This market is a must for all foodies. The stalls are so colourful and well-presented it puts Borough Market to shame. There are bars scattered around the market which also provide food but they are so busy very hard to get a stall. We had a wonderful meal just by the edge of the market - a wonderful paella and seafood platter. Very tasty. Would assume and hope this restaurant gets their produce from the market.

A must place to visit. One of my favorite place to visit im Barcelona. Here you buy fruits, vegetables, nuts, candies, jamon, sausages and cheeses. There's also a restaurant where you can sit at the counter and order fresh seafoods. The place is packed with locals like immersing yourself in true local living.

Lots to see. Best place to get some fresh fruit to walk around the city with. Also great if you want to get some cooking done. Good prices. Fresh. Also looks lovely - some very original features in this market.
Vibrant market - don't miss it!. I felt like I was on a Food Network show! I was waiting for Andrew Zimmern to show up!Incredible food, great way to get a huge dose of Catalan culture!

A must-see place that is way too crowded with us tourists. We come to Barcelona to experience everything we have read about, and the Boqueria is one of those places. It is too crowded to be fun, but you absolutely must see the food in all its glory.

A must see, but, crowded. What a fun place to wander through the food stalls. Go hungry. Lots of healthy food choices, ready to eat. Fruits, nuts, fruit juices. Fresh and prepared seafood abound.Well worth the visit. Great picture taking.Be careful of your wallets and purses (valuables). We didn't have any problems, however, it could be an easy place to be robbed because of the tight quarters.

Great Mercat, no wonder it was so busy. This Mercat is easy to find being just off Las Rambles. As well as buying food for consumption elsewhere several stalls sell items that can be eaten on the spot. We enjoyed a paper cone full of slices of different types of choritzo sausage with freshly made fruit smoothies. The range of flavours available was amazing. Well worth visiting even if you don't plan to buy anything. However I'm sure that you will be tempted to make the odd purchase.
Absolute must. Fantastic market on Las Ramblas, just how a market should be full of the most amazing fresh products with lovely little tapas bars

Busy market. I went on a Saturday at mid-day, market is packed. Early morning would be much better. Fresh fruit, fresh seafood, fresh meat, and all other goods stalls and all kinds of food. If you have visited another market in any other Europe or Asian cities, this one would be the same. You can skip this one if you visited other ones and is time pressed.Tip: restroom is at the back of the market downstairs. Prepare exact change of 0.50 EUR to pay. They have a cash change machine there to get you exchange changes.

Great fun for Foodies!. The good points - brilliant atmosphere, huge selection of meat,veg,fruit, spices and oils etc etc. Great for tapas and a glass of wine or a cold beer and soak up the buzz.Bad points - absolutely packed around lunchtime so much so that you feel as if you are in a human tide just being washed around all the stalls and can't swim against the tide! Some repetitive stalls.Overall - a must experience if you are a foodie with plenty to see and buy. Well worth trying to get a table at the many little bistro's on the outskirts of the market but just get there early enough to enjoy and don't lose your patience!

so lively. this market situated next to the La Rambla avenue. fresh fruits and candy stands all over the place (the ones at the entrance are moer expamsive). the sea food section is very cleen. be awere for pickpockets as enywere in Barcelona.
Nice but full. Nice to see once. But it's very full of people and same type of shops. But nice to experience and see the fresh produce.

Visit early in the morning . We went to the market twice. Once around 8am on a Friday and once around noon the following Wednesday. Man, what a difference a few hours make! The early visit was peaceful and so enjoyable. The noon visit was like Disney World! There were so many people you couldn't even see what the stalls had to offer. It's a great market and everything you could want is available for purchase but I highly suggest an early visit to really soak it all in.

wow what a find. Great market if you like meat fish and sweetsThat's all that seemed to be there but very impressive.We went back on the Sunday to get some chocolates but unfortunately there is no market on a Sunday so avoid on that day!
Too busy. Even though it was a Monday in April this market was packed. Better to visit other markets in the city,of which there are many.

Enjoyed our first Barcelona meal here. Quite a number of restaurants and specialty food shops in the colorful and busy market. Enjoy a meal at a Basque restaurant as we watched the activity. Definitely worth a visit to try the food and maybe buy a local delicacy or two to take home.
Animated market. A fresh daily market full of life and yummy local treats from cold cuts to fresh juices. Everything u might need!

Great Market. Amazing market. The best tip I received was to purchase items more towards the center of the market as the outer vendors cater more to the tourists than locals. You can get fresh juices and cut fruit from 1 euro up. Whereas the outer starts at 1.5 euro and up for the same juices. However, there are some better selections and flavour combinations in the center for sure. Beware that this market is very busy and is considered to be a popular place for pick pockets to hang out. So watch your belongings. Myself and my travel companion never experienced any issues but we were warned numerous times.

Amazing market!. it is the best market ever! It is clean and not smelly and there is a lot of fresh produce, fresh smoothies/juices, fresh salami and cheese in a cone, fresh spices, dried fruit, nuts, sweets...It is amazingly out of this world.

A Delight for the Senses. Worth a visit if you are in the areaThis market is located on the right hand side of Las Ramblas about half way down. It is a very busy and popular market and has really become more of a tourist attraction attraction. But saying that it is a delight for the senses with all the rows of brightly coloured fresh fruit and veg and is also a great place to pick up a smoothie or a fruit cup. Go in a few rows and these goods are cheaper than at the entrance. If you can find a seat at the half a dozen or so bars then the tapas is good and you will be getting a real authentic Barcelona experience although if you like your space then you may want to give this a miss.
Fantastic for quick grab and a glass of wine. The Mercat is very busy, colourful and offers a unique food and drink experience. Watch your belongings as thieves operate in the area. Worth a visit.

Get a dose of real vitamin here!. I am a cooking traveler so of course I had to go shopping here. Crowd of tourist makes shopping for locals difficult (Mercat de El Born is where the locals shop!). Beware of pickpockets. As anybody else has mentioned the shops close to Las Ramblas are more expensive- for example the fruit juice ranges from 2 to 1 euro from the front to the end of the market. I shopped for cheese, seafood, olive oil, fruit and veggies from here and I was very pleased with quality and price. There is no decent bakery in this market and there is also a wine shop on the north side of this market that offers very reasonable good Spanish wines. This place is closed on Sundays.

Sheep's heads and sweeties. The last time we visited this market our young daughters were with us and we were soon dragged out and made to buy icecream. This time we could wander at our leisure and take in the aromas of the fresh produce available in this wonderful traditional market.
Woooow. A must see and try. Lovely food. I went there 3 times. Not open on Sunday. It is a market. Try the meat and the fruit.

Pick up supplies for a picnic!. Whether you're just sightseeing or on a mission to stock up for a picnic, don't miss a chance to have your senses stimulated. You'll find vendors offering chocolates, peppers, meats, seafood, bread, fresh fruit and vegetables. We stopped here to gather items for a picnic. Then, we strolled through the Barri Gotic and into Barceloneta to catch the Teleferic to Montjüic to enjoy our picnic.

Fantastic market. If only all markets were this interesting, Just popped in during a short city break and all the food especially the fruit and vegetables looked so appealing. There is such a diverse range of foods to buy at this market, you will be hard pressed to leave without sampling/buying! Not open on Sundays.

A Typical Local Market. This is a typical covered vegetable, fruit, meat and fish market and it opens to La Ramblas street. It is worth visiting as you walk through La Ramblas. Even if you don't intend to buy anything, it gives you a good feel of the local Spanish products.

Wish I could sleep here. Amazing marketplace, just of La Ramblas. Reminds me of the Egyptian Bazaar in Instanbul - so many flavors and colors, tastes and textures, just amazing. It;'s just as crowded too. Perfect place to find anything from fresh and processed meat to fresh and juiced fruit and vegetables, and there's even the option to have a quick lunch right there in the market as some merchants will cook right in front of you and serve it to you on the spot. Incredible place, makes the walk through La Ramblas almost bearable.

100% Worth a Visit. I have had the pleasure of visiting Barcelona multiple times, and the San José market is a place I always enjoy visiting. It is a Spanish-style market with all manner of fresh food packed into rows of small stands. You can find everything from natural juices to croquettes to fresh cooked seafood. It's a great place for all ages and a wonderful stop for hungry travelers.

Great place to visit...even if not shopping. Been here lots of times, but it still fascinates me.Sounds, sights, smells.....love it! I always take breakfast here when in BCN.Top tip.....the further you go into the market....the cheaper the prices get! But great food at any of the cafes in there.
OMG. Phenomenal market. It is a must see. The food on sale is fascinating. We had lunch there and it was great. Very busy, fun experience.

In love with this place . Coming from Rome - a city full of garbage everywhere, especially in our "mercats", this place in particular makes you feel like you're a barbarian in comparison. You don't hear one single vendor screaming, nor will you ever find dirt on the floor. This place is an explosion of fresh food and colors. I absolutely recommend eating there also.Went with my parents, sister and daughter.

A feast for all your senses. Yeah, it's a tourist trap. So what?Fruits, juices, candy, disgusting sea creatures, body parts you wouldn't think anyone would want to buy, etc. This is a great place to sample all the flavors Barcelona has to offer. Wander around, blow a few euro on something you might not ordinarily taste and have fun.As others have said, be sure to keep a close eye on your belongings since pickpockets are known to troll the area. There's so much going on, it'd be easy to lose focus and get victimized.If you want a slightly smaller, WAY calmer experience, check out Mercat de la Concepció.

Great place to grab a juice or a quick snack. La Boqueria is one of those places that all tourists must visit when they come to Barcelona, but even locals enjoy shopping there. Try to avoid visiting during the lunch hour (between 1:00 and 3:00pm) as it is incredibly busy, but remember that it closes at 8pm so don't count on grabbing dinner there. It is also closed on Sunday and on most holidays so be careful as there are many holidays in Barcelona. The stalls at the front entrance are over-priced, but you can find more reasonable prices as you go further inside. Whenever we are in the area, we stop into La Boqueria to grab a cup of fresh juice for 1€, so many flavours to choose from. We enjoy walking around the stalls and trying all different types of food. Great fun!

Loved this Market! A Foodie Must!. What a colorful delicious market! You can walk through this market and guaranteed you will be amazed by the variety of fruits, breads, meats cheeses, sweets!! It's a bit small and crowded, so it will be hard to keep track of friends and family. It doesn't have many places to sit and eat like San Miguel market in Madrid does, most of the things are buy and go. Not good for people who don't like crowds. You must try the freshly squeezed juices and the chocolate covered strawberry skewers. We had lunch at Cinco Jotas to get away from the crowds, it's located in the perimeter of the market. The food was great, service was friendly and our waiter was very funny, cracking jokes with us the entire time.

A truly colourful, bustling and vibrant place!. I love visiting markets and this is one of the best - joint favourite (for me) with Valencia.The produce is displayed amazingly well - it's a form of art.It's very popular and busy, both with locals doing their shopping and tourists looking at the artistic creations.All the fruit and veg looked high quality and I loved the way they had made up little takeaway pots of fresh fruit and salad - perfect for picking up for breakfast or as we did, to take with us on our long train journey home. An excellent value (and healthy) snack.I recommend a visit to this bustling, vibrant market!

Eating, drinking or shopping? You can do it all under one roof on Las Ramblas.. We discovered Mercat de Sant Josep de la Boqueria our first day in Barcelona while strolling on Las Ramblas. We stopped in for a light meal of seafood and wine, which was great, then wound up buying cheeses, breads, sweets, nuts., and thoroughly enjoyed the diversity of offerings and the eclectic atmosphere. We went there several times during our stay in Barcelona and have told many friends to put it on their list of things to do in Barcelona.

Brilliant atmosphere. Great to be in the thick of things but stay clear if you don't like crowds/other tourists! Hard to move at some points but the stalls were great. Not much variety as the same foods were repeated but the display of each was brilliant and lovely for photographs. Fresh fruit, smoothies, nuts, chocolates, lollies, meats etc. Would recommend going to experience and get a snack for the rest of the walk up Las Ramblas!

Wonderful and not overpriced!. We have been planning with my boyfriend to just see La Boqueria once for breakfast and to get the vibe, but since the first moment we entered, we came back for breakfast every single day of our 4 days stay. The very first day we just went through the whole market (its not huuuge, you can go through, check the prices and then decide). For example the juices at the entrance are 1,5 or 2 € per one while in the end on the left side from the entrance you have a stand with fruits and those same juices for only 1 € each, so we went there even 2x a day to have a juice and enjoy the atmosphere in a shadow in bench behind Boqueria. The first day we have had some fried sea food for 5 €, you pay for that 15 € in restaurants and also bacalao croqueta (bomb) second day we had meat pie and the last die we had tortilla for 3 € which was a huuuuge piece for 2 people and we couldnt even finish almost. The place is crowded, but it depends when you come there. First and second day we were there about 11 am - 1 pm, it was thursday and friday and it was full, but you could make it... and the last day saturday we were there at 8:30.. completely empty, just the owners preparing the stands, everything totally fresh and like 10 tourists. So dont be lazy and go there early in the morning :)
Very crowded but good food and ice cream. . This is used by locals, old, not a tourist spot. Pick up a fruit smoothie, a fresh baked empenada or choose from a variety of other inexpensive foods
Very colorful. This market is located in las Ramblas, is a very touristic place and very busy but is worth to take a look at it and have some food while you are there.

Wonderful!. This is a fabulous market and an absolute must visit when in Barcelona. Locals come here and do their shopping, so it is a great opportunity to see daily life. There are also some great places to eat and enjoy a tapa or two!

Excellent . One of my favourite places in Barcelona. It's such a treat to visit here. It is busy so be prepared for that but it's well worth visiting and the food of course is great. There's also a lovely square at the back to sit and enjoy your purchases.

No trip to Barcelona is complete without going to this Market. We came during the Easter week and the market was packed all the time! Being with throngs of people walking in awe of all kinds of meat, fish, veggies, fruits, nuts, candies, flowers - half of them never-seen before - was like immersing yourself in true local living. Even if you don't like crowds and you don't intend to buy anything, you should still go to this market to sample this truly unique Barcelona experience.

Not just a market! . This is much more than just a market you can have a full on dining experience. It is filled with lots of stalls packed with just about every kind of food you can think of ... fruit /veg/meat/fish/deserts/ nuts/chocolate. There is a buzzing atmosphere and wonderful smells as you stroll around. There are also many bars where you can eat tapas & hav some cava or beer to wash it down. Some of the seafood selections were amazing. It's a great place that you should visit at least once. We went a couple of times !

Very touristic but still very colorful! . This central Barcelona market is very popular among the tourists and is always very crowdy. The prices are reasonable good and the atmosphere is great. Try one of the many tapas bars in the area ,particulary for seafood.

Amazing!. Amazing food market off La Ramblas with a great variety of food stalls and eating places. Fishmongers had all manner of sea food from squid to octopus to sea urchin and the meat counters proved that no part of a pig is wasted! Quite an assault on the senses if you are not used to that sort of thing. A definite must-visit for foodies.

Amazing tasting experience. Wow the fresh seafood tapas, cava.... Heaven on earth for any foodie. Just make sure you have a companion that is an adventurous and hungry eater. Also the exotic fruit stand is highly recommended. Before you go watch a traveling food show that you can pick up some of the European delicacies...

So much to see/smell/buy!. Sensory overload! This area has the feel of both local life & tourist attraction...which is very uncommon anywhere! I say tourist attraction simply because of the tremendous amount of foreigners walking around but it's certainly local in their offerings and its vendors. They sell everything from meat (suspended from above in true barcelonian fashion), to sangria & mojitos (to go!) to flowers, and much in between. This area is fun to just walk around but due to the extreme caution on pickpockets, watch your belongings closely! There are so so many people milling around...just be cautious...but put down the map & take it all in.

Foodies paradise!. This is a great place to experience Barcelona. Make sure to be hungry when you visit because you will want to taste some of the local fare. The pimientos padron are not to be missed- a slightly spicy fresh green pepper quickly deep fried and salted then served in a cup. It is off La Rambla and easy to get to. Fresh fruit drinks and tasty homemade treats are mixed in with the meat and fish and vegetable stalls.
Amazing!!!. It's a really nice experience!!! And really tasty food!!! Everyone should visit it because you won't find such a mercat anywhere else!

Incredible market. Great market located off the Ramblas. Lots of food to see and buy. We found the seafood section particularly interesting as there was a large range - from fish to prawns, clams crabs squid, octopus etcYou have to be prepared for the crowds of people everywhere.Apart from the crowds it was a fun visit
colour splashing. a mixture of scents, attractive candies, world-wide fruit appealing to your palates, attractive fish and nice and cheap packages of fruit to relish

Colourful and full of scents. Though the market seems to be tended towards tourists, you can still buy anything from fish and meat to candy and spices. Quite touristy, and some of the candy cost 3x as much as in nearby stores. Be mindful of the prices.

Loved this!. We had been recommended to visit here, and we were not disappointed. The sights, smells and tastes were amazing. Stalls offering tasters of cheese, ham, fruits you cannot leave here hungry. Such a shame markets like this are severely lacking in the UK, a celebration of all things fresh and wholesome.
You can find anything there . A huge market with a vivid colors that give to all the kind of foodlovers to have a taste of everything that they want and desire!!

Bustling atmosphere. This is a great place to visit. Lots of fresh produce available. We went for fruit smoothies to go with our breakfast. There was a great atmosphere in the whole place and definitely worth a trip.

Impressive place. Must to walk on Rambla and come into La Boqueria . And most important is to be hungry ready for excellent food , prepared in front of you . Very impressive place to walk around and first meet all this spectacular food with eyes.

A must in Barcelona . Have to visit here, try avoid during the weekend. If you visit later in the day get things cheaper. Keep hold of your belongings as very crowded. The juices are great but don't buy ones at the front! The tapas bars in the middle are quite pricey so wouldn't advise. We visited twice during our stay, loved it! Eye opening and great to see how locals go about.

Great Food Market. This is a large food hall, selling every kind of fresh produce from octopus to carrots. The place is a riot of colours and smells and noise from the vendors. In among the stalls are lots of eating places also selling the produce prepared and ready to eat. If a visitor to Barcelona you are unlikely to be buying any of the fresh produce but try it at the eating stalls. Lots to choose from.
Weird experience. The hustle and bustle to the most diverse indoor sure Leaves people with an experience they will enjoy. Situated along the Las Ramblas please note not open on a sunday

A must visit. Typically Barcelona, a true must visit. And even more so if you are a foodie.There are prettier markets, but this one has to be on your list.Pick some of the small bars for excellent tapas to satisfy your hunger built up by walking around the great food stalls.

Great BUZZ. Wandered in off Ramblas and were surprised to find this bustling market with tons of informal eateries. Ok it's touristy but perfect for a stop off and a bite to eat and some people watching

Absolutely visit here when in Barcelona . We came here in search of lunch and there were plenty of options. There are tapas bars in the market but we just bought items from the stalls. There were beautiful fresh juices for €1 in so many flavours. We had raspberry/blackberry and mango/kiwi which were delicious! For eating there were stalls with all kinds of baked goods including empanadas and quiches, as well as really interesting versions of kebabs/burritos and seafood. There's also lots of nuts, fruits and chocolates.I'd highly recommend coming here when you're ready to eat. It's great fun to look at everything and you'll definitely find something to your taste.

Tempting food palace along La Rambla. The main entrance to this large and popular market is marked by the crowds of locals and tourists alike. It is easy on the eyes and tempting to the palate.
