Kinda made me wish I could take a bunch of stuff back to prepare a meal! There is also plenty to snack on throughout, with prepared food kiosks as well. Other stops run the gamut from the freshest fruits, veggies, meats, fish, cheeses, olives, candies and more. Great place to pick up a picnic lunch for your future plans. Notice that you won't see any flower stalls within, by an "agreement" with vendors in years past. There are plenty nearby on La Rambla.

Rip off. Now its just more of a tourist trap - i bought two pieces of fruit for a mad amount. Completely over price and a lot smaller than one would think. But nice to just walk around and see the colours.

Best market in Europe. Been to the Boqueria several times and love it for food and people watching. Too bad I'm always in a hotel with no kitchen to cook the beautiful fish and shellfish they have for sale! Lots of snacks and cheese though for a picnic. Lovely selection of herbs too.
Great market, fresh fruit, smoothies and hams. A great place to wander round taking in the atmosphere. All the stalls look amazing, there are so many temptations, from fruit, juices and meats.

Barca at its best. A quick read up prior to travelling to Barcelona said this was a great place to see, feel, smell all what Barcelona has to offer in the way of food. It was such a great place to mingle not only with tourists but locals we revisited it again before finishing our break. The colour, smells and sights are so inviting that you can't fail to be impressed. Not only a chance to see a wide range of fish, shellfish, vegetables, spices, fruit, ham, salamis and fresh juices you will be able to find lots of opportunities to find local eateries at cheaper prices than on main streets. Bursting with colour, this really is the flavour of Barcelona.

Please go! ..... It's a must see!. Food, food, food.... Small electronics, ham, beer, juice, calamari, oysters..... Everything! I mean everything! While in BCN I came to this market daily for one of my daily meals (8€ average) my favorite ones are pictured below! I think pictures speak louder than words! .... Don't miss the juice please!

Don't miss this wonderful covered food market. A fascinating place to wander in the rain or shine because it is covered.This is a bustling food market with lots of stalls selling cooked and raw meats, fish, cheese, vegetables, fruit (including smoothies) and more. There are several stalls that are cafes selling food to take away or to eat at the stalls. I love the eclectic nature of it and if you like markets you should have this as a must-see.
Busy busy busy. We went there on a Tuesday, still so many people. We manage to get drinks and food but would not be able to find seats for four. Anyway we still had great time, enjoyed everything.

Fun to see the meats and fruits. It is fun to walk around the market and see and try the different fruits , veggies and meats. There are also some nice eating places inside the market. Very lively place !!!
Busy market. Nice market with vibrant atmosphere. Unfortunately the products are overpriced as it's targeted for tourists. Good to experience a market in a different country
Bustling busy place . Walk around the market absorb the sound and smell. Taste the food. Be assaulted by the wonderful interactions and sound of this Market.

Fantastic. When in Barcelona, this place is a must see!
Even if you don't buy anything, you have to witness the colours and the buzz!
My wife and I go here for the stunning fresh fruit.
Cannot be beaten. Go early as it soon becomes very busy!

Great to walk around. WAY too expensive. The food looks amazing and there's great choice of fresh fish, meat, veg, etc. But it is VERY expensive. 10 euros for a veggie wrap?? Have a wander round as it is visually amazing but you can eat much cheaper elsewhere. Also, bought some spanish sausage from here and it was terrible.

Busy but so worth it! . This place is packed with people, but it's clear why. There is so much fresh, beautiful, delicious food, and your options are endless - fruits, veg, meat, olives, cheeses, spices, oils, breads, desserts, juices. YUM!

Fruit and Meat Market. A large market mostly serving fruit and meat. Some baked goods, fish, and cheeses available.
The market is a short walk from the metro station. There's also plenty of places to eat just outside. Worth about an hour and a half, more with lunch.

Vibrant market. This is a lovely market just off Las Ramblas, which we stumbled across after already having had lunch - then immediately wished we hadn't already eaten! Such fresh produce and a range of stalls, including different hams/cheeses/tapas to eat on the go and lots of lovely fresh fruit and juices. Absolutely recommend a visit, even if you don't buy, it's lovely to look around.

Excellent food, slightly overpriced. A heaven for food enthusiasts. In Oslo we don't have half the selection of sea food they had here which is a real shame. I'm considering booking an apartment next time rather than a hotel room to take advantage of the amazing ingredients that were on sale here. The restaurants were a bit overpriced, other than that there were plenty of apparent locals them which means it couldn't have been too bad in terms of pricing.

Best market I've ever been to! . I'm a green grocer/market trader by trade and my family have been doing it since 1885 and honestly this market is nothing I've ever seen before!! Great fruit and veg stalls, meat stalls and fresh food cooked at while you sit at the counter it's amazing! Hustle and bustle in this market but 100 percent have to go when your in Barcelona you will not be disappointed!!

Great market. This compares so well from Borough Market in London. Probably better. Great displays of all types of food. I got some lovely strawberries for 1 euro. Paprika in funky tins and my first look at salt cod.

Wow foodie heaven. 3 hours went by in a flash! Gorged on fruit smoothies and empanadas! So much tapas available. The sights, sounds, smells, tastes... an assault on the senses. I went twice in my four days there! Must see if you're a foodie like me.

A great place to wander round for an hour. A great place to wander round for an hour and see the local produce. It’s a pretty busy place with plenty of tourists taking pictures of the various stalls. There were also a number of tapas bars dotted around, I’m not sure how many locals were frequenting there but there was hardly a spare seat to be seen and the food looked really good.

Bustling Food Market. Busy crowded delicious food market where you can get anything from the freshest fish just pulled from the Mediterranean to amazing fruit juices and everything in between. Located just off La Rambla it is easy to find. It is extremely crowded, but worth fighting your way through for all the treasures hidden inside.
Amazing food. Amazing fresh fruit and vegetables, as well as seafood, cheese and meats. Everything is quite cheap, so good value and all very fresh

Temptation of La Boqueria. This is a bar right in the middle of the famous La Boqueria market, where you see people sitting so cosy, drinking wine, having delicious tapas and you cant resist the temptation to try it. Good wine, nice ambiance, tasty tapas - but price is a bit exaggerated. But then what to expect from such a place? It is a super tourist magnet there will be always people willing to pay extra for the flavor of La Boquiera.
The food heaven. The best place to have a taste of Barcelona. To enjoy its fresh and tasty food, this is the best place to go. Too colorful fruits and sweets and exotic food. The best!

Cute market near Las Ramblas . Had the opportunity to drop frequently to the market for some fresh cut fruit but the quick food was delicious also. You can find anything from fruits, vegetables, cheese,meat, ham, jamon, sausages ,fish, bread, pastries, sweets and anything. I got some different types of turrón to take home and give as presents. Totally suggest to drop by.
Busy but interesting. Fantastic local market, €1 for a smoothie, can't be beaten. Also have a glass of cava while you're here.

What a fun market. This place is overflowing with fruits, meats, fish, candy, etc. Such a fun place to wander around and see what the locals of Spain have to offer. Just off Las Ramblas, not a place to be missed.

Best food market I've seen anywhere.. Wonderful food market, probably the best I have ever seen. Bustling atmosphere, full of delights with both familiar and unfamiliar items. Lots of free samples to entice the buyer, from chocolates to fish to fruits. A really good experience to just browse or maybe buy a few treats. Also several places to eat and drink along with the locals, who know all the best places.

Not only for foodies. Is it a touristic place? Very much so. But it's also a historic beauty and foodies heaven. I recommend that you take some time to visit this market. Try to be there either early in the morning, or shortly before closing time (less crowded). The market is still very much used by the locals and offers anything from snacks and smoothies to whatever your food lover's heart desires.

Highlight of my Barcelona visit. As a food lover, going to see the food stalls at la Boqueria was my Disney World. I took countless photos of the colorful fruit stalls, fishmongers, Iberico ham, cheese, candy, etc. Some of the foods seemed a little pricey but as a vacationer I didn't mind. I don't recall the name of the place where we had breakfast but the plate of potatoes, eggs and ham were mouthwateringly wonderful. We went two days in a row and I would have gone a third had we the time to do so.
A little gem. It's a must have to visit lots of fresh juices,the fruit is huge...out of this world!Cheaper the further in you go.Go even if to just soak up the ambience

Tasteful. Everything in this markethall invites you to eat: fresh fruites, fresh juices, fresh meat, there are some spots for lunch with meat, fish, seafruits, a wine bar, asian food... for every barcelona trip, this markethall is a must have, if you have not been there, you have not been in barcelona
Must visit in Barcelona . Visited here yesterday! Really great place to go. Must visit whilst in Barcelona. Fantastic food and lots to try and taste.

Hours disappear here . Amazing colours smells and sounds. Take a camera. Also perfect for spice shopping as well as local goods. Place is brimming with life. Go early morning to avoid tourist stampede. Lovely eating and snaking venues.

Little crowded and much the same. . It's a nice market which does get a little crowded. The stalls seem to sell a lot of the same produce and actually quite expensive. The juices on offer are not great, and are watered down, hence the €1 price. Mornings are best for a visit.

Wonderful. You want to discover Local products, here is the place. Building is lovely and the atmosphere is amazing! you get the opportunity to discover and taste Barcelona's local products at excellent quality. This is definitely a must when visiting the city.

Great fresh food market with hreat restaurants. Wow! What a great marketplace this is: fresh fruits, vegetables, meat and fish. Overwhelming bouquet of colours. For instance at the booths that sell fresh fruit juices. In the back are various small restaurants. Undoubtedly using very fresh ingredients. This place is a must. It is clise to the Lyceu metrostop on la Rambla.

Superb market. One of very best in Europe.. Highly recommend a visit, even if only looking rather than buying. A really wide variety of produce including some rarely seen in markets these days. A bustling atmospheric place, and truly memorable. Free of course!I went with children and of all the places we went it probably have produced the most conversations since!

Full of colour and design . Great to see the fantastically laid out stalls. Full of bright colours and fabulous vegetables meat fish sweets drink oils. All very fresh. Bought some giant strawberries - tasted great and priced ok however bag of caramelised nuts was Euros 10 ! Didn't have to buy them I know !! Fruit seemed very reasonable. More about the experience than the shopping for us.

Amazing place.. except one of the fruit juice stalls. I loved this market so many vibrant and nice stores! Really liked the lolly/chocolate store. Had one nasty experience with one of the fruit juice stalls in the middle back who weren't interested in serving me because I was a tourist. They served other local people but for some reason didn't seem interested in my business as I didn't speak Spanish. Instead I would highly recomment the first juice store when you walk in at the front. They are lovely and have the most reasonable prices 1 euro, the other ones as you walked through seemed more expensive.

Lovely market!!. We visited here for an hour one morning and really enjoyed it. LOADS of food stalls so you can sit and eat breakfast if you wish.We also bought a smoothie each for 2 euros each which were great and then walked around taking in everything! Lots of meat and fish stalls... interesting to see and a nice place to visit.

Best food market!. Super cool place to visit or hangout, really nice vibe selling all the cataluna delights, meats, cheeses, fish...you can sample for a fee and buy bigger portions too at the sit up restaurant bars.If you're visiting the city, you absolutely MUST visit here.

nice market place. take some time off from the Ramblas and stroll in, watch out for pick pocketsfresh cut fruit and juices, the more you walk in the cheaper they getgood food stalls are all over the market to sit and enjoyin all a good experience

Where are the grilled veggies ready to eat?. Although this amazing place will remain in our memories forever as it is a market thought for everything..My vegetarian friend suffered a little bit to find something he could eat (I'm not talking about fruits and tortillas). When we came 10 years ago we found grilled peppers and vegetables ready to be put on a plate all goodness....but failed this time. Left with a watery mouth and ate somewhere else.

Always good and interesting.. I love El mercado de la Boqueria, always nice to see all the food variety and make me wish to get a hotel with kitchen so I can buy there and cook at home. However, the restaurants there serve very good and affordable food. We good grilled seafood plate and grilled Zamburiñas ( scallops) some cava and wine... Very good. We ate at the seafood place almost at the entrance of the market. Great service, cool guys. There is not wine list, just house wine and cava, nothing wrong with it, yet not the best wine, but fine with the food. The market website should inform when the market will be closed for holidays and also if they closing early. We went on Saturday and almost all shops were closing at 17.00. We arrive there 16.30 because according to the web it was open until 20.00. It is a must when visiting Barcelona. Have fun!

Can't get enough. Where to start... So much to see so much to eat and drink. Love this place and nothing like I have seen before. Everything looks fresh and tastes good and is well priced (in my view).The market can be very busy and cramped which is the only downside however if you're 6"6 you tower above the mass, you won't mind. Those smaller may feel it a little claustrophobic.Overall great food, free admission and a great explore.

Really interesting . A fascinating place to walk through to see every kind of produce laid out beautifully and to sample local food and drink would recommend a visit, even if you just go to observe and don't partake.
Lively and rich market place.. Loved it. Would go again. You can eat here and shop for food. İt is walking distance to Liceu station.
Bustling, lively and a great visit. Don't miss the opportunity to call in here to soak up the atmosphere and even sample some food. This place is popular with locals and tourists

buzzing market filled with locals and tourists. This is a proper working market that is nonetheless hugely popular with tourists, being so close to La Rambla. Fresh produce - fish, fruit and veg, meat, poultry - as well as prepared foods, like nuts, bread, preserved hams and wine. Among it all are a few tapas stalls where you prop up and pick from the freshly made offerings. It has a more chaotic, more energetic but more touristy feel than Santa Caterina.
Foodie heaven. Fresh food of all kinds available here.... We bought olives cheese fruit... Wish we could have bought now to take home! If you're on la ramblas well worth a pop in! Free...

Best market in Spain . Great market. The best one in Spain. Aside from the size, there is a great selection of fresh fruit, juices, fish, and tapas!! Take advantage to try as many kinds of hams and cheeses as you'd like for 3-5 euros. Go before 2pm otherwise some of the stands will be closed. Tip: sangria is just what tourists think Spanish people drink. If you see sangria being sold keep in mind it's mostly for tourists. Tinto de verano is what they drink (sangria menus all the fancy fruit)

It is a nice market but for tourists . It reminds me of Mercado de San Miguel in Madrid. It is a nice beautiful market but no local goes there. Besides it is very expensive. Go if you are walking down the rambla for a 5min stroll as you have nothing to do but I wouldn't make it a priority
So Colourful . Just walk around and soak up the atmosphere and take in the colours and the sounds- it's is only a quick visit but I would rate as not to be missed

Lovely market! . Great market for fresh fruit and fruit smoothies! Also has a couple of lovely bars for tapas and beers. There is a nice stall near the back of the market on the left which serves great pies and empanadas! The market gets very busy in the afternoon so the best time to go is early in the day.
Heart of the Hubbub.. You have to go there. Great mix of food market and eateries. Had lunch in El Quim on the heart of the hubbub, which would be hard to better.

Fantastic place. We found this place by accident on our first day looking for breakfast and we ended up going every day after as it was so lovely! The colours and smells are a treat and really get your taste buds going for some excellent food! A wide variety of foods can be found from fresh fruit, veg and fish to smoothies chocolates and meat! We loved trying something new here and really wish they had something like this near where we live!Please make this a place to go on your visit!!

A great place to sample local food!. Before I even arrive in Barcelona, already I had friends who recommended I visit the La Boqueria, a large sprawling marketplace of fresh produce, delicacies and interesting tiny eateries. Located almost at the centre of La Rambla, it’s an amazingly packed tourist draw that see many people flock to sample some interesting finds. Move past the front door though, and go deeper where you’ll peel yourself away from the tourist crowd that don’t normally venture further inside.[Pinotxo Bar] I’ve seen this guy many times before in guide books and travel shows about Barcelona. My first time was while watching Rick Steves travel show on YouTube. I had to simply capture this shot here at the Pinotxo bar just to capture the moment of actually seeing this for myself. Business must be good, cause I could hardly find a place to sit and there’s actually a crowd waiting, and snapping photos while waiting.

Lots to look at but crowded . A great place to wander - but there were also a lot of repetitive stalls. It seemed like juice stalls were never ending at one point. On the other hand - cheese, fish, meat, vegetables I could have looked at them all day! Also the tapas stalls inside the market looked incredible - except lines were so long we didn't even bother trying.

Colorful. "La Boqueria" is a colorful and splendid market in the old town of Barcelona. Very hectic, a lot of tourists, but a great place to see. Full of fruit, fish, meat, spices, wine ... almost everything to eat or drink. Especially the fruit stalls are amazing. Don't miss this.
Fresh sea food. Place you need to visit if you like good fresh food. Oyster straight from stall with a bit of lemon juice, fantastic. Try fresh seafood baked on local market cafe.

Juices from paradise. Ok first of all : FRESH JUICE. Please have one . It's only 1€ ( if you find one that is more expensive, change stall, you'll see there are a lot of them) and it's delicious : mango-coco, blackberry-kiwi, you name it, they have it !You can also grab food on the go ( 5euros = one juice, one fruit salade and one empanada).It's worth seeing

Busy but Brilliant . One of my favourite places in the world. If you're a foodie, then you have to visit here, try and get there early as it can be very crowded during the middle of the day, but is a great atmosphere

Spicy experience. The "boqueria" is a legendary market located in the old town of Barcelona. Although the market itself is quite large it might be difficult to spot at first! To get to the market make a turn on the central Rambles avenue near the Liceu metro station into a small passage that will bring you to an enclave with large rows of goods. The variety of things on sale, the colors and the overall hubbub of the boqueria is an experience in itself. We spent about 30 minutes simply roaming in the lines of stands gazing at the abundance of diversity that is on offer: fresh fruit salads in adorable cups standing next to a stand with mouth-washing pastries, freshly caught seafood and fish on ice, huge jamon legs hanging from the ceiling nearby, plants and flowers, meat, colorful spices in jars and bags of different sizes, anyhow, the list can go on endlessly..! And thankfully the rows are encircled with small cozy cafes where you can get tapas snacks, a refreshment or a paella in case you get tired of the hustle and bustle.

Amazing!!!!. This place is one of a kind. The food is like artwork. You must visit & bring cash, there so many great treats. I paid $4 euro for a vegetable sandwich, best sandwich I ever had. Fresh bread, fresh vegetables & manchego cheese....delicious!

So much colour. Visited here at breakfast on Saturday. Immediately struck with vibrant colours of fresh fruit and vegetables. Loads whole but also equally as many cut and ready to eat. Fresh smoothies and juices also available. Further down the back there is also meat and cheeses but not so much ready to eat. Unfortunately we visited again at 10am on Sunday but it wasn't open. Not sure if this is the case for every Sunday.

Cinematic place!. To visit at least for sightseeing, but good for buying too. If you are a foodie you'll love it!Is a small square full of life with desks all around, mainly of food, but also of gadgets and similar.Some prices look higher than usual, but some products have also higher quality. Is also possible to negotiate the price sometimes!
Colours <3. A bit hectic place with lots of tourist. So many beautiful colors, tasty food...just a great place to see.
Lousy and expensive. For what is provided, the quality is very low and the prices quite high. The only positive thing with this place is the location.

Top Lunch. This is a great place, I was a regular visitor. I often bought real quality fruit, nuts etc here. It has fish, meats, seafood, gelato and smoothies. Also bought a plastic tumbler of mixed fruit to eat whilst browsing, a freshly prepared smoothie will hit the spot too.There are some restaurants also where I had lunch, a glorious sea bass platter. Pay a visit, you won't regret it.Jeff V

Amazing! . Amazing market! Full of fruit, veg, meats, fish, chocolate, seafood, smoothies, gelato, spices, wine, beer and spirit stands! Beautifully displayed items and bargains! Very busy place but lots to see. A lovely place to find and try unseen things! Would go again.

Must Do. Not only are there stalls with every type of produce you have seen (and some you haven't) you can buy sampler packs at a lot of the stalls plus wine and beer! Seafood, beef, goat, poultry, offal, eggs, fruit, juices, vegetables, mushrooms, confectionery, cakes, nuts, pulses etc etc. Go to buy dinner and have lunch while you are there. This is my sort of market. Crowded but fun and the resident buskers provide entertainment for a small donation.

Wow. The colours. . What an awesome market. The fruit stalls are amazing and so beautiful. An excellent choice for lunch if you're happy to eat on the go (although there are some places to sit and eat).

Loooove it. . Such an fantastic place. Love all the fresh food you can get here. Just to bad we stayed at a hotel. So no where to cook the food. A really nice place to get hold of some local food. But also lots of tourists.

Experience for all your senses . I had a few hours in morning before having to go to the airport so decided to skip the hotel breakfast and have it at the market. I suggest you get there around 8 am. You can watch the many merchants set up and that is an experience by itself. Before the locals and tourists alike flood in. Watch them how the set up the fish stalls and the colourful vegetables and fruits. See a master butcher carve a ham leg or arrange the different cuts of meat would get your taste buds going. Started with a coffee and a croissant from Pinotxo or try the Xuxo for a more local tasty dessert. Then decided to have breakfast at El Quim from the many reviews I saw in TA. And they didn't disappoint. Although pricier than what you would think of a market food place it's worth it. The baby squid omelette is amazing and so are the croquettes. The place started to get busy around 9/9:30. And places were becoming limited, I guess would be hard to get a place around 10 onward. But The Mercat Sant Josep was a highlight of my trip.
What colours!!!. If you are a foodie and like markets this is the place for you! Don't miss it! I simply love it!! Probably the best market I've been to so far.

Most amazing market ever!. This is the best market I have ever been too! It's full of a huge variety of foods--fruits, vegetables, juices, cheese, wine, seafood, meats, baked goods, nuts... Basically anything you could think of! There are a few cafe type places were you can sit down at a bar for a drink and something to eat. Such a great place for people watching! I dream of coming back to Barcelona just to visit this place again!! So full of energy and excitement. If you like farmers markets, you will be in heaven!! My husband and I tried the fresh juice. I had kiwi and he had orange/strawberry. Both were awesome, but his was admittedly better. The bathrooms are surprisingly clean, although it does cost .50€.

Amazing . Great food, great people and great products.. its a place where you have to good if you are in Barcelona. Its a real show to see the products and so much people enjoying the amazing and fresh food wich you can taste there

Nice market, but nothing special. I went at night and everything was closing. So all the food was cold and there weren't many options. People say it is better to go for lunch than at night to eat something.

Great market, wonderful food!. Walking around the Boqueria was an absolutely wonderful experience. My sister and I hit the market a few times during our vacation, picking up something delicious each time. The seafood stall located on the left-side, back of the market had a great selection of seafood (the razor clams and mussels were 100%). The candy stall (located somewhere in the middle market?) sells a variety of chocolates, including boob-shaped truffles, red-topped mushroom chocolates, and little black/white hedgehogs (!!). They make for cute and tasty souvenirs.

Mesmerising. Wow what can I say, this is one of the most amazing, fragrant, enchanting, colourful and vibrant markets I have ever experienced. The fresh juices & fruit were delicious. We had lunch in one of the restaurants, again fantastic. We bought Parmesan and olives. Take some time off the craziness of Las Ramblas and allow your senses to be awakened

I need a kitchen!. An absolute feast for the senses. I found myself wishing I was not staying a hotel - I want to buy stuff and COOK. There is a good bit of prepared food as well, so all was not lost. Give yourself an hour or two, more if you are a foodie.

Lunch at the Bouqeria yumm. Wow so much to choose from and everything is fresh and delicious cocked in front of you served with smile.A must visit while in Barcelona I will go there again tomorrow for last minute shopping for all my Cheff friends in Israel that ordered specials from this amazing market.
Well worth a visit . A vast array of food stalls, loads of places to eat and sample many tapas. Stalls well laid out and very colourful . Just off Las Ramblas and must see market

Good Market. To me, markets feel very similar regardless of what part of the world you're visiting. This is a good market and has a lot of good food options if you're looking for any. If, however, you have nothing you need to buy and you've been to a market before, we recommend skipping this. Personally, I don't feel it is a destination stop worth your time unless you are passing by, curious or need to purchase something.

One of the nicest markets ever . I like to visit markets, i really love food and been so many markets around the world everywhere but this one is so gorgeous, unique with so many, great quality products. Really worth to visit.

The best market experience I have ever had. The market has every type of local cuisine you could imagine, try them all! Fresh, cheap and authentic, it doesn't get much better. You absolutely must make a visit!

Must-visit in Barcelona. This is a playground for everyone - from candies, chocolates to fresh produce, seafood and all types of meat, it is a true sight to see and be part of. You may either visit it early in the morning or come for brunch and eat your way through the market. For those who are looking to buy saffron, I found a stall which is reasonably priced called Bacallaneries Martinez Number 720. From the main entrance, walk towards the seafood section and make a right turn when you reach the end of the seafood section, you will find this stall which is manned by a friendly lady. I bought from Saffron here and it was reasonably priced. I am not a saffron expert but the saffron sold by the lady was of a deep red and had lovely aroma.

Fresh food, fresh tastes, fresh colors. This market just off La Rambla is an assault on the senses. Bright colors, great smells, excellent tastes. The food, especially the fruit, is so fresh and tasty and beautifully presented. We had some fruit salad, fresh fruit juices, ham and cheese - all of which were fantastic. The ham, in particular, served in a small paper cone, was the best I've ever tasted (and I've tasted a few). The prices vary a little bit between the different stalls. It seems that you will pay a little less if you go further into the market. You can for example find 2 glasses of fresh fruit juice for as low as €2 and fruit salads for €1,50. A bargain!

A local market and a tourist attraction. The Boqueria Market is a local market and a tourist attraction situated just off La Rambla.It is a quite big market and you can find a lot of food stalls, including seafood, meat, vegetables, fruit, tapas, sandwiches, paellas and whatever else you might need.Despite being a tourist place, the prices are quite fair so you will be tempted to buy something and you will see many people go around eating or drinking.The people working at the stalls are not pushy at all so you can just have a walk around, browse and take pictures without being annoyed.I have been there on a Monday and it was busy but not too crowded.

A wonderful market. This is a must visit if you like markets. The stalls display the produce beautifuly. You can eat almost at every stall. Fruits, sea food, cheeses, meat and chocolates. A haven for foodies and people who love food. Come at lunch or dinner and have feast.Yona s.

What a wonderful, bustling market!. This market is a gem of a find. Not only will you find fresh vegetables, meat and seafood, you get lots of cooked food and chocolates and almost anything you can think of! I visited 3 times on my holiday and had several of the fresh juices and food dishes which were very affordable. It's such a beautiful place and somewhere you should definitely visit when in Barcelona.

Foodie Market. Great place to visit and see how poor our veg is in UK. Lots of fruit and vegetables, fish and meats. Can´t resist the tubs of fruit for 1.50Euro. better still go there for lunch, you wont regret it
Fabulous place for food and drink. You can get local food cooked to order,or take with you at very good prices.Lots and lots of stalls for food and drink open until late as well.Well worth going

Foodie Paradise. The Boqueria is one of Europe's great fresh produce markets. Colourful and busy it is also atmospheric and fascinating. A huge range of produce is on offer, including fish and shellfish you have never seen before, baby suckling pigs, milk-fed lambs and kids (the goat kind), hams, cheeses, nuts, olive oils, and just-picked fresh fruit and veg. Things like the ham and the cheese can be quickly vac-packed at no extra charge to make it simple to bring home. A more recent introduction, especially by the stalls near the entrance to the market is to offer small portions of foods to take away and eat on the go, like little fruit salads, bags of dates and nuts, cheesy comestibles and so on, these in addition to the tapas type offerings from the several small bars within the market, many of which are of excellent quality and silly cheap, because there is no middle-man to bump up the cost. If you're a foodie or a youngster travelling on a tight budget, this is a must visit.

Visit This Too When You Visit La Ramblas. This is a market which sell mostly fruits, juices, meat, fishes, candies, nuts and spices. Visit this when you are at La Ramblas to have fresh juice and tropical fruits! Cheap and nice market.

Famous Boqueria Market. Just off Las Ramblas this very busy market is worth a visit. Huge range of stalls selling everything you would expect in a Spanish market. Excellent, well displayed fish, fruit and veg, ham etc though very much a tourist attraction these days.

Loved it. This place is full of stalls selling traditional Spanish meats, fish, fruit, sweets and juices. Theres even a full stalls with bar seats where you can come and pull up a seat and enjoy a meal. Our hotel was near here so a few morning on the walk past we would enjoy a morning smoothie from here. Everything is so fresh and delicious. Be warned it does smell due to the fish stalls and it will most certainly be very crowded!
heaven. it's a fresh food heaven! either to buy fresh ingredients, either to have tapas. a bit overcrowded a moments, although worth to stop by.

Just to browse. I love going to all these markets in different cities. It gives you some incite as to the produce and ingredients that are used in the cuisines of the different countries. This is a very touristic type of market, whereby the closest you are to the Ramblas, the higher the prices. Move further into the market and the prices go down. This is one of the larger markets that I have seen.There are a few counters where you can actually eat freshly cooked fish and seafood but are a little more pricey than if you go elsewhere. You do have to try their juices, not expensive and delicious. It is interesting just to browse.

The Boqueria Market. Well, this is an indoor market full of little stalls such as fish stalls, sweets and fruit juices and there is a bar in there as well, if like me you enjoy photography then this is a must especially at night

awesome market. it is an awesome place to see ... buy from .. and eat there ... everything is so fresh and nice arran ged that keeps you there for even hours if you have the time ...Ate there and the food was very fresh and tasty .. it is a plce to see when you are in barcelona
Coolest market. It has everything, from ice cream, smoothies, chorizos, seafood to candy and fruits...A great place to explore in Barcelona even if you're not buying anything.

Great in every way!. So many colours and tastes! It is definitely worth a visit even just to see the variety of things it offers! Don't forget to taste some of the fruit or smoothies it has- they're amazing!!!

Buzzing marketplace. Buzzing with people that come to shop, eat and enjoy the sights. From fresh seafood to bright fruits and vegetables. From saffron to tripe. Also very suitable to have a bite. Tapas, sandwiches, fresh juices, etc. As always look where locals go and order what they eat. Many places cater for the tourist with matching prices.
Wonderful market . What a wonderful experience in Barcelona and not to be missed!!great food and colorful atmosphere. Think it's closed weekends so check it with a walk down the ramblas.

Crowded. Overcrowded and stinky, none of the foods I tried was spectacular, the only thing that I was actually excited about is finding jackfruit. They have a ton of pretty much the same stuff, and there is no order to it, even after walking through every single aisle to make sure I didn't miss anything, nothing was that impressive. If you are looking for exotic fruit or tripe/brain type organs that you haven't found elsewhere, check this place out but that's about it. Even the famous jamon iberico that I tried from a couple different spots wasn't that great, idk what the fuss is all about, does the taste grow on you or what because it's not that mouthwatering...am I missing something? Not like I was looking for super quality foods but everything seems to be cheap fried foods and the only spots that serve semi normal looking foods that are not fried are extremely overcrowded and very few seats available. Yeah, they have tripe, brain, tongue and intestines for sale but nothing I've never seen in a meat market. The jackfruit was the highlight of this place.
Fresh food heaven. Complete market all varieties of food and Spain . Superb presentation of all fruit ,meat, raw and cooked. Tapas and meals. A true exhibition of agriculture and horticulture.

Amazing selection of foods and eating stalls. Crowds flock here but the further into the market you go the easier it is to get around and the cheaper some of the items are to buy! The foods are fantastically presented and look very inviting. Try the fruit drinks available from several stands - I can recommend the kiwi and coconut combo. Also saw strawberries dipped in white chocolate which looked tempting. The butchers display unusual cuts, the fish stalls are a work of art as are the ranges of fruits, nuts and sweets. Easily accessible from La Rambla.

What a treasure. We took ourselves for a tour of this market. It was amazing. All the fresh food on display. The way it was displayed is amazing. Everything is clean. The Parma Ham at the different prices, hanging whole hocks for you to buy. The stall owners were very pleasant and you could taste many of the things on sale

Family wander, has to be dine. We visited this market and my goodness it was beautiful!
It is a visual treat and a photographers dream (even though there are signs everywhere saying no photos!)
The fruit and veg are beautifully displayed and it's a feast for the eyes and senses.
Well worth a visit and make sure you try some tapas as the fresh seafood stall/bar!

Great photo opportunities . The colours are amazing with fruit and veg piled up seemingly defying gravity. The fish stalls are also really interesting but not for the faint hearted. Prices are good too. Lots of eating places inside with wonderful arrays of local delicacies. Well worth a visit with many photo opportunities.

I've seen better.... Compared to other markets we've visited across Europe, this one falls short. For tourists there are room temp empanadas, Iberian ham, and fruit smoothies galore. As a foodie, I didn't recognize any food as being very unique or with any local flare... although there were 2-3 small, crowded bars that only had enough seating for 10 people. Otherwise it's just a place for locals to buy fresh produce, meat, and seafood for the locals. Definitely not the place to buy food souvenirs or have an eclectic meal.

Extremely fresh food. Fresh veg, fruit, bread, seafood, meat and many others. Smoothies, sandwiches, seafood tapas, iberico, sweets. Everything is there. You can even have fresh oysters, opened at your request.

Highlight of Las Ramblas. I've never seen the greatness of Rambla. Kiosks and thieves. High prices and poor quality in restaurants. However Mercat was very nice with different sections for everything. We bought only 1€ fruit juices but it was totally worth the visit.

A maelstrom of Foods, Flavours and Sounds. Having been to Barcelona several times, always for the day, and having seen but never visited this market, I made a beeline for the Marcat de Sant Josep de la Boqueria on the first day of our short stay. The place is a tightly-knit metropolis of stalls, smells, foods, and sounds.We were not disappointed in what we saw and what we ate - little pintxos, from a plethora of stands - very enjoyable!If food is your thing - and it is mine, there are a myriad of wonderful stalls to examine!

Beautiful market full of colors. This place is absolutely amazing! I love the colorful displays of food, fruits, candy, cheeses! Its a huge market, with many sections f products. La Boqueria is a MUST SEE if you visit Barcelona. You can have a juice of many mixed fruits for about 2€, or you can also seat and enjoy a meal of fresh seafood. You will see live shellfish on displays, that will assure you of the freshness and quality of the food you see here. It's a very busy place, so beware of pickpockets, but this is a beautiful place that I strongly recommend to anyone that comes to Barcelona. Entrance is free.

Colorful market. Stumbled, (although one cannot miss it), across this market whilst walking up and down La Ramblas - very colorful display of fruits, food, fresh, preserved, cakes, mini restaurants, - it all so exciting and stimulating to the eye.Fresh meats were a good bargain to bring back to the apartment to cook up a meal.

Probably one of my favourite markets in the world. This is a food market for cooked and uncooked foods. The atmosphere is great and the people watching very good. I only wished I was stating somewhere that I could cook food. Great for breakfast, lunch or dinner. If you want to eat and walk with a snack, sit down to eat at one of the counters/tables or gather stuff for a picnic, this market has it all

Fab atmosphere. A wondeful atmoshpere with so much on offer. The juices dotted around the market are so refreshing and perfect for a hot day and there is so much food to pick at. The ice creams are devine and so many flavours you rarely see in the uk.

Never seen a market like it!. I was told a visit to this market was a must, it was our first place to visit when we arrived.... It was fab, never seen anything like it! There was all sorts of treats for everyone from sweet treats to lovely meats to every sea creature to shell fish that you could want, the place was so busy and had a great feel to it.

Amazing, endless displays of food and colour. This place is definitely worth a visit... We first visited on a Monday and yes a few stalls were closed.. But a vast amount were open and the colours of the fruit and juice stalls were amazing!! We grabbed a picnic to take with us to parc Guell and drank lovely juices on the walk around.Tip definitely hang onto your bag in here as it gets really busy!!All the food is reasonably priced and very inviting... Returning for breakfast today.

Something authentic. If you want to take a bite of local food and fresh amazingly tasty fruits - you have to go here. Oranges, pineapples, carrots, cherry ... anything you might want on a hot day. Noisy. Busy. Cool. Just watch your bag ;).

Love this place. I really love this market with the fresh fruit and seafood at reasonable price. Ask the fishmonger and they will prepare your fish as you like them. Went there to get some fresh prawn and sepia to took at the apartment. Beautiful!

Quality!. We skipped breakfast in our hotel to visit this market, and found a nice local cafe instead. Fruit, veg, meat, chocolates all very good quality, and beautifully presented. Take photos the colours come out well. Would be nice in the UK!

A must for food lovers.. This is a paradise and a must for food lovers. If you are not at the least hungry when you go to this place - definitely a treat for all five senses. When walking at the Rambla from Plaza Catalunya, you will not miss it, it is on the left side, and just the smell of food alone will lead you to it. You can easily spend a few hours here, looking at the colorful display of fruits and vegetables, fish and seafood of different kinds, meat and processed foods, spices etc. Try some of the pintxos in the food stalls and bars, which are also to be found in several places of the market. Give yourself enough time as this is not your usual fast food joint. If I lived in Barcelona, I would come here everyday to shop for food - I would never need a freezer ever again.

A treat on the Eyes !. You simply can't go to Barcelona without visiting this feast of the senses.... yes it gets crowded but that just adds to the experience ! sample the tastes of Spain whether it's fresh Fruit & Veg or Meats & Sea Food... there's something for everybody, the only problem is trying to get a seat at one of the many Tapas Bars as others have mentioned it gets very busy. Even if you don't but anything it's at least worth a visit for the spectacle that it is.

Don't miss it!. Just off Las Ramblas, this is the place to go to tease the senses. The smells, noises, colors, and tastes are unforgettable. The fish is the freshest, some of it still wriggling about on beds of ice; meat is interesting, especially the offal which is not such a common part of all our diets; fruits and vegetables are well-displayed; candies and nut products beg you to try them - as do the vendors! We found it interesting to see so many Christmas candies, especially Santa Claus' in February. There are a number of seafood bars where the fresh seafoods are reasonably priced and well-prepared. If eating isn't your thing, there are also clothing, leather, souvenir etc. vendors. Oranges were delicious and cheap when we were there and we bought oranges, sausage, and cheeses for a great picnic - totally worth a visit to the market!
Fantastic market. A great place to walk round and take in the sites and smells. We have been here numerous times and love the atmosphere.

Interesting. We visited this crowded market at lunch time when people were buying pasties, fruit and all sorts of goodies to eat as they wandered down Las Ramblas. The stalls were really interesting, laden with fresh fruit, fish, meat, ice cream and deli items. As you enter the market the crowds are really thick but if you have the patience to walk in further, it is quiet and probably cheaper.

Very nice market!. As our experience wasn't very good in market in Madrid - this one was definately opposite. Very big, very crowded but the experience - 5*! Prices are more affordable as well.Do not miss it - Much recommended!

Great market in the mornings. I went to this market early in the morning and also later in the afternoon - would recommend the morning. Everything is fresh and it's not as crowded. It was a great time to wander around, look at all of the goods, and buy a few things. Great spot for photos and buying fresh fruits.

Feeling the sense of the city!!!. Definitely a must see!!!! There you can understand what this city feels like!!! Crowded but alive, full of smells, colors and noises!!! Go around noon so as to have the chance to grab something in one of the many shops or else just drink a fresh fruit juice!!!!
Too touristy . Being the supposedly best market in town I had very high expectations but it was so very crowded that you couldnt move.
Wow. Fresh market and fresh food. This is a fresh market and also different restaurants. What a place to walk around and amazing food to eat. Just wow

Fresh Market with esthetic product presentation . Located on the Ramblas this market offers fresh product to locals and tourists. Fish, fruits, herbs, meat and veggies are widely available and presented in a beautiful way. Try the famous Spanish ham or indulge in a seafood diner with tapas at one of the food stalls. Be aware some of the products are rather expensively priced in comparison to local supermarkets. This market is not necessarily cheap. Also be aware of pick pocketing. It's a common problem along the Ramblas area.

A feast for all your senses!. This is a covered market focused on food! From sweets to fruits to seafood, spices and nuts, you can find it all here. There are also a number of bars where you can eat and drink to your heart's delight. I loved the feel of this place and enjoyed to just walk around, look at the goods and take it all in. This time I did not buy anything but I am considering going back there while I still am in Barcelona for perhaps a breakfast? it all looked so tempting!

The best part of our trip!. I love food but this market is unbelievable! We went in low season so I was surprised to see so much wonderful food on display.We bought the majority of our meal from here and we will definitely be going again!

Amazing place!. Every wanted to experience the real thing of a food market in Spain, well I guess that one comes really close.Extremely lively, many different stalls and so much generally to see. The colors across the place are hitting every nerv and the best thing there is... if you feel hungry - have a seat in one of the little restaurants.

Best market in town, food everywhere, worth the visit. Awesome market, several stores with all sorts of food, fruits, ham, olives, etc.
Best to visit during the late morning and maybe for a quick bite for lunch. Clean and expect to be crowded.

Love it. Absolutely loved it ! Very original , loads of food to buy and quality seems very good !
Completely in love with this market . Got a pot of fruit for 2eur and loved it .

AMAZING MARKET. The title really does explain it. One of the biggest markets selling literally EVERYTHING all fresh and grown and VERY cheap. Every type of fruit imaginable, veg, sweets, it has it's own fish section in the centre, meat, olive, oils, spices. Recommend to everyone that they should visit here, much cheaper than the supermarkets and the quality of the food is incredible. Bought the best chorizo I have EVER tasted here. Can't wait to come back!

Beautiful setting beautiful food. As soon as you get in your can see a sea of colours and beautiful displays of fresh produces (vegetables, fruits, fish, meat) and beautiful stands of spices and already cook meats. But one of the best things in the market is to find a space in one of the bars inside to have some fresh food cooked there and then. We had lunch at the entrance in a bar called Ramblero whee the seafood grill platter was huge and delicious and the staff quick and friendly.
Excelent. ExcelentLots of food , fresh food , meat , fish , smoothies , all excelent taste and amazing good looking food Very good tourist point to see :)

Nice market with good products. This is not just a tourist place, also locals go here to buy their food. There is a great variety of fruits, but also fresh meat and fish are available. Really recommended if you like markets.
WOW! I loved it!. Title says it all, I loved it here, I had to come everyday to eat at the market seafood stalls while I was in Barcelona! A must go if u like seafood, fruits or iberico!!

AMAZING MARKET! . wow never seen a market like this one! fresh fruit / juices / sweets / fish / meats / olives - best street market been to for long time (travel often and live in london) VERY cheap for this kind of tourist market. SHUT UP SUNDAY!
A great foodie place. The food is displayed amazingly. Treat yourself to many tasting experiences. Very busy so watch for pickpockets. Saw it happening but not to us.

A sight for sore eyes if not sore feet. Just a few yards of La Ramblas but a whole different world away. To me this is what visiting Spain is all about. A feast for the eyes, mind and stomach. Even in February very busy, it must be almost impossible to get around in the Summer. Full of fruit,vegetables ,fish, fruit juice, meat, chocolate and much more

Cute place. For sure it is a nice place to visit at least once. There are many and weird stuff. Probably the bad point would be the price that sometimes seems to be excessive but anyway you can go to walk and have a nice time.
Fantastic . The best market I've ever been to by far. The produce is fresh and looks fantastic. There are fish stalls selling best looking fish and seafood, live lobsters and other shellfish.

Sensory overload.... Visited in February with 2 young kids (6 & 9). Was crowded but nothing like peak tourist season. Amazing array of seafood, meats, chocolates, fruit and vegetables. Some we'd never even seen before. A great place to nose around in and my top tip - cheap fruit juice and fresh fruit tubs for €1 each go down well as a pick me up.

Well that was fun!. Had enough of walking around the shops or historical sights, or just want to do something different? Then I strongly recommend a visit even just out of curiosity. This is what markets around the rest of Europe should strive to be like. Busy, exceptional quality food and just interesting to see, smell and taste what's on offer.

Stunning Local Market that is a Must!. If you want a taste of Barcelona, this is the place. It does get packed keep your bags close. Try the cones of cured meats, olives, nuts and cheeses. The smoothies were great and if you want any kind of fruit or vegetable you will find it here. We spent two hours eating our way through the market when we thought we would just walk through to see it.

Hustle and great Bustle !!. Had a trip round the market this week, fantastic stalls selling a massive variety of produce, meat, fish, fruit and vegetables like you don't see back in the U.K.A must see experience for any visitor to Barcelona !!

An amazing place for tourists but non only.... The atmosphere is noisy because it's really crowded. But it's cool. You can taste everything : the best ham (pata negre), fresh fruits, etc. Careful, make sure you havecash on you.
Massive variety, great prices. Massive variety, great prices.All kinds of feeds as well as cooking materials.Lots of fresh tasty fruits served in to go cups.Easy to get to.

Magnificent display of food. Reviewers have cut this place as well as priced it. It has been said that the locals do not like tourists, sneer at them and they want to keep it for themselves. I cannot imagine that, as the fantastic display of fresh and cooked food of all kinds definately is at a higher level than local markets of the tourist tracks. Many things offered are so clearly aimed at tourists (said as a compliment) and the only problem here would be the crowds of visitors (was not too bad in February). Take your time to walk around and above all, be polite, greet the sellers if you want to buy and try to say some words in Catalan or Spanish ( just Hola or Bon dia is enough for a start) and you will be welcomed. They are proud business person to be respected for their high quality offerings, not apes in a zoo.There are other food markets in central Barcelona if you want to chat a bit and buy high quality local produce with no crowds, but admittedly, the Mercat de Sant Josep is the most spectacular.
Great location if you like markets and food. Paid a visit to the market late on a Saturday afternoon. Very busy. Nice bars with tapas etc. Well worth a visit

A fresh taste of everything!. Get your coins ready, get some tissues, watch out for your belongings and just get inside this interesting place for a wonderful and fresh tour of healthy and cheap snacks. Everything looked mouth watering and clean, and the walk was truly a unique chance to have a close feeling of the simple life of Barcelona.

Cool place . This is a must visit place for any tourist! The atmosphere is incredible! I recommend getting one of the freshly made shakes or juices in the market and pick up a nice breakfast sandwich and some too goo fruits and meats to eat when you return to your hotel !

Vibrant market. This is exactly the kind of market that makes one think, "Next time we visit we will do self-catering!" The array of produce available is wonderful, though it is not for the feint-hearted as some of the crusteaceans on sale still move! There are plenty of places to eat at in the market, but be wary; the prices are probably double what you could expect to pay in tapas bars elsewhere. For example, we saw gambas for €18.

Got to have a look. This was next to our hotel so we often went through and got a smoothie, a quick snack as well as looking at all the fresh produce, fish and meats. Wish there were more places to sit and eat as it was always full at the few places to sit.

Market Magic. You don't have to be a local to come here and marvel at the colour and smell of this magical market, it's half way down las ramble and is a great place to stop for lunch lots of tapas bars and little stalls selling lunch. A great place to buy cheese, hams,spices and fresh fruit and fresh pressed drinks. The market gets busy at lunch with locals buying fish,meat bread fresh flowers etc, a lovely place to see the real Barcelona

Fun vibrant place but pricey. We had a bit of time to kill so we walked around here as many others were doing. We bought the worlds most expensive "penny sweets" that came to nearly €9 and was around 300g. There's a real buzz about the place tho and plenty of places to grab a bite to eat or to have a drink. It was cold when we went, but I expect in spring summer and autumn it would be a lot more fun. Toilets charge 50cents unless you produce a receipt showing you were a customer of the market. No problem except no one gave us a receipt for anything...

Don't forget to eat at Kioosko International when in la Boqueria. The restaurant bar <Kiosko International> had a revamp last year and updated their kitchen and seating arrangement. The food is still exceptional. Everything is on view so you needn't worry about speaking Spanish, just point. Both the wine and beer are good. What you may not see if their steak. For me, although this is primaririly a fish restaurant the steak is the best in Barcelona. Have a plate of simple mixed mushrooms, a steak and a beer or some red wine and you will be in heaven. If you have time walk around the fish circle in the middle of the market. and watch the fishmongers deterity when cutting and skinning the fish. It is an art form. Don't waste money on buying the pots of fresh fruit which is a new tourist gimmick. Just feast with your eyes.

A Must-Visit. Great market. Has everything you think of when you think of Spanish food. Tip: go towards the center or back of the market. Prices there can be up to 50% cheaper than those at the edges.

Don't miss this one! . Chaotic and vibrant, located on the Rambla, you need to check it out. Go there with an empty stomach because there are too many options to choose from. Everything from fresh meat, seafood, cheese, chocolates and bread, there's something to satisfy every taste. It's always pretty busy and squishy so be patient. Don't go for the first thing you see, which will be hard not to do, do a few laps and then work out what you want. Great opportunity to see and try the high quality of products local producers have to offer.
Spain food trip. A must- see for foodies! They Have yummy fruit shakes and delicious chocolates!Ofcourse, iberico ham too! Situated near Las Ramblas. I will definitely visit this place again.

A must visit!. Fantastic experience. Often when travelling I've found markets a little overwhelming with powerful smells and intrustive market traders but Boqueria just does everything right... a great selection of food, plenty of room to move around and a lovely inviting atmosphere.Can't say what I'd recommend the most either! The mini tapas bars are great if you want to sit down, but the various cones of meat / cheese / mini pastries / pizza slices were all delicious to pick up as you wander through and I took home quite a lot of the chocolate which I'm still munching my way through!

Take a tour around the back area to find great eating spots. Great market with all the colours and small of the world. Fresh everything and if you take the time to go to the very back of the hall you will find Tapas and Sushi places to make your stomach smile!
Great experience!. Great experience with lots of movement. Very interesting experience with many vendors with fruit and vegetables, fish and meats.

Authentic and great. Could have stayed here all trip. a vast array of choice, all fresh and cooked in front of you. We had a few glasses of cava and shared some tortilla, croquettes and mint chorizos- all were outstanding! Very friendly, efficient service. Really reasonably priced. A Barcelona must!! Wait for a seat- it's worth it

Fantastic Place. Such a wonderful food/drink market to explore and so much to see. Whether you want a meal, a snack, a drink or just supplies, it's all there for you. It's definitely worth a visit or two if you're in Barcelona!

Touristy Market. It's nice to walk through and see all the stands.... especially with the local items (makes some good pictures). We had a mini lunch here, the food at the empanada/fruit stand really wasn't that good but maybe the other stands are better. Fun to walk through and take some pictures but I wouldn't spend too much time here.

Cornucopia of Delights. A 19th century covered market with fish, meats, sausages, fruits, vegetables, spices and sweets. Right off of La Rambla. I found the Paella stand called Vidal Pons and had the Chicken Paella. I took it to go and caught the bus to Park Guell and had a picnic. Closed on Sundays.

A fabulous market thats so colourful. We were staying by this market and visited it every morning at eight for breakfast and to look at the many stalls. The tapas bars in here are all good value for money and all serve a great variety of dishes. The stalls especially the fish stalls must take hours to set out on chipped ice, with such a interesting selection of fish I had never seen. Lots of fruit and veg stalls and fresh smoothie and fruit juice stalls. All I could think was why haven't we got anything like this at home I would love to shop here it would be a pleasure not a chore. Great place

the ultimate market. Barcelona's fresh market, if you were going for a cup of coffee or a fresh meal this is the place to be. Perfectly crowded and contains a large choice of meat, seafood, sweets, groceries and drinks. Recommended while staying in Barcelona.

Amazing market. This is our second time in Barcelona and our hotel is less than 5 mins from here. We went to one of the stalls for lunch on our first day and it was great. Apart from that we have not bought anything at the market as we just like to wander around it.They have everything, fresh meat, fish, smoothies, fruit, chocolate spices, you name it they've got it. The selection is amazing. It is an extremely busy market so it's not recommended if you hate crowds.

Great experience. We heard from friends that we should go to the market. I was excited because it is where tourists and locals mix.
It's an old building and there are so many stalls of fish, seafood, fruit, snacks and even restaurants. The market is clean and isn't smelly at all. It's not expensive but a great experience.
Wow. This is a mothers paradise as they sell different kinds of fruits, vegetables, meat and almost everything. I so love this market.

See the Spanish life in this beautiful market. Bring you camera!. We saw this market from a distance and wanted to stroll around that day, but it was closing. So we came back the next day and spent a grandtime looking and seeing the sights up close. the vendors are greatarrangers of their goods, fruits, meats, and veggies. I took numerousphotos of such color you have to see to believe. Don't miss this it isthe real thing

Not only a food paradise but also a riot of colour and wonderful smells. This place is truly amazing, i could visit every week and never get bored, the stall holders have a real passion for their goods which is reflected in their artistic delay. An experience that satisfies taste, smell and sight with many free samples to tempt you this is a must visit destination.

Spectacular, Impressive Market... Foodies will go nuts here. This place is an amazing Market. Wow the freshness , variety and colors is indescribable. From rarest fish, lobster, vegetables, cheeses, charcuterrie, fruits.. We began our walk and there's lots of restaurant inside, hard to choose. You must have an eye for Pickpocket style theft. Almost lost my bag. But i acted quickly then kept my backpack in front of me at all times. Besides the Market is completely fascinated. You must go with empty stomach and have breakfast and lunch or even dinner.. Can wait to go back , Barcelona one of my favorites places to eat in the Planet..
Amazing market. The biggest and most famous market hall in Barcelona, offering all kinds of fresh food and delicacies. It's a great experience for culinary travelers

So much colour and it's all food. Do not miss a trip around this amazing market. Even the fish look colourful. Who would ever think such a thing. You could eat all the way round from savoury to sweet. The tapas bars are amazing. The Harmon stalls are incredible you can get little tasters. Go do it.

A sublime sensory experience. An almost overwhelming collection of sights, sounds and smells attack your senses when you first enter La Boqueria. It is soon apparent that this comes from the passion that the stall holders have in their produce. In particular, the fruit and vegetable are sculpted works of art in there own right. There is something for everyone here and a visit is highly recommended. If you have the time it is well worth queuing up to sample the tapas on offer.

The best reason to walk along Las Ramblas. A fabulous place to stimulate every sense. Everything is displayed in a characteristically Barcelona way - with colour and flare! Plenty of opportunity to try tapas as you stroll around.
Amazing marketplace . Amazing explosion of color, sound, smell, just an wonderful experience for culinary travelers. I was able to buy a bunch of exotic ingredients for a reasonable price

Colorful market, a must-see. It is a very interesting and a must-see attraction /market in Barcelona, including exotic fruit and juices, varied types of meat and salami, jamon, and tapas places as well as markets to shop from. Most interesting part for us was a small tapas place where there was a proper show of chefs! We went there for breakfast and it was fantastic. You should go there if you like tasting interesing food and enjoying different tastes.
Old market. You can find the most famous food here. Like sausages, fruits, spice and olive oil. Anything in Barcelona you can find in here.
Amazing atmosphere. Fruits, sea foods, and a nice atmosphere.A good place to eat something and relax looking around.Recommended.

So good, we went twice. Absolutely amazing experience! I only wish more of the stalls let you sample their goodies! Usually at the entrance of the market the prices were higher. Avoid the burritos- cheap and tasteless. The good chocolates are of fair quality, but cost 68-72€ per kg! So be aware. Fresh fruits and smoothies are worth a sample

We Loved It!. If you like wandering around nice markets, this is a place you should visit while staying in Barcelona. We are foodies and market lovers :) and we really enjoyed our walk there. The market is impressive with its abundance of everything - all kinds of seafood, fruits, meat, spices, cheese, etc. There are food places where you can find the fresh food from the taquillas ready to be eaten. It is really a fantastic place. We only regret we culdn't buy many things due to we could not transport them in our luggage (we were travelling by plane). :)

An assault on the senses in the best way possible.. We spent a wonderful few hours wondering around the market, sampling food aty every step. The quality of the food was immense, we stood at one market stall and sampled oysters and sea urchins like locals as the old ladies jabbered around us haggling over the price of the fresh produce that surrounded us.

Lovely place!. The market of Boqueria is located on Rambla, near the metro. it's such an atmospheric place! You can buy different food or snacks there: fruit, veggies, meat, eggs, seafood, juices, mushrooms, hamon and other cured meat, sausages, sweets, bread etc - there is a wide choice! You can even eat there - there are couple of stands which serve local food (mainly seafood, but also meat, veggies and mushroms) in short time. Yummy and not expensive. And you can pay everywhere by card.The only thing I didn't like is the working time. They claim to work 8am-8pm, but in fact at 5pm almost all stands are closed. So the best time to visit Boqueria is morning and afternoon. It is closed on Sunday.

Absolutely fabulous! . All the fruits, vegetables, jamon, sandwiches, juices....everything, looks amazing! It's beautiful and colorful and you want to try all the food. I visited it right before lunch, ate some snacks and had lunch there. I've tried the biggest cherries that I've ever seen in my life. Getting hungry just thinking of it. Love it!

I love markets . I came across the market by accident and it was an awesom surprise. Lots of energy, lots of neat meat looking goodies to enjoy. What really made my days were the fresh fruit stands that offer precut fruit and smoothies for a quick and healthy boost of energy while exploring La Rambla.

Fun, food, a feast for the eyes!. We love food! It was so much fun to walk around and see all of the fresh food offerings. I could've stayed for days and eaten my way around the market. So many offerings...There were also several restaurant/bars in the market that looked lovely. Certainly fun to walk through!

Great market. Really interesting market, especially if you're into seafood, cured meats and fresh fruits. Some nice places to grab a bite to eat and a drink. Nice to look at how much the fancy meats go for...
Stunning Market. Simply a stunning market. The food is mouth watering. Vibrant, colourful, loud, and the stall holders are only to pleased to explain what they have. A must see.

Fabulous Fresh Market Not To Be Missed!. This is one of my favorite experiences in Barcelona! Watch the locals purchasing their daily fresh fruits, vegetables, and meats.
Colorful! Exotic! Beautiful!
Be sure to enjoy a snack or meal at one of the delicious internal grills.

Look around. This market was colourful and vibrant. There were lots of different food stalls: meats; fish; fruits; chocolates and nuts; and many eateries. It was all there to enjoy. Walking around listening and seeing the many stalls and lots of people had a nice vibe. We spent hours in this place shopping and enjoying the scenery.I enjoyed the freshly squeezed juices and chocolates.Warning, it's best to look around before purchasing items. I particularly noticed that the smoothies were €2 at the entrance of the market from La Rambla end and €1 deeper inside and towards the back of the market.

Amazing place! Not to be missed while in Barcelona. A delightful sight - the mix of vegetables, fruits, seafood, meats, cold cuts, spices and more - all in great harmony!! If you stay for only one day in Barcelona I would take a look at the Sacred Family, Gaudi´s dream, and the Mercat de San Josep de la Boqueria. Both will make you happy!

I love it. Here you have everything you could ask, it a really nice place with all sort of things.. If you are in Barcelona you need to go! I don't know if these markets are common in Europe but for people from American continent can be a nice activity..

Huge!. This place is huge! So much to see and eat. We walked around for what seemed like hours just browsing and exploring what the different vendors had to offer. Saw many things I've never seen before!
Amazing market . If you love food it has to be seen. It makes Borough market in London look amateur. Enjoy! The colours and smells are amazing.

Amazing Market. This is an absolute must for anyone visiting Barcelona. Even if you only have a short time there don't miss this market.Fantastic displays of the freshest fish (not Mondays though obviously), matured meats and fresh fruits and excellent Iberico and Serrano hams. Some of the butchers must have an absolute fortune hanging up in the hams on display.If you have time wander around in the morning and buy food for a picnic to be enjoyed at one of the other sights.Very clean and safe and all the stall holders were friendly and helpful

Colorful. When you enter the market from The Ramblas you see all kinds of fruit beautifully arranged. Also you will find fresh fish, meat, vegetables, olives, candy and much more. At the back you can eat tapas, freshly made. Well worth a visit!

Wish I Could Bring This Market Home :). You literally can't miss this market, just off the main street "Las Ramblas"
Once inside.....it took my breath away
It's every persons dream market if your into cooking and more to the point there's a fabulous vibe while your walking around
****Closed on a Sunday****

A feast for the eyes and later for the tummy ;). We walked around and saw so many beautiful food stalls. Fruits, veggies, hams, seafood, amazing stuff. Took many pictures and worked up an appetite.
Then went to Bar Central and had fantastic tapas. From lamb chops to mixed grill seafood, all were excellent. Mostly local people and not too many tourists. A hidden gem.
Freshest fruits, nuts and seafood!. We love this place. So vibrant and colorful. We had the best, freshest and coldest oysters ever! A must stop and taste when you're in Barcelona..
For foodies!. If you're into markets and food then this is a must for you. Fresh fruit, fish, poultry, eggs, spices and much more for sale. A great place to wander round and soak up the atmosphere.

Must see market. The stalls are laid out spectaculary and are a photographers dream. The market has stalls selling fruit, vegetables, herbs, spices, bread and lots more. Great place for fresh fruit juices at 2 for 2 euros. Plenty of stalls to sit and eat cooked foods - mainly fish meals.

So much colour and character. We wandered around this market for an hour just amazed at the wonderful colours and choices of food and drink. It sells literally anything you could want to eat or drink and there is such a buzz as people shop and traders sell their wares and holiday makers just look on in amazement. There are cafes inside and close by if you want to sit and eat and drink.

Fantastic food market.. Great market for food and always worth visiting on a trip to Barcelona. Very good place to pick up a fruit salad or anything else you would require for a picnic in one of Barcelona's stunning parks.

Colorful, but you need a strong stomach for the visit. The market is colorful, and it must be a good place to visit in hot weather with its overload of fruit drinks for sale, but I observed things worthy of an alert: All parts of an animal are for sale, and most vendors seem to dislike tourists.

Another Market for a great View. Boqueria has the same status and glamour as any other European Market filled with tourists. Views that astonish every visitor and it's a great picture scenerey for gourmet fans and stuff. However, i don't think it's the best place to spend calories eating and drinkink. There are many other places where you can experience Barcelona Food. I would recommend a visit after a meal, so you don't have to eat everything that and spoil a proper meal.

Bustling Market Best Enjoyed Off Peak. Caters mostly for the Rambla crowd given its location so can become overwhelmingly busy. Keep your wits about you in the crowd but it's a great visit to browse for groceries if you're able to cook in your accommodation and the brunch/lunch venues are pretty varied and good - if you can get a seat. Prices reflect the central location. Well worth a visit regardless.
La Boqueria. I love the boqueria! The food is good and you could take a cool photo. I thought it was going to be bigger but it still has enough stalls. Definitely worth a visit.

It is a must see. One of the most famous market in the world. Often the place is crowd,but it 's a must to see if you are in barcelona. There are a few bars inside where you can eat. There is a great atmosphere.
I would recommend you to go in the morning when the food is really fresh.

Amazing!!`. I love this marketplace ....beautiful presentation, filled with color and flavors. I spent at least 3 hurs just walking aorund and even bought some fruits and had lunch in one of the local shops.

Fresh vegetables, fruits, meats, cheeses!. I stumbled upon this place just randomly walking around Barcelona. I'm glad I did though because this place was SO COOL. There was so much food, so much meat, so much vegetables, so much bakery goods! You could probably find anything food-related here; it's amazing. A lot of places were selling fresh juices, and there was just so much variety. I got an eggplant pastry and a mango pineapple juice for lunch, and it was delicious! I wish they had these sorts of places in America; there are farmers markets here but I haven't seen one as big as this nor with as much variety. This place is awesome; I'd definitely recommend coming here to look at what's being offered! Chances are you'll find something you like.

Beautiful Market for everyone. A must visit in Barcelona, from fresh fruits to fish, sweets, meat and very nice restaurats to dine in. I enjoy every visit I made there.If you are looking for special foods,that's probably the place to find it.

Fantastic! . This is a must see in Barcelona! You may think it's just a market but it is out of this world! From fresh fish to tapas bars, there is nothing you can't find at this market! A real treat for the senses!
Yeah!!! . This Market is fantastic. Visited twice, once on a cooking class tour to get our ingredients, the second time alone. Stunning food. Incredible variety. YUM

Must see and eat!!. That's the funniest and the most colorful place to eat what you will choose yourself! In winter a bit cold to sit on the street bar, but still very good!!! You can always take some "para yavar"))
Best seafood ever!. Real taste from Mediterranean seafood with options for any budget. You can't fail choosing whatever you like as there's plenty offer

Marketplace. I could stay one whole day here, it's like paradise. fresh fruit, juices, various food, cholcolades, sweets, spices... so colorful and interesting.Go inside, juces cost 2 euros on outside stands, and if you go litllebit inside you can get two for 2 euros ;)

Amazing place - not to be missed1. Must see stop, along La Rambla. An amazing place to visit - a treat for all the senses. If I lived in Barcelona, this is where I would food shop. Nothing even close in the US!
Colour abounds. Perhaps one of the most fantastic neighbourhood markets. Stallholders display their produce with a real sense of flair. Definitely worth a visit for the atmosphere alone.
