Awesome . Went there with my mum I think it is a great place we had some ham it is given in a cone we also had some juice both of them were very good then we had some oysters and they were awsome

Unique market. This is one of the most famous market in the world. The place is crowdy, lot of merchandisers, tourists etc. You have to see this market if you are in Barcelona. There are a few bars where you can take a breakfast or lunch. If you like sea dishes probably you find your needs. Prices are not cheap but the experience compensate this.
The paradise . All you want is here! Every kind of food!I loved fruits and candy... It's wonderful place! You can eat all you want! Jamon for every price

Great fresh fruit juice, wonderful colors and shapes!. Just off Las Ramblas, great option for fresh juice/ fruit and quick bites for good prices. We were in Barcelona in the summer, so it was so refreshing to stop by at the market after lunch and have a drink! Don’t go buying at the first stall you see, it’s a market, so do some comparison shop. It is a bit of a maze and the stalls look much alike, but you’ll find your way back eventually. Smoothies were around € 1.5, but we found places that sold 2 for € 2. It’s a market so there’s this incredible array of fruits, meats, nuts, vegetables, candies, you name it. We didn’t get anything to eat, we were not really into the options there, but you might find something you like. So colorful, great picture opportunities.

Mercat . Probably the oldest market in the whole of spain , this is another must see every time i go to barcelona i / we make a point of coming here because of the fresh fruit and all there different spices and i love the fresh fruit drinks and the way they set up the stalls there isnt one thing out of place you also have food stalls where you can sit have a beer and a fresh piece of fish with pata bravas or cured meat bagguettes , your certainly spoilt for choice , again you have to be there to experience all of this .

beautifull marketplace. when you go for a walk in the Rambla, crossover in this market for a glass of fresh juice and a cup of sliced fresh fruit. There you can see and leanr about Spanish traditional food. Nice short walk around a marketplace full of good energy!

Great experience. Visited here while staying in Barcelona for a couple of days. The place is all hustle and bustle, full of energy, sights and smells. We wanted to buy so much food but settled for some snacks. The home made I've lollies are amazing, a must try!

Is this the most attractive market going?. Whenever we are in Barcelona this place is a definite 'go to' place. It is a delight to see such abundant good quality produce of all kinds. Stall holders take a pride in their displays that for me indicates their respect for the food. A very uplifting place to be.
Fresh produce !. Should definitely go to this market if you love food. Fresh veggies, fruits, meat, fish etc. A glass of fresh juice costs just 1.5€!
Great Experience. This is a great example of the Spanish mercat and was an experience just walking around seeing the variety of foods on offer.

Fresh and colour!. A market place visited by lots of tourist. Here you can find fresh fruits, vegetables, spices, fish, meat, and everything good. Prices are very good (1 box of strawberries for 1€). If you have time, try the fresh sea food. You can see how they prepare it freshly for you, and maybe you can try something what back home you don't have chance to do.Here i've eated fresh coconut as well for 1€ and i tasted the coconut juice as well.If you wanna see something "spanish', try it.

A festival of colors and noises. The famous central market La Boqueria (officially Mercado de Sant Josep) is a festive, noisy place that amazes me again and again, every time I am in the city. Piles of fruits and vegetables, baskets of mushrooms, racks of bread, hanging hams, bunches of spices and unimaginable quantities of fish and meat will leave you breathless.

Wow. An amazing market offering all kinds of fruit and veg, fish and meats. Everything looks so colourful. Lots of the wares seem expensive compared to our market prices at home near Campoamor but it is well worth a visit and to sample a nibble or tipple or two.

Great place to eat or just walk around. This Mercado is just fantastic..you can find great and fresh products here...at excellent price. As well great restaurant, especially if you love seafood. It's on the right side of the Ramblas (middle) if you go late afternoon you can find great bargains...it's a place not to be missed in Barcelona with easy access. If you decide to eat in the Ramblas area this will be the only place I would recommend based on my research while I was there. I do not recommend the rest of the Rest. in the Ramblas.

Great place to buy frech food. The Boquería is a great place to shop for your food. You can find an endless choice of places to buy fresh vegetables, fruit, cheeses, meats, beverages, tapas, anda much more. During our visit we used it to buy our lunch (which we alter ate at an open plaza in the old city quarter), and also our dinners (which we ate at home, as we werw living at a rented apartment). Much cheaper than a restaurant, is a must go just to see. Downside: at some times in the day there is too much people.
Good. I was there around 8 p.m and there were just few shops open. But it was good experience to visit there

Great place for quick lunch on the move. Sure it's crowded, but you can't beat this for a convenient place to get a great variety of well-presented fresh food and drinks. Don't miss this free spot if you want a fascinating, colorful, hunger-satisfying experience and/or a quick lunch on the move. We would get some fresh bread at one shop, fresh sliced Iberico ham, chorizo, cheese, and some fresh fruit and drinks at others. Wish we had a permanent fresh market like this in Boston.

Great market!. We got to this super market by chance! It is really interesting! And the products they have are unique. We were lucky because we stayed in an apartment with private kitchen so we bought fish and meat there!
Variety of fresh food and drinks. It is worth a walk around to grab something to eat. Many seafood and fruit stands to buy from. The place has a fresh essence.

Just so-so. I'm sure there are plenty of others more reasonably priced markets in Barcelona. This felt very similar throughout with just a handful of stall varieties (seafood, meats, fruit juices) and the prices were that certainly of the fact it is next to La Rambla so a haven for tourists, we didn't stay long in there.

Foodies heaven - an adventure in food. How I wish we had such a market near our home! Crowded but fascinating to walk thru - the crowds tell you just how super popular this market is. Arrive hungry and plan to spend some time here.

Definitely Worth A Visit. I wandered into La Boqueria quite by accident actually. I was trying to find a highly rated paella restaurant. I found the restaurant and it was closed much to my chagrin, but I landed in the middle of the market. I've been living in Morocco for five months so this market really blew my mind in terms of sophistication, diversity of items and quality. You name it, they have it. Pastries, cheese, olive oil, chocolate, fruit skewers, Spanish empanadas, rabbit, pork pork and more pork, fresh fruit and veg, and so much more. I found the prices to be a little high (used to Moroccan market prices I guess) so I didn't really buy much but it was still worth a wander to take it all in and to snap a few pics. In terms of outdoor markets (I've seen my share across Asia and North Africa) this one is fairly small and easy to navigate. You can manage it quite easily in an hour or so.

Try to go and delight with jamon, fish and fruits. Very nice covered market. You may find any type of products from fruits to jamon, to fish. Very coloured and fresh. it is nice to walk inside the market and buy and taste products.

great market,(but narrow) . absolutely worth to visit, many interesting food, and if you look around for a while and compare the prices you will find good stuff for the right amount of money, very crowded sometimes, forget about bringing big backpacks or trolleys... enjoy the catalan atmosphere

best place for food and understand barcelona. travel to barcelona must go into this marketthey have everything.. food, fruit, restaurant, coffee, fish.. everythingone will enjoy the time inside the market .. easily for 3 hoursshop till you dropis not about luxury .. is about culture,try the tapas, jamon..

Awesome place, colourful and full of life. It is a fruit, veggie and fish market. It you are in a mood for a fruit salad, there are lots of variety to choose from. They serve you the salat in a cup and the price vary from 1 euro to 2 depending on the place you buy it. We could not get enough fresh juices, you can find them anywhere. If you look carefully there are places where they cost only 1 euro and they come in all variety of flavors.

Fresh juice. It is a great place to shop prsciutto-ham, to drink very cheap freshly squeezed juices and to have lunch. The restaurants are charming, you eat in the middle of the bouqeria, in the croud of people that shop fresh fish and hams. Prices are not cheap. The food is good, but is a little bit pricey. You can eat twice in Cerveceria catalana for one lunch at the market. But it is worth it.

Awesome market- worth a trip. We went to this market on our last day in Barcelona. We wished we visited sooner, we would have visited more than once. The fruits were amazing, we found unique produce that was so fresh and sweet, we were eating out of our bags. We bought meat for dinner that was delicious. The best day ever, warning- don't touch the produce, the vendors get it for you.

FOOD HEAVEN. We were pretty surprised by all the food that is served there everyday.
The fruit bowls which are usually 3€-4€ in Foodstore are 1€ in La Boqueria.
There is a great atmosphere in there.
I would recommend you to go in the morning when the food is really fresh.
It s a must see.

Best ever <3. straight on La Rambla, huge market with everything you need in life :D .. great food and drinks from all over the world.. prices are not huge.. it is overcrowded but you forget everything on the spot =)

Good ''Mercado''. This was the first Mercado I've visited in Barcelona, some 15 years ago, when I came here for the first time.I was enchanted. Never saw anything like that before.Now I am living in Barcelona with my beloved wife. We do not make shopping at Mercado San Josep because we live in central city and have the Santa Catarina Market (Mercado de Santa Catarina) nearby and with better prices. We also use to have lunch there every sunday, eating perfect spanish or chinese dishes that are perfect, just perfect. At good prices too.But San Josep is still the same, one of the most beautiful places to buy fresh vegetables and fruits, that I can say.Some day I will go and try its cuisine (cuinas, in Catalan), hoping it's as good as the fresh food they sell and as good as the dihes you can eat from Cuinas Santa Catarina.If you come to Barna, you must visit San Josep!

Enjoy colors, flavors and scents.. Typical market in front of the Ramblas, it was full of people and it was difficult to keep the group together. Is good to enter and see the colorful stands of candies, chocolates and to buy different kind of fruits. If this is not what you are looking for, probably there are a lot more to see if you are short of time in Barcelona.

Must see in Barcelona. Near the famous Rambla lies this local market which sell local food such as fruits, ham, seafood, sweets, candies etc... Some shops also have terrasse where you can eat, and few restaurants are surrounding the market. Must go and try different food !
Don't visit on a Monday!. Make sure you visit during the weekend, as much of the market might be closed! Beautiful smoothies, and obscure fish cooked straight out of the sea!
Break. Market ok but just food and drinks. No clothes or anyghing else. Not open on bank holidays. Good for snacks, fruit, juices.

Very interesting. This market has a great selection of stores, selling fruit, nuts, seafood, sweets, cured meats, and much more. Around the perimeter are several bars and cafes. One of the more reasonable and authentic food options, especially so close to Las Ramblas, this is a very interesting market.

Intense cultural experience not to be missed. Just walking around this market is super cool and appeals to all the senses. Not for the squeamish, as there are a lot of butcher shops with various meats, fish, poultry, and game out on display. There are a few bars where you can sit down and get a drink or sandwich. We had breakfast there - talk about fresh food! It is covered, but not climate controlled.

Market sublime . Honestly wasn't expecting this as its so close to las rambla and thought would be an out and out tourist trap. It was mind blowing. Fresh gorgeous produce of all kinds and fair prices. Scooped up lots of delights for a casual in-hotel much needed restaurant rest! How lucky they are to have this in Barcelona

Local Experience. We are visiting over Christmas and staying at an Airbnb apartment in El Gotic diver have a kitchen. The only bad part about the Market us that it is so big you want to buy too much!
Great prices, fresh meat and produce. Fabulous experience.

Fresh fruit juice!. A good place to visit if you are interested in sampling a bit of everything if you are short on time. Be wary of pickpocket thieves as this place can be pretty packed full of people. Definitely worthwhile trying out the freshly squeezed juices that are located at every corner of the market - uber refreshing and such a great way to get those essential vitamins and minerals into your system!

Colours smells and wonderful sight . A must visit to experience the wonders and sights of food and vegetables displayed with such colour and beauty. A lovely place to see early in the morning before the maddening crowds appear. Enjoy
Good place for seafood and ham. This place is very close to La Rambla and would suggest to have dinner here. Many shops sell ham, seafood, dried fruit, fresh juice, chocolates and spices.

Great selection but meat display may disturb . The variety is huge from fruit and juices to nuts and chocolate to vegetables, meat and fish. Everything there in booths. Huge crêpes and lots of other foods for all meals. But looking at skinned animal heads, cow penises, hanging ducks in full feather, and legs with hooves and all manner of meat and fish can be disturbing for vegetarians, kids and sensitive people.

An assault on the senses . La Boqueria is so much more than a tourist attraction, the quality of all the food is outstanding. Compared to a market like Borough in London, it is also a great market that still has realistic prices. Go for an early lunch at El Quim for some excellent inventive tapas

A cornucopia of sights and smells.. This is a fascinating, busy, and gorgeous market. Not only is it great for people watching, its a great place to eat or pick up local gourmet foods. I purchased several of the freshly squeezed juices, they were great!

Historical market . What can I say more then the other 4000 people who left reviews here on trip advisor , not much! I return to this market every time I visit Barcelona and grab a bite to eat at one of the tapas stalls. The food is always fresh, the place is alive and I always leave in a good mood. I suggest a visit if your in town.

maybe one of the oddest places you'll ever see. giant market place with every weird kind of meat you never wanted to see [all kinds of unmentionable body parts of cows, pigs, sheep]! fruit, veggies of all kinds; all kinds of candies, really good fudge; for drinks and late night there's tapas bars and restaurants where you can get paella. but if you're a germophobe, don't go.

Great market!. This market is fantastic! Super fresh good and it doesn't reek like most other public markets I've been to. Note: you may want to venture further in the market before you make purchases as the prices seem to decline with distance to entrance

To Market. A nice market to walk around and view the local fruits, seafood, etc.
Wonderful variety of fruits available, stores selling all sorts of nuts, seafood, caviar, iberico ham, etc.
After admiring the variety of stores in the market, stop by one of the many seafood eateries to try out the local seafood.

Must see!. If only all markets in the UK were like this! Fantastic place to buy fresh produce if you're self catering! If you're not, then it's great just to wander round and sample the different goods that vendors have on offer. Try some of the fresh fruit smoothies!
Rancous food paradise. It's clean and vibrant trqditional market. Be sure to try some fresh sea food. Juice are a bit pricey though. Most of the snacks are looking good.

A market like no other!!. This is a must for any visitor to Barcelona, a walk around the fruit, meat and fish stalls. It has been compared to Borough Market in London but I think it is different as there is less ethnic influence.If you wish to snack on tapas there are a couple of bars, as you will see they are well frequented by not only tourists but also locals.Monday is not a good day to visit the market as a lot of stalls are closed. It is always crowded with visitors and locals so don't be surprised by the quantity of people.If you are up early like 5 in the morning there are always famous chefs patrolling to find their catch of the day!!
fantastic. Must to walk around to see the market ,the fruits, the food,the original products of Catalinya regions. to eat some sea foods or local meal

Must visit in Barcelona, but.... When in Barcelona, La Boqueria is a must see for sure, but take under consideration that some of the places are tourist oriented. We bought a small "truffel oil" that turns out to be olive oil with a tiny piece of mushroom (doesn't taste or smell like truffel oil).There are some nice places to grab a bite or dine, look for the Pallea place in one of the corners and for the family place- Boqueria Bar.
go go go. go there try knowing the local market just remunder to be careful of the entrance candy shop, which seems to cheat tourist

Good Place to Start Your Day. It is a local marketplace which becomes a touristic attraction. You can see many locals doing their daily shopping. Very broad range of fruit salads and meat can be found along with seafoods. You can do some shopping and I definately suggest local catalan cheese.

Just Delectable!!!. If you come from brisbane, AUS these markets will put ours to shame!!! the food could not get any fresher, colourful, cheaper or mouth-watering. I ate a meal here everyday for 7 days and never got bored of the range. I ate everything from breakfast, which included fruit cups to lunch which ranged from DIY meat platters, of freshly cut cured meats, cheeses, and olives, to hearty-lunch meals such as salads or nachos to desert which was handmade chocolates, purchased buy the weight! If you go to Barcelona, you HAVE to visit this place.

Perfect tourist trip in the middle of the La Ramblas! Highly recommed.. This is the most beautiful market I've ever been at. The fresh products (sea food, fresh juices, fruits, .... ) are to die for. It's a little pricy but it's worth every penny. If you are in Barcelona do not miss going to this market as you will be missing everything the La Ramblas is there to offer. Highly recommend.

magnificent market. Tremendous displays throughout the market - fish, sweets, bread - anything you could want. the vegetables looked amazing, and lots of intresting articles to consider and peruse. Would be fantastic if you were self catering.
All around-senses-feast. A place you won't forget easily, endless variety of exquisite food / tapas / products..within this world class outdoor market. bottom line-a GREAT experience..

Puts supermarkets to shame!. Having seen a television show on Barcelona where La Boqueria was highlighted as a "must see" attraction, I had to put it on our list of sites to visit. We were not disappointed. Of all food markets, both indoor and outdoor, I have been to this tops them all. The candy vendors alone are worth the visit with a variety of delectable treats so eye appealing one would think they were in an art gallery. Fish I had never seen, meats so fresh it would seem the animals were being raised behind the booth. If you love sausages and cheeses as we do you will have an endless variety from which to choose. Skip lunch at least one day and graze here.

Fantastic, fun, and fresh!. From fish to fruit and everything in between, this market is a feast for the eyes and the stomach. While it's always crowded, it's definitely an experience with a hint of novelty about it. It's prices are higher because it's famous and packed with tourists, but I've yet to be disappointed by anything purchased there.

I love this place!. The best part of the otherwise commercial La Ramblas. Stalls filled with super fresh fruit, vegatables, meat, spices, and incredible seafood is brought to a higher level by several excellent tapas lunch counters that serve food that is inexpensive and exquisite. The cultural experience alone is worth the trip to this world famous outdoor market.

Colours and smells. It's one of those places you will always remember. You may find hundreds of different food (typical mediterranean, exotic ones, fish,fresh juices, mushrooms, and lots and lots of incredible things).One of my favourite stores is one named Olives Francesc, you may find there all kind of olives (I discovered there olives stuffed with Greek feta cheese ... delicious). They also have souvenirs to take home such as small olive oil bottles and other typical spanish things.Don't forget you calera to take lots of colourish pictures!

Endless bounty and temple of temptation. One of the first permanent produce fairs that we have visited. Restaurant chefs, homemakers, tourists and workers stroll amid endless bounty of glistening fruits and vegetables , gleaming fish counters smoked meats, loads of cheese, barrels of olives & peppers, chocolates truffles...In the end a handful of bars serve up variety of delicacies.

small tasty expensive. i didnt buy a lot of things in this small market.i bought some chocolates.holly crap were very delicious handmade but veryyyyy expensive! come on dudes with a realistic price i could buy from you everyday i spent in barcelona!!!

Beautiful displays and local fare... Was lovely to wander round such a colourful and varied array of fruits, sweets, meat and seafood. From the beautiful to the weird and wonderful this market has it all. Well worth a visit when you wander down Las Ramblas!
Vibrant marjet. Great indoor market that makes shopping a pleasure. Interesting & vibrant with a few places for a coffee or cava en route. The displays are fantastic.

9 days in Spain. What a Market, or should I say Zoo.
It sure is an experience to go through this place.
Packet with any kind of food stands, tapas bars etc.
A lot of good finds for the foodies

An incredible display of meats, fish, seafood, fruit and vegetables. I've been to plenty of famous food markets but this was almost breath-taking in the depth of the displays - so fresh and full of colour. I could have spent hours just looking at the produce. Wonderful.

Experience la Boqueria. By the second you are at la Boqueria you notice the fantastic atmosphere surrounding you. The colorful stands filled up with tens of different juices, the sea food, a great variety of nuts, candies and native specialties. On the whole if you are in Barcelona do not miss experiencing la Boqueria. Cheers !

Traditional market, delicious tapas!!!. We stopped off here for lunch on our first day and were not disappointed! Fresh tapas made in front of us, great variety, great quality and tasty!The rest of the market has great produce, loads of fresh fruit, vegetables and fish and loads of fresh fruit juice stalls which were very refreshing!No visit to Barcelona is complete without a visit to this market!!!

A must-see place for a food lover. Amazing place with all the colourful and beautifully displayed food on offer. Everything looks so good. It's easy to spend a couple of hours just looking around and wanting to try everything! Everyone will be impressed with this food market but especially food lovers will love it. It gets very busy and crowded here but you hardly notice it because you're so amazed with all the food around you!I visited the market in the evening time for the first time and the atmosphere was good and there was still lovely things available. The second time I visited in the early afternoon and most of the food stalls were closed and the selection wasn't very diverse. I think the best time would be to visit early in the morning to see the full selection of all the products.The problem is you can't decide what to buy!
Nice place to visit . For those who loves jamon Serrano this place is a heaven everything is extremely fresh tasty and nice! Definitely the place to visit in Barcelona

One of the best places in the town. When you walk down the Rambla you need to do a little detour. Visiting open market La Boqueria is far more important than visiting some museums or El Corte Ingles or a tourist trap called building place Sagrada. You will meet real life on the market, people from Barcelona and from other countries, meat, fish, fruit, vegetables, spices and much more. You can find something to taste or eat on a spot, from fresh fruit to snacks of all kinds. Vendors are very friendly, they know how to communicate, how to make jokes. And, this is not a spot for big tourist groups walking behind their guide as behind a guru. One of the rare problems there are bad, artificial lights; they change colors of food and many nice things seem to be artificial. A bench here and there for a rest can be helpful.

A tourist jam. Years ago used to be a great market place, full of color and with all the type of stores for buying all types of food. Now it still is a good market, but tourism has ruined it a little bit, since is too centric and in all city guides. Market places in Barcelona are great and I, as a local, prefer to go to a less touristic place when looking for a market.

Great market, huge choice, pricy . The best food market that I have ever been to. So many different fruits, veggies, fish, seafood, nuts, mushrooms, meat etc to buy, with that kind of variety of everything you have a difficult time what to choose. Check different boothes before to make the final choice. Prices are higher than at other markets in Barcelona but the variety of food the biggest in the city and only here you can find some unique and rare products. I have never seen so many different fish and other seafood and so rare products like persebes (goose barnacles), sea urchins, and huge scampi etc. everything is super fresh. Coming to Barcelona better rent a flat with a kitchen instead of hotel and you can go to that or other market - buy some fresh fish or seafood and cook it at home, like we do. Also market has some cool places to eat like Kiosko Universal, Bar Central, and Ramblero. But avoid restaurant Sukaldari - nothing special.

Gluttons Unite!. The market offers a range of seafood, meat, produce and sweet delights. I enjoyed the rainy day zipping through the aisles, making note of all the stalls I wanted to return to. A nice pit stop for stocking up on snacks before a long plane ride.

I never get tired of this place!. I have spent 7 days in Barcelona over two trips and I have been to the Boq 7 times! Great place to take pictures, have a meal or just snack. Grab a fresh squeezed juice and
Food, food, and more food. There is an endless supply of fresh foods here, anything and everything you can think of. Fresh octopus, shrimp, chicken, even weird stuff like cow tongue and sheep brains.

Enjoyed Our Visit to the Market. I know that a lot of reviews on TripAdvisor say that this market has become a tourist oriented destination as compared to what it used to be. However this was my first visit to the market so I have to judge it as we saw now as opposed what it may have once been. We like to visit markets when we travel as we feel that a real market gives you an idea of what the people who live in buy and eat. This market has the feel of a real market. No souvenirs. No little dolls. No shirts and rugs. Just food. Food to take home and food to eat on site. The day we visited it was crowded with people who were buying groceries and eating at the food stands. Lots of tourists wandering around the market but also lots of locals buying stuff to take home to eat.The place may not be as good as it used to be but it was certainly the best shopping experience on La Ramblas. One of the questions asked when you write a review is if whether the attraction is a good rainy day experience. It did rail and it was.

An amazing range of fresh and cooked food stalls. Visiting the market when you're ready for something to eat is a great idea, not only are there stalls where you can buy food but there are stalls where you can sit down for a meal, many are licensed and the food is predominantly excellent.

The best of Butchers & Fisherman. This is a market that has a history dating back to when this was a area that was the heart of the city in the 1800's and eventually became an enclosed market in the 1900's.You can sample some of the best dried meats and the fish is beyond fresh. A great way to spend a few hours and it is within a five minute walk of great shopping center.
One of my.favorite markets!. Absolutely loved this market! It was fun and had lots of energy! I loved the fresh juices and the prices seemed to be fair! Definitely a highlight of my trip to Barcelona
Food and fruit oasis. When walking on the Rambla, you have to pop in this fairy tale market! The variety of fishes, fruits and jamons were amazing. :-)A MUST SEE attraction!

The most amazing fresh produce, but very busy. We rented an apartment directly opposite the market (Las Ramblas 102) and had the pleasure of shopping daily for a week for pur meals. This place is a foodie dream! We enjoyed our home-cooked meals even more than the ones we had in restaurants.
Great atmosphere. Very busy, almost too crowded! But everything on display looked so gorgeous you could eat it all.There's something for everyone. It tends to be a bit quieter in the late evening.

Fun Place, Good Food.. Whenever I am in Barcelona I eat here at least once every day. Always for breakfast and again for lunch when there is time in the day. Not only is it a fun place to eat, it is a fun place to walk around, shopping for food to eat later and just people watching.

Best food market!. Super cool place to visit or hangout, really nice vibe selling all the cataluna delights, meats, cheeses, fish...you can sample for a fee and buy bigger portions too at the sit up restaurant bars.
If you're visiting the city, you absolutely MUST visit here.

Tasty food, pretty stalls. Very crowded market with beautifully displayed produce, all kinds of seafood, nice eateries, candy and more. After we walked around, we had lunch at one of the seafood counters, the portions were big but delicious.
I enjoyed it, especially the many photo ops.
A vertible feast for the eyes and palate.. We loved walking through this market...the colors...the variety of food on display....the people! Just wish we had more time for a more leisurely stroll.

Barcelona trip. We had give there, we had tried seafood tappas. It was so cheap and so hummy. Weer had also candy, juice and fresh fruits. Old people was rude and that was the only disadvantage in that great place.
great food. Great place with great food and lovely peolple. Definitely a must go. Good prices of food as well...

Beautiful classic market. We went to this market guided by curiosity and we were amazed. It's a large classic market, with fruits stands, vegetables stands, chocolate and other sweets, meat, eggs or bread.You can also find places to eat here and some of them have very good food and good ratings on TripAdvisor.Be aware that some of the prices (mainly for sweets) are a bit overated.
Rainbows!!. Amazing coloring and products.They have meat, vegetables, fruits and sweets. A strange thing.. They don't have cheese:)

Amazing!!!. This is one of the coolest things to do in Barcelona. The market is centrally located on Las Ramblas, it is super easy to find. The market is filled with everything from fruits to fresh seafood to meats to tapas bars. There is scattered stands that sell fresh juices and fruits, I recommend going to the back of the market because they tend to be cheaper, especially at the end of the day. I don't recommend coming here to eat Tapas though, since it is so touristy it is very expensive to sit down at one of the bars and eat. If you like Pinterest this is your heaven, its is filled with crafty foods and snacks. To read more about my trip in Barcelona check out my blog weeksatatime.com !

Nice fruit. Very lovely fruit at this market. I prefer markets that sell jewellery and items etc but this was just food. I would recommend to buy any food from the stalls in the middle as there were fewer flies about there!
Very Barcelona . Interesting range of culinary treats. From the beautifully arranged fruits and vegetables to the yummy candies and tempting meats.

Be a little bold.. The Mercat de Sant Josep de la Boqueriaor as it is locally known Mercado de La BoqueriaIs a great place to spend time if you are a little bold and like adventure, explore this wonderful gastronomic delight, push past all the gawking cruise ship passengers blocking the entrance and work your way through the Kaleidoscope of colour towards the back. Whichever isle you take it will be full of smells and surprises, we found a delightful small stall where they served scallops on the half shell surrounded by shrimp bathed in garlic butter and cool Olives stuffed with little gherkins. Of course one has to have the obligatory bottle of local Cava. Wondered round some more you might find the incredible coffee stall, were you can spend hours people watching.

Second Best Market Ever. A bustling, active market amongst La Rambla. Quality of The food is first class and we found the stall owners very friendly with nearly all fluent in English. Clean, tidy and yummy. By the way, the best is in Adelaide, Australia...

A blaze of colour. It may be tourist central, but its still somewhere you have to go. A fabulous array of fresh fruit & veg along with amazing fish stalls. As well as that you have a mass of great little tapas stalls all around. Sensory overload.

Amazing. This market was an incredible experience. I cannot recommend it enough! As an early riser, I was surprised to see that turning up at 8, most things weren't open yet...coming back at 10, a lot of things were still setting up. Try middayish.Be careful of the chocolate stores, while they are delicious they are also very pricey!
Fresh!. You will see all kinds of kiosk's selling all sorts of culinary delights! Fresh fruits too or sit down at one of the Tapas bars inside and enjoy some Spanish food!

Fresh food everywhere. From fresh fish to homemade candies. Cured hams hanging from the ceiling to fresh meats and poultry. Vegies and fruits and everywhere--many places to eat also--off of the Las Rambles.
Food heaven. This place is a foodies heaven! The quality of food available is top notch. So many fantastic things to choose from the sheer choice is abundant. A def visit if you are in barcelona.

Barcelona beloved Market. This is a Barcelona landmark place you have to make an effort to visit. This is a market on La Ramblas that is bustling with activities and people all day long. A place where locals shop for their fresh food and eat everyday. Fresh seafoods, meats, vegetables, fruits, nuts, candies, jamons you name it, you can find it here. Tired of walking around, find a food stall and sit down to enjoy some delicious tapas.

A experience NOT to miss. It is interesting walking around the market even if you are not going to buy food. There is some very interesting foods in there and even snacking foods that you can buy to sample the local cuisine. We did not eat at it but there is also a Tapas Bar there that you can sit at and enjoy a meal. Do not let the crowds scare you away from this market, it is well worth the experience

MARKET LIKE A MARKET. There is nothing something special. This is market like a market. Many things is not nice, like forexaple Traders seling fresh juices but, 100% percent they are not fresh! Not fresh squizzed! All the price is expensive, Just only because people talking for this! We just planing to brekfast every morning there, but when i saow what is there, i just get no satisfacting. Just , my advise is, if you don't have to do any special, please, don't go !
Must see fresh food market. This is the famous fresh food market hall in the middle of Barcelona. There are more fresh food market halls in Barcelona, but this one is the most famous one.

Loved the Boqueria . What a great market. They have everything from veggies to fresh juices and fruits, to seafood to meats. Dont't forget the popular Iberico. Lots of small restaurant serving food on a counter for around 12 seats. Food served ranging from seafood to regional catalonian cuisine. If you are a foodie, lots to discover. I spend 4 hours here my first day.

Interesting place. Great place for all sorts of Spainish local food. There are stalls for fresh uncooked to cooked food. It's good place for finger food or good meal. Love the pork ham n bacon sold in little cone shape for €2 -€3
Awesome market . If you want to feel the local vibe of Barcelona. This is the place to be. You can find it all here. buzzing vibe Food, drink, candy, fruits & vegetables and spices.
An experience. Despite its appeal to tourists and its location off the Rambla, it is worth visiting during the morning when locals shop there
A great marked!. You should visit the marked in the lunch time. It's crowded,but if you find a seat,down in one of the bars, you have to order some fresh grilled seafood.

Colors of Boqueria. It is a must! Colorful place full of scents and great deals. :) We bought lots of fruit in the evening, it was still frest and cheaper. Good restaurants serving seafood, or you can buy some fresh shrimps and cook them at your apartment. The place is worth visiting. Closed on Sunday!

Yummy seafood!. I still find myself daydreaming about the mixed seafood here. Best seafood i've ever had. :) It can be pretty busy during the spanish eating hours so if you're a tourist used to eating lunch at 12 and dinner at 7, I suggest eating at your regular meal times to get good seats at the food stalls.

Beyond sensory overload!!. this is an absolute MUST for any foodie!! the variety - the smells and the sights will not leave you disappointed! Its apparently often so crowded by tourists "just coming to see" that the local traders can get a little miffed!! we found them friendly and welcoming - takin gtime to explain their fares and dishes. and the prices were much better than out on the street!

Amazing!!. If you are in Barcelona this is a must. A beautiful market with all the food you could imagine. All sellers were very helpful and some offered samples. The smells, atmosphere and colours are worth the visit alone. Very busy but totally worth the visit.

"La Boquería": Food and Taste Carnival. - The most famous, most beautiful, biggest market in Barcelona. - The Mercat de Sant Josep de la Boquería dates from 1217, Officially constructed and recognized in 1826 in the middle of the famous Las Ramblas Avenue. - A visit to La Boquería is certainly never missed. Monday to Saturday from 8 am (actually earlier) in late afternoon shops start to close gradually till close at 8:30 pm. - It is not just market, it is a real carnival of tasty foods you may not find anywhere... - I stopped by the market everyday in the early morning and once late afternoon to buy my foods; fresh, cheap, elegant presented. I like much fresh juices and fresh fruits, wonderful. - The fruit and vegetable section was spectacular and very colourful. - The fish market, everything is "today fresh" and the varieties were amazing. There was seafood I had never seen before, you can also find salt fish. - Poultry, meat and cheese of all variety. - Dried fruits, nuts, sweets, and more and more. - Also you can find a lot of small café and restaurant section (on foot) serving sandwiches, snacks especially sea food or whatever you may like.. Enjoy ... - I enjoyed much watching trading between vendors and clients, it was wonderful as people from everywhere in the world are there. - You can go there by metro to the Catalunya station and enjoy a nice walk of 10 minutes to the market on your wright .... Or the metro to Liceu station and go back 2 minutes on your left ......- Never miss this carnival .....

One of Barcelona attractions you have to see. There are markets and markets, but Barcelona Boqueria market is really special. Not only that you can eat excellent fresh fish and sea food for reasonable prices but you can also just stroll between and see all those spices, fresh fruit and vegetables, typical Catalan butchery shop, taste the best Pata negra jamon. Few times I had a meal at Ramblero stand and every time it was excellent.

A wonderful encounter!. We found this by accident walking on Las Ramblas and it was the highlight of our Ramblas experience! We had a delicious lunch and enjoyed shopping the fresh seafood, meats, vegetables and fruit. There were numerous locals which makes it a more authentic experience with lots of laughter, local passion and vibrant chatter! It is easy to miss since it is located within a large building with minimal labeling and we are SO glad we found it!

This is a MUST SEE Place in Barcelona!. This market is amazing and quite organized - get a map at the entrance it will tell you all the shops and how they are organized. Walking through all the different food shops make us wish that we have something similar back at home. You get to taste and see all the fresh seafood, meat, vegetables, fruits, cheese, bread, wine, specialty food... also lots of small eatery right in the market. You can purchase a fish from the fish section (the circles in the middle of the market) and have it cooked the way you like at various food stalls. The place really is amazing. We had the best meal there the night before returning home.

Is a must if you like quality food. The marketis located in the ramblas which is a very nice area to see and have some beers, the market is full of fish, fruits, vegetables of the best quality, pass by, you wont regret.
Fantastic. Probably best food market we've visited. Colour, smell and hustle and bustle. The fish market is a real must.

Wonderful Place to Visit. If you're in Barcelona, you have to visit here. It's amazing to see the variety of everything they have here; fruit, vegetables, seafood, meat, cheeses. We enjoyed a lunch of tapas at one of the many bars in the market.

Colorful. You HAVE to go there. This is an amazing market full of colors. Walking through it is a pure pleasure. Food is fresh (with lots of food) and you can buy fresh juice for cheap. I would have missed something not going there via La Rambla.

Deliciousness! . barcentral seafood place at the end of the market was by far a favorite! the chef and waiters were friendly, attentive, and never rushed you to finish your meal! The razor clams was the best at Barcentral. The fresh juices was also a favorite. One of the best markets in the city ( at least I've been to so far)

Awesome Market. I could stay in this market all day. The seafood and other foods in here are to die for. Best calamari I've eaten in a long time and it's super fresh. You could lose 1-2 full days in here sampling foods and watching the regulars come in to shop for their restaurants or home. Highlight of our trip.

An absolute must to see in Barcelona. Great food market in the middle of downtown Barcelona. Everything is available from jamon, juices, fruits and Paella. Very crowded. Go around lunch time and eat at one of the restaurants near it. Recommend and outside table so you can view the people.

Fantastic!!!. This is one of the most beautiful market I have ever been to. I tried many exotic fruits and juices. I do recommend to Europeans to taste mango, papaya, pitaya and other "strange", "weird", exotic fruits. They are not expensive.

Amazing. A must see if U are in Barcelona.
Amazing market with nice places to enjoy a meal. The variety of fresh goods is amazing.
amazing. One of the must see attractions of Barcelona. Great atmosphere and some wonderful little restaurants for a blow out meal or just a few tapas.
Beautiful place and full of life!. It is amazing to go there and get to know everything and take some pictures but I especially advise to have lunch there...paella and a fruit juice match perfectly!!

It’s fattening your eyes as well.. It doesn’t matter if you’re hungry or not, when you’ll see the displays in the market, you’ll have the urge to buy something, to eat something, to drink something, and when you’ll wake up finally, you already stuffed yourself. After some tempting seafood, some have to try a little Jamon Iberico Bellota, even not to mention a few slices of chorizo or maybe in the reverse order. Of course a meal isn’t a meal without some finishing slices of cheeses and beautiful ripe fruit. I always could resist the temptation, so I just checked desserts. But then tomorrow! I’ll be back and a girl can be weak sometimes. Now, only a big glass of fresh fruit juice and I’ll be satisfied. This market is a place where you can spend hours, and even if you don’t eat, it’s an entertainment.If you’re after some “proper “meal, first try to go to El Quim. It used to be extremely busy.The reason is the extremely delicious food.Once, when after some serious waiting you're able to sit down, try several dishes. It isn't cheap,but you won't mind the bill. Ramblero is the second choice, if you haven't the slightest chance to sit down at El Quim, but be prepared to spend there 20-40 euros per person.
Great for breakfast. We stayed room only just off la ramblas, so this was our daily breakfast spot, so much choice, but just even worth a visit to see all the colourful displays and arrays of food!

A market of dreams! . I have no words for how much I loved this market! Rows and rows of the most beautiful fresh produce, nuts, chocolates, fruits, meats and more! Added to the experience was of eating the best pastry for breakfast and the friendly service. Take a bag and go here to stock up on fresh food or simply to relish in the experience. A must see!!

Go early in the morning to avoid crowds . My husband and I went early in the morning to La Boqueria. We drank fresh fruit juices and bought sandwiches, chocolates and fruits for our daily picnic lunch. My advise, go early in the morning to avoid the crowds

Awesome Mercat!!. We went to la Boqueria twice while in Barcelona. We were told that you should start toward the back of the market because the front shops are a little more expensive. By the time we got there in the late afternoon, a lot of the fish markets were already closed for the day but it was cool to see such a big fresh market. We walked through looking for a snack and treats and went to a nut/dried fruit stand back by the WC. They are very nice about letting you sample something before your purchase but be very specific about how much you want because they are not shy about giving you a huge scoop of something very expensive as you pay by the kilo. The dried peaches and strawberries were out favorite since they tasted like eating chewy fruit snacks. The nuts were also delicious but pretty pricey. We tried a sandwich on a baguette from a bakery which was very delicious and cheap, wrapped so cute by the employee. We also enjoyed Patatas Bravas (fried potatoes with spicy ketchup) at a little place that also sold very delicious Samosas. It's a fun cool place to go check out, wish we could have enjoyed more of the local offerings. We'll be back!!
A beautiful local market. Colorful arrays of fresh nuts, fruits, candies, and so much more. Reminded me of Pikes Place market in seattle, with a European twist :-)
Oh, yes. This was my treat of the day! Fresh fish, fruit and lots more. A glass of real fruit juice for just one euro. So refreshing after sightseeing, best part of the day:)

I stopped by the market everyday. The market turned out to be my favorite spot in Barcelona. It has hot food, cold food, drinks, fruits, cheese, lots of good stuff. Don't hesitate to spend a couple of hours here when you have a chance.

Great market!!. I love markets and this one is in the middle of the Ramblas and since every tourist ends up visiting las Ramblas you have no excuse not to visit the place unless it is closed. If you are staying at a place where you can cook, buy what you need here. If you can't cook you can still find items you can buy or you can have some food and drinks. Just take the time to walk around and feel it!!

A wonderful experience for the eyes and stomach. There was such incredible food there. Locals are there buying fresh market produce, fish, and meat. And tourists and locals are enjoying the fresh food. Some of the best seafood I have ever had! It is well worth it to just walk around and see all that they have to offer. I don't think I have ever seen some of the types of seafood ever.
Lively Market. A very lively and colorful market for fresh produce. You can buy fresh fruits, have a couple fruit juices, and admire the many meats and seafood on display.

Sooo much food!. This market has all the local food delicatessen has to offer. Just to be in the market gives you a sense of feeling how the local work. The atmosphere is fantastic. You can get fresh juice variation for as low at 2euro. Tapas bars are also available in the market.

a must in Barcelona. This market is amazing! You can taste some of the best ham, fresh fruit juice, seafood, tapas and more! Be sure to get here early to avoid large lineup/crowd, best to come here with an empty stomach!

Food, glorious food.. We came on this market while strolling down La Rambla, and entered a truly magic world. The quantity, quality and variety of food was every gourmet's dream - not to mention the common folk. Makes you want to move here to live.

Food, Glorious Food.. A must do. This is such a wonderful place. The sights, smells tastes to be had in this market will amaze you. Have a snack at the market stalls and the café, you can't get fresher.

Great market - really interesting. I wanted to have a quick look at the market but I couldn't believe all the different things on offer here. It is one of the best markets I have ever seen. So vibrant with lots going on. Really good quality foods on sale and the fish in the ice were still very much alive. You can't get much fresher than that. Very strange but fascinating and just off Les Rambles so you'll probably walk past it. Make sure you have a look inside.

For the foodie lover in you.... We happened to stumble upon this market by accident while strolling on our first day there. We sampled "pata negra jamon" the Iberian ham, wonderful. Then we ventured in and grabbed a "cone" of chorizo, potatoes and vegetables (wonderful). I tried the seafood cone, but the trick is to buy it while it's hot. Some folks may get "repulsed" by the meat display (let's say you know what the animal is). Fresh fruit cups, batidos (fresh fruit smoothies), bars with tapas and wine all under one roof. It's a must stop if you're in the gothic section of Barcelona.

Unexpected charm. The market may be the best part of Las Ramblas. We went there on a rainy Monday (the locals tend to avoid Mondays as its closed Sunday) so it wasn't too crowded. There is a roof that pretty much covers the market - we did manage to find a spot with a leak. The variety of produce can set you off into sensory overload!
One the best market in Europe. This is a must to do in Barcelona. Be there early. One of the best market in Europe. Nice activity if it rains

Food, fun and crowds. Ok, foodies, this is the place for you! Although according to some locals the market has become oriented to cater to the tourists, this still has a great selection of all you need to create food masterpieces AND some great places to sample good local food. Even though touristy, this is still a place where locals and restaurants come to shop. For a meal, I can recommend Barcentral on the right side about half way down for great seafood (not cheap, but really good!). Several good gelato and chocolate places. If you want to buy nuts and/or dried fruits, wander around a bit and ask for samples before settling--there are many vendors and some seem to have better products than others. If you like almonds, try the "marconas" a fatter, buttery almond that I haven't seen in the States. The Boqueria Market is right off Las Ramblas. As in any crowded environment, be mindful that there are folks in the crowd who want to lighten the load of your wallet or purse. Be mindful and stow your valuables in a safe place and you'll be just fine.
Love it. You have to see this place and try the fresh fruits! You cant miss it at las ramblas! Enjoy a part of history in the middle of Barcelona!

Used to be awesome.... Now it is overrun by the same establishments all over the place... You can still find some good shops around and the smoothies are good but it's not worth visiting, there are other more authentic real markets in Bcn.

A food experience . We visited on a Sunday and the place was packed with both locals and tourists. We found a Cafe and settled in for some tapas and pinxtos, and it was some of the best we had in Barcelona.

Great market, centrally located. The market is just off Las Ramblas, it is a great place to visit, it is a functioning market serving locals and restaurants in the area. Lot of fresh foods.Worth a visit, if only for a quick fresh snack.
Best market with delicious fruits. It's my favourite place in Barcelona. You can get there delicious fruits like huge dates, dragon fruit etc.
A foodies market. My wife and I had a great time wandering around the market. Plenty of places to eat at and such a great variety.

A must visit while in Barcelona. I had thought I'd be disappointed, having been to some stunning markets in France and Italy. This one can hold its own with any of them. Outstanding. Displays are artistic and beautifully done. Especially the fish, meat and vegetables. For me seafood was the highlight. There are many, many places to eat. We'd already had lunch so passed. It did seem that every counter had folks waiting for a seat at the counter. The food looked fresh and appetising. We were there about 2PM, which is late for a market. Some stalls were closing down. However it was still very crowded.
good experience. traditional and tasty dishes in the heart of the central market. that's the right place for a short break during the tour of the city.

very pitoresc !. it is an experience, though one can easily fall for the tourist traps, such as expensive . . . you should make a tour prior to purchasing anything and only then decide what and where from you want to buy.for the fruits it is recommended that you go towards the back stalls and if you happen to reach there by the evening (1h before closing) then on the back stalls you may get really good deals . . . 3 fruit cups for only €2, while in the street they would sell/just one cup for €4.

Vast array of fresh seafood and meats with choice of tapas offerings. Right off Las Ramblas. It can be quite crowded and as always be mindful of your valuables. The freshest fish markets I have ever seen with many oddities in the meat markets. There are many fine places to eat in this venue. We enjoyed everything from falafel to razor clams and gambas.

Interesting experience. Plan to go when you're hungry. There are limited places to sit down to eat, or you can take out for a picnic or back to your hotel. Lots of fresh fruit, candy and nuts as well as meats and cheeses.

DO NOT MISS THIS WONDER FULL EXPERIENCE. We have been to so many markets around the world but this is one of my favorite. Each and every stall is fresh and delectable. Situated just off the Ramblas opposite the Museum of Erotic Art it is en route to the main shopping area and should not be missed. Not only do you see the market of the every day people but there are zillions of little tapas bars all the way round and you can eat at the bar to your hearts delight. We came back with hams, sausages all pre-packed and delicious.

My favourite walking in Barcelona. Colorful, Cheerful and tasteful! yes you can find a lot go good food at cheap price. You can either sit (if you manage! At lunch all the world is there) or buy something to eat while walking. You can find this Jamon in tranches to take away (delicious) or have an empanada or a portion of fried fish. If you are lucky you can manage to sit in one of this tapas places where you can find any type of food, but there are also real restaurants.Not to miss a fruit juice at 1 euro! The market i open almost all day long and all days.You cannot say you have seen Barcelona if you miss this market just on the Ramblas!

Amazing!. This was the most amazing market I have ever visited. Nothing but food, no cheap knick-knacks and souvenirs. If you are at all into cooking or eating, the place to go! Grab a beer and a bite at one of the stands and watch the people of Barcelona doing their grocery shopping. Not to be missed!

Eat with your eyes!. If you love food, colors and people watching make sure to stop in this market. One of the biggest attraction off La Rambla's, so kind of a no brainer :) We didn't sit to eat at any of the places, but we did buy some spices and fruit. We were impressed with the amount of traffic in and out of this place and really loved the colors. Worth the trip.

Colourful market for foodies. In my earlier review of the La Rambla I mentioned the la Boqueira market. We just had a glance on our first walk; On the second afternoon we went in and what a riot of colour especially the fruits and veggies neatly arranged. Fruit juice stalls and stalls with large cylinders of smoothies. there were also food vendors with throngs of people eating/buying; we stopped at a vendor selling dried fruit and nuts and bought sugar/caramel coated cashews(we went next day to buy more) and pears-these helped sustain us during the day. The market is clean with no unpleasant odours, unlike similar markets in the East

Must see Market along Ramblas. The go to market in Barcelona... a foodies heaven :) If you stay nearby, you can opt out of the hotel breakfasts and have it in the market instead. There are several bar-type eateries that will serve you an assortment of spanish food for breakfast... go for a morning beer while at it. You can also wander the stalls to get some jamon, juices, bocadillos, etc.Try to go early to avoid crowds and it does get crowded.

Don't miss this wonderful market!. For this foodie, walking through the Boqueria was a highlight if iur first trip to Barcelona. An incredible array of fresh fruits and vegetables, meats and fish. A perfect place to pick up items for a picnic, or you can try to get a seat at one of the crowded tapas bars. It's worth a stroll though just to experience the colors and atmosphere.
Great market!. Great market with variety of food!You can find whatever you want to eat there!From food to sandwiches,chocolates, fresh juices and fruits!You have to visit it atleast one!

Seafood and Jamon. I read somewhere that this is the biggest food market in Europe. After circling the complex, maybe not true. But the entire complex is still very interesting for foodies like myself. Jamon everywhere, and of course their fresh seafood. We had really good oysters, so fresh and so smooth. Really amazing scallops, not very big but firm enough with wonderful sauce. Clams and prawns were also good. We brought home a kilo of jamon to enjoy back home half a world away. Wish i can buy the entire leg..

One for the foodies. This is a must see for the foodies. I would advise getting there earlier in the morning as by the afternoon it does get very busy! You can buy almost everything food wise here. Everything is so fresh and colourful. You can buy fresh juice for 1 Euro, bargain! You can buy every type of fruit possible here, and all fresh. It is worth trying the Iberian ham, beautiful and some of the local cheese, they go really well together. There are some Tapas restaurant inside the market, which serve lots of fresh seafood.
Nice . Very colorfull placeEverything is so beautifull Great smells and viewTheres a lot of tapas bar at the marketSo you can stop and take a break in there.

Old world market. Not for the faint of heart. If you have ever been to a fresh local market you know you have fresh fish, chicken, beef, pork and even rabbit(not my favorite). It can be overwhelming but hang on the edges and start tasting something that catches your eye and ones opinion might change. Also you can have lunch and cava or beer at one of the full service spots.

A must see market. A great market on La Rambla. Our favourites were the fruit mixes for one euro (about 2 dl). There are several fruit mixes (coconut, banana, water melon, passion fruit, strawberry, raspberry, etc.). There are very special seafood and sandwiches you can buy for less money. Great experience, a must see program, especially when you are hungry.

Anything and evert hung you want to eat . A giant market with friendly vendors. Here you will find prepared good and that that needs to be cooked. . Vegetables, nuts, candy, delicious thinly carved Spanish ham, cheese and a thousand other goods. The market can get a bit busy in the morning so try in midday.
Foody Heaven !. Just go ! A must! Tons of choices. Fishes, veggies, seafoods, world of wonders. Tapas, tomatoes, peppers, calamari, oyster, shell, prawn

Fresh fruits, fresh seafoods, and Catalan's tradition. A great traditional market to visit during your stay in Barcelona. You can feel the ambience of Barcelona's market life.Approximate spent-time: 1 hourWhat you can find:1. Fresh fruits2. Fresh-mixed juice (€1 per cup)3. Fresh seafood4. Tapas restaurant far inside the market (it's really crowded tho)5. Catalan's traditional food6. Spices shops7. Dried-fruit shopsCheap, fresh, traditional, unique. Those words could simply explain this market.

Don't waste time coming to this place. I m still wondering why we entered this market. This market is full of raw flesh, raw sea food, and the smell makes it difficult for you to stand. And about Tapas, you will find them every nook and corner of Barcelona. No wonder its just like a fish market.

A cacophony of taste, smell and sound . A visit to this food market is a must. Yes it's full of tourists but there is no where quite like it if you love food. There are plenty of bars that you can sit at with a glass of cava and tapas and watch the world go by

Don't be sad if you miss it. . I love markets and food and have very low requirements for food to be deemed edible but a lot of the juices etc. In the market looked old as did all of the pastry and snack-like food stalls. Pretty much everything was prepared at some other point.... I saw the saddest chips under a hot lamp I think I will ever see! Which was disappointing as I was looking forward to trying some new food. Saw a stall packing undrinkable juices away so I guess they make a few days appearances before being scraped. The restaurants were popular and looked fresh so that's your best bet. Looks wise, it's interesting if a bit repetitive in its catering to tourists. If you don't have time you haven't missed much.

Sense sensation. Set roughly half way along Ramblas make the effort to walk across the road and enter the market through the iron gated entrance and take your time to allow your senses to take in the abundance of colours, scents, tastes on display and a great opportunity for some excellent photos too. Be sure to walk around the edges where there are a number of small coffee houses and restaurants running alongside the main market. For us the highlight was the amazing "chili" fruit and veg stall where the colours on display were superb and the hanging assortment of chili eye opening; closely followed by the array of sweets on a stall near the entrance. There are numerous stalls with benches available to sit and taste the food on display, including salads; pasta; sandwiches; meats; sushi and likewise with drinks too. This is a free attraction where tourists mingle with locals and you get a feeling of what life is like living in a busy city centre. You can spend 15 minutes or a few hours if eating or drinking and is a step away from the main tourist traps and the fact it is different makes it a location well worth a visit, we loved it.
Great market off Las Ramblas. Any stroll down Las Ramblas should include a stop at this market. A wide variety of meats, fruits, vegetables, and fish along with tapas and paella.
Taste of Spain. You can eat here some typical spanish snacks, buy spanish delights and many many more. Have to visit, have to taste

A Food Bazar that is WOW. Don't miss this place. What a great surprise for most of your senses. Lots of eating & drinking choices as well as replenishing your supplies! Add in people watching and there is something for everyone. Do not miss this one, or you will be sorry!

Interesting place. Crazy food market with everything from skinned rabbits to quail eggs. Worth a visit if you are on las ramblas. A few nice places in there to sit and have food. Beware of pick pockets. I stood on ones toe as he was lurking behind me...

Great market, amazing range and quality of food. If you like markets - this is a must see. The range and quality of the fresh food and produce is simply amazing. It is a great side show to see the jambon (very expensive but delicious) being carved. The fresh fruit and vegetables can be purchased in adequate quantities for a snack or to take home to your serviced apartment (which we did) to make your own meals. The fish. meat, fruit and vegetables looked fresh and of excellent quality and affordable. There are many food outlets for tapas, paiella and other simple meals - again of good quality and affordable.That it is located on Las Ramblas in the centre of the tourist area has to be a boon for anyone living in a serviced apartment. There is always a crush of people here.For those with a sweet tooth there are several stores selling excellent hand made chocolates and sweets.

A must-visit market. Great assortment of fruits, vegetables, seafood, jamón ibérico. Since our group of friends was renting an apartment, we purchased our groceries here several times for cooking our own meals. Never disappointed.Highly recommended. A wonderful experience, even if you're not buying anything.

Incredible Market. You will not be disappointed. This is a very well known destination with a bountiful selection of meats, fish, delicacies. A feast for the eyes. We enjoyed the wide variety of prosciutto, cheeses and fruits. It gets quite busy during the day. Don't wait too late to go as the vendors start cleaning and packing up their stalls early. Expect an amazing selection of fish. Some of the best I've ever seen. Don't miss this market.

A feast of colours and foods. Amazing place to buy fruits, vegetables, fish, cheese and much much more. We bought papaya, mango, coconut, fresh juice and dates (to bring back to UK) and it all was really yummy and fresh. The vibe is lively and on Saturday it's very very busy. Defo a place to go to.
Fantastic selection of food. I have never been to such a huge food market which sells so much good fresh food at affordable prices.

Very good for food market lovers, but it is always crowded.. I've been to Barcelona 3 times and each time have had to visit the market - it's so colourful, such a large selection of fruit/veggies/seafood/food 'to go' items.. well it's a long list! and always there are new things to see. It's not a market that doesn't keep up with the times. All the produce is of high quality and is beautifully displayed too.The marzipan creations are incredible... the japanese themed ones this time very colourful and atttractive to see. Also the breakfast in a paper cone was a hoot we thought. If you love sweets/chocolate it's an ideal place to browse!You are spoilt for choice re the hams, salamis, cheeses to chose from.You would be hard pressed to think of something not available at this market.It is always crowded but, in October, not as crowded as at peak times so you do get to see everything quite clearly.I'd recommend going there definitely!

Amazing food in one place. If you love seafood & fruit juice ( not together) this is the place for you. The seafood restaurants are all great, serving fresh fish cooked to order & perfection. There are lots of stalls selling a variety of freshly squeezed juices for 1 euro which all tastes amazing.
Must go . If you love to eat definitely you should go there. There are a lot of cheap local food. The colourful fruit and juice are so tasty.

Once is Enough!. A must see if you're on the Ramblas, but get ready to jostle with huge crowds and rude tourists. It also would help to slip the the waiter(s) a few Euros to insure getting a place to sit at the super-busy popular seafood restaurant. " First come first serve" doesn't apply here!A much better market, although smaller, is the Mercat de Santa Caterina (just off the Via Laietana). The crowds are much smaller and the vendors are selling the same produce, cheeses, and other goodies that you see at the Boqueria.

Great food market. A great market with a good variety of local fare. You get a selection of fresh seafood and meat, along with international selection of fruit and vegetables. There are some interesting products there which are clearly local tastes, especially in the seafood section, so if you like to experiment and have access to a kitchen during your stay, this is a good place to explore.

This is a wow stop MUST DO!. We had been here the last time we were in Barcelona but it was another must do on our list this time in particular because we wanted to buy some of the Marcona almond candy that we cannot find anywhere else. This market experience is exceptional and you could spend a good portion of your day looking at every stall but because we were on a half day tour we made all of our purchases and only looked around a tiny, tiny bit so as not to keep our driver waiting on the street! We took photos of nearly every booth that we had time for but did not even scratch the surface of what is there. When you go beware that pickpockets are looking for people that are not watching themselves - do not fall into this category. We did not have any problems but were very self aware.

Kaleidoscope of flavours and colour. Barcelona has an abundance of markets with deliciously fresh goods. We were told La Boqueria is the largest. This place has that typical great feeling you get when shopping in an environment like this. Lots going on, locals and tourists alike shopping. We bought cups of fruit, olives and ham to nibble on while we shopped. Saffron is inexpensive here and many stalls to buy from. There are cafes to sit at the counter and have a light bite or meal. We stopped and had a coffee/beer and lunch while watching the famous Pinto make coffee and give you a great smile. People we met said this was the market we had to visit, they were right with that advise.

Worth a visit. Visited on a week day, lots of people lots of smells and colors, they pretty much all offer the same things and theres not much difference between this market and others in Europe.If you're ok with fish smell and way too crowded places you'll be fine.

Amazing. Amazingly clean market . The products are so fresh specially seafood. Really impressive though pricy but the best quality I could imagine when it comes to Jamon Iberico and Saffron e.g. A must visit when in Barcelona.

Beautiful . I love how this epitomises Spanish cuisine, fresh and colourful. Nothing processed. It is crowded but everyone is moving with you rather than against you. Get some fruit, vegetables, cheese and olives. Just find some bread and you have lunch! Delicious!

A great very busy market. It is an excellent very huge market on La Ramblas. Anything and everything is available here. You can get fish, seafoods, lobster, meat, hams, tea, vegetables, fruits, juices, tapas, candies, cheese, dryfruits, spices and many other things. It is always very very crowded and there is hardly any seating place. The presentation of goods is very nice. The prices are little cheaper at rear end shops. If you are a serious shopper then start from back. Worth visiting this colourful lively market.

Not like any market on the world. Stalls full of restaurants from tapas to cordon bleu supplemented by the sale of fruit and veg, plus fish and meat.Don't just go to buy your ingredients, you can let someone else cook them and enjoy whilst the world passes you by.

Not the first we've seen but still great to visit...... Large, very busy but colourful and full of fresh food. The best known in Barcelona, on La Rambla, lots of stalls with fruit, vegetables, meat, fish, cheese and sweetmeats. A bit of a scramble in the crowds but worth the effort to see it.

Wonderful!!!. This is one place not to miss in Barcelona, and one of the world's prettiest markets. I love everything about this place, the entrance, the hams stalls, the colorful fruit stalls, the fish sellers, and of course, the buss at the tapas bars at the back, if you are patient enough to wait for a seat to be free. Its a wonderful place to see weird fish varieties that you wouldn't see anywhere else, juice makers that have an amazing and colorful array of fruit juices to offer, the lady that has more varieties of mushroom than anywhere else I have seen, and the lady who almost has mo voice left because she screams to the top of her lungs to sell her seafood. Not to mention that most delicious Iberico ham you will find anywhere. I have been to Barcelona may times, and can never tire of taking a trip to La Boqueria.

Too crazy to be fun. This busy market on La Rambla is great eye candy, but it is so insanely busy that there is really nothing to do but walk through and get out ASAP. Not my idea of anything fun to do while on vacation...

SImply AMAZING!!. I have never seen anything like this market. Selection of everything as far as you can see. Beautiful presentations and variety of anything and everything you can imagine. Very clean!!! Wonderful food!!! I am extremely jealous that in Florida we do not have markets like this anywhere. (although the heat would never allow it for freshness) If you come from a place with Markets it may not be as impressive to those of us who are not blessed to have these amazing places and fresh everything with terrific prizes as well.This is a must !!!! it doesn't cost anything just to walk through and see it. I promise you will buy something though. The fruit alone is too amazing to not at least test for yourself.Extremely FRESH FOOD!!!

Not to miss!. THE FRESH MARKET. You have the possibility to taste different kinds of tapas, drink fresh juices for 1€, and buy fresh products such as fish, seafoods, fruits & vegetables and spices. A must-visit site in la Rambla :)

Feast for the senses 😀. Well worth a visit - a busy, colourful, vibrant market filled with fresh fruit, veg, meat and fish. I would shop here every week if I lived in Barcelona. Luckily there are plenty sampling opportunities to allow vistors a taste of the market. Loved it!

Amazing food market!. As a fresh food market, this a really great market. You will see alot of fresh seafood, living lobsters, clams etc. Alot of good hams, cheeses and also ALOT of fruit and juices. Would recommend going there for some good juices and to look around if you are intressted in food.The bars and bocerias are probably a bit more expensive compared to alot of other good places in Barcelona, and the service is a bit hectic at some of them.

Unimaginable crowds. A must see but be prepared for bone crushing crowds..A great place to take photos, as the colors of candy, produce, meat, spices,and fish is spectacular..Very hard to get close enough to vendors to actually buy something....so eat lunch elsewhere.Also, very little seating if you do plan to put a picnic together.Wonderful prices on Spanish Saffron..so be sure to stock up on that.

Great - And Always Very, Very Busy!. This gigantic centrally located market off the Ramblas is busy beyond believe and no matter how many of these you may have seen in your travels, this is bigger. The crowds, especially near the main entrance, are huge, locals ship there as well as tourists, and we were there off season! The locals know, and my wife was told in her cooking class, to migrate towards the shops towards the rear where the prices are cheaper. You can buy everything from specialty candies to a whole octopus, from prepared sandwiches to vegetables and fruit you will not find at home. The quality and presentation of the produce and fish and meats and everything else is better than any market, from Budapest to Rome, we had ever seen.

Overhyped. It's cool...I mean, I get the popularity of this place but then i dont. It's a big open air indoor market with lots of tourists. Lots. I've been to markets like this before but I'm just not impressed by it. Because it's located right in the center of all the tourist activities, I think it's one of the reasons some of the prices weren't as I expected it to be. You can find some good deals but they are mostly priced for the suckered tourists. Also, markets like these usually provide samples...but none here. I guess you can ask each one of them but all the vendors seemed too busy to assist you.If you don't know what you want to eat, come here so you have a variety of options. There are tons of meat vendors, fruit stands, breads, a descent seafood section, and bit of everything else in between. There arent very many sit down bars and if you find one, it's super crowded with limited seating. So you literally have to stand behind someone eating and watch them uncomfortably consume their meals while you stare at them. But even the food they serve you are not that well priced. For a market like this in a non tourist area, you'd spend at least half of what they would charge here. So yes, you come for the experience but be mindful of the prices so you don't hurt your wallet too much. And be ready to fight the crowds.
Busy but a must see. This markets are beautiful. Could get lost in their for hours! Beautiful juices, lollies, chocolate and more! Great atmosphere but is it quite busy so be prepared.

Typical touristic market. Yes, there is a good variety of fruits, vegetables, meats, fish and condiments available, but you pay dearly for them.An interesting and good pastime on a rainy day, perhaps.

Fun market with great food and worth exploring. It is just a great and fun place. stores selling all kind of fruits, sea food and meats.
