You can buy every part of the animal such as tongue, feet, balls etc. You need to try sea food stall in the back of the market. sit on the bar stool and order all kind of sea food with some whine. Great experience.,

My FAV place in Barcelona!. COLOURFUL, lively, lots to see, eat and buy!My FAV PLACE for breakfast. .. Un cortado and a xuxo at the Bar Pinotxo... sitting at the counter... next to Juanito 's side where the espresso machine is. Lots of locals and tourists alike! CanNOT be missed!!!Cafe con leche... or a cortado (cappucino) and a melt in your mouth cream-filled pastry, which is to die for... called a xuxo.. pronounced chucho.

Great market. Heard lots about the market but also that it would be so crowded. Decided to have a wander through and just the smells (some good, some bad) and the colours were amazing. Definitely somewhere I would frequent (in the mornings) if I was a resident here. We passed through the market to a couple of streets away from las ramblas (as recommended by our tour guide) and decided to grab an ice cream on our walk back through; go for the snickers flavour!

Nice colourful market. This market is situated right on La Ramblas. We found it hard to get a seat at any of the food stalls within the actual market and there were always people standing behind the people on the stools eating waiting for their seats.Great market to buy meat, cheese, fruit, fresh juice, have something to eat/drink etc. We ended up eating at one of the places within the markets that is around the outer area of the market but still within the complex. Has a nice atmosphere. Worth a visit

Most amazing market I have ever seen. I love visiting local markets and taking photographs - this blew my mind! The most amazing displays of produce - fruit, fish, nuts, candy, even eggs! If you need to snack - this is the place. The prices seemed amazingly reasonable for fresh, fresh produce. A must see place.

Amazing market. Visited here on my birthday this year as had seen it on a map just off Las ramblas walkway. The stalls are packed with fresh produce and the smells were good! Little tapas bars located inside also and the fish stalls were nothing like you would see inside the supermarkets in the UK! We had seen a Rick Stein cooking programme done here before in the past and he said it was great to. Would recommend a visit here if you are passing as it's a fun bussling place.

An amazing place!. This is a must see market, especially if you're on a self catering holiday! You can buy anything; meat, super fresh fish and shell fish, herbs, vegetables, pastrys, cake, fruit and sweets! And it's all well priced and affordable. As a vegetarian I could have done a whole weeks shopping here for a reasonable price and had a feast every day. I highly recommend dropping by, even if all you want is a slice of cake and some of the freshest fruit juice you'll ever try.

You have to see this market . I was told about this market by a friend and as it was close to the hotel, I decided to go on a Saturday morning. I didn't think it would be that much to look at. I was wrong. We spent about 3 hours there, amazed by the vibrant freshness and variety of what was on offer. It's an attraction its self. Although super busy, it's not stressful as people are understanding and not pushing or rude. The fruit juices were to die for!!

A necessary stop in barcelona. an old market. some very professional traders.A lot of fruits, fishes, cheese and meat. Chocolate and sweets. A noisy place in the heart of the city. An extraordinary old market.

Beautiful active vibrant. Amazing variety of fresh organic produce and meats, eat in cafes and pubs. Although tight of an evening ot adds to the atmoaphere. Be aware of personal belongings at all time as this is a pickpockets paradise. So far my favorite fresh produce market in europe.

A must see attraction. Every type of food immaginable is sold here. The crowds are huge and the activity is non stop. Strolling and looking are free. If you make a purchase be sure to know the price before making the transaction. There is a lot of jostling so keep your valuables tucked under your outer cloths.

This is a REAL and important market - you just need to get past the first few rows to explore. Although the Boqueria is packed with tourists and the first rows of stalls on all sides near the entrance focus on tourists.. don't make the mistake of thinking this is a tourist market. This is definitely a thriving "real" market which is frequented by chefs and other locals. You can also have some exceptional food if you look for some of the bars and other small eateries (well past the entrance). There is even a school based in the market (yes this is catering to tourists :)
What you need? . The question is what you need. Then you would almost answer your question in terms of food here. One should go there and see the real Bazar.

Crazy!. Everything in this market is gorgeously arranged, Like a drawing.My advice is to go as early as possible because it gets very crowded.Make sure to buy one of the fruit drinks they're offering for 1 €.I don't know about the other prices, because I do not eat most of the stuff that were offered there, but I enjoyed the experience!

Expensive. Food is gorgeous but so ridiculously over priced!! 15 euros for a bowl of mushrooms. !!fruit drinks are amazing!! Marzipan sweets were 5 euros each! Didn't see one get sold! Great atmosphere though

Heaven on Earth. Vibrant, buzzing, inviting: fresh fruits, vegetables, fish and sea-food, Spanish jambon, great variety of tapas.Staying in the area while in Barcelona, I visited the market every day having there breakfast or a snack, or just drinking a glass of wine in one of the tapas-bars around the market.I loved it, as busy as it is, and for a foodie like me, it was a heaven on earth. I recommend to visit it in the morning, because later in the day it becomes over-crowded.

Non-Stop Energy. My best advice is to go early, when chefs and locals are selecting their specials for the day. If you're shopping, following the locals will lead you to the freshest vendors. If you're watching, you'll get an eyeful of the best, brightest, and most alive. But it's a heady experience at any time of the day, and definitely a highlight on La Rambla.
Over priced and for tourists. Except for the fish and meat section the rest is pretty over prices especially the sweet and fruit and cooked food/tapas stands! There are better markets.

Nice market. If you don't like crowded area's you should avoid the market. But if you don't mind, go!! This is a traditional food market with fruit and vegetables, Meat and fish and bread. The area in the back is cheaper then in the front.

Eclectic, crowded and lively market. The market is located in the very busy street of La Ramlas. The market in itself is very busy and crowded. There are tons of different stands in the market from seafood to fresh meat to fruits to nuts, even wine. Tons of option but it could get very overwhelming with the tight crowd.

An eye-opener.... This place had it all from fresh fruit to fresh animal heads!!There was a really beauty in all the vibrant colours of not just the fruits but the spices, nuts and fish!Of course if you're not a fan of the smell of fish, crowds of people or seeing every part of a pig for sale then keep your attention focused on the bits you do like!It was something a bit different for me (where I live there isn't such a market its all supermarket shopping) and I thoroughly enjoyed wandering around and tasting some of the produce available!

Fantastic Traditional Food Market. We discovered this market from a side street when wondering around the lane ways that meander off Las Ramblas. And what a market this is, it is best one I have encountered in Europe. It has a myriad of fresh produce stalls, these included: seafood, fresh and cured meats, fruits, vegetables, nuts,olive oil etc. Additionally, there are many places to grab tapas and freshly cooked food and drinks. I saw a cooking lesson going on and many groups of people enjoying the atmosphere. This is a must see when in Barcelona! Do yourself a favor and check this place out!
Colourful market. Free to visit. That's a plus on its own. Love the colourful fruits displayed for sale. Not particularly fond of the crowds but still worth a visit.

An unbelievable array of wares!. The St Josep de la Boqueria Market is just off the Ramblas (on your right heading towards the sea) - an amazing array of wares - you could spend an hour or more just walking round this market.It is huge! We found it amazing that there was so much variety and all so well-displayed.Wonderful colours and smells, and the sellers were often real characters.Such a difference from the run of the mill supermarkets - everyone should experinece this sort of market at least once! A must-see of you ar ein Barcelona.

Interesting to visit. But unless you have a kitchen not much to buy. Can't ship raw meat or veggies home. Cooked for mostly overpriced for the tourists. Was interesting to see all the different products. Colorful & busy.
Good but hectic! . Brilliant market but just so busy and hectic! Mercat de santa catarina is better as it's got the same things but is cheaper and only locals go there.

An authentic slice of Barcelona. A charming, rustic market located in La Ramblas, this is a place to get your fresh fruits, juices, mushrooms and most especially all kinds of ham. You can even buy ham to go from any of the food vendors.
Crazy fun. This place is awesome, so much food and stuff. If you do not care for fancy restaurants they have fantastic fresh and yummy food for all 3 meals - seating is limited though.

Congested and Over Whelming. We were told we must go the market. It was very over crowded and packed like a NYC subway. All I could think of holding onto my husband's wallet. Some of the vendors were impolite to people who wanted to take photos which is not very tourist friendly. We ate at one of the restaurants that offered seafood (which I happen to adore) within the market on the inside perimeter and it was awful, over sized portion and very under cooked ... I wouldn't give it to a cat! Tourist trap indeed ... at least there was no charge to try to go in and observe and get out quickly.

VERY PRICEY!!!!!. I went to this place as was a must to visit according to everyone. To start, is soooo crowded, you cant even move!!!!! Fruits and vegetables are over priced.... they have the "fruit juice" for 1 euro at must fruterias but is so small you drink it in 2 sips.In addition, I got a couple of grapefruits and pommegranates and both were expensive and too acid!!! Just not what I expected.I went for lunch at one of the places they offer fresh sea food, and got an octopus a la gallega that was TINY for "16 EUROS!" way too expensive!!!!! If youre in Barcelona, there are many many other amazing restaurants to try that are cheaper and nicer... less crowded and more authentic.

I wish a market like this could be near my own apartment. - Somewhat expensive- Great variety of products, particularly in terms of fruits and seafood- Found some of the items a little off-putting/exotic (horse meat... including whole horse heads)- Note that a lot of stalls close starting at 4pm

You are there .. why not visit !!. and once you visit, you will not be disappointed... The energy and colors of the market will get you excited... i was lost as to what to try and what not to .... The prices vary from shop to shop , so better go around and see for yourself.. there are lots of tourists.. so anyway its going to a little pricey... but I don't mind when you are exploring ... I wish I had a market like that near my city...

Loved this market!. Loved this market a lot. It was pointed to us by one of the friends who was in Barcelona previously and we didn't regret visiting it! It has all sorts of tasty goods to try - fresh vegetables, meats, vegetables, etc! Really nice and rasty experience!

Fabulous!!!!!!. The Boqueria is amazing and certainly worth a visit. Try the tapas or food from one of the other stalls. The fish market is FANTASTIC. I cannot express in words hoe enchanted I was with every aspect of the market. The stall holders are real characters with immense belief in their produce.

Bustling market. We visited this market twice, once on our first evening in Barcelona when we just stumbled upon it almost at closing time, and the second time for lunch.It is a very busy place and all the marvellous produce is displayed attractively. It is however quite expensive. We bought a single medium sized mango for over 5 euros!We had a plate of sea food for two at 60 euros which my husband loved. However, it was hell getting seats at the bar as pushy people come and just grab the seats as they become vacant, regardless of how long we had been waiting there being no order.If you like markets, then go. It is only a market and has numerous food stalls. If you're aim is merely to shop there is a Carrefour supermarket on Las Ramblas which is a lot cheaper and you avoid the masses of tourists.

Beautiful, colourful market but expensive . Massive selection of seafood, meat, poultry, pastries, olives, cured meats sausages.....but my favourite is the mushrooms...WOW the selection was eyes opening.....a must see & do but beware, expensive
A Must Visit. The market is so vibrant and such great produce on offer. Its in a really unusual location tucked away between buildings on a shopping street!
Great ambience and food. You could spend hours here if it weren"t so crowded all the time. My fav spot is a place that serves basque chicken kebabs. Yum!
Boqueria.. Un-be-lievable! There is no where else on earth like the Boqueria. Make sure you bring your camera. If you have time, have lunch there as well.

Bustling markets of La Boqueria - a must see!. We visited these markets on a Saturday as part of our coach tour. What a fantastic kaleidoscope of food all under one roof! There was a huge range of seafood, meats, pastries and other tempting delights! A fun atmosphere where you could sample the wares and just have a really different experience. No visit to Barcelona would be complete without visiting these famous markets.

Bustling colourful food market. Situated just off la rambla this is in the busiest part of the city but it's vibrancy is part of the appeal. Visit around lunch time and enjoy some fresh seafood and a glass of wine sat on one of the bar tools

Impressive colors and food options!. This seems more like a tourist market so I have no clue about how fair the prices here are, but if you like looking around this is a great place. Lots of colors and curious food options (both raw and cooked). A bit less crowded in the evening and might be lucky to get some special offers (we bought 3 empanadas for 5 eur, while normally each was 2.5).

An Eatable Landmark. A bustling engaging, landmark market for both locals and tourists. Cannot wander the aisles without buying something. But best of all are the counters, and the offerings of an array of fresh seafood. Belly up to one of several counters. (we like the one just to the left of the entry) No bargains. but this is Barcelona. So suck up the oysters, crack the crabs, drink the beer, and by the way, watch your wallet here and in the area. (I thwarted one attempt) .

A bit of disappintmen. I went there with a friend of mine and expected better food and service. Merchants were rude, unhelpful and their merchandise not very fresh. We bought fried sea food from a lady and it tasted like it was several days cooked. I believe it could be a quickie visit but not much to expect.

Great sights and smells. A great place to just take in the sights and smells of the market. At first i was sceptical, i thoight it was a tourist trap, but there was so much fresh fruit, fish and other things to try, buy and be awed about. A must to visit and if nothing else, buy a fruit smoothie for justna euro

Fun, fresh and as varied products as audience. Except for the opera/theater, this is the only place worth a visit on Las Ramblas. Everything from snacks to oysters to lunch to nuts and smoothies and butchers products and fruits and ... cava of course. Intense colours, smells, people.(Next door there's a good enough wok restaurant for those who need to feed kids with chicken and rice after being overwhelmed by the sheep heads and cow tongues.)

don't miss it. This market is a don't miss-the variety and quality of the food is amazing. Try to go early when it is just opening and the vendors are setting up their stalls-it is less crowded besides being a great place to grab breakfast.

Original Market. What can i say apart form if you are in barcelona you must go and visit this famous market, it is a fantastic experience.The fresh produce will just amaze you... go and smaple the fresh food, choose your own food and they will cook it for you. Seafood is so fresh you can taste and smell the freshness of the sea.The smel of the Iberico hams is just amazing ..... not cheap but do taste before you leave.Although it is a very very busy tourist place and crowds of people be careful as i am sure pickpockets are around so do take care.

A Spectacle Well Worth Visiting. Tourists abound this action packed market. Enjoy all sorts of different tapas from the massive selection of fruits, veggies, meats, fish, fresh pressed juices, baked goods and more and more...A great way to spend a few hours immersing yourself in the Catalan food culture.

Burst of colours . Reach the market and get enthralled by why Spain is probably the most vibrant country in Europe.... the spices are hung up, iconic eateries where the chef doesn't have a menu, only what was the best catch of the day will be served... gorgeous!

A must do when in Barcelona. We visited markets in Madrid, Sevilla and San Sebastián, but none compared to this one in Barcelona. The colors and smells of this magnificent city can be all found in this historic market where you can buy fresh cheeses, fruit, cold cuts, meats, seafood, fish, candy, spices, juices, and much more. Or you can just visit for the beautiful sights and smells.
Wonderful. Fabulous. Loved the colour, variety and bustle. Def worth a visit. Kids really enjoyed it. Can be a little pricey but worth it as everything is so fresh and great quality.
Very busy but nice. Its small but very nice and worth to buy some fresh juices/fruits. There are other meat or seafood products too.
Must go. Its a tourist hot spot but its a must visit. The food and the shops are great and at a very reasonable price.

Taste Barcelona without paying a lot for silly-expensive restaurants!. Barcelona has many local restaurants that are worth visiting but they are very expensive for the quality they are offering because of the millions of tourists. You may simply enjoy the local tastes at this very vivid and unique marketplace with a piece of freshly baked loaf in your hand, buying delicious cheeses, fried fresh seafood or grabbing tapas, while smelling the unique air around, full of mediterranean aromas. A must-see place when you may visit every day for a quick and exceptionally tasty breakfast or lunch.

So much to see!. I had my favourite meal in Barcelona here. Seafood was AMAZING and reasonably priced and we just went hoping from stall to stall and they were all good. Also bought some iberico ham from a butcher and after trying some my companions immediately decided to buy packs of it home. There were also stalls selling juices, fruits, nuts, vegetables, raw meats and seafood, candies etc. Overall a great experience not to be missed.

Best market in the world. I love markets of all sorts, but this one tops everyone I have ever seen. It is a mass of food, from potential eats for starting a meal to desserts. here are wines of every type, nuts and dates from all over the world, fruit of every description, including some I could not identify. Go there and be prepared to be overwhelmed.
Overrated . It was a nice market with lots of different things to see and eat. But it was packed with tourists. We preferred other market like Sant Antoni Market than this one.

A Barcelona must-see!. A Barcelona must-visit, if only to grab a fresh juice (the mango-papaya was fantastic). I'd read that the market is a bit dirty, with pools of fishy water and detritus, but we visited both early and late and that was not our experience. Be prepared for throngs of people--but even when it was busy, the vendors were patient and friendly. Tip: If you want to buy little decorative tins of Spanish paprika to bring back for friends, don't buy here. Stop at the Carrefour market at the top of Las Ramblas and get exactly the same brands for a third of the price.

A great journey of the senses. Every turn was exhilarating as we weaved our way through the markets and tasted delicacies of all kinds. The atmosphere was fantastic and there was so much to see and take in. A wonderful culinary eexperience

Great market in the heart of the city. Great market - masses of fresh vegetables, fruit, juices, meats, cheeses. Full of tourists but definitely don't miss this. And go hungry so you can taste and enjoy the food options available.

a visual and gastronomic treat - don't miss it. This is great for the foodies - we had freshly squeezed dragon fruit and kiwi juice, fresh oysters, strawberries in chocolate kebabs, fresh prawns and delicious ham. Fantastically vibrant - but watch your purse/handbag as it's asy to be distracted by the goodies on display. Best place to buy all the ham and cheese to take home - incredibe, fruit, vegetables, meat and fish - an absolute must do

Fantastic Experience!. This is a huge market with an incredible variety of items on display--everything from Jamon to fresh seafood to paella to flowers to fruit. It's especially active on Saturdays--which is when my husband and I were fortunate enough to wander in. What an experience! We spent at least 2 hours wandering around, eating and enjoying the afternoon. Highly recommended.
AMAZING. One of the most awesome places in Barcelona. Great variety of things to eat and drink, a must see once in Barcelona! :)

This is a must. Great experience if you like markets. Always visit them in any city we travel to. Clean and without unpleasant smells. Beautiful displays, plenty of fruit. Lots of great little eating places. Try Universal Kiosk, seafood to die for. Great service, super prices and delicious food. Very fun expenience.

Don't miss it while strolling on La Rambla. This is not just a market, it is an experience, a place full of fresh produce, full of energy and buzz. Let the crowd drive you through the stalls, enjoy a cold fruit drink or a freshly cooked meal. Yeah it is busy, but the colours, the food, the displays are worth it. Enjoy!!!

Impressive. These markets are impressive. Huge variety of stalls from fresh fish, meat, fruit and veg, eggs and you can't go past the Jamon and chorizo stands. Beautiful displayed produce, fresh fruit juices chilled and lots of standing bars to eat there
A feast for the belly. You can find great deals here - on saffron, seafood, fruit juices, candied nuts, figs, etc. But it gets very crowded. Beware of pickpockets.

So crowded, we could hardly move!. As we walked up Las Ramblas, we came upon this market. We had heard about its reputation as a premier fruit, vegetable and food market and so we decided to pop in for a quick look. On first appearance, it reminded us very much of the Central Market in our home town.Any hope of venturing too far into the market was stymied by the fact that “the world and his wife” were visiting whilst we were there and it was almost impossible to move through the massive crowd. In the end, we just had to make do with the little that we could see through the mass of people and then struggle to make our way out to the exit. It appears that to make the most out of your visit to this market, you have to carefully choose the time of your. From our experience, you should not go there, around lunchtime!
Wonderful fresh fruits, meats, nuts. Fun place!. Love going here for such great variety of fresh produce, fruits, meats, etc. always full of people but worth the crowds.

A Feast for the Eyes but not for the Stomach. Much has been written about this market and for sure it is a place you must see. The food displays are amazing and the energy of the vendors and the customers is wonderful. But ... if you want to enjoy something to eat head to the Santa Caterina market which is close to the cathedral and not far away. There are far smaller crowds in that market and you far more likely to sit and share your seafood with a local resident there and not some tourist from Toronto.
Awesome . Fantastic variety of produce and very reasonable prices. A welcome and refreshing stop about half way up the Ramblas.

A paradise of colors, smells and wonderful foods and drinks. The place to visit, several times!In August was too crowded but still worth every single visit.At the entrance the colors captivate your eyes and you just want to buy everything from vegetables to sweets and dried fruits. The juices are little peaces of heaven! Mango and coconut is the best. But there are others! And boxes of fresh fruit too!A little bit further in the back are little restaurants where you sit around it and you can choose the food to cook and see it being cooked in front of you. And it just smells sooooo good! Visit this Market many times, for your own good!

Great market!. Beautiful market, I make it a point to go visit every market possible... to gauge the culinary culture of a place. This market is wonderful, fresh produce, local for the most part, and several eat-in stalls. We ate lunch and it was fantastic!

Fancy and colorful, although very expensive. There was a very small variety of stalls (although each was copied 4-5 times), the prices are VERY high (except maybe the fruitshakes). Seafood lovers can thrive there though. If you do come, try to do it early as it gets really crowded.

Once you walk inside you might not want to leave.. As the title says this is a market that if you go to Barcelona, you MUST see it. You'll find meats, fruits, drinks, long story short, everything you might need for a good meal, including wine. There are so many kiosks that you might go a bit crazy wanting to go to all of them, so plan to spend at leas 45 minutes in here, we went in and ONE hour later we decided that if we did not leave we would miss other attractions we had planned for the day.

Amazing. Boqueria is a place where you can find everything you need.Fresh fruits,juices,fish,meat,vegetables,sweets and many other tings.If you are walking on Rambla you cannot miss it.And you absolutely must try the fresh juices that you find there.They have many different types so the hardest thing is the choice.If you want to eat,there you can find fresh fish and meat and they cook it there,so is super fresh.Great

Awesome markets! . Don't eat before you go, as there is an infinite supply of food to try! Everything from fresh juices to chocolate, empanadas to tapas, meat and fish to fresh salads. Amazing and a lot of fun but be aware that it can get crowded!
Paradise :). Amazing market. Its great for the eye and the stomach :D There were so many things you could buy! It's worth the visit!

Busy, busy and great sights and smells. Just off the Ramblas, always when we were there very busy, stalls galore and plenty to see. As always in crowded areas of any city, be aware of personnel security, but once you keep this in mind you'll enjoy the atmosphere.

A great market, offering so many different foods.. Such a great place, not far from our hotel, about two thirds of the way up the Ramblas. It is one of Europe's largest and famous markets. Every morning and some afternoons we would walk over to the market to see what fresh fruit, fresh squeezed lemonade, or delicious food we could find. The choices are incredible, something for everyone. Fresh fruit smoothies, delicious crepes (one of the stalls that offer crepes, the chef is known for his entertainment value, as well as the delicious crepes, offering many types - and they are good) Also be sure to check out the baked goods, tapas, fresh vegetables, fruits, cheeses, spices, prepared foods, seafood, meats, candy of all varieties - the list goes on and on. You name it, they seem to have it. It was great place to stop in for a quick tapas, or breakfast or light snack. But the locals shop here also for their seafood, meat, spices, vegetables, fruits. It was great fun, prices of course are excellent. This was our second time to Barcelona and we headed right to this market. It is great for both locals and tourists alike, because of all the food offerings, price, quality and great presentation. A must see. If you don't like the crowds when traveling, travel during a quieter time of year. I would visit this place time and again. And we did. It is worth checking out.

Visit at lunch time and grab some food. Excellent place to go at lunch time to grab fresh and delicious food and feel the atmosphere. We took a table for 11 at the plaza de San Joseph and had the best meal of the week end!

Colorful, alive and fun. Also named La Boqueria, the market dates back to 1200 and has been under some reconstructions to reach today's shape. Many of the salesmen continues their family busnisses according to the market website.Very vivid, full of fruits, sea food, chocolates, buchery goods. We went there twice at nights when the market is closing...you can find some good bargains at that time...the salesmen are homehow generous.There are also some tapas bars inside the market where you can eat.

You should not miss!. Excellent place to shop and eat. The produce are fresh, good quality and cheap - compare to Hong Kong. The shops are honest - except one - 'Fruties Ramona'. They put some bad figs below the good ones. We only found out when we got back to our apartment. This is the only bad experience shopping there.
Fun, loud, colourful market. Fun place to visit especially as a tourist. It's loud, colourful with plenty of choice of fresh produce. Interesting place to sit and have a bite to eat. Lots to see.

Loved it . This market is fantastic. Just of Las ramblas. Mainly fruit veg seafood meat and cheese but with some amazing bars and eateries thrown in. Had a lovely lunch there but thoroughly enjoyed just wandering around. It's really buzzing a really lovely place to visit
Touristic but a must go. It is a touristc place but a place you must go when you are in Barcelona.The place has fruits, chocolates, fishes, restaurants and a lot of fragrances.

Great fun!. This is a great place to visit. Loud and fun, colourful to the eye and a treat for the taste buds.We had fresh sea food here, was excellent but they do try to sell lobster to you even when you've said no several times. Also watch your bill.Fresh fruit, smoothies are excellent, all sorts of food produce here. Eggs, fish, tapas, fruit, meat, veg, cheese, sweets, you name it, it's here.Definately worth a visit, it's very crowded, so be careful with your bags/ wallets.

Overcrowded by tourists. We use to go by our fish there. We still do sometime, but it is dying from its success.If you are going to visit the place, enjoy it! but please don't buy pre-packed fruit bawls, smoothies and other attraction style item. Every time you do, another stall is tempted to stop selling real market products for you. Help us prevent the market from becoming Disneyland. YOU are the one who is going to influence how great that place will be. Otherwise, when only the touristy stuff will remain, you won't want to come either.

Vibrant and exciting. Though I tend to avoid extremely crowded touristy locations when I travel, I love this market. The smell, the variety, the colors, and the noise were all a part of its charm. It was overwhelming, vibrant and exciting. The little food stands/bars inside offered quite a good selection of fresh seafood. How often do you get to eat inside a massive and beautiful market? Definitely try it if you have never before. One thing to keep in mind: front of the market are more for tourists, and the back is where the locals go.

Colorful fruit stands, impressive seafood counter. This indoor food market on La Rambla was extremely busy during lunch hour and every time we passed by there was a crowd of people going in. It was so crowded that we didn’t feel like spending too much time inside. The most memorable thing was the colorful fruit cups standing in slushed ice beds and the fruit smoothies in every imaginable combination. And for fruit candy lovers they had one stand that was just selling loose candy. So this market is really a treat for eye. It is also interesting to go to see the fish counter since Barcelona is big seafood port. They have the freshest fish over here. They also had nice bars for sitting and eating tapas or have a glass of beer. For everyone who comes to Barcelona this is a must visit but I wouldn’t put this as the top attraction.

Wonderful visit. Fabulous place to visit. A feast for the eyes and stomach. Not to be missed whilst in Barcelona.
Wander around with some Catilan speciality to nibble on, and take in the most amazing sights, sounds and smells

Must see in Barcelona! . I don't know why the boqueria doesn't seem to be on the top list of attractions in Barcelona. I think it's amazing to walk through and find some yummy meats, cheeses, fruits, juices, etc. to eat. I would definitely recommend walking around and having lunch there during your trip. Just be warned that it is closed on Sundays!

Eat, Chat and enjoy life. just walking trough the stals , inspired by the lovely smell of fruits and vegetables.having difficulties to decide what to cook : fish , meat ...
Even crowded with tourists , dont miss this place

Very cool and very interesting. This market, just off of La Rambla, is a very interesting place. You can get breakfast, buy a cow's tongue and everything in between. The various merchants sell candy, fish, beef, tripe, meals, etc. etc. etc. For a North American it is interesting just to wander around and watch the life of the city. We loved it.

Extraordinary!. One of the most fascinating places to visit in Barcelona. Every imaginable food is available and you should definitely take advantage of the opportunity to try the offerings. From veggies and fresh juices to eggs; horse meat (!) to every imaginable sea creature and prepared foods galore --- it's all there and all on offer. Many small tapa restaurants and definitely try some of the marvelous Catalan ham/sausage offerings (small bags are 3 euros!. It's hustle bustle, and DO watch out for your wallet and cell phone as the crowds and commotion invite pickpockets of which Barcelona has NO shortage. Don't let that stop you from putting this on your must do list.

Culinary Adventure. Barcelona is such a special city and El Mercat de Sant Joseph was simply amazing. Plenty of delectable culinary treats to satisfy everyone. From seafood, fruit, meats and sugary treats--it's a food lovers paradise. Keep in mind they are closed on Sundays and most of the stands close for a siesta (around 1:00) during the week. This is a must see for any food lover...enjoy!
A battle of the senses!. Really good fun wandering around watching it all happen. Try and snack there, it's worth just watching the show!

My favourite thing to do in Barcelona.. What a place, exceeded my expectations completely. Wonderful to wonder around, amazing food can be brought on the way round and sampled. Thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and I'm sure we'll go back before we leave. Highly recommended.
Lovely market. A very lovely market. Lots of colors and interesting spots. It's a place for a quick bite as well. The Tapa restaurants there looked good but doesn't taste the best.

What a colourful market!. Boqueria market is a must if you are in Barcelona. I have read reviews that the market has lost its originality because of tourists. Sadly, I will never know what it was before but I can tell now that the market is buzzing with all sorts of colourful sweets, food and drinks.It was very busy on the day we went and we could not sit down to eat. There is a variety of fresh goods, tapas and fruit juices and the vendors were helpful and friendly. I was even more happy to see sugar canes, they reminded me of home. You should check this market out, you will not be disappointed!
Must do!. A food lovers paradise.... Eat the right at the counters if you like. Have the fresh seafood, cured meat on a stick, beautiful fruit and blended juice combination. Truly a wonderful place.
Colourful. This market is a must to visit - you can buy everything there. Best time to go is early morning while the stall holders are setting up. Good place to go for breakfast.
A must do in Barcelona. Favourite part of a trip to Barcelona is the market. Sights, sounds and smells are just amazing and some great places for lunchtime snacks

Great place for lunch. The market here is a reasonable size, and even on Mondays when lots of stalls are closed its still bustling. The food is cheap and good quality (in my opinion), but there aren't many places to sit down and eat. Out the back is a seating area frequented by homeless, can't blame them but its not where I'd choose to have a picnic!

Wonderful market and you don't have to be a foodie to appreciate it.. Make sure when you visit this market you have not had anything to eat as you will see so many wonderful foods that you;ll want to try.
worth a quick visit. Lovely Catolonian market - but can be very crowded at times. Best to go very early in the morning and can be too hot in late afternoon summer

Best place to sample the freshest Spanish seafood and culture in Barcelona. La Boqueria Mercat (Market) is one of the few must visit top gems in Barcelona, or if you have not been to the La Boqueria Mercat, your Barcelona trip wouldn't have been completed meaningfully. For the fact that Barcelona is an extremely touristy city with over 180million tourists per year flocking into Barcelona, sad to say that the chances of getting a good tapas of fresh seafood is very unlikely in this city.If not the Galician seafood that you are looking for, La Boqueria Mercat has some of the best Spanish seafood that you can ever find in the entire Barcelona city itself. The food there may be a little bit more costly than the outside restaurant, but the freshness of the seafood and the ambience of the market will certainly justify the sum that you are going to pay. There were many more other stalls selling fresh fruits, veg, meats, spices and local delicacies, or I mustn't forget to mention that this is the right place for you to hunt the best Spanish Jamon (ham). Spanish or in Barcelona city ppl don't practice giving free sample, you have to pay a small fee to buy their ready cut Jamon in a paper cup so that you will know which is the Jamon that you like best to buy.There are just so much more to see in this place from the smells of the food, the colour of the fresh produce and may be also the basic culture of the Spanish way of life if not the authentic one. A must visit!

Great mix of Tourism and Local. When in Barcelona, make sure to always visit this cute market! There is a great variety of foods; fruits, vegetables and fish and meats! It all looks great, and it tastes good too!Generally if you go in to the market further than just the entrance, the prices get lower.It's busier in the weekends, but also more booths are open.. Some close during the week.

Taste of the Barcelona. Colorful place full of everything what's best in Barcelona's and Spains cousine! Everything is def worth trying!It's good to revisit the place just before closing. You can get the food, juices and fruits in better prices then.

Great market with refreshing fruit juice. We visited on a Monday when the fish section of the market was mostly closed but the rest of the market was huge and we enjoyed looking at all the colourful and well presented stalls before deciding what to try for lunch.There are many stalls selling fruit and delicious thick fruit juices, venture to the ones at the side rather than the front since here they are only €1.
Interesting . One interesting market... fruits veges nuts herbs berries fresh juices sandwiches meat jamon seafood...u name it...everything under one roof... must visit when u r here..

So much to see!. Mercat de la Boqueria was another must-see on our 5-day trip to Barcelona. The market was very easy to find since you can't really miss it when walking down La Rambla. The entrance of the market was obviously full of tourists, but "deeper" inside the place it wasn't so crowded. Every little shop was selling amazing, colorful fresh fruits, juices, candy, chocolate, seafood, meat... the prices weren't too high. There were also tapas-style restaurants inside. Definitely a must-see :)

Must visit. It is a unique experience. Not many places that have this busy, abundant atmosphere. Beautiful display of fruits and meats. Pass by the entrance and make your purchases in the back, where you can pay as little as half the price from the front vendors.

Just go . It's pack ed noisy and smelly. So what? Would you miss it Just for that? Throw your Self into this lively confusion, taste a bit of everything, Just cooked fresh on the spot.walk around See the family owned kiosks. It's not a tv show It's real Life stuff.

What a market.. Just look at the photos....WOW. WOW. WOW....If you cant find something to eat here your going to starve...i suggest walling through the hole market before you decide what to purchase and eat.....Buon appetit...
Cured meat. This is the holy grail of cured meats and sausages. I went here every other day while I was in barcelona.

What a market!. This place is busy! But it is full of the most amazing foods at good prices. As soon as you go in try go off down a side lane to avoid the mass of people moving in one direction. Well worth good look around, but do buy something as well!

Make Sure You Are Hungry!. We visited the market twice, the second time to return and buy the wonderful caramelised almonds that had been rolled in sesame seeds. Yum! We also enjoyed the fresh fruit juices on a very hot afternoon, and found these were up to half the price of those on sale in Las Ramblas. This is a wonderful place to photograph colours and characters.

A market like you've never seen before. We turned the corner into this market and our jaws dropped...we love market areas, china town etc but this is one to not be missed! Quantity is one thing but quality another. Every booth is well presented, and there is lots for the stroller in the market to purchase from pasties to fruit to juices to meats!

Food heaven. A wonderful bustling market full of fabulous food at great prices. Don't miss it. You can sit and eat Tapas, et take-away or just buy loads of wonderful goodies especially fish and shellfish.

Great experience ! . This busy and bustling market is just off Las Ramblas. Yet not at all touristy. It has meats, cheeses, fruits , and excellent fruit juices. Strawberry kiwi, coconut, and raspberry were all excellent. And there were several more -at 1 euro each. Closer to the front prices are higher. In fact on a visit around 7.30 pm the juices were being sold at 2 for 1 euro to get rid of that day's stock. Fish, snacks, mushrooms.... Even if constrained by staying in a hotel there is enough variety to ensure something of interest food wise, and in any event, an enjoyable experience. A visit is highly recommended.
One of the great markets. Must see in Barcelona. Amazing range of produce beautifully presented. An outstanding market experience.

Super Market. Great colourful and vibrant market. Just off the Rambla- super place to wander and grab a bit of Tapa. Possibly too close to the tourists but if careful not a problem- just keep a hand on valuables. The vendors are friendly and helpful just an hour is sufficient for a refreshing stop.
Great overall experience!. Good atmosphere, beautiful market and a great place to visit in barcelona. I would definitely come back and try other food and bev once i visit barcelona again.
WOW. Amazing food u have to see it to believe it! Take in all the different smells and colours absolutely wonderful...but very busy!

Colourful, bustling, great atmosphere. We visited twice during our long weekend in Barcelona. we spent an hour here, but could have easily spent more, there is so much to look at and try. We had breakfast here twice, both occasions it was good.
Happy accidental find. Just ran into this wandering around. Terrific food market for anything and a perfect place to grab a quick lunch

A must see! . A must see when in Barcelona! A bustling produce and food market right in the middle of las ramblas. The busiest times are in the morning and then settles down as the day progresses. Pick up some yummy smoked/ cured meats, sausages, cheeses and sweets. Plenty of little bars/restaurants within the market itself mostly focused on seafood. Just remember that the stalls right at the front of the market are going to be more expensive due to higher rent than once towards the back-which are just as good and cheaper! Can be crowded so keep a close eye on belongings.

A Feast for your senses - smells, colour, nice displaying!. It could be a tourist trap as many want to call it, but definitely worth dropping by, wandering a bit through, snacking and taking pictures if you have the time. La Boqueria is a spotless market formally known as the Merkat de Sant Josep de la Boqueria. You won’t see cardboard boxes on the ground, fruit and vegetable peelings, or loose plastic bags. We came upon it almost by chance and were struck by the overwhelming diversity of goods and the overall cleanliness of the place.We thought to skip lunch that day although the meals looked good. Instead we bought several fruit and fresh juice.We marveled at the sheer variety of goods on offer, and noticed that there were several locals buying the produce. The stalls are eye appealing and several benches even offered samples to taste.

Pop in when you walk Las Ramblas.. A real market with locals buying their food here. Stop off for snacks of all sorts from seafood to sweets or buy some Serrano ham, dried mushrooms, spices or other rarities you can't easily get in the UK. Or just wander round and enjoy!!

Fantastic. Visiting this venue is what caused the weight in our suitcases going back to the UK.There are a range of foods and gifts which you can take back as presents. There are stalls that actually vacuum pack various items if you state that you are flying with them.This is one of the cheapest places to shop in Barcelona apart from the large supermarket which is to left off the market on Las Rambles. Do try the smoothies, the ice lollies and cod fish cakes (minus the hot pepper sauce)- full of flavour.Enjoy- but go early morning as you will be stampeded.

Bright, colorful busy market!. In my opinion this market is something not to be missed on a visit to Barcelona, especially as It is off the Ramblas and most people will be walking past it at least a couple of times.It's worth it to just walk through and soak up the atmosphere, definitely a feast for the senses. Good opportunity also to try some local specialities, either from the stall holders, or at the tapas bars and cafes which are all around you.If it's too busy try to get there early morning when it's much calmer. Lunch time is the worst time to go.
Foodie Heaven. Travelled with young teen & loved it! Sites & sounds with plenty of tastings on the way!Worth the visit for fruit juices & mountains of sweets!
pretty touristy. It's one of the biggest tourist traps in the city. In spite of this, it is very beautiful and the prices are almost fair, so it's worth a visit.

Worth a visit for a fruit smoothie. Great food market to wonder around and highly recommend the delicious fruit smoothies. There are stalls that you can sit at and have tapas but the whole place gets very busy and we opted to buy pastries and smoothies to take away.

Hide your camera and enjoy the place.. Hide your camera... open your eyes and breath deeply. Once you get through the tourist crowd, you can enjoy the variety of smells, colours and flavours that this market has to offer. Whatever you need, you will find it here!

Taste of Barcelona. If you're looking to sample local foods, this is the place to visit. They have fresh fruits, baked goods, breads, fresh juices, gelatos, Iberico hams, all kinds of cheeses,etc. The market is kept clean and well ventilated. Come with a empty stomach. Enjoy!

Pretty expensive produce. On our last day in Barcelona we decided to visit the market and buy meat and scallops to make for dinner. Firstly, be warned that if you are after fish you should come early. We were there at about 4:40pm and most of the fish sellers were packing up for the day. We did find scallops, but they cost 10euro for 4 individual scallops..I've never bought them before but it seemed expensive to me.There were many meat stands, but they were also quite expensive. We bought what we had intended to buy, but it didn't cost any less than a good meal at a restaurant would have cost.It is interesting to walk through the stalls though, and they sell some ready to eat food which looked very appealing.

Buzzing market with food around. A real nice place for foodies with colorful fruits, veggies, meat and spices shops selling Mediterranean flavours. Go for a short visit even if you dont enjoy street food. It has easy access from Las Ramblas.

Gourmet visual smorgasbord, massive crowds, fresh produce. It was probably a mistake hitting this place between 12pm and 1pm. The streets were packed on the way, and the market even more so. Everywhere you looked there was fresh food and interesting ingredients...everything the cook would need for a spectacular feast. There were lots of tourists, but also locals. From creative, inventive marzipan 3d figures to all manner of seafood, cheese, fruit, bread and more. The little take away cones of cheese slices, cured meats and salamis, along with the seafood sewers, sent a particular clue that we weren't at home anymore. There was live music and so much to see and experience...definitely worth a visit, although I would suggest trying to find a less crazy time.

Famous, not entierly justified. Very famous landmark in Barcelona, but extremly crowded.
Although not my cup of tee, still worth visiting. If nothing else, it's on the Rambla, so you're virtually on the doorstep of it when walking down this famous street.

Fascinating . At first when you enter the market you are amazed at what they have to offer. All kinds of fresh food, juice bars, meat, fish, vegetables. But my fascination was to finally taste the famous Jamon (ham) so we found eventually a stand that offered it in a paper cup and also had a cups of cheese to complement it. Well it was the best ham ever

The real mediterránea mediterránean food. If you go to Barcelona spain you cant miss this place when we first get in to the market the variety of fruits make lo look the place like a farm in the city .the iberico ham, fresh seafood cooked in front of me . Try shampoo(ice cold beer with lemon soda)the prices are ok.but do not order too much if you dont want a big check

A real market experience. A lively market with lots of different fruits, vegetables, spices, meat and fish. There are many bistros, tapas bars and restaurants in it and don't be afraid to eat at one of them - we tried one at the side and it was fine for a really good price.

A great market!. A very lovely market with tons of food! If you're looking for jamon and all that jazz, this is the place to be, there are quite a few shops selling them so you get to choose what suits you! There were a few tapas/pintxos which were really full. The fried seafood looked so yummy! Went there in the afternoon and there were many stores closed so get there at the right time and you would have lots more choices!
A world of colour & vision. Oh wow! the fruit, the fish, the tapas, the meat cuts...everywhere I looked my eyes feasted on something interesting/beautiful/strange. It was just wonderful.

A Colony of Colour. I was never told about La Boqueria Mercat, but rather stumbled upon it while walking down Las Rambla with my girlfriend.The sheer amount of people coming and going from the main gates (Both Local and Tourists) was astonishing. And Upon entry we saw why. It is simply a local market.... but so much more. The fresh juices, Sweets, Meats, Gifts, etc present an array of colour throughout the aisles.It was one of the few places in Barcelona that i felt like i was among the locals, and not just another tourist.A must see. :)

Wonderful Authentic Experience. It's a special food street market right in the middle of Las Rambles. Should you wish to taste real authentic goods of Barcelona well this is the place to be. Fruits,meat, Fish & sea food, juices & cocktails, spices, candies, chocolates and nuts etc... you may either buy your requirements or also have them done and eaten there on the premises. You can't just visit without buying nor tasting anything. An authentic experience not be missed.

A must visit for food lovers!. This was on our list of things to do from the start and I'm so glad we were able to visit. We wandered up and down the stalls buying seafood , pasties, fresh fruit juices, gifts of homemade nougat and sweets - gutted I couldn't bring home any of the cheeses!!!I recommend getting their early as we hit it at lunch time and it was packed! My only regret is that we didn't get to sit at the 'bar stool type' restaurants scattered inside. The food looked immense but they were always full with a crowd waiting behind!!

Better than the Sagrada Familia. Visiting the Boqueria market is a must. We go very regularly to buy particularly fish and mushrooms but also meats of all sorts and then eat at one of the restaurants in or near the market.The shellfish stalls are amazing but watch out for prices if you are a foreigner.You are just off the Ramblas so watch out for pickpockets and don't pull out your wallet or wads of notes- pickpockets patrol the Ramblas. Never buy a drink in the Ramblas bars- prices are extortionate and again get bumped up if you are foreign. Eating and drinking just one street in from Las Ramblas is rewarding in price and quality.Walk all the way down from Plaza Catalunya to the old harbour via the Boqueria. There are also decent Indian restaurants along the side streets near the Boqueria.Great way to spend a morning.

A Must-See In Barcelona. I just happened up La Boqueria in Barcelona. It is a large covered market that also has restaurants where you sit at the bar and order your food and eat there. When I was there in April it was very busy for lunch and I had to wander around and wait for people to leave. Lots of places served seafood, which is what I ordered, as well as wine. Absolutely delicious and a great way to meet and talk to other diners.

Gastronomic experience. Every time my wife and I were hungry we took the underground and went here. It's so much fun.Beautiful on the eyes and stomch.We loved it. Don't be attempted to buy in the front stores.Much cheaper inside

A feast for your senses. One of the mots fascinating places I've ever been, full of colors, aromas and wonderful people. You can taste the famous Spanish ham which is absolutely magnificent and also you can eat whatever crosses your mind. One advice, don't go there if you are hungry!

Just get it and buy everything you love.. Sea food? Yes. Candy? Yes. Something else on your mind? Yes. You can find probably everything what every market should has. Prices are high for luxury seafood, but you can find great bargains as well!

The freshest food to eat in Barcelona. This was the most beautiful market we have ever visited. It has a large variety of fruits, meats, and vegetables in addition to prepared foods. We bought a pint of large figs for 2 Euros, and they were delicious. One can order freshly cooked seafood to eat at the counter, and I could have done so every day, instead of going to restaurants where one is unsure if the shellfish had been previously frozen.

Very crowded. It is a great market if you are looking for fresh fish, fruits and a bite to eat. It is just very crowded with locals trying to shop and tons of tourists. The fresh fruit juices are great, just about 1euro but stay away from the prepared fried seafood unless it is hot. We got a mixed seafood cone and while it was only 5euros, the seafood was soggy and not crispy at all. Ordering at the tapas bar is a better bet. Good to go through once just to see what the hype is all about.

Fascinating and colourful. My first time in this type of dry markets and i must say I was dumbstruck! It was full of colours and very vibrant, people enjoying their dinner. They have almost everything...chocolates oh the chocolates. In many different colours and shapes. Varieties of churros too. They close pretty early ard 9pm i think. So make sure you get there bfr that. It is located very near the Metro too.

Great place but a little crowded. We went to the market with my gilfriend to buy some fresh fish for lunch. It was very crowded, which is normal for being so close to La Rambla. We got the fish very cheap, but we also got to try some raw oysters and bought some sausages to bring home. All in all, it is a very happy and lively place and I think it is definitley worth a visit.

Such and amazing market. Food everywhere!. Great market. The fresh food and produce plus tons of excellent hams You can grab tons of little bits from most of the stalls for a few euros. I suggest you go early verses later in the day as some of the stalls close down. We went at 5:30pm and many had closed but still we were overwhelmed with all the amazing food. Highly recommend the El Rambulera. Fresh seafood and good prices. Be careful though to not over order. The staff will help you get a bar stool but will quickly show you the lobster that you should buy!

Amazing experience!. Best market I have seen anywhere! The displays are awesome. Why eat in one of the tourist restaurants 2 mins away when you have this on the doorstop. I got there at 12noon and waited a minute for a seat at Pinotxo Bar near the front. Sat in front of the fresh langoustine (small lobster) still alive! Not for long! I ordered chickpeas and grilled langoustine. The waiter said this was a good 'breakfast"! After dropping into a liquid, I guess anaesthetises it, it is covered in the grill for a few minutes then cut in half for final grill. Meantime the chickpeas came and were so tasty. The langoustine was perfection. Use your fingers! They give you a wipe. Other food selections seemed just as good! Mushrooms, grilled peppers, ox tail stew, sausages, steak. No real menu just ask! Walking around I could sample Spanish ham with or without chips. Fresh dates with chocolate or nuts. I then found the oyster man and had the largest, sweetest oysters for 2.50€ each. Fresh fruit in cups and juices are everywhere as are fresh made icy poles. Try the fig juice it is quite nice. Wandering the stalls is fascinating. It can be crowded around entrance stalls but most people seem to do a few at the front and leave. Don't get that! So push past and visit stalls in the middle and back. More sit down eateries at back! Think I will go for "breakfast" again tomorrow! Enjoy!

A must have in your Barcelona visit. A must to see, in Barcelona. Plenty of color, with exotic fruts pyramid, take the time to drink a fresh fruts juce or cocktail, you can also eat fruts, iberic ham or buy freh fish or other traditionnal spanish product.

You can buy most of the souvenirs and delicacies in here!. This is by far the largest market we went to during our holiday in BCN. We went to most of the markets in the guide books. However there are larger markets elsewhere in other places in the world like Hong Kong etc.The variety in here is staggering but the smells can be quite off-putting. There are a couple of flies, fruit flies and one wasp that we spotted. Lots of litter on the floor too with lots of wet/damp puddles and ditches. Be careful with your step & there are plenty of pickpocketers around for sure. It is definitely not the worse market I've been too and there are plenty of them elsewhere in the world which are worse and offends your nose!The food can be quite cheap if you want to walk around and have a sample of some jamon, fruit, cheese, bread, sweets etc. We bought two burritos which were bloody awful. I guess its just luck. The juices look refreshing and are only 1euro each.We shopped around a fair bit looking for the best price for chorizos and iberico de bellota etc. We bought a fair bit of iberico de bellotta in the form of ham, sausages, chorizos etc. I didn't get any manxego though as I was afraid that it would stink up my luggage bagsThe fresh produce like vegetables, fish and meat, eggs and cheese looked really good and I wished that we were self-catering at times during the holiday so that we could buy and cook up the fresh seafood.We walked past the market a couple of times, and alot of the stalls were actually shut on National Day of Catalonia.
Nice market. Nice market. Good food. The best fresh fruit juices ever. The only disadvantage is that is very crowded... due to the best food at very good prices

Barcelona's best market. If you can visit only one market then the La Boqueria is one you should pick. The produce in the market reflects Barcelonian culture with the varied fruits, meat, vegetables, cheese and even cooked food. We bought our Spanish sausages, olive oil and they were really good. With over 200 stalls in the market you will be occupied for at least two hours or more.

Excite your senses. :). The beauty in this place is inexplicable. I couldn't help but wonder how much time the vendors spend to achieve such lovely patterns and color arrangements.This market is off the street of Las Ramblas, so be careful not to miss it.And, there's a Dunkin Donuts right at the exit. Sweet!

Disappointing. I would have liked to stay here longer but when we entered someone was begging.. this is a distraction as when the man you believe is a poor soul has your attention someone else attempts to dip your pocket. The actual market stalls are so vibrant and it would probably have been amazing to go in and out for hours.. so if you do go here leave all your valuables in your hotel. Similarly to Las Ramblas I do not have any photos as I was scared to go into my bag. It's a shame as I would have liked to spend my afternoon being nosy and interested here.
A must see....you will not be disappointed!. It is just absolutely amazing. A feast for the eyes and senses. Don't even think about going, just GO!!!!

Just fantastic!!!!!. When I entered the market I said "Wow!!"There were soo many things you could buy!!Jamon,cheese,fruits,vegetables,snacks,tapas,juices and everything you possibly imagine!!For a must go!!!!
Lovely food. A beautiful old market, but I do wonder how much it is just for tourists now. Lots of lovely things to look at, and to wonder who on earth pays 200 Euros for a leg of ham!

Very clean and neat market. You'd be amazed with the level of cleanliness of this market shared by more than 100 retailers and visited by thousands of visitors everyday.The quality of the fresh produce (fruits, juices, hams, sweets, meat....) will amaze you as retailers replenish their stock on daily yet hourly basis.I would have loved hanging in such a location only if my country had such a nice and clean market.Must visit !
Love it. Beautiful market! Their food looks amazing and inexpensive. This is not tge only market in the city. Each neighborhood has at least one. It is a very Catalan tradition!:-)

Spanish food . LA Boqueria is a great market, so lively, colourful and interesting. There are so many things you can try there to eat. Having been to Mercado San Miguel in Madrid, I was expecting the same but this is different. It's more of a market and the places that serve food specifically are very expensive and absolutely not worth it. If you want to wander around and try bits and pieces without sitting down for a meal, then it's ok. Great range of things to look at.

Exciting food marked with a wide range of Spanish hams, olives and cheeses. Exciting food market with a wide range of traditional Spanish hams , olives and cheeses .The selection is great , but it's important to get hand-carved including ham and cheeses . and do not buy the goods that are packaged . Some of these have been in the heat for a while and has lost his taste wise.The atmosphere is outstanding, but beware of pickpockets .Knowledgeable people working there , and they take all major credit cards .Recommended .

You'd love it if you like food. Very lively market. Many stalls where you can have very fresh seafood with excellent bargains. Also lots of fruits, juices, and to buy Jamon. Even the locals come here.

Delightful, sprawling, bustling, comprehensive, must-see. We visited the market every day during our week-long stay in BCN and only sampled a fraction of the wares on offer. The best that I had was the Pita Falafel from a stall called 'Organic Barcelona'. I'm a thoroughbred carnivore but this vegetarian meal in a tray was one of the most filling things I've ever eaten, and set me up for 8 hours of solid walking and adventuring through Barcelona. Seriously delicious, functional food!Throughout the market you'll find an almost unlimited range of sweets, treats, meats, cheeses, juices, smoothies, pastries, chocolate, hams, etc. etc. with only a few repetitions from stall to stall. One of our favourites was the variety of coconut blend juices. Situated directly on La Rambla, you'd be mad not to go here at least once!

Wow. All the vendors have fresh fruits and veggies. Candy and chocolate vendors are there to make you fat haha.Seafood market was insane .It was a great experience .Wish I could have that type of market in Miami.

Food. A very good place to sample the best food of Barcelona at a reasonable price. Seafood, ham, fresh fruits are plentiful with many good offers available. Fresh fruits cut up €1. Fresh fruit juice €1. Sandwiches €2. It's just a great place for lunchtime snacking on different foods available.

EXCELLENT. DO NOT MISS IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!Practically you can find almost everything here!, but the best and freshest seafood can be found here, plus the variety!; also meats, hams, cheeses, fruits, just made fresh juices, etc., etc. We walked around the market and its vendors, but because it was our first time we decided to sit at a small restaurant in the perimeter gantry/porch. The Mercado perimeter is full of small restaurants that sit in the covered gantry/porch of the buildings that enclose it.  Do not miss the "navaja", its shell/conch looks like a barber razor; great flavor!

One of my all time favourites!. I don't know where to begin! I love visiting the Mercat de Sant Josep!! It literally is a foodie heaven, everything from meats, fish cheeses and a huge selection of fresh fruits! It's great to just wonder around and sample different tastes and flavours and be devoured by the atmosphere. Definitely a must for every foodie in Barca.

Fantastic . So worth the visit, full of fresh produce. Busy but buzzing atmosphere. Try a slice of pizza from the pizza stall (beautiful) there are lots of little tapas stall but unfortunately they get very busy and not many stools to sit on to eat. Lovely little Chinese stall selling wok noodles yummy!!

Barcelona Market . If you have time this market at the top end of La Rambla is well worth a visit..the display of wares from fish to cheeses to Meat and Hams ..spices and nuts is wonderful to top it off we had a magnificent lunch at one of the bars which was doing a roaring trade. Fresh Cod with a slice of aubergine Tomato and pepper ..freshly prepared.

UN-FREAKING-BELIEVABLE . This is my first time here and many friends and family that have been in Barcelona before told me that I should not miss it... And now I know why.Me and my husband are from the hospitality industry from the culinary department specially... We could not believe our eyes!!! I think that we tried something from every single stand!!! It's not possible to just choose one thing to eat!!!This is a place you cannot miss if you are in Barcelona and specially if your are a foodie!!!

Surprising market. We thought it might've been a tourist market but surprisingly the prices weren't too bad for a lot of cured meat and cheese that we bought - similar to a local market where we were staying. We heard El Quim stall was very good for tapas but it was packed so we didn't get to try it
Too crowded. The Market was quite lively and I love a good market. However, it was a little too crowded for me and a little manic.

Amazing but overcrowded. This is an incredible food market, colours, smells, fresh produce - sensory overload. It does get really busy and I am glad to hear that there will be a limit / special times for large tourist groups because they make it very difficult for locals and other tourists to get around.

Astounding colours!. This is one of those wonderful places you stumble in on off the beaten track. Vibrant colours, amazing food, well presented and friendly people abound. I'll definitely be back again.

Quite an experience!. Busy bustling market situated off Las Ramblas. Eye catching, colourful stalls selling all types of produce, including fresh meat and fish towards the back of the market. Whether you go to buy, browse or people watch, it is worth a visit.
Magnificent!. Definetly go there and take some photos! Amazing colors and scents. And buy a juice! But keep your belongins close.
Great authentic delights . Just wander through and get bite sized treats from all different vendors.Its tempting to want to eat what you see straight away but there is so much to choose from

Superb. Bustling market full of Catalan food treats. Lots of fish and meat to either buy fresh or have cooked in front of you. Personally loved the chilli stalls and seeing them hung up on string. Some hot flavours!!
St. Josep Mercat de la Boqueria. The market is rich in all kinds of bright colors of bountiful fruits and sweets. Amazing. I love this market.

Shakes, chocolates, fruits.... Great street market located near Colon monument. They have fresh natural juices, fruit, chocolates, icecream, fish, meat, tapas, wine... Yes, it's a touristic market but still it's recommended, you should not miss it.

Fish as you wish!. A colorful market at the heart of Barcelona, on Las Ramblas...A definitely must-see, where you can buy fruits, spices, organic ice, organic fruitjuices, fish etc. You can try different kinds of food, not only fish but also, for example mexican food.

Superficial & commercial.. Initially it looked like attractive market with interesting vendors and eateries. However it quickly becomes apparent that the entire edifice is a massive tourist trap full of expensive tat. There is so much in Barcelona which has real value and merit. You can make better use of your time than visit this market.

Fantastic!!!!. If you love food here is The place. So much joy to see all The food. Lots Of fruits, tons of fish! Amazing sight to see at the market which is not too big and not too small. Great place to discover super great ingredients both from Spain and other part of The world. Must see spot in Barcelona!

Clean & fresh market. Its clean, cheap eats, wide variety of fresh produce and fruits u can buy and eat here, lots of people too and pickpockets, most famous market in Barcelona located at Las Ramblas
A THEATRICAL EXPERIENCE. we went at 2 different times. Mid day totally crazy, but great people watching. End of day, when they drop prices- great deals on everything.

Yummmi. I have travelled most of the world but the boqueria is a new try for me you can have anything you want to eat anything fruit fish meat sweet anything with a great exposing and very clean way especillay you can have the jamõn experience wich is very tasty dont hesitate to go la boqueria its located in the middle of las ramblas and its toi big

Such a great experience!. What a great place to explore and eat. We went early to beat the crowds and had breakfast at El Quim de la Boqueria. This was my dining highlight in Barcelona. This place is awesome. It is a small restaurant inside the Boqueria, the food is fresh and presented in such a beautiful way. I had a potato omelette, delicious! This market is so colorful and vibrant with all sort of produce, fish, meat ,seafood, flowers... make sure you bring your camera and your appetite.

Great variety. A wonderful place to pick up food for snacking, a picnic or to cook later at your rented apartment. A huge assorted of fish and seafood, meat and ham, fruit and veggies, fruit juices, various cuts of meat, nougat, and some restaurant-style offerings. No place to sit unless you eat it at some of the restaurant-style booths. Very crowded during the summer. Hang on to your valuables.

Loved this market!. I am a big fan of Farmer's Markets, so when we discovered this market on our trip to Barcelona, I was thrilled. It is filled with stands selling meats, fish, eggs, produce, nuts and dried fruits, and pastries. There are some restaurants in this market as well. The produce stands were my favorite. The fruit looked so appealing piled high around the market. I got an apple from one particular vendor each day. It was crisp, fresh, and inexpensive. Take a stroll through this market, if you are in the area!

Wide variety of fresh fruit, fresh and cured meats. Located off La Ramblas, this market is unlike any other place in Barcelona.Everywhere you turn, there is something to catch your eye.Easy to part with your cash.

Must visit . For anyone who loves to eat and enjoy local market, this is the place to go. Coming from Asia, cheese is very expensive. My hubby and I went crazy buying several types of blue cheese, olive oil, cherry tomatoes, fruit juices and lots of local products. I was there thrice during our one week stay. If you like seafood, i guess this is place to go for it. I personally didn't try but i saw many others did.
Fresh fruits and fish. The most fresh fish in town. So fresh and high quality fruits I've ever seen. Try the fresh fruit shakes in many different sorts as pina, melon or mango.

Awesome!. Awesome place to visit! Super, super busy and crowded, but a great place to see a wide variety of foods. The tapas bars inside are a great place to sit for a snack. A truly fantastic market!

Tapas Galore. If you're walking down Las Ramblas you definitely need to check out La Boqueria. The Market is split up into different sections: meat, fruit, seafood, etc... You can sample food from several of the vendors or enjoy a seat at some of the mini restaurants that are located with in the market.

Tapas delight. Used this Tapas bar 3 time now and felt it`s time for a review.Fantastic tasty food, never rushed to eat despite other folk queing behind for a seat, very friendly staff and superb value, lunch for 2 including drinks can be a stomach bursting 25 Euros.

Favourite place in bcn. Amazing market, the deeper you head into the market you encounter the none touristic stalls - I love the stall holders because they are so happy when you speak Spanish to order (however badly) great produce always
Colourful. Very colourful, a lot of the stalls sell the same thing but can taste open oysters if you feel the need to!
A Must..... The most vibrant market place, with wonderful food and tapas bars. You must be prepared to wait for a place at the tapas stalls but it really is worth it.

Don't Miss This Place!. I loved all of Las Ramblas, but la Boqueria was absolutely my favorite part. It could even had been one of the highlights of our whole time in Barcelona! There were so many beautiful, exotic, interesting, delicious food stalls, and I was overwhelmed by the majesty of it. There are a lot of great market areas and small shops where you can get fresh fruits, vegetables and meats in Barcelona, but la Boqueria is the best of them all, by far. I wish I could have gone back there every day to pick up food for dinner. It was breathtaking.

always a delight, but best in the morning. We had out hotel nearby and thus visited the market several times.It is always worth seeing, although very early (Opening: 8AM) is best, because there are only a few tourists and you can take a small coffee at La Quim and watch the busy men there prepare food for the day.If you want to try fresh juices - there are several options for 1 EUR that offer the same quality as the ones with 2 or 1,50...

Nothing like it in Europe.... This market is truly unique. You'll have one of the most unbelievable experiences here. BRING YOUR CASH AND DON'T FORGET TO NEGOTIATE! It's so much fun going from shop to shop. You'll never forget it.

Gastronomic heaven - worth a visit ( early morning). Gastronomic heaven - worth a visit ( early morning) when the shops are still opening, badly overrun by tourists in the day. nevertheless if you can negotiate the crowd and madness. Worth a visit for the juices and other goodies.

A bit hit and miss!. We are backpackers so if you can't afford to sit down and pay around €15+ each for quality food it can be disappointing. We got a juice each and they weren't cold despite being covered in ice chips in the display. We also got a seafood wrap and they were cold, old and chewy. Didn't even finish it and I LOVE food! Just a bit hit and miss.
Fun. Crowded! But that's what made it fun and in our 5 days there we made 3 trips to the market. Just walking around. People watching. And just be like locals.

A must for any traveller to Barcelona!. If you are looking for fresh food and produce and a healthy lunch that isn't super expensive then you MUST visit here whilst in Barcelona. The fresh fruit juices are amazing and only 1€! There is a place called organic Barcelona and they have he best paella in Barcelona and its vegetarian and organic like all their food is! Absolutely loved this place!

Visually great.. The Boqueria market is one of the the "must see's" in the city. The problem is that it is so packed with tourists that a lot of local shoppers do not go there anymore as they have to fight their way through hoards of people taking photos but not buying anything other than a tub of prepared fruit or a fresh juice. If you go to the Boqueria, I would try to go very early in the morning and avoid weekends if possible. The history of the market is very interesting and its worth reading about it before you go. Top tip - look up and see the columns and high ceilings around the perimeter of the market. It was built to match the Placa Real so wander down the Ramblas after you finish in the market and go to the Placa Real to see how it was meant to look.
Just LOVE IT. The most beautifful Mercat i've seen til today. Full of colors, smells and flavours! It has a lot of choices to eat and they are awsome! It's a place full of people, be carefull ;)

Great authentic place.
