A must see in Barcelona, mainly for people coming from countries where this open markets do not exist.Full of colours, flavours, it offers a huge selction of food, veges, fruits, meats, fish and seafood, delicatessen, spices, sweets, drinks etcAn amazing mix of people too, between tourists and local, that makes a busy place most of the day!Take time to sit at one of the bars there, have a glass of wine and taste some tapas!An unforgetable time!

MUST VISIT!. One of my FAVOURITE places in Barcelona. I love exploring new cities and countries the local way. This bazzar was as local as it gets. One of the oldest in Barcelona, its centrally located on La Ramblas street. Buzzing with activity, fresh fruits, veggies, meats, produce.. it comes to life early morning! The best part about it was the breakfast we ate at the one of the oldest coffee places- the aroma of newly baked croissants & hot Café con leche ! oh yumm! MUST DO. The gentleman who owns it was absolutely adorable and super friendly. We don't speak spanish, and he didn't speak english, but the communication was spot on. would love to go back again! check out the pictures!

Amazing foos market. This is an incredible food market, colours, smells, fresh produce - sensory overload. It does get really busy and I am glad to hear that there will be a limit / special times for large tourist groups because they make it very difficult for locals and other tourists to get around. A great place to get some fresh produce for a snack or a do it yourself lunch.

Paraiso de carteristas. Any one visiting Barcelona for the first time must go to the Market the La Boqueria even when is not what it was still worth to see but my advise is to watch your belongs very carefully, is full of pick pockets and others, I must say " Thief's Paradise "

Best food!. Barcelona is knows for its markets and we visited a few, but this was our ultimate favourite! Even if you don't want to buy anything, go just the experience of walking among the stalls, the smells, colours, noises... You can get there both fresh and ready made foods (snacks, tapas), so it's a great place for lunch and tasting the local food - we did it twice and we got totally stuffed both times. Try the fresh juices that several stalls sell - many flavours, delicious, any only €1-1.5 per cup.The only drawback - it's usually very busy, so be careful not to lose your companions in the crowd ;)

Wow! . It's just the most brilliant food market to wander around, buy and try stuff, and have a quick drink at one of the many little bars. Too full of tourists, of course, but as a tourist who am I to criticise? The more squeamish might be put off by the huge arrays of dead fish and meat, but it's a real market, not a sanitised, air-conditioned supermarket. Personally, I think it's a must see if you're in Barcelona.
Food Fun. If this is the same place it was amazing,putting places like Fairway and Whole Foods Stores to shame. Great for fish and meat and other foods as well as fine dinning with the locals.
Nice place with lots of people. Go early in the morning cause there is lots of tourists the whole day. Have some fresh fruits or fish. Its fantastic!

One of the best markets I have visited. What a choice of fish, meat, candies, fruits and juices! Great location, good prices and worth visiting (as we visited it at least 3 times on our little vocation) :)

My preferred in Barcelona, dont miss it!. I spent everyday some time. Special food and special Tapas and Bocadito. The fish is superbe, we tried almost in all the small restaurant in it. Really fantastic.
Beautiful and unique market. Beautiful and unique marketCentral location with an experience of buying options that starts with a cup of cut fruit and more.It is recommended to visit for some fun.

Indulge your senses! . This market is just incredible. From the moment we stepped inside we were delighted by the beautiful displays of fruit, chocolates, sweets, cheeses, meats, seafood and more. You can buy small plates of food from the different vendors as you walk around, allowing you to sample many different Spanish dishes. If you prefer to spend some time, there is also an option to sit at one of the food bars to eat and drink. Expect crowds of people as both locals and tourists visit this market.

Heart of Barcelona. This is a unique place! Oldest market of Barcelona. You can not only see, but smell and taste Barcelona! You can find a wide variety of delicious food and cold drinks, including local fish, fruits, jamon,etc. Every spot is decorated and looks really attractive. It is also visited by locals.

Food and Crowds. If you go here, be ready for some serious people pushing. This place is jam packed on any given day. Having said that, it's worth the visit. The variety of food you get in this market is amazing. Now there are many places which don't offer some amazing food, so it's a hit an miss really. But the experience of this place is amazing. You can keep nibbling on different items as you walk through. Its a great experience.

Tourist trap, really. I visited the market for the first time 30 years ago - the last time 8 years ago. Today the Market (as the RAMBLA) is just an echo of the original. The entrance gates hosts Dunkin' Donuts - an abomination for me. The market's offer has diminished to a minimum, largely catering to tourists, though you will see the odd local shopping there, too. Snacks on the spot are good, as always, but very little left. Way too many tourists, way too few local vendors & visitors. Barcelona has many other local markets much more worth visiting.
Great market . Whether you like fruits or seafood this is a great deal for you. Looking for great food at reasonable prices. ... stop here... people watching is great also@
Really good. Definitely worth a visit, lots of things to see and taste. Yummy food and drinks and great location. Would recommend going there.
Beautiful . Wonderful market filled with everything you could imagine to eat or drink. Well worth the detour off of the main avenue for a bit.

The heart of Barcelona . My favourite place in Barcelona. Walking in this market makes you really feel the catalan atmosphere. Colorful stalls with fruits, vegetables, juices,spices and much more. A must see!
Worth to go there. Nice market with lot of things to see and to try.Be careful of the price. The same product can have two different prices depending of the seller.

Take in the sights and smells. You definitely need to visit here if not for the food or drinks for the experience to see hoards of tourists and locals weave through the crowds avoiding those taking pictures of their food and the hanging pig legs. Went in August so a lot of the stores were closed for vacation yet there were still many to choose from. The fruit drinks are good but look around as the prices can vary from vendor to vendor. We tried a number of snacks from a few of the shops and had lunch there so it is a good diversion from La Rambla. Walk around and visit each of the stands to see what you truly want to taste before you start buying. Of course like any place the places in the front tend to charge more than the vendors in the back of the market so be forewarned.

You must go at least once! can't miss!. The market is amazing. you can travel and drink fresh fruit shake and have a good snack. If you stay in an apartment like we do you can buy everything in there and cook your own food and it would be delicious.

Great market with lots of sights, sounds and smells to excite. Based just off La Ramblas the market is a great mixture of stalls selling everything from fine nougat to fresh fish in a setting which will excite every one of your senses. Taste some of fresh fruit and sample amazing Spanish Jamon whilst you drink a cold beer watching the world go by. A visit to Barcelona isn't complete without a trip here.

Must see, eat and drink. It's a kind of open market in the heart of Barcelona, just beside the metro station. So it's easy to reach there.Too many types of fruits and juices. Different foods, seafoods, cheese, meat and things related to good food in Barcelona.While I was in Barcelona I've been there four times, at least.It's amazing, juices, tapas, seafoods and much more.

HEAVEN. If you are in Barcelona and havent been to la Boqueria yet stop whatever you are doing and get there right now! I always start my morning here for some fresh fruit juice and dried meats. You can spend hours walking around this amazing place and it never gets old. The smells, tastes and colors that come from every little stand are amazing and the people that work at them (most of them anyway) are very nice and helpful. Some will "try" to stop you from taking pics but that didnt really work on me. Before leaving I always buy 1 or 2 pata negra sandwiches for the road. This is a must visit if ever in Barcelona!
Must visit. Great to wander around. Go in the morning / early in the day to avoid the crowds.A good place to eat, either at one of the restaurants or bars selling food to take away

Celebration of food and life !. Gothic market is buzzing with food, delicacies, abundant fruits and local treats - easy to find local souvenirs to bring home, from almonds to tea to spices. Definitely go while hungry!
Incredible nice place. A must in Barcelona. We went there every day during our stay in Barcelona. Always something new to discover.

Fantastic lunch. After a long morning of walking we stepped into the market for a quick lunch. This was the highlight of the day. The sights and sounds are wonderful and the different foods were delicious.

Food heaven!. My hostel was adjacent to this market. This market has meat, vegetables, fresh fruits and other interesting options for eating. It' a detour from the crowded La Rambla street.A must go-to place in Barcelona!

Worth visiting but prepare for crowds. I spent a week in Barcelona, staying about 10 minutes walk away from La Boqueria. I had heard much about La Boqueria and so went there. The market caters primarily for tourists. Most stalls offer small "take-away" servings of their particular fare (fruits, juice/smoothies, pasteries, meats, seafood, etc.). Some stalls even have a dining counter and some high stools, but I didn't try those (too crowded and I don't like being jostled while I eat). Some stalls (meats, fish) cater for the more serious cooks.It's well worth visiting La Boqueria. Make sure you have, say, 20 euros in 1 and 2 euro coins as most of the fare is in the 1 to 5 euro range, and I didn't see many signs indicating that credit cards were welcome.The main inconvenience of La Boqueria is the crowds - it's a victim of its own success. However, this is just a nuissance, and I did not have any unpleasant experiences (pick-pockets, etc.). But people in wheel chairs, or parents pushing buggies, seemed to be having a tough time getting through the crowds. One other issue is that I couldn't find rest rooms within the market.Finally, for the food lovers, La Boqueria is not the only such market in Barcelona. The Mercat de Sant Antoni is about 15 minutes west of La Boqueria and is bigger, but it is currently closed for renovations.
Go to pinotxo!!!. Baby Squid with beans enough said. Great seafood and people watching. This market is well worth the trip down the overly crowded Rambla.

NICE!!!. We went there almost everyday during our stay in Barcelona.
We bought fruits and fish and chorizo to eat in the hostel.
We once bought tuna for 9€, shoyu and ginger and we ate sashimi at the hostel.
Nice way to save some money.
You have to visit. It is a foodie mecca. We bought cured meats and walked around with our tongues hanging out of our mouths. It was convenient to the Metro and filled with goodies.

Nice . When i tried to find some place to eat, I found this huge market. There are so many things to eat ( really good tapas & fruits)if you're tired walking down the rambla you can have good fruit juice in here!

Great Market!!take a look at the plan with childrean. Great market!! fruits, cheese meat and all food you can think of. the kids asked for fresh fruit juice and a fruit salads, ee walked and chose great cheese and walked by to casa guinart restaurant to have a few glasses of wine with cheese that was a nice tour at the market.

The Jewel of Las Ramblas . The market off Las Ramblas epitomizes what a market should be. Artisan local foods brought to you people who have pride in their product. From fresh to cured meats, seafood, produce and herbs the market will have you on sensory overload. The deeper you go into the market the better it gets, so go get lost for an hour sampling the delicacies.

Incredible . This place is a must visit, located on la rambla you are guaranteed to encounter any and all kinds of seafood in this market. It also has a wonderful bar/restaurant in the middle that has amazing food and is constantly packed with a line around the corner. That's how good the food it. Usually fresh seafood caught that day and bought and sold from that very market. There are also meat and fruit stalls within the market as well. Not a place for people with claustrophobia as this place is always crowded with tourists.

Fascinating market. I have read about this place before I went to Barcelona and I knew that I needed to check this place out. It is a big market that sells everything you can think of. Fruits, vegetables, meats, cheeses, sweets, cured meats, seafood, tapas, etc. My husband and I made sure that we saw every stall inside the market. It is crowded inside, no surprises there. Be weary of your belongings. We met a man who works there, who comes from the same country as us, and warned us about pickpockets. Thank goodness we didn't become a pickpocket victim. Going back to the market, it does become a bit repetitive, another meat stall, another fruit stall, another seafood stall. The tapas stalls seemed very popular. We didn't get to try them though. My husband and I bought fresh cut fruits and fresh fruit juices - there are lots of them. Go for a walk and compare prices because others are more expensive. There is also a lolly store which was just pleasing to the eyes. By the time you pick what you want to buy though, it becomes overwhelming because there are just way too many options. Definitely a must go if you are in Barcelona. Oh and you need to pay 50cents to use the toilets.
Teasing the tastebuds!. Fantastic food market. So much to eat and drink all in one place, with bars to sit with tapas and a cerveza - an incredible sight!

Great!. It's amazing ! A lot of goods , arranged more or nice , you can taste almost anything, seafood , fruits and vegetables that I have not seen elsewhere. I recommend baby octopus cone - a marvel ! Also, the glass fruits , kept cold are great for you cool in hot weather . It is recommended to visit in the morning when all goods are fresh and nicely arranged .

Great place to eat and photograph. This is a wonderful food market. The goodies are beautifully displayed and there is a range if delicious delights to choose from. It is crowded, especially at lunchtime, but definitely worth a visit. Some of the stalls have counter seating and there is a square out back as well.
Definitely worth a visit . Very popular where one can purchase freshly squeezed juices and fruit salads, tapas and Spanish bread. Tip: juices are cheaper from the stalls at the back of the market.

A feast for the eyes and taste. Here in this medieval covered market, you find an almost complete varieties of fruit, vegetables, meat, fish, seafood, canned food, fried food and candy one can encounter under the same roof. You get only the best quality of fruits and vegetables here! Many famous chefs from Barcelona (like Ferran Adria) shop here for there restaurants...The food bars you find here are also excellent!

Interesting marketplace. Crowded but interesting place. You can find a wide variety of fruits, vegetables, jamon, sausages and seafood for sale here. A piece of Espetec sausage I bought here for 2eur was way better than another sausage I later bought at the airport for 20eur.

Nice Market. Busy place but so nice to roaming around.everything you see is amazing.Great ideas especially the arrangement of the different kinds of fruits and foods.everything you need about foodtrip you can find in this place.

Good market with lots of variety and things to see. If you're even sorta close to La Ramblas, I'd recommend checking this place out. It's very lively with all the different food stalls and lunch spots. There are many food stalls, and the most expensive seem to be up in the front near the middle, but it's a short walk to the sides or back of the market where things like the fruit juices are a little cheaper.

Foodie Heaven. Stumbled upon this market and so glad we did. Lots of different foods being served in a very casual environment. Highly recommend trying some of the fresh juices and pots of fruit for a refreshing breakfast / snack. I wish we were staying in a serviced apartment as I would love to have made something with the fresh seafood on offer. Lots of chorizo and cured meat as you would expect in Spain. It is a very busy market place and can be a bit frustrating keeping together.

Lively market, with all sorts of food.. We came here in a late afternoon, and were amazed by the variety of exotic fruits; seafood includes oysters, shrimps, fishes, clams; produces; and all sorts of edible items the market offers, there were also several seafood restaurants in the market. What an experience.The place closes on Sundays.

Stimulates the Senses and a Feast for the Eyes. It's exciting and fun, but there are about 3 types of shops here throughout the whole market: candy store , fruits and fruit juice store, and meats/deli. Drinks are 1 to 2 euros on the perimeter, and 1 euro in the centre. Go shopping for your items!
Crazy in August. Had plans to go in for a stroll around this market..but the minute we got there we realised it was a bad decision.it was thronged with people at midday.arrive early.

Fantastic fruit and veg.. We absolutely loved the wide selection of fruit available here and spent an absolute fortune! We left with peaches, nuts, fruit slushes, bananas, and sweet treats.We came across this market during a walk down Las Ramblas one afternoon. Lots of interesting choices to be made. It's easy enough to find. It's on the right side of the street when you walk down towards the sea. (Slightly back off the main street.) If you find the Erotic Museum it right opposite.
Exciting and Colorful. Love this exciting market place. There are a variety of food choices, drinks, meat, seafood and the people are very friendly. It was a pleasure to see this market.

Must see.. We popped in here and it's as good as other reviews say. Very busy and humid. Some wonderful displays of produce and stall holders don't mind you taking photos. For a bit of fun we challenged ourselves to find a light lunch for €5 for the two of us !!! Buying items from different stalls we did it easy.

Wonderful experience, beautiful seafood.. Fantastic seafood whilst sitting at the counter sipping cava, this is a wonderful place to wander around and see the unusual meats, fruits etc. The highlight is definitely the seafood eateries at a very reasonable price. A must visit (not for vegetarians!)!
Delicious. If you want to eat some fresh fruits, from all over the world, this is the right place...also, the juices are very good and diverse.....but it is very crowded....

Food Lovers Dream!. If you are looking for fresh food and an authentic casual and memorable experience you have to visit La Boqueria. From fresh fruit, to fresh seafood and meats, La Boqueria has it all!

One of the more famous markets in the world. Lets be honest, this is a food market, not the seventh wonder of the world. It is nice and people from Barcelona we love it but it is fully crowded of tourists making photos and buying nothing. people working there are a little bit tires of the people walking around and making them feel like animals in the zoo. The nice think about the place is the old tradition and ambience there. the building is also pretty old ald well conserved. If you go there please buy something and walk arround but dont block the corridors too much. The nice thing is that you can find almost every thing you can imagine. Aniways when you find the insects shop keep in mind that it was opened as a weird thing for making jokes or surprise your friends...we do not eat and have never eaten insects in Spain. ( Im not sure if it is still open because I did not see it when I was there for the last time). Spetially recomended from my side are the dry mushroms shop (if you like cooking you will love them). Also very good the vegetables and fruits. Do not buy the exotic fruits, they are very expensive and normally not mature and not typical from spain (again another thing that they included for courious people). If you like cooking or you are a foodie this is a total must. If you are not interested in cooking or food just walk arround for a minute is enough!
Amazing. If you're in Barcelona, you simply have to go there! The food is simply amazing amazing amazing! I went 3 times in one trip

so sad that this market has turned into a tourist attraction. so sad that this market has turned into a tourist attraction. The part at the Ramblas is all fruit juices and sweets. I still know where to go for some things, but overall; this is not what a Barcelona market looks like. I advice all the tourists who come to Barcelona for the real atmosphere, to avoid this place. The people from Barcelona do their shopping somewhere else.

Feel the city vibe . A maker you should visit. Here you can find all kind of fruits and enjoy a fresh juice. Fresh fish and oysters. There is always a plenty of people. Get lost in the crowd and enjoy..

A sensory food experience of the highest level. Being familiar with the Adelaide Central Market, we thought we knew what to expect. Yes, there are similarities, but the scale of La Boqueria is overwhelmingly massive. The goods on sale cover fresh fruit and vegetables, fish, meats of all varieties, confectionery, raw, cooked, tapas, cheese, breads etc etc etc. If you are planning a picnic then come here first. There is an entrance off La Rambla. Protect your possessions as you are likely to be in the midst of a crush at some stage.

Great Market. Visiting this market is a must! Includes all types of fruits (fresh), fish and other types of food. However, I have noticed that many of the people that are in business are not Spanish (makes you consider the authenticity of some of the products sold in the market).

One of the best food markets!. Amazing food great atmosphere,so many and colorful food in one place. Very crowded though.. we walked around and then choose any restaurant where we can simlpy sit and enjoy our food. Baby octopus and jumbo shrimps were perfect

Colourful and buzzing. Stumbled upon this while walking down las ramblas. But so glad we found it. The colour from all the fruit and veg stalls is incredible. Fresh fruit juice from stalls for a euro is not to be missed and try some jamon from the meat stalls too. Just loved walking around all the market and seeing the fish stalls and meat. Very busy but just added to the experience for me

Wonderful Food. This market is in La Rambla. it's full of stalls selling a huge variety of fruit, candy, meat, eggs, and seafood. There are even some restaurants. Even if you do not want to buy anything, it is fun to just stroll around the market looking at all the colorful foods. I highly recommend coming between noon-5pm because after that time, the stalls begin to close. This is a wonderful place for lunch and extremely cheap.
Bustling market.. Bustling place, great to wander and observe the people and food. Many choices for food, ice cream, sweets, fresh fruit. If you have the time find a seat and soak up the atmosphere.
Full of colour and taste . Bouqueria is truly must to be place. You can find any kind of food there, but fruits are amazing, diversity of colour and taste. First time I see some of fruits.

The best fish place in town. The boqueria is one the best market I ever visited in Europe. The food is excellence ,ask for the fish cazuela and you are going to experienced a gorgeous taste of the fresher fish you ever tasted.Also the price are very cheap compare with the rest around the Ramblas.

Was not impressed at all. Having visited same sort of market in Madrid La Boqueria was a huge disappointment. Foul smell along the entire market. Only thing i liked about this place was the fruit displayed as you enter the market. For me it was a waste of time.

Fantastic!. This place is fantastic! Lots of food from candy to fruit to chickens with the heads still attached. No need to buy anything. You can just walk around and look. Much larger than the markets in Madrid.There's a Dunkin Donuts (called Dunkin Coffee) here.Don't miss this one!G

If you don't mind huge crowds, then this is a must. You should definetely visit Boqueria if you're in Spain - and, if you don't have a problem with very large and tight crowds. I personally had to leave after a few minutes, because I cannot stand such cramped places, but there were A LOT of stands with great-looking food and drinks, so if you don't mind the people, this is a wonderful and colourful place!

Beautiful & Colourful Displays. We visited Barcelona as a family of 6 adults for 3 nights this week, staying at the close by Condes De Barcelona hotel.The Market De La Boqueria is situated on Las Ramblas and is a must whilst in the area. The displays of fresh fruit, meat and fish are incredible. It's a great place for picking up cheap tasty snackes i.e. cold meats on sticks, nuts, sweets, cheeses, fruit, tapas snacks, and particularly appealing to us were the fruit drinks for 1 Euro.Although I'm not a fish eater the fish stalls were amazing.The market is obviously very busy but definitely worth a visit or two.

Amazingggg for a foodie!!. Excellent visit, upon entering you are hit with smells and Boise befitting of a bustling market. I personally visited 4-6 of the stalls purchasing a variety of smallmouthfuls - all of which were amazing! The first meat stall as you enter on the left has a selection stick for 1 euro, the oysters felt fresh and are prepared to order, the tapas and pinxos bars are a joy to behold.Please go here!

Get lunch or dinner here!. I never miss a market when traveling because it gives you a true sense of the city and La Boqueria does not disappoint! I collected dinner here through Iberico ham, cheese, dried fruit, crackers and wine. If you want a meal ready to go, not a problem...many, many options of small restaurants with local food.

Amazing!. It's definitely worth visiting this market!!!I was amazed by all that food, those fruits and all those colors. Too bad i had already had lunch before going there so i just had a coconut juice which was really good! And it was only 1 euro.Definitely recommend!Elisabeth

El Bazaar de Barcelona. An extensive open market of over 100 vendors who sell the freshest produce, meats, seafood, prepared deli-type foods, and counters where one can eat freshly-prepared tapas, BBQ's on skewers, etc. This place is open 6 days a week - closed on Sundays. We were able to find a stand where fresh oysters were getting shucked at 2.50 euros each and served on a napkin with a lemon wedge! After a few of these delicacies, we moved on to another vendor who sells whole marinated freshly cooked jumbo shrimps and other seafood salads. We sampled a few of these standing there, and then purchased cut-up fruits, fresh purple figs (unbelievably sweet) and a spinach quiche to bring to our apartment. This market is popular for the extensive varieties of Iberico hams, charcuterie, and cheeses. Definitely an un-American experience.

Fascinating fresh food market. . Easily accessible on foot branching off of La Rambla. Buy your self a goats head, spectacularly presented tripe and of course any amount and type of Jamon. Fresh fruit stalls, cold juice and vegetable drinks. Seefood of all types and you can have a meal rubbing shoulders with all types at one of the bars.

Packed with people, but still brilliant. There is so much to see (and sample) here that we will ensure this is one place we come back to again and again. We loved the fresh juices (coco/kiwi, mango/orange, watermelon...) which were €2 each at the front of the market and 2 for €2 towards the back. There were lots of cured meats, fruit, breads, chocolate, tapas, cheese.... The best thing to do is go hungry, avoid the front which is super-busy, weave straight in to the middle of the market and start sampling. Take lots of smaller notes and coins if you can.
Ok. Well this is basiclly a normal market, it is interesting but nothing to much, it is usually very crowded

Vibrant . Great market, fresh produce. Such a vibrant place. Enjoyed watching the locals meticulously select and buy their produce. Some nice little eateries dotted on the outer aisle. Although we didn't intend to eat there we couldn't resist sampling the yummy seafood paella after watching it cook. A must see in Barcelona.

Must see. Yummy stuff all around. . It's a must have see when visiting Barcelona. A lot of tasty stuff to find and explore. Very busy all the time so be careful with your belongings. I did get travellers diarrhea from eating the watermelon there. But the slushees and vidal fruit juices are safe to eat.

Awesome Market. We've traveled to many countries and always enjoy going to local markets. Barcelona's Mercat de Sant Josep on Las Ramblas is one of the best anywhere. We spent 9 days in Barcelona and went to the market every day to eat, buy food for later and just enjoy the sites, sounds and smells. Go when in Barcelona!

Wooow, that's amazing. I have necer seens omething like this market place. I felt in love with this. Its so colorful, so nice, so many types of food you can find from vegetables to beef, fish and sweets. If you will go to Barcelona, do not forget to visit it! :)

Busy but still worth a visit. This place is extremely busy but it's to be expected in the height of the summer holidays. We loved the market and the stall holders were very friendly and helpful. Were intrigued by the variety of ice creams, especially the avocado flavour and the raspberry was the best we've ever tasted.We bought several of the natural juices on arrival at the entrance for €2 each. If you go further into the market, you can buy the same for €1.50 each or 2 for €2.I have only given this a four rating because about half of the stalls were closed.

Amazing sights and sounds. We walked in while some were closing but it was great to see the different juices, meats, seafood, fruits and candies that Barcelona has to offer. It was very nicely organized and nice variety.
Must visit . Along with Tsukiji in Tokyo, one of the most amazing wet markets in the world. Make sure to visit El Quim or Pinxto. Worth the wait.
Jackie b. Hi we visted the market and it was amazing so many fruits nuts oils etc the colours were mouth watering bought a couple of cartons of fruit it was amazing so fresh.

Lovely. Shopping, shopping, tasting, eating...all day. Is great. Is great. Read the history about this place, like that is more interesting. And when you go out, you have to try Erotic Museum that is in front. Is great. Nice mix.

looked good, smelled good, tasted great!. The food is so visually so appealing that just have taste it! We were staying close by and found ourselves there everyday stocking up on fresh fruit. A great place to visit.

To die for. So, I know what you must be thinking, what could be that great about a local food market?? I went there to just get some fruits and veggies to stock up my fridge, but I probably had as much fun shopping for my groceries there as I did visiting the most popular monuments they have- and I just love monuments, so that says something. The way they make all the produce shine is outstanding, the seafood is the freshest you'll ever lay eyes on. This place literally has EVERYTHING, from vegetables all the way to cake decorations and gummy bears, I recommend going there to anyone who's visiting Barcelona.

Must to see. When you are in barcelona you have to go there! The people selling their own products with a smile on their face its something different from the other places in big cities like bcn is. The food is perfect by the way. I have been there almost every day to have a breakfast
Fresh food marked. Very good place for having a fresh fruit. The stores are small but very nice and well designed. Try the stores at the middle of marked

Incredible Market!. Whenever I go to a new city, particularly in Europe, I love a stroll across a local market. La Boqueria is certainly quite a market! I have never seen anything like it. Piles of fresh, vibrant fruit and veggies, fresh fish and meat, heaps of exotic sweets and chocolate, small eateries and even a bakery. This is a place to see! It is incredibly crowded, I should say, so going in with a stroller, wheelchair (or a bad case of claustrophobia) may not be so enjoyable, but otherwise, I would highly recommend spending some time here, see where the locals shop and sampling the wares.

Amazing Market. You can almost miss the entrance off the Ramblas if you're not careful. But please don't as you will be missing one of the world's great markets. Fish, meats, produce, treats and just about everything on display. There are several wine kiosks which is perfect for sitting and enjoy people watching. We've been there are Christmas when everyone is in great spirits and singing.
Crowdy. As expected, it's crowded with tourists but it was fun. Also as expected, it's expensive.It has good selection of seafood, something we really appreciated.

Good market. Good variety of food. You have to drink one of the juices over there. They have some really different juice mixes. I drank mango with kiwi juice for a euro and half. Try some jamon while you are there. It was very crowded but a good place to enjoy some food. Good location to walk to and from different locations. Highly recommend visiting this place.

Alice in foodland. This is probably the place which I loved best during my stay in Barcelona. It's the perfect compound of flavours and foods, of aromas and little wonders which catch the eye (and not only!) of a gourmet. It's really worth going, trying and buying. For this reason, my advice is to go there more than once, not at a rush hour, and merge in food culture from all over Spain. Local products and ingredients can be enjoyed and brought home. Street dishes, burritos and "zumos" (juices) are an absolute must!

Amazing!. Absolutely amazing! It's always very crowded, but it's easy to realize why - people are nice, food looks fresh and delicious, everything is so organized...we just can't resist to try some of the juices or macedonias,or empanadas...or just stay for lunch!

Great market. I visited here in the hope of a Spanish style Borough Market and my expectations were exceeded. Large market with loads to choose from. It's very popular which meant it was busy and there wasn't much seating which was a shame. I would recommend visiting as a place to get lunch and a drink in Barcelona though

Coolest Market I've ever visited. What a place! As soon as we walked in from Las Ramblas, the first thing we saw was a meat booth, serving small paper cones filled with various Spanish and catalan meats. We bought a few for a couple euros and snacked on these delicious snacks as we walked around wide-eyed looking at the huge variety of foods. We returned another couple of times, and tried the fresh fruit, the smoothies, some sandwiches, nuts, candy, chocolate, and so much more. This is another absolute must do if you are in Barcelona for a decent stretch of time. You can have a full meal made of a variety of different foods and snacks for only 10 euros as you walk through. Just pay attention to the prices, as you walk through you'll likely find the same thing, or a better/bigger version for a cheaper price. The meat cones for example- further back in the labyrinth of vendors we found another meat vendor selling larger cones for cheaper. Pretty much any food you can think of is sold here, this market was truly a fantastic experience.

A unique experience in the Ali Baba food cavern.. An advise, go there just before lunch time. You will not resist to the thousands of different fresh products (hiberic hams, fruits, vegetables, sweets, wines, tapas, fish...) all so nicely presented. Yes it is noisy and crowded btu it is a real leaving experience. If you are hungry you can stay and have tapas at the bar !

Went for a second visit and want to visit again!. Nothing like a market to help you understand the tastes and local culture of a place. La Boqueria is just amazing, lots of food and a chaotic yet organized mix of locals and tourists in search of an authentic experience!

The place to meet Barcelona. Eventhough some fish sellers do not like tourists and their mood could be worse for taking pictures to their fishes and seafood, Boquería has been for many years the best place for visiting all the flavors and nice looking products of the city. Sit down in one of its bars and taste all that you can ...Social contact of fish sellers with visitors from worldwide should be improved.

Arrive before 11:30am. This is a very popular location of locals and tourists alike. The food available is fresh, not to mention delicious. To really experience the ambience of the market for lunch you should arrive before 11:30 at the latest.

Go there as soon as possible. In the morning it's very pleasure to walk around it. At around 10 am the market filled up by the people. Try the infinite variety of fresh fruit juices. The more adventurous can try the oysters and other specialties.

Lovely!. Part of me does not want to write this review as the place is already extremely crowded. But Barcelona is not Barcelona without this market. Great food, fresh juices, local food and amazing bar on your left - try the Navajas - now a must for me every time I'm in town

It has everything.. We were in Barcelona only for 5 days, but we visited this market three times because it has everything I wanted. Freshly made fruit juice only sold for 1 Europe, and they are beautifully decorated. Must try their 4-5 EUR per cup ham. They also have a lot of seafood for sale for very reasonable price. This is my No. 1 favorite market comparing others I have been to. If you want to buy some ham home, I suggest you should buy the one unpacked for 4-5 EUR per cup instead of the prepackaged one.

Too Crowded - not essential if you're a tourist. we were in barcelona for the christmas holiday season and perhaps there were too much people. I mean you walk around the Rambla and you're constantly looking around for potential pickpockets because everyone warns us about them... then you wander into this place and you can't even enter there. I am not saying there isn't a huge variety of things but hey what are you going to do - buy a kilo of navajas and take them to your hotel room? yes you can buy a fruit juice or a fruit - but for that you can also just go to a fruit stand in a less crowded space. I'd say don't sweat it if you go in an can't really walk there... just go an enjoy the city elsewhere
Pretty Deliciuos. Market well worth the visit especially for breakfast or lunch. Fresh juices and produce abound! YES!
Bcn must see. Nice food market in the heart of Barcelona.you can find fish, meat, fruit (a lot!) , spices, candies and sweet cakes.nice to see if u're around Rambla.

Definately one for a foodie. This has to be one of the best markets in the world. I was mesmerised by when was there. Everything was so fresh and a great place to stop for food and tapas. Definately one to visit

A foodie "must see". Don't leave Bareclona without at least taking a look into the giant covered Boqueria market. It's a delight for the all the senses, whether you are going to shop for a picnic, get a bite to eat, or just look around. You'll be amazed at the variety of vegetables, fruits, nuts, meats, and seafoods displayed in dazzling arrays of color. You'll probably see fruits and vegetables you've never seen before! There are juice bars throughout, so stop to get a delicious drink along the way. Several stalls sell savory delights you can eat out of hand, or you can stop at one of the tapas bars where you can sit down at a counter and enjoy a selection of goodies.

Kids' favorite Barcelona attraction. Our two teenagers loved the market, where they found delicious, decadent ice cream (Speculoos cookies flavor, tiramisu, and dolce de leche were favorites). We also loved the fresh fruit juices kept on ice at stands throughout the market, and picked up some Spanish specialties, including peppercorns, Marcona almonds (not in oil), and wonderful, large dates. The market is a feast for all the senses and is not to be missed.

An indulgence for your vision, smell and taste. The bouqeria is busy all day but it is imperative a stop to find probably the best and largest number of foods concentrated in one space. Fruit, fish, meats, cheese and anything your stomach can digest and all freshly displayed. Juices of any kind are cheap and delicious and a couple of stands with great produce to be savoured instantly. Tastefully Spanish!
amazing. my favorite place in the world! Just went to Santa Monica farmers market after returning to LA, and felt so depressed thinking about boqueria and how much better it was :(

An awesome market. This market is amazing with a huge variety of stalls selling just about everything but the produce and food stalls are outstanding. The fresh local produce is beautifully presented and seems very reasonably priced. It is just a great experience to walk around the aisles and absorb the atmosphere.

Very Good Market. We stumbled upon this at the last moment and unfortunately didn't get a chance to fully explore, but the parts we did were amazing- lots of fresh produce and amazing food. We worth dropping in if you are in the area. It's a little bit hidden so you might have to look it up or ask some one for directions.

Every's chef dream. Simply a market that has everything- from dragon fruit to fish that you can't even pronounce. And on top of all that, the presentation is amazing, so even if you don't like to cook, you will find it beautiful (plus, there are all sorts of sweet and savory meals to be found). It's a good place to eat too, since you are sure that you will get the all the fresh things.

Great place to visit. Very touristy hence a LOT of people. Great place to see where people purchase their food items. Some items are a bit expensive, and some not so. Lots of places to eat within and around the area, there may be some wait time. Sadly when we went there we had already eaten but did have their fresh fruit drinks which is great value. A must see place when your in the area, but also take note of other Mercats as we went to others and I preferred the quiet ones, obviously not so touristy.

Unfirtunately turning into a tourist trap. Used to be one of my favorite place Barcelona... but now half the food you have there is bad (borderline horrible for some stalls). If you go tio the back you still have some nice shops with non english speaking local stalls but they are disappearing fastShame.

Wonderful Food Market. This market is simply world class. Vendors display the freshest fish, hams, sausages, vegetables, fruits and juices. Numerous tapas bars are interspersed among the vendors so you are assured of having the freshest tapas along with your wine or beer. The displays of fresh seafood show you the catch from nearby waters. It will take you at least half a day to fully experience Boqueria.

Sensational and a MUST place to visit. I was careful not to set my expectations too high of this place as i had read many great things and didn't want to be disappointed. I wasn't.It's a feast for the senses with so many wonderful produce to see, smell and taste. Yes, it can be crowded with tourist and locals alike, just like Sydney's Paddy's market is at Haymarket. I guess this is what happens when a market is (now) located right in the middle of the city.For me, this is the number 1 place to visit in Barcelona.

Fresh products but also touristic. It's fun to visit this market once. You'll find a mix of fresh products, including meat, fish, fruit, smoothies and ice cream. However, it's also very crowded with tourists (including blocked aisles and many cameras) so we didn't stay that long.
Food heaven!. Both fascinating and inspiring. Fascinating to see such a vast selection displayed in such a beautiful way. Inspiring to think of what you can do with all those fresh produce.

Awesome Market!. During are walks around La Rambla we encountered this place. What a find! Very cool place with all kinds of fresh food. There are vendors near the entrance that sell fruit drinks and we thought they were tasty and inexpensive. If you're in Barcelona, you need to check this place out, it's worth a look.

Fun!. This really is fun place to go to. Lots of fresh veggies, fish, ham, fruit, etc. We had some yummy fresh fruit juices (3 euros by the entrance, 1 euro further back), bought some candy for my boys, got a little container of ham and enjoyed the sights and sounds. Definitely an experience!

Must visit when in Barcelona Spain. 2 weeks Self-drive Family trip to whole of Spain, starting from Barcelona.La Boqueria or the central market is place must visit, though it is more of a tourists attractions but we can still see locals buying their groceries there.The fruit juices stalks are very beautiful and colorful.After the visit, just stroll along the Ramblas avenue all the way to Columbus monument.

Fascinating REAL market, not just for tourists. This amazing food market, just off the Rambla, is uncommon in that it is obviously immensely popular with both the locals and tourists. For good reason, too! The variety of seafood, meats and local specialties, and their picturesque presentation is a delight to the senses. Feast on paper cones of fried squid, purchase premium canned tuna or fresh meat, or just delight in the beauty of fresh local seafood displayed on ice. Have a seat at one of the restaurant counters or get something to go, it's all here in one vast shed. Not to be missed!

Good place to go but don't forget to shop smart. Very attractive market place with a huge variety of items. Several stalls sell the same wares so it helps to walk around first and compare prices to get the best deal. The further you go into the market the better the prices get. Stall vendors also vary in friendliness and helpfulness. Don't forget to ask if it is okay to take a picture as many vendors were shoeing away those who were just wanting to take photos. Also, beware of the floor in the seafood section it gets a bit slimey and slippery...not entirely pleasant.

Great Experience. This was a very fun and bustling market to visit, one of the most fun I have been to in Europe. You can get any type of food there--from refreshing fruit juices, to sandwiches, to cured meats, fresh produce, cheeses...you name it. We especially enjoyed the juices as well as some meat empanadas!

A Great Place to Nosh. La Boqueria isn't the best food market I've visited in Europe, but it certainly gets the job done! Like all great food markets there are numerous stalls where you can belly up to the bar and have an entire meal. Or, you can go from spot to spot trying a little of this, a little of that, and just nosh your way through. One night I did the latter, spending less than five Euro. I was content and considered myself done with dinner. La Boqueria is a tasty way to spend some time in this beautiful city.

Amazing. This market is amazing don't buy fruit juices or smoothies from the vendors at the front as the ones further in are half the price and nicer! The stall selling fruit ice lollies was brilliant too. The colour and vibrancy of the whole place was amazing.

A MUST visit!. This is definitely a must-stop location, especially if you find yourself wandering along Las Ramblas. Go a bit earlier to beat the crowds so you have a little more time to wander around the different stalls and really take everything in. If we were able to I would have visited every day for lunch as everything we tried was so delicious - and CHEAP! 2 Euros for a cone filled with ham, 1 Euro for a fruit drink, 2-3 Euros for a sandwich, etc... It's a great place to go to try different foods without breaking the bank.

Colourful. A great place for snacky food and trying out the different fruits and fruit juices. Avoid buying fruits and fruit juices from the stalls right at the entrance that don't have prices as they charge a lot more than stalls further in (we learnt the hard way!).

If you enjoy to walk in a fresh food market, this is the place!. Probably this place is one of the main reason for Catalonians to feel proud!, and I can understand why!.The design and the architecture of this market are absolutely unusual!, from outside it seems like a trendy, modern and nice market, and it is of course, however once you are inside you can feel the old way to look for fresh food and buy!, you can purchase from vegetables, fruits or meats, until food ready to eat right there!.If you visit Barcelona, don't miss out the La Boqueria market!, it is just in front of Las Ramblas and closer to Plaza Catalunya!.An advice: be careful with pickpockets!

So much life in such a compact space. We came to get a sense of the foods and people of Barcelona and this place delivers. Friendly vendors, delicious snacks and I never knew even half that variety of fish and seafood existed.

A must not miss with all the bright colors and choices.. This is a great place to just go and look at. So many choices and reasonable. I got a 1 euro fruit cup that was fabulous. There is so many different things to look at and see. Well worth the stop if you are on Los Ramblas.

overwhelming, but in a good way.... We had been to the Mercado San Miguel in Madrid the day before, but it didn't prepare us for La Boqueria in Barcelona. Plus, it was hot in the midday and there's nowhere to sit. There are chairs, but they're for surrounding restaurants. So we gave up and found a restaurant.A few days later, we tried again. There are many, many vendors of anything you want: meat, juice, nuts, fruit, seafood. We picked up some juice and pastries. We didn't go in hungry this time, so that was good. And, of course, we didn't leave hungry, because there is, quite literally, everything here you would want to eat. Lucky for us, we stayed just off La Rambla, not far away, so we were able to wander in and out.When you're on La Rambla, use your walk to hit any of the neighboring sights: Barri Gotic, the beach, or La Boqueria. The market is an experience you can't miss when you're in Barcelona.

Great market. Awesome market for a walk through. Great juices of all varieties at many stalls. Really good, fresh food.We particularly liked the baguettes from the little bakery in the middle of the markets.

A Photographer's Dream. This is one of the most colourful markets we have ever seen. Stall after stall of the freshest fruits, vegetables, meats, spices, and candy plus super refreshments.Every retailer here puts in a huge effort to make their food display as attractive as possible.We especially liked some of the smoothies. If you go later in the evening before closing the smoothies are half price.

La Boqueria. I was really looking forward to visiting La Boqueria and I was not disappointed. This outdoor market has a tremendous history and more variety than you could imagine. The many stalls include, meat, seafood, fruit, spices, nuts, cheese, chocolates and there are also many small tapas bars with counter seating where you will find some of the best tapas in the city. I walked through the market every day as my hotel was next door and enjoyed it each and every visit.

Awesome market on La Rambla. While walking up La Rambla, we saw this market that I had no idea was there. This is a great street market with nearly every time of fruit, vegetable, meat, candy and juice for sale. It is open air and bustling with people. If you walk La Rambla, you have to stop here and visit. I would have liked to have found lunch but other than a fruit juice my family was in sensory overload and we had to move on, still one of a kind market.

Full of life. This market oozes atmosphere - full of people, colours, and most important of all - FOOD! There are loads of places to grab food (both sit down and on the go) and so much to see. We had some spinach rolls which were brilliant and some fresh fruit juice from one of the many stalls selling juices and boxes of fruit. Some of it can be a bit pricey but definitely look worth it. It's seconds away from the Ramblas and it's definitely worth the detour to have a look around.

Magnificent market in the heart of Barcelona. The best time to explore the market is mid morning after all of the vendors have opened but before the crowds arrive. There is so much fresh produce located in this market, it is hard to believe they have to set it up every morning and take it down in the evening. If you go deeper into the market, you find better deals on the same fruit, fish or meats. We had some wonderful chocolate covered strawberries on a stick for 2 euros. Try to avoid the lunch rush around noon to 2. It can get very crowded and hot.

A must see. Friends recommended this to me and I'm so happy I went. It was great to see the different options of food. I ended up visiting every morning for a fresh smoothie and fruit. All the food was amazing!

I wish I had a food market like this!. We went here on a Saturday and took in the amazing array of fruit, meats, fish, candy, nuts, legs of pigs! This is a good time to go since the locals shop here but it is very crowded. I would love to have something like this in the States you could tell everything was fresh! If you are going to buy something stay away from the entrance as it is cheaper when you go in the back. I got a coconut beverage and it was 2-3 euros near the front but about 1 euro near the back. They do have some tapas places and restaurants but they were pretty busy but I didn't eat there.It was fun to walk around and see all the different types of food stalls. They do give samples! We bought some chocolate covered almonds that were out of this world. If you miss home there is a dunkin' donuts near the main entrance!

TAPAS PARADISE. La Boqueria is a must do in Barcelona! So many good things to eat and to drink... You can either take your food to the beach for a picnic or sit at one of the many bars and order a feast... And it is cheap! Just go :)

Fantastic food hall. This is a great market to visit whether you are a foodie or not! A fantastic blend of colour, smells and exotic foodstuffs and to top it all there is a good range of tapas bars both inside and on the outskirts of the market. Sitting here and enjoying a drink and a snack gives a great insight to the workings of this fantastic food hall

Worth a visit. Visited here one of the main food markets.We arrived too late in day.....4/5pm when a lot of stalls had closed and most bars/tapas were either closed or closing.But still worth a visit. Stunning displays of fruit and vegetables. Would advise to go earlier in the day!

Amazing, but ridiculously crowded. If you're visiting Barcelona, odds are that you are going to do a stroll on La Rambla, so this won't be out of your way. I would definitely recommend visiting--the fruits and vegetables, in particular, are beautifully displayed and wonderful to see.But there are just so many tourists here that I found myself anxious to leave after a matter of minutes. A pity, because this could have been a much better experience.Still, it's free, you are going to be in the area anyway, and it's a Barcelona institution. You might as well go see it.

Absolutely Sensational. You must go here when you are in Barcelona. The food is fantastic. I sat at a bench and ate some delicious fish - right at the back of the market. There are so many stalls full of meat, fish, fruit, sandwiches and everything else you could imagine. It has the best atmosphere and is probably the best market you will ever go to!

Wonderful!. Nice to walk around and see the fresh produce and eat in the market restaurants. Love the Organic takeout place, vegan pialla so good, did not miss the meat as the flavours exploded in you mouth, not spicy just full of flavour. Going tomorrow for pizza as recommended by another review.

Best of Barcelona. A market right off the rambla. It is like a bit of a tourist attraction now, but who cares when you can get amazing produce, meats, candies, juices... For such amazing prices! We came here everyday to grab fruits for breakfast, and a few more times to grab lunch at the Taco stand and pizza place! Honestly so exciting and delicious absolutely have to go! Favorite place!

My My My I never knew a place like this existed...Take your time. There is so much to say about this place so I'm sure I'll forget something. Scores of rows of fresh pork, beef, exotic seafood, sushi, fruit, juice, candy, nuts, candy, ice cream, vegetables...I'm sure there is more. We spent 3 hours here and I don't think we saw everything. My favorite was the juice...fresh squeezed...whatever you want! I had mango, guava, passion fruit. We also had some pizza, sausage, jerky, octopus, fish, ice cream. Well, pretty much everything. I wish we had found this place sooner. The only reason I didn't score 5 stars...the prices varied A LOT. One booths had juice for 1 euro and the booth next door was 3 euros. And a few, very few of the vendors were a little aggressive. All in all, GO GO GO here!

Best Market, probably ever. This place is incredible. Full of fresh, on the spot made, delicious food. You have to go here. I would recommend going here everyday for lunch but you have to go at least once. It is full of fresh seafood, fresh fruit, fruit smoothies, candies, chocolates, sandwiches, tapas, EVERYTHING. It is all reasonably priced as well. It is a great place for eating or getting ingredients to make your own dish.

Wonderful place to visit and eat at .... Reasonably priced also !. Whilst closed in Sunday's, this place is easy to get to and well worth a visit, lots of beautiful colourful fruit veg stalls, and bars to sit and eat at.... Well worth visit!
It became a tourist attraction. It used to be the place where the locals go buy their fruits, poultry and meat, not it seems to be more of just an attraction to tourists.

Mercat de la Boqueria, a must.. This market in the middle of the tourist trap La Rambla is a fantastic place to find a lot of delicate things to eat and it is a kaleidoscope in colors and decoratively arranged food and it is always crowded with people from morning to late evening. Here you can jump in for just a glass of fresh pressed juice or buy vegetables, meat, fish or why not a langusta or a lobster for the evening dinner. When you are visiting Barcelona, this marketplace is absolutely a must, not only for market freaks as I. I can strongly recommend a visit.

Lovely to wander around. I'd been desperate to visit this food market since my mum visited Barcelona and showed me her photos of it. And I wasn't disappointed! Such a great place to wander around, amazing food on display, and a real buzz about the place.

try some exotic truit. The most popular market in Barcelona, located in La Rambla, the hart of the city. It has a very diverse selection of goods. You should try some fresh fruit juice and some exotic fruit. You will enjoy going to market.

Great market. You must visit this market and see all the produce, meats, seafood and prepared items that are sold here. This is a great place to grab fruit for breakfast or any part of the day. Very inexpensive. You can also get great jamon iberico de bellota here.Opens early and stay open until the evening.

Very busy tourist market. A very extensive market with lots of things on offer, but nonetheless it is still just a market. Worth walking through to have a look, but unless you want to buy things or eat lots of street food (which we didn't because it was just so crowded) then there's not much to it.

I highly recommend travelers to Barcelona to experience this market!. A wonderful market in the center of Barcelona, the seafood, meat, fruit, everything looks so fresh! Also stop to enjoy a "café con leche" while there to experience the sounds and activity around you. Highly recommended!

1€ juices!. This was my second visit and it didn't seem as exciting as the first time, however in saying that it's a must stop place for fruits, juices and photo taking!The market is bustling with people with vibrant colors and yes 1€ juices!Some stores will sell it for 1.5-2€ but on the right of the main enterence you will find a few stores for 1€. Juices are small and not that cold, so if you're suffering from the heat you I might want to get a cold drink from a supermarket first.

One of my favorite places!. This market is just amazing! You can get fresh squeezed juices of all kinds for 1€ (it's 2€ at the entrance, cheaper if you go further in) and lovely fruit cups to bring to the beach. They have tasty tapas places and shaved ham in little cones that is just wonderful. It is also fun to walk around and look at all the exciting things they are selling. I try to come by here every day when I am in Barcelona.

Paradise for food lovers. One of the most colourful food markets that I have ever visited. Not to be missed.The jamón de Jagubo can be sliced and packed for travelling Good place to eat if you want fresh tapas, fresh fruit juice, fresh fruit salads etc

Amaaazing. This is a must-go-to-place. We only had 3 hours inside there one day and it was not enough. Dont eat before you go there, there is plenty of things to try. We had great pizza, good french fries, good burritos and so much juice and fruit. Its cheap and many options for everyone. You should try the chinese/asian food all the way to the left when you go in in the front entrance of the market. They were sold out when I got there, but still, it looked amazing.

Nice but congested market. Great market with some amazing fresh fruits, cured meats, fresh seafood, and these amazing $1 fresh juices. There are also a couple of tapas joints inside as well. Perfect for a walk around if you are a little hungry, there is plenty to snack on here. Some items aren't practical from a tourist perspective, like buying a fresh squid. This is a stop I would definitely recommend in your travel in Barcelona. It does get tight around here so I would keep your belongings close.

Breathtaking . The most beautiful arrangements of fruit, fresh juices, candies, meats, eggs, and just about anything else under the sun! A sight for sore eyes! Even if you don't buy anything, you have got to see this market. It was one of the highlights of our trip to Barcelona.
Sensory experience. Make surrnyou arrive at this market with some room in your belly! It is a full sensory experience, not one to be missed if you're a goody!

Tourist strip in Barcelona. Having just arrived in Barcelona and staying at Serbs hotel Rivoli Rambla you can walk to so many places to eat and markets to shop. The mercado de la Boqueria has so much fresh food...meats and seafood to try. It's definitely a busy tourist spot but so refreshing to walk out and find healthy food and lots of choices. Juices and fruits are plentiful. Looks like we will need our walking shoes on as there are so many off streets to explore.

very busy. Very touristy market, lots of produce but it all looks as if it is just there for display purposes! Very busy and again, watch your belongings, as you can be jostled. Colourful but other places to visit which we enjoyed more.
All under one roof. Don't eat before visiting here. Try the cod croquettes from the fish section, they are delicious. Tapas also looked amazing

The Borough Market in London with bells on!. Came here with the family, spent €15, fed everyone, walked around food shopping for over an hour. Go just for the spectacle. The top was correct - wait until further into the market before spending your money, it's cheaper the further in you go, and the kiosks with bar stools for tapas & drinks are something else!
Must visit. This market was amazing! Everything you could ever want in one spot. This is what I yearn for in the States! Fresh food all around.

Save room for lunch!. A few friends had recommended going here, but we made the mistake of eating before coming here (we figured it was a market, but didn't realize it was a food market LOL). We had some fresh juice and some tapas anyway because everything looked so good (and so cheap!) but we wished we had made a whole meal out of it. This place is also great for photographers too, since it's full of colors, textures and interesting people. Definitely stop by here, but keep in mind they're closed on Mondays.
Amazing colours through out!. Amazing colours through out! Definitely worth the visit. We found a counter where we bought a variety of cheeses and chorizos. Delicious!

Make a pit stop. Market full of everything. Sights and smells and tastes that you do get every day. The seafood stalls are a lessen marine science. From fish and meat to candy and spices, it's all here. Most of it is reasonably priced. Be sure to stop at El Quim for a quick sit down snack...yum

The best gourmet and delicacies! Fresh oysters.....mmmmmmmm!. An amazing place! In the small Place it has concentrated everything as soul desires. Fresh seafood, almonds, sweets and fruit, meat and vegetables - there is everything - it is colossal! All you can taste. Here is a small restaurants and eateries with different tastes and wallet thickness. Definitely I recommend to taste fresh oysters!

Overcrowded, overpriced and overrated. Fun for a quick stroll through, but don't bother purchasing anything -- food's not great and it's fairly overpriced. Still fun from a tourist perspective, but beware of pickpockets.

Heaven for Foodies. The market literally has everything you want to eat - fruits, icecream, sausages, ham, and so much more. My friends and I ate at one of the restaurants on the side of the market for paella and it was one of the best paella we have ever had in the whole of Barcelona. The food in the market itself is also not as expensive as we expected and some seasonal fruits are actually quite cheap despite the market may seem like a touristy place. Everyone going to Barcelona should go and check this market out!

For the tourists more than a real market. Based on other reviews, we went and had a look, ate there and bought some fruit. The cafe food was good, especially the seafood; the prices are higher than other market food stalls - try Mercat Santa Caterina, which seemed more genuinely a market and is less crowded, for a better market experience.

A must visit for foodies!. This is truly a feast for all senses! You'll be overwhelmed by the colour, variety of produce on offer! If you're a foodie, you will LOVE this market, which is purportedly the largest produce market in Europe. There are loads of stalls selling jamon, cheese, fruit and vegetables, cooked food, fruit juices, spices, oils, nuts and sweets as gifts and the raw food (butcher, uncooked seafood is at the back of the market). If you're on a shoestring budget, you can probably grab a takeaway snack or meal from here. We always end up there for breakfast or a mid-morning meal at Bar Pinotxos which is practically right at the main entrance. If you go there, you must try the boiled octopus, sauteed chickpeas and xuxos (custard filled donut/croissant hybrid). All washed down with a glass of sparkling cava! Depending on what you order, the price can range from 20 to 40 euros for two so it may not be exactly cheap. We loaded up on spices to bring home (Morilla dried fruit stall), and also tried their cherries, strawberries and heirloom tomatoes which were in season. There's also saffron to buy, and Spanish bomba rice to make your paellas (which I cannot buy at home!) and of course, loads of jamon and chorizo. Also bought my nut candy from a stall there.

Engaging all your senses!!. Going to La Boqueria is a true experience and it will engage all your senses. You will be delighted to see all the fresh food and all the busy alleys filled with customers and tourists alike. You will be able to touch, smell and taste whatever your heart or your tummy desires to eat. There are stands that serve cooked food, fruit juices, raw food, wine, vegetables, grains, anything that you can possibly imagine. Do not confuse with a flea market, the only thing you will find here is Food and Drinks. Also this is a pickpocket heaven so please be mindful of your belongings while strolling through the market. You can't miss it!

Mobbed at mid-day. This place was so packed, it was hard to get in on a weekday in mid-May. The tourists have taken over. Try to go off hours so you can actually see the variety of foods. LOTS of places to grab a bite so go hungry.

A must see, smell & taste !. This is truly an amazing market. Try a whole bunch of food. No need to sit and eat. Many different spots to enjoy food, drinks and desserts !! A simply great market even if you don't want to buy anything. Juice = 1€Fruit cups= 1,50€ Definitely not touristy pricing. On la Ramblas it's often 2€ for a juice. 2 thumbs way up!!
You will regret missing this. Fresh food abounds!! Go early for breakfast at one of the counters. Nuts, meats, seafood, eggs, candies, fruits, vegetables, smoothies!!!

Fun & food! . Once I heard about this little market, I knew we had to visit. It's about 7 minutes walk from Catalunya metro (on the right hand side). There were many places and a variety of shops: meat, cheese, fresh fruit, nuts, gelato, smoothies (I had one that was incredible), seafood, and even sit down bar style.

Food Heaven. this place is amazing, the food is so fresh and colorful. During our visit last week in Barcelona, we went 2 times. the first time they were closing so we picked up a lot of little tapas, and fruit, chocolates, nuts and had a little tapas party at our hotel. Second time we went we actually sat at a booth/bar and had some seafood and beer, I can't remember the name but it was towards the back. It was a really fun and happening place. I must stay it is by no means inexpensive, my husband and son shared a seafood platter which was probably $30 us and I had a small shrimp plate that was probably $20. Nice experience and the food was good.

A very diverse selection of goods. Every edible thing you can think of is for sale at la Boqueria. The quantity and freshness of the goods is outstanding. A very colourful market worth a visit while you are in Las Ramblas. Tip: If you go at the time of closing, some vendors will sell you their items (fruit salads, smoothies etc) for lower prices, so that they won't go to waste. Perhaps not the freshest around, but still good value for money.

NOT TO BE MISSED!!. A MUST DO if you are in Barcelona! We've been there twice, during pre-cruise stays in Barcelona, and wish we had more time there - just to experience MORE of this Market! The sights, sounds, and smells are nothing like we have ever seen, and dream of going back some day!

Insane. We went to the Boqueria searching for ingredients to cook a high end meal for a new friend kind enough to host us while in Barcelona. Our travel companions lived in Barcelona for a while and had given the heads up as to what you should expect. We were still not prepared. This place is insane. It's like the largest farmers market on steroids. It has everything you could possibly imagine as far as food products. Truly incredible amount of vendors and product. It's unfortunately also overrun with tourists not really buying anything so it can make you feel pretty claustrophobic. Worth a visit

Cacophony of sights and smells.. I always visit the farmer's market in any city I travel to and this one was great. In addition to the fantastic seafood and ham stalls, there are an abundance of fresh fruit stalls where you can pick up a quick fruit juice sitting in cups in ice. The selection is unbelievable. Also looked like a great sit down restaurant counter for seafood, although we didn't get time to eat. Suggest going early in the day as it gets crowded and vendors start to close up in the afternoon.

Must-visit in Barcelona,. It is a very famous a tourist place and at the same time a big market with many stands selling sea food meat, poultry, cheese, juices, breads, fresh vegetables and fruits, pastries and other, prices are usually cheaper. We visit this market each time we come to Barca. It is an authentic place just off Las Ramblas. We had fresh juices and bought manchego cheese, we then had sea food lunch in one of the nice little restaurants among the food stands. It is definitely a must visit place in Barcelona.
Crowded market with fresh produce. Huge selection of fruits and vegetables, fish, cheeses, a real feast for the eyes. Very crowded. Easy to find on Ramblas.

Go for the Experience. It is a tourist place. A very big market with many stalls selling the same things Cheaper to buy some items like Nougat. Go for the walk around it but not worth searching it out extremely crowded - not sure why
Must See In Barcelona. This is one of the better open air markets you will ever see so take the time to drop by and check it out. Great place to grab a bite to eat and people watch as well.

An interesting place to visit. This was our first stop after we arrived in Barcelona. The place was busy. Lots of customers and lots of varieties of food to choose from. The food looked fresh. Similar settings to some of the farmers markets in the States. However, the eating places were very crowded (I guess it was a weekend when we were there) and the hygiene could be improved.

Authentic Indoor Market. This is an authentic market just off las Ramblas . There are great little restaurants in here among the food stalls. They sell lots of prepared fresh fruit and juices and wonderful chocolate covered strawberries! So plenty for tourists to buy. Lots of stalls selling nuts and spices. If you were staying in an apartment this would be a great place to shop ! Well worth a look.

Top notch food options!. The Mercado de Boqueria is like a temple to gastronomy. It’s a riot of food options, from fresh fruits and vegetables to prepared juices and salads to jamon and tapas and seafood. Best of all the prices are all really quite reasonable, my wife and I picked up a few meals; good quality and great prices, ideal for picnic lunches/dinners in city parks and/or at our hotel’s rooftop deck. Definitely a must see in its own right but worth consideration for taking care of meals!

A taste of real Spanish life. Take a look at where locals and visitors alike can buy fresh meats, fish, bread, spices, and so much more. This place is a feast for the eyes as well as the palate. We made some purchases for a nice brunch of local ham, bread, cheese, "tortilla espanola" and fresh squeezed fruit juices.One caution: Spaniards use all parts of animals in their cuisine, and some of the meat stands display various organ meats and heads of the animals. It is not for the faint of heart or vegetarians. Skip on ahead to the pastries and breads!
Amazing!. So much diversity in food that you can eat on the la boqueria market! You can find prepared food and fresh fruits!In the corner we found a nice bar with excellent wine.A bit crowdy

Soak it up!. An institution just off Las Ramblas and as famous for its cooked food as fresh! To be far you need to go really early to see it in the working sense but never less it's worth a visit whenever you can go!Weren't able to eat at the Legendary Bar Pinotxo as busy so settled for a nice bar at the back were we over indulged in pulpo Morcilla and several tortillas!Just love the whole vibe and potentially could of wasted a few more hours here!

not very ecological. How changed this market has become in only 3 years! it used to offer an amazing display of artistically exhibited fruits and vegetables, all placed in perfect harmony of shapes and colors. Although today the exhibits and the fruits are still the point of this market, everything is displayed in transparent plastic cups . The fruits are cut and sold in these gobelets which are then left behind under stalls or accumulating in the garbages. I would really suggest to the newly elected mayoress of Barcelona to come to this market and see for herself the totally non ecological attitude of the new marketeers.

Nice market.. I sort of expected more from La Boqueria because I read many good reviews about it. It seemed to just have the same thing over and over again. I wouldn't say that it's the best market I've been to, but it is worth a visit.

Gorgeous Food Displays. We've visited every time we go to Barcelona and love looking at the gorgeous displays of foods. Lately, more fresh fruit and smoothy types, but still fresh fish and lovely looking meats, as well as lovely snacks.

Amazing market on La Rambla. Very nice market on La Rambla. Take a walk inside and enjoy all the seafood shops and bars. You'll be able as well to eat some local jamon (ham) or typical dishes. Highly recommended!

What a market!!!!. This place is absolutely breath taking. When I visited I was expecting just a common market... but then, you see it. Fantastic, colorful, full of life! Must visit it when in Barcelona! Great to have a snack or just to walk around admiring the stands. Fruit is amazing there so go ahead and eat some!

Great food and drink options under one roof. If visiting Barcelona, one must visit the Mercat Boqueria. It's got several food and drink options under one roof.. It also has a fresh food market selling good quality fruits and sea food. The fruit juices flavours that you can find and lovely and unique. I had some yummy Strawberry cocounut juice and Mango coconut. Among the bars and restaurants, some good options are - Bar Clemens - for seafood and Bar Pinotxo.

A MUST WHEN VISITING BARCELONA. Its an old market extremely well maintained, great for breakfast or lunch at the small puestos where they serve you fresh fish, food or whatever they have. Beautiful historic place

A feast for the senses. We visited the market for a cooking class and then again to look around for ourselves. It is a feast for all the senses: sights, sounds, smells (okay, a few of the smells I could have done without), touch and tastes. It is a busy, bustling market – nothing quiet or dull here. The way the food is laid out is an art form with different colors and shapes making up different pictures. You can get fresh fruit and vegetables (love their idea of fast food - fruit in a container already cut up and ready to eat on the run), delicious smoothies, very fresh fish and meats and food already made up and ready to take with you (more fast food: Iberian ham twirled onto a stick). Leave a lot of time to go stall to stall and do not be dissuaded by the seeming chaos - it is part of the charming experience. We bought some saffron and small sachets of olive oil to take home which were very well received. We found a sandwich stall with delicious treats for lunch.
