There were stalls where you could eat but we were there during lunch time and the seats were all taken.
Dead Animals Galore. The place stinks! If that is your idea of spending your time, in a butcher and slaughter house, go ahead and enjoy it. It is disgusting and revolting and I ran from there.

Exciting Fresh Market. Very closely place from Liceu Subway station. center of ram brass street.Famous sight seeing place.But, everything Fresh and has Good Bar.please do not miss when you visit to Barcelona.

A must visit. If you are in the Ramblas you need to pass by this market to at least have some fresh fruit that are available in abundance already cut and with a great selection. If you wish to cook fish at home also this would be a good place to find your needs. But just to have some fruits would be highly recommended.

Eat here. This should be the go-to place to eat and drink. Go on your first day in Barcelona to check it out. It's buzzing six days a week (closed on Sunday) - we only visited on Saturday and that was a mistake. In addition to usual fruit, vegetable, cheese and meat market stalls, there are several tiny open plan cafes.
drinks and food galore!. impressed by the assortment of drinks, fruit, meats, pastries available here. A visual feast as you walk into this market. Spend time to see the taste delights for sale!

Best seafood of our trip. This market is a bit different from the one in Madrid (Mercat San Miguel) as that has common seating place where u get food to your seat while this is mainly a market filled with small tapas bars/ restaurants. I prefer this. We had some great meals here- bar boqueria, bar pinotxo and of course the star that is bar Clemens. I would strongly advise at least one visit here- u will surely return. It's right in la rambla.. Near the Carrefour store.
Jam Packed Market. It is always jam packed. The fresh squeezed juice are amazing. So much bright, beautiful food. There are other markets that are not as crowded and don't have as many tourists.

Great place to grab a quick lunch. If you're on the go or simply on a budget, go to this market. It's nice to walk around and see all the food offered. You can order meals like baked or fried goods, pasta, seafood, etc. alongside fresh groceries. It is closed on Sunday.

One of the best markets in the world. This was our second visit to the Boqueria Mercat. On this Occassion we had the confidence to really interact with stall holders and also enjoyed a late lunch at one of the bars. The way we were looked after was amazing a sign that the Barcelonians really appreciate their international visitors. Nothing was too much trouble. Take a chance and eat like the locals.

A Taste of Catalonia. Every possible thing you could eat or drink can be found at this market. Fish, meat, vegetables, fruit, nuts, spices, etc, etc, etc. You can get meat on a plate, in a bag, in a cup, on a stick, on a rope, etc, etc, etc. Every possible combination of fruit drinks, and candies of every size and shape. The colours and smells overwhelm your senses. An experience not to be missed in Barcelona.

Wow... back for sure on our next visit to Barcelona . A traditional market adapted to satisfy the travellers needs and curiosity.... no words to describe the mix of colours and smells of spices. .. small cones of the typical ''Jamon'' mixed with cheese. ... the fresh seafood. .. all this can be bought or eaten in the Market of Saint Joseph de la Boqueria.... A must.... to visit in Barcelona

Amaaaaazing . This was awesome place to walk in..Its a Bazar for food ..All kind of fresh foods are available Juices and slices of fruits are very good idea to start...The internal atmosphere is absolutely fantastic and look like old townsVery recommend

Cool. Fun market to visit while in Barcelona, however; if you've been to other markets in other big coastal cities (Seattle especially) it's much of the same but with local offerings that shouldn't disappoint.

Fabulous Market! . So much food to choose from, excellent fresh seafood including sea monsters I have never seen before in my life! Definitely get some fresh cut 'pata negra' from the vendor on the right of the main entrance.

Awesome Market!. This market is right off La Ramblas. While it is insanely busy with tourists especially later in the day, it is so cool! It is an attack on all of the senses and I loved it! So much to look at, smell, an hear! There is so much fresh fruit and fresh squeezed juices! I liked it so much we went back early the next morning to have fresh fruit and juice for breakfast! Again it is packed with people later in the day! We went early and it was much less crowed when the market is first opening.

Everybodies favourite eatery.. Not many people can pass up this iconic public market. Fresh fruit, vegetables, fish, meats and then the deli style pickled, smoked and dried.There are dozens of bars and food areas making tapas, meat and delicious seafood combinations. Fruit drinks, wine and beer, the best that Spain can make.Tourists love this area and it is packed, particularly at lunchtime,Customers pick a diner who looks like they are about to finish and queue behind them for the seat.There are ice cream and fruit combinations to finish your meal. A visit here is a must if you are in Barcelona. Enter from Las Ramblas........too easy.

The best food market in the world?. I love this market which sells a huge range of food. There are beautifully bright fruit and veg displays, fish and seafood to delight, butchers counters, cheese, ham, nuts, wine, olives...just about anything you could desire. There are also lovely little bars scattered around where you can stop for some tapas and a drink. Simply stunning.

Why are they turning a grand dame into a hooker?. This was undoubtedly once a tremendous place to shop - and there are still areas, particularly the fresh fish stalls, where there is incredible variety and quality, and tremendous knowledge and skills (filleting) by the vendors. But what is it with the profusion of stalls selling cheap smoothies to tourists? These are the people taking selfies in front of a water-melon and willing to spend no more than a euro on a nasty watered down fruit confection. No wonder they ban tour groups of more than 15 on Friday and Saturday until after 3pm. Pity the old ladies who come daily for the freshest of produce and have to squeeze past obese camera toting (nationality deleted) who couldn't tell a pomegranate from a guava. Some reviewers have said that prices are sky- high because of the tourists. Not so, some prices are high because of QUALITY ! For people used to buying a bucket of buffalo wings (whatever they are) for $5 it may seem obscene to pay €195 a kilo for ham aged for 5 years from an acorn fed hog but that is because the Spanish don't expect to sit down and eat a kilo all to themselves smothered in mayonnaise in something called a submarine sandwich. This is a great market being sullied by people who don't actually come to buy the food ! My advice would be to come here as early as you can, keep your sense of humour, try to speak Spanish, however badly, and compare prices - there is choice, exercise it. Even haggling is acceptable.

Tourist central!!. Okay, this market is cool and there's a lot of unique products and great places to eat. And the candy... Yummy!!! But the problem is the market is so packed full of tourist it loses its charm and it's hard to navigate. I would recommend finding a smaller neighborhood market.

LOVED this market!. Randomly walked into this place while wandering Las Ramblas one day and ended up spending the whole afternoon. Fresh fruits and juices, local foods, wine and sweets...it was fantastic!

Great quality. The prices are high here as the market is surely marketing to tourists rather than locals.However there are very nice products, colorful juices everywhere, fruits and vegetables, meats and sausages, and amazing seafood.Kids will love walking through the market and sampling some of the produce. Be sure to tell the sellers how much you want because they can be VERY generous with the amount they try to push you to buy.

Must Do. You have to visit on your stay in Barcelona. Venture past the initial fruit stands and there's a layer of the city waiting to be peeled back. It's beautiful and the noise can seem overwhelmingly like an orchestra. Plus, if you're ready for a snack, there's a cornucopia of choices laid out for you -- all within a thrifty budget!

Worth visit just before the closing time. I agree that this market is famous and impressive. I especially recommend to visit it before closing (8PM), since then you can find great offers. At other time, everything is quite expensive and it is difficult to get any discounts.I do not recommend buying traditional turrón in La Boqueria, since in El Córte Ingles (Pláca de Catalunya) it is much cheaper.Also you should be careful with juice. It seems that in some places juice contains too much water.The cleaness of whole market could be better.

Great market. La Boqueria market was such a great place to wander around. We intentionally got a hotel room that overlooked the market to wake up to the sounds and sights. Right off Las Ramblas, this was a market that was alive with great food and vendors.

This Open Market is a Sensory Feast. A plethora of vendors under one roof, including fishmongers, butchers, produce and artisanal food sellers. It reminds me of a very fancy and diverse US farmers' market. You can purchase any cheese or sausage imaginable, most have a tasting tray for passers by. We visited twice and feel like we could have visited again. The crowd is a balanced mix of tourists and locals. Some booths include an eating bar where you can order catch of the day. Closed on Sunday so plan your visit accordingly.

Hungry even thinking about it!!. Loved this place. Everything here you can think of, nothing more to add to whats already been said. Buzzing, busy, colourful, missing it already. Loved the juices, great guacamole & nachos!!

Typical Spanish markethouse. You shouldn't miss visiting La Boqueria! It's located just sideways of La Rambla and it boasts with stalls, markets and activity. Try the juices for just 1 euro and you won't be disappointed.

Gorgeous market. . Such a fun market to explore! So colourful and interesting. Make sure you try the juices, jambon, chocolates, fruits and sit down to eat at a tapas bar! Get there early to avoid crowds- when we were there it was raining and yet the place was still packed with people! This market is definitely super touristy and I don't imagine too many locals visit, as it is quite expensive for a lot of it - however, it is still a must visit!!

A sight for all the senses. I love markets and always try to visit one in a foreign city. The Mercat de la Boqueria is one of the best I have seen. Catalonian towns grow around their markets and la Boqueria provides a daily service to the locals and a great treat for tourists. It has existed in one form or another since the 12 Century. You walk into the market, off the Ramblas, and are greeted by the sights and smells of the most fabulous chocolates and candies. Barcelona is famous for its sweets. Right beside the glistening sweets are stands with fresh fruits and freshly squeezed juices ($1-2). Along the sides of the market are the cheese vendors, selling fresh slices of manchiego cheese. Along the outside flanks of the market, are the meat/ham vendors. Fish vendors are also placed along the back flanks. This represents some thoughtful placement so that you are not bombarded with strong tasting foods as you walk down the centre isles. There are one or two cafes at the back, tapas bars, as well as bakeries selling local bread and pastries. You could easily eat a full breakfast or lunch at the Boqueria and be full for the day. The market opens around 8 and it is best to get there early for great selections and less picture taking crowds.
An absolute must in Barcelona. Amazing variety of local produce - truly a foodie's dream. So much to see & taste! Even walking around, you hardly know where to look.
Jamon. I really love that place! We stayed in a Hotel very close to that, and was impossible to get out at night without see beautiful people in there! Try a most delicious jamom ever!

Our best times were in this market!. We stopped on our first walk through La Ramblas. It is intense as soon as you hit the market sign. 1st lesson, you see it, you like it, you better buy it. I saw some mango infused cheese and waited until our next visit and it was nowhere. Although I found some cheese with pineapple in it, yum! There is everything from 189 Euro a kilo super special Jamon to penny candy. Fruits, nuts, dried and candied fruits and nuts. Meats and fishes of all kinds. And then there are the tapas stands around every turn. What that place starts popping you are lucky to turn around. The spices and seeds and beans are laid out in their stalls they look like mosaics. The walls look like tiles with product. Don't miss this experience!
Every City must have a Market. Las Ramblas STOP for good food and more interesting people to watch. Small restaurants with great fresh food. what better place to take a break. recommended MeuterMedia

Just stunning!. I could have been happy just coming here. The colours, smells and atmosphere was just fantastic. Fresh food and produce in abundance and the rainbow of colour was wonderful. I felt like a child in a toy store. Love it.

Not to be missed. This big food market is at Ramblas. We had lunch at the Pinoxto Bar: the seafood was fresh and cooked the way you like it right before your very eyes! The boqueria has everything from fresh produce, eggs, nuts, candies, to different types of jamon, they are all enticing and a feast to the eyes! It's like the Disneyland of food!

A must see in Barcelona. Today we visited the market, wow you will never die hungry here, there's something for everyone and some of the aromas are to die for ! The crowds were there in the masses. This is a must see in Barcelona.

The Colors are Delicious. My favorite part of Barcelona! La Boqueria is located off of La Ramblas and is definitely worth a detour. There are countless food stalls with fresh fruit, vegetables, meat, fish, or their own meals. Shy away from expensive restaurants around La Ramblas and eat a better lunch at La Boqueria. I personally tried two types of fresh fruit juice and two small sandwiches (olive and chicken and olive and salmon). The food is cheaper, likely fresher, and the experience is better than you could get at a restaurant. If you didn't go to eat, enjoy perusing the stalls, being awe-struck at all of the colors, and get lost in the scents and sights of the food. But, I bet that once you're there, you'll just have to try something. What I had here was by far my best meal in Barcelona.

A feast for your eyes. Mercado de La Boqueria is an amazing market specially when it comes to seafood and Jamón Iberico, but not everything is a treat, even though they might look great. We picked up fruit cups and wild strawberries from one of the vendors and they were both very disappointing. The former lacked any flavor at all and the latter was an inferior quality. Thankfully Jamón Iberico made a lasting impression.You can see the pictures at:https://travel4foodnart.wordpress.com/2015/06/01/mercado-de-la-boqueria/

Highlight of Barcelona. We came at lunchtime on a weekday. It was packed!! We tasted our way through the many stalls, having tapas and tasting the free offerings. While the crowd made it difficult to get around and there was that bit of trepidation you get in a foreign city when in Europe--i.e. pickpockets, we were very happy with our visit and would highly recommend it.

fresh for sure. So on our vacation, we didn't waste anytime having "hotel breakfast", we just came here first thing. It opens at 8am which is plenty early for vacationers. Plenty of fresh fruits, seafood, candy, snacks, jamon, drinks, etc. There are some vendors that serve tapas in here too. The closer to the entrance vendors seem to be more pricier than towards the back. But no matter what you chose here you will have something fresh.As many said, it is hard to pick what to snack on because of the almost limitless choices.Have fun!!

Foodie Heavan. This is the best market in Barcelona. The food, the colors, the smells, the chaos, the beauty, the history all what you want from a food market. We got all our breakfast snacks from here, no need for expensive hotel add on. You could even pack a bag lunch for later. Avoid stalls in the front as in most markets, they tend to be the most expensive.

Food heaven. Very very busy but what a joy if you love good produce.Sit at a tapas bar and enjoy great produce.Try the ham, buy ham pick n mix. Great idea. Great fruit and herbs and spices.Great fish and meat. How I wish we had markets as vibrant as this at home.A must visit if you enjoy looking and experiencing food.
Such colour. I was so tempted to try new foods but I was too nervous as I only speak Spanish poorly. Wish I'd gone with a guide.

Couldn't make a decision. There are so many food choices that I couldn't make a decision to buy anything. Plus, it's so very crowded- it's tight to move and you'll be jostled around. It was incredible and I'm glad we went but probably wouldn't go again. I kept a strong grip on my purse!!

You must certainly visit this market!. An impressive market in the most central part of the city. You'll find carefully positioned whole fruit and fruit peeled and cut into portions at very cheap prices, sausages, charcuterie, cheeses, fish, local sweets.Also you can buy charcuterie packed airtight back for home. You can even try tapas with a glass of wine.

La Boqueria - a "see food" experience. All things edible - tapas, fresh fruits, slushies, sweets, fresh meat, beer, wine, etc - under one roof. This place will not only delight your stomach, but your eyes as well. Another must-experience when in Barcelona.

Big food market off the Ramblas. This was a cool thing to see. Food, food and more food. Easily toured in 45 minutes, with lots of things to graze upon with Euro coins in hand. I found it similar to the large urban markets found in Mexico, only cleaner and without the fear of contracting a nasty, vacation smashing food born illness. Some say it may be touristy, but hay....I'm a tourist and this was neat to see, especially if you have never seen a big bustling city market before.

Awesome street market with some bizarre fare. If you can't find it here, people don't eat it... From fresh fruits and pastries to brains and snouts, this place really does have it all. Totally worth a walk though when you visit the Las Ramblas district!Warning: this is a hotbed for pickpockets. Just be aware of your surroundings (at all times in Barcelona) and you'll be fine!

Must do, see, smell, taste!. This place is amazing. The food is fresh, cheap and delicious. Get a smoothie and wander about, buy some fresh fish, sit down for tapas, just take it all in. Do what you want, just go!

Wonderful, But TOO Crowded. On my first visit to Barcelona, a few years ago, I didn't visit La Boqueria, in spite of the fact that I had heard it is a must-see. I DID go to the wonderful Santa Caterina market and was delighted by it.Then, a few weeks ago I found myself in Barcelona for a day, and decided that I would stroll down the Ramblas and drop in on, among other places, La Boqueria. As I walked towards it, turning right off Las Ramblas, I could already see the seething crowds outside slowly making their way in to an even more crowded interior.The place is fantastic, just as most people write. The displays alone are startlingly beautiful, from fruits and veggies to seafood to meats and cheeses. And there are several places at which one can sit down on a bar stool and eat to one's heart's content. There is no doubt that La Boqueria is one of the best of its kind, anywhere.But I just couldn't take the crowds! Trying to make my way down the center aisle was almost impossible, and almost everywhere else the same was true. Only at some of the very edges could one collect oneself, not be constantly jostled, frankly - have a good time. This may just be me, as certainly many WERE having a good time. I had for a while the goal of getting a seat at one of the bars, where there would not be much room but where I'd at least have a little personal space and maybe be able to eat. But it became clear that the people who had claimed a bar stool were not easily going to give it up. I DID get through all the main sections, and again, it's extraordinary. But as I wrote in another review of Barcelona, on Las Ramblas, "the people were packed so tight that the sardines were gloating!" I was there on a weekday afternoon in early May - what must it be like in high season?You'll go, of course you'll go, as I did, and you'll enjoy it - if only La Boqueria could manage crowd control!

Fun To Wander. This is in a super touristy part of the city and between this and the Ramblas the only time I was worried about where my purse was at all times. That being said.... the market was a site! We didn't buy or eat anything there but just wandered through the stalls and it was awesome.

Best seafood market. The market has all the options you needed for a healthy diet. From fresh fruits, vegetables, seafood and poultry. The beautiful colors of fruits and vegetables are just wonderful. We bought lobster for Christmas lunch just in case restaurants are close and we enjoyed it so much. This is the only market too that I found a purple potato. I would go back there again.
Great destination for breakfast or snack. So many good things to eat..where to start. Macedoine fruit cups to go, halved dragonfruit to go, cheeses, wonderful Hams.

plethora of goodies. Even tho' it's quite a jam in there, it's a great place to see a variety of iconic Spanish food. Stalls of chillies, olives, hams, fish, fruits & cheese provide a feast for the eyes and nose. It's a riot of colour.

A market with everything!. Wow what a market. I read so much about this market, but its even better than i thought! So much variety, the hanging legs of jamon, the varied wheels of cheese, fresh abundant seafood, colorful fruits and the raucous crowds all enjoying this mecca to good food! There are also places to eat, like tapas from Bar Pinotxo or great seafood from El Cochinillo Loco! There's all this and so much more. Its open Monday to Saturday from 8am to 8.30pm.

THE place to eat. We had the best seafood, fruit, candies, Iberian ham, Manchego cheese,cava, and sangria here. It was very crowded in the mornings, but died down in the late afternoon which made it perfect for us to go in for tapa after a long day of sightseeing and shopping. A great place to take pictures, too.

Central Market on La Rambla. What a feast for the eyes and senses! A color explosions of everything you could want to eat and drink. The fruits, vegetables, dried mushrooms, nuts, meats, sweets, pastries, spices and the cured hams, they are called jamón Serrano. I bought some saffron, and chili spices to bring home. I bought some brie cheese, ham and a baguette for a picnic lunch at Montserrat with some fresh squeezed juice. Everything was delicious and reasonable. I took lots of pictures of the fresh and colorful displays. There were lots of shoppers, mostly locals in April. They say in the summer it is very crowded with tourists and locals. I can recommend off season travel.

Avoid at all cost. One of the historic markets in BCN this used to be a special and truly Spanish experience. Just before its major renovation is due to start, the market has lost about half of its regular vendors. The empty stalls have been filled with smoothy mass sale driven by asian vendors at prices too high even for tourists ... Aboid this place for now and wait for its re-opening next year.

Visit when you're hungry. We had been told to visit this market, and it was well-worth it. It's a food market, with lots of places where you can eat sitting at a bar, or buy something to take with you. The food displays are stunning and very tempting. Hang on to your bags - it's very crowded. Don't let that put you off, this is a place that shouldn't be missed.

Food galore. If you like food markets this is a stunner. It's huge and full of stunning displays of fruit, vegetables, meat, fish, confectionary and more ...........
Wonderful for foodies.

Everything and then some! . Gorgeous market! Very busy and crowded but the beautiful and delicious displays of food make up for the crowds. Great place to find freshly cut fruit and freshly squeezed fruit smoothies for a euro! They also have every cut of meat, every type of seafood and sweet that you can dream of. It is definitely a foodies paradise and well worth the visit :)

Amazing Market. First let me say that this market is very clean. And it doesn't smell, even in the fish area. Bring your camera. You are in for a treat! I have never before seen so many candies, so many parts and pieces of meat, so many fish (live and fresh)., so many choices of olives. . . This is an amusement in itself! There are lots of tourists, but then it is so different from markets elsewhere. It is conveniently located right on La Rambla. Not to be missed!

Very large market full of atmosphere!. A lovely market on the side of La Rambla, full of atmosphere and busy people with busy markets selling all sorts of food and drink - you could be forgiven for spending a little money in here. My favourite choice was the €1.50 fruit pots, which offer a delicious refreshing snack on a warm day.

The holy grail for cooks. Vibrant, busy and overwhelmingly interesting for anyone with an interest in cooking (or eating!). The produce is perfection and every stall makes an effort to present their wares in the most attractive way imaginable. A great place to grab a picnic lunch, a cheap fruit juice and some cut fruit. The only downside of this place is, if you are staying in a hotel you come away incredibly frustrated that you can't go home with a bag of goodies and prepare a meal. Oh...did I mention the lollies?????

food , food glorious food. for anybody who enjoys cooking or eating this is the place to visit, just on the rambla , this market has anything a cook can dream of. even if you are staying in a hotel , it is a nice place to go a view , the fresh fish counters, meat to die for, fruits, spice counters, anything you can eat is here. Also plenty of little bars to have a bit at, fried fish, serrano ham .

Truly Great Spanish Market. We entered the market off La Rambla and wow what a great atmosphere. This place is a feast for fish and meat lovers. There are huge displays of fresh fruit and juices and sweet stalls all over the place and don't eat before you visit because there is plenty to eat all over. If you reading this and looking where to in Barcelona - yes visit here. Enjoy.

I wanted to cook every single thing in the place.... A bit overwhelming, what with the crowds and tourists, but the seemingly thousands of stalls with fresh produce, meats, jamons, cheeses,breads, fish, sweets... it all looked wonderful and inspiring -- we bought provisions for dinner and ate it all on our rooftop terrace. Loads of places to get something to eat and or drink, we parked ourselves at a seafood bar and got some grilled seafood and killer fried artichokes, washed down with cold local beer. Just watch for pickpockets on la rambla - busy place, loads of tourists, fertile grounds for robbers! (luckily we weren't robbed, just watch your stuff! :-)

Not as I expected it to be. La Boqueira is centrally located in Barcelona, basically on La Ramblas. The food market is not as big as I thought and offers a range of stalls with cured meats, fish, cheese and fruit. It is good to have a snack there and it is a place to visit in Barcelona

A veritable cornucopia!. A must in Barcelona! Loved this market! A huge variety of foods/drinks etc. to be found & experienced. Even if you don't buy anything, you should walk through it! There are seemingly endless booths of all sorts of goodies & there are tapas bars throughout. We enjoyed walking through the whole market, perusing & sampling & settled at the very back at a tapas bar, Clemens, to eat--DELICIOUS FOOD!! So many bright colors & aromas---just a pure delight for your senses! For those of you with strollers, it is usually 'tight'/very crowded in the market so be determined once you enter & keep small children by the hand! :P An excellent maze of yummy discovery for an hour or two!

much hype about nothing. the oldest and biggest market in Barcelona for every conceivable type of food you could wish for.all the stalls laid out and beautifully presented with fresh produce, all tempting you to buy something.the market covers a fairly large area but it is much of a muchness. there is nothing unique or different. the smells are the same. the noise level is the same - in fact i prefer the main market, L,Olivar in Palma de Mallorca.Stop for a coffee or morning tapas and listen to the locals chattering away in Catalan. It is a great experience
La Bogaria. don´t forget the Mercat La Bogarìa, St Josep, La Rambla.Great market for breakfast / brunch, Mojito 5 Euro :)

One of the world's great markets. Fish lovers delight!Meat lovers delight!Shellfish lovers delight!Iberian ham lovers delight, from those on a budget to 180+ €/kg.Rabbit/lamb/chicken lovers delight!Clean, not crowded until 11:30 or so. Plan on 2-3 hours!

Highly recommended . This is a must visit for any trip to Barcelona! Grab a bite at one of the bars and watch in utter awe the crowds and the mesmerizing array of delicacies, local produce and delectables on display. Walk the many aisles of food shops and soak in the beauty of it all, what a sight!

One of the best attractions in Barcelona. The market structure dates back to 1830s, although the original market began in 1217. This traditional Spanish market offers visitors a unique experience with stands that offer everything from candied insects to rare exotic mushrooms and herbs.Here you will also find the "El Quim" our place to eat in the market.

Great Food and People Watching. A visit to the Boqueria while in Barcelona is a must. If you happen to go around lunchtime, stop at this wonderful place. It sits in the center of everything. Grab a seat at the counter and watch the madness all around you. We ordered the grilled artichokes (fantastic) and the grilled seafood platter (expensive at 30Euro but amazing).

Mercat de la Boqueria. You MUST allot an hour or two to this experience. Located off Las Ramblas, it is a raw and prepared food market unlike you've ever seen. Best before noon(fish and other fresh food vendors pack up in the afternoon), the offerings are not only delightful to look at, aisle after aisly, but irresistably tempting. A heaping fruit cup for breakfast or cured meat, cheese, olives, and shellfish for lunch, you won't be able to say no. Plan on taking scores of photos. Nothing in Barcelona is so colorful, energetic, or unbelievable yet relatable.

A must see in Barcelona!. This is a great market. Its mostly food. The fresh juice is excellent and widely available for 1.50 Euro. The seafood stalls with bar type seating were packed. You can buy fresh meats, cheese, and seafood here as well so its NOT just for tourists. So far one of our favorite places to wander in the city! Decent bathrooms at the back of the facility.

Fun Photo Opportunities. It's not hard to be drawn into this colorful market. First, you will be greater with vibrant fruit juice stands. For €1, don't hesitate to stop for a drink - they were delicious. Then, get your cameras ready, because you will see a ton of interesting dead animal parts posing as food for sale. The sharp toothed fish, octopus tentacles and lamb heads were my favorite parts. The marzipan candy stands were especially creative. Stop and get some free jamon samples sliced right from the giant hanging legs. Be careful about eating at any of the small restaurant stands - some of the prices were outrageous.

Interesting food market. This place has become a great tourist spot where you can find a large variety of food ranging from fruits to sea food and olives to Iberico ham. Worth a walk round but again beware of pickpockets.

A great one time experience!. Yes, it's touristy as is most of Las Ramblas. It's just a place that must be visited and experienced at least once during your visit to the beautiful city of Barcelona. The trip would have been incomplete without walking through the many food stalls. This is the place to go for all kinds of unusual foods to take home as souvenirs. They also had many exotic fruits, seafood, nuts, mushrooms, and even hot pepper sauces. I bought some mango juice which was very refreshing. I was tempted to buy the fruit cups which looked very good. I wish I had done that.The best time to go is in the morning (before lunch). There are tons of people there all day long. It may be difficult for some people who don't like to be in large crowds of people. It can be a mad house. Make sure you guard your belongings. We were told that pickpocketing is very high in the market, but that happens everywhere. Don't let it hinder your experience. Just enjoy it.

omg amazing. Wow what a place, can't recommend a visit here enough, when you walk in your senses are on overload, it's the most amazing place selling food, have the fruit drinks they are fab, if you want to eat you can, we had seafood, octopus, whitebait, crab claws, wish I could shop here all the time.

Food not trinkets . La Boqueria is strictly a food market, if you are looking for more of a flea market vibe or a place to purchase trinkets to take back from your trip your time would be better spent elsewhere. That said, the market itself is spectacular. Lots of similar stands, 3-4 stands selling fruit and fruit juice, 5-6 stands selling meats, 3-4 stands selling veggies, several stands selling fish and several a stands selling bread. Take a pass around the whole place to gauge the prices before you purchase something as the prices for the same objects can very from vendor to vendor.

Eat, eat, and when full, eat more!. This is one of those unique places on earth where you must ignore that silly feeling of being full and just eat till you drop! You must try the fresh fruits, the candied fruits, tapas, gelato, artichokes, pastries, seafood and anything else edible. Really! It's that good.The area is a near closed market with scores of stalls selling everything from fresh to cooked food. Don't make it your last stop of the day as almost everything comes to a screeching halt around 5:00pm. Great for lunch or brunch and really affordable.

Exotic and delicious food!. I loved the variety of fruits, vegetables and many other products from many places! During my short stay in Barcelona I've gone there a couple of times specially to drink delicious fruit juices (very cheap!).

Too busy. Was just too busy a place. Couldn't get any food anywhere as everywhere was packed. Pretty much just wanted to get out of there. I was looking forward to getting food there to make dinner, but was not a welcoming atmosphere, so we left.

Walk Around and eat !. It is a nice market where you can walk around and try several types of food - Jamón, fish, cheese, fruits, etc - moreover, the prices are low! Highly recommended if in Barcelona

Colorfull market, one of the most interesting parts of the Ramblas. We passed this market strolling down La Ramblas on our first day in Barcelona. You get automaticallt sucked in by all the colorfull stands and smells coming from the market. Once passed the beatiful market entrance you will be blown away bu all the fruitstands in the beginning. It looks delicious.Venture further in market cause you will find more than one fruitstand and the offers are great for great prives. You will also encounter several stands with fresh fish, meat even candy and sweets shops.More to the side you also have small bar stands where you can enjoy freshly made gamba, calamari or tuna right in la Boqueria, maybe even next to the stand where they bought their produce.Anyway lovely market must see!

Really cool way to eat lunch!. I had lunch here with my mom and boyfriend halfway through our stroll down La Ramblas. It was really cool! We ate samples from a lot of different booths. We had cured meat skewers, cured meat wraps, smoothies, fruit, chocolate covered strawberries, stuffed bread, and an interesting burrito. It was a great way to eat because it was pretty cheap, and we got a lot of variety in one meal. We also got to walk around while we were eating and check out the whole market. I would have loved to have bought some eggs from the egg booth, but it was pretty close to the last day of our trip and I wouldn't have been able to take them home. Definitely would recommend!!

Best breakfast, lunch and dinner. This is, by far, the best market I have been to. Beat Borough Market by miles. It was so good that me and my friend when here several times on our short break just to experience different meals. It was so nice to wander around with locals and the staff there are so friendly. Be warned, it gets packed. For me, this is a must if visiting Barcelona and is located perfectly on Las Ramblas

SPECTACULAR MARKET!!!. A truly wonderful food market in central Barcerlona!!. This place has everything you could imagine and More. The food is displayed like artwork and beautifully done. The people are wonderful. I took some of my most memorable photos here and bought some great food and things to take home. This is really not to be missed. A food Gem right off La Rambla!

This is THE market. What a brilliant experience ! You must visit this market the selection of fresh food is amazing a feast for all your senses Sit up to a Tapas stall and have some freshly cooked food at reasonable prices

Tourist trap???. First of all I have to say its very nice spot. Lot of fresh see food, fruits and vegies... yes we ate here and yes it was OK.. we came back second time and we spend more time to see things.. and yes, appart really from fresh stuff like fishes and meat, everything is overpriced and not really as it seems.. look at fruit, one chain same products of juices etc. Even pankakes done infront of ya its a franchise you can find at many places.. Bio Organic food stand, we have ate that Paella or what ever is the name of the dish, and it cost 10Eur and it was just rice and raw vegetable. DO NOT EAT AT place called BAR BOQUERIA we had grilled squid it was really grilled - wow congrats, but we ordered grilled octopus with potatos and it was all do e for 10min in microwawe!!! For 14Eur? Seriously? WE REFUSED AND IT WAS GIVEN TO NEXT COUPLE few minutes after!!! Go there enjoy atmosphere eat so ething small and get out!

A Fascinating Market. You can get a good feel of Barcelona by walking through this busy and extensive market which has a wide range of goods from meat, fish, vegetables, fruits and small goods. It is usually crowded and which adds to the atmosphere and fun . Well worth a visit if you are at Las Ramblas.

I love the huge covered marketplaces you find in big cities. Barcelona has one of the nices I've seen. From everykind of meat, sausages and fish to cheeses, vegetables, wines and olive oils (and olives of every size and shape) and candies and chocolates of every shape and size. Here you can find prepared tappas to take out or eat there. The colors are amazing, the smells are amazing. Did I mention spices? I bought authentic Spanish Saffron and rice. I will be making some great Paella this weekend!

La Boqueria Market. This Market is really unique place. The colors make you happy and the variety is so big that you may miss one of your favorite. Buy the most exotic fruit you dreamed on and enjoy it . Take with you some sweets from any preferred color or shape and enjoy it all day long. Drink smoothies and enjoy the taste of even. Many people walk between the small shops but you easily find your way.All shops owners are friendly and you can take pictures of the beautiful and colorful stands.I am sure you will enjoy the visit in the market.

Prepare to spend time here. This is one of the best, most captivating markets I have ever seen. The fish is so fresh that it is still flapping on ice, and all of the fruits and vegetables are sweet from local farms. If you want to try Iberico ham, this is the place for you, but be prepared to buy about 100 grams.
Colors and scents. Market full of fresh fruit, vegetables, fish and meat. Also sweets, nuts and chocolate. You can have a drink and a bite and take in all the colors and scents.

Amazing. One of my highlights. A must for food lovers. So colourful and beautiful. The produce looks lovely fresh. My husband a fresh mango juice and I had a small punnet of mixed cherries. I would definitely go back there. I am planning to return to Barcelona and stay in an apartment where I can buy the produce for the market and cook myself and enjoy the fruits, cheeses and meat selection.Enjoy your time visiting the market but don't drop your guard. It is very busy and crowded.Avoid visiting late evenings. The best time is first thing in the morning.

Colorful, local flavors not to be missed!. Where do I even begin? It is an absolute treat for all your senses! The colors, the smells, the sights. Of course you can buy raw produce & fish like the locals do but most tourists probably indulge in the amazing fruit displays (including chocolate covered strawberries on skewers) and smoothies or the cheese/ham cones. You'll see fruit you've never seen before, parts of animals you've never seen before and probably savor some local flavors you will not find anywhere else in the world. Go - enjoy and try everything!

Not worth the hype. Expect over crowding, lots of fresh juice and veg, lots of the stalls sell the same thing which is disappointing, also lots of the stalls where closed when the website states that the market is open until 8pm & it was only 6pm, won't visit again but it is an experience if you happen to be passing.

AMAZING!!!!!!. This market is AMAZING! The fruit is so delicious, the real fruit ice creams and fruit juices are definitely the best!!! So cheap too. Go early (it opens around 8.30am and is closed fridays) to avoid most of the crowds. Some of it is quite expensive but its mostly pretty good. 100% recommend.

Must!!!!. City Market is always where one can se how, what,when , local people eat, what king of food they eat .Boqueria is a very special place , the best one Market in Barcelona , specially for sea food, fruits, and look for one that you can find a lot of funguiThe prices , a bit touristical .Pepole, photos, selfies- many!!!

Very Tempting!. It's funny isn't it? .. .. I mean that when you're away from home on holiday,commodities that you see in the shops such as food for example always seem to appear so much more interesting and tempting than what you generally see when you're doing your shopping back at home,and we found that this was definately the case with the 'Mercat de Sant Josep de la Boqueria' which you'll find halfway down the 'La Rambla' tourist thoroughfare in Barcelona,which is a very busy market hall absolutely crammed with all types of meat, fish and fruit on display,all of which was obviously very fresh and looked really appertising.My wife bought herself a fruit drink to enjoy here,and I must confess that we were sorely tempted to take some goodies home as well,but as with most markets the produce on sale is perishable and I'm sure that it would not had lasted the journey back to the UK,so we were disappointed to have to resist the temptation to buy lots of foodstuffs and fruit here,although we did treat ourselves and make a small purchase of some fruit and sausage to eat later on in the day for our lunch - and I must say that it was really fresh and absolutely delicious.My wife and myself considered that the 'Mercat de Sant Josep de la Boqueria' was our favourite place to visit in 'La Rambla,' as it is such a super market hall which is well worth taking the time to stroll around and to view all that's on offer here,and much to my surprise bearing in mind its location in such a major tourist hotspot the prices charged in the market seemed to be fairly reasonable.However,much like all of the 'La Rambla' area,it's a very busy place to visit,and do remember though that it is closed on Sundays................Enjoy your visit!
Dazzling. The market had an astonishing variety of items, and it was a colorful array of foods from all parts of Spain. It was a joy to be amid such a cultural celebration!

Delicous food!. We wound up eating lunch three times here, the little tapas places are serving delicious and affordable food. (Check Bar Clemens - great!) You can also find smaller snacks here, for example smoothies, empanadas and different fish snacks.Great atmosphere, but can be quite crowded.

Great, bustling market - a must-see!. Brimming with life and people, with a maze of different stalls - was a great experience to get a taste of what a real market feels like. Had a fresh coconut juice which was ice cold and delicious! Very crowded but great to see this first-hand!

A big one!. Yes its touristy but it still has the most amazing stalls jam packed with every kind of food imaginable. Pastrys, jamon, olives, herbs spices nuts fish meat fruit n veg, chillis... and incredible cheese shops. Everything eyepoppingly displayed.It is a lot more than just a tourist sight.Go for brekky and avoid the crush.The bars inside are terrific. We had an amazing coffee, one of the best in barcelona. Good food to be had at the bar.The biggest priblem here is not being able to carry sacks of produce home and not having a bih enough stomach to eat all i wished on our visit.

Must visit. We've always loved markets and this one did not disappoint. Other reviewers have detailed out what can be bought from here so I will not repeat. There is a stall El Pepito or something like that that serves amazing breakfasts. Try to stay away from the fruit lady right at the entrance of the market. We bought some cherries from her and while those on display looked fresh and bright, she gave us the ones that were wilting.

A Tourist Must. It was great seeing the varieties of fresh foods on display and the chance to taste the small different dishes for a few euro's at a time, but beware, without realizing it you would have eaten a ton in a couple of hours.Great place and a must

Tourist must - I guess. There are certain places and things one feels obligated to experience when visiting certain cities. In Barcelona this is one of the musts. Walk down Las Ramblas, enter and experience the crush of people, sights, smells, and sounds. Enjoyable? Not terribly.Interesting? Not really - unless you are new to European markets.Best market? Not really -high prices, tight quarters, etc. There are other markets in the area which are more pleasant, offer similar products, and are actually enjoyable to walk through. However - if you ant lots of people, and noise, waits for a stool at a tapas counter, high prices - this is your place.I prefer to see it - understand the nature of the place - leave with my wallet still intact - and go to other locations for a better experience. Best deal is to go an hour or so before closing and buy a fruitcup or a smoothie made from the day's fruit that didn't sell - good deal.Worth seeing - nothing else.

Must Visit Mercat de la Boqueria. The Mercat de la Boqueria on Las Ramblas is a historic market and amazing must see attraction for anyone interested in a unique cultural experience in #Barcelona, Spain. You can find many varieties of bread, candy, chocolate, coconut, coffee, dried fruits, fish, foods, fruits, fuets, herbs, juices, Jamon (Spanish hams), meat, mushrooms, nuts, sea food, seeds, smoothies, tapas and vegetables. You will be able to enjoy a wide variety of cut fruits, juices and blended smoothies priced from 1 to 2 Euro each. Many people enjoy a cerveza and tapas for lunch or dinner.

Fantastic Market, You have to visit this place. A must visit market, walk down La Rambla turn right, When you enter there are amazing stalls of all of the fresh fruit and veg you can think of, Follow the isles up and down, you then find the meat part, fantastic cuts and all totally fresh. Then in the middle the fresh fish circle, so fresh some of the crabs, lobsters etc were still wandering about. Then the bakery stalls with pies and pasties with numerous different fillings. Also little sit and eat stalls, with full platters of seafood, paella, omelettes etc, Or buy little wrapped up parcels of different hams, meat etc for 1 or 2 Euro's, bowls of different fish Squid, white bait, prawns, etc about 5 Euros, all washed down with amazing fresh fruit juice or bowls of fruit, 2 Euros. Go in hungry you won't come out hungry. We ate quite a bit and no dicky tummy !! Best go AM

Beautiful Market on Las Ramblas!. This is a really cool market. It's beautiful and they have everything you could ever hope for and more! Try the smoothies, they are really delicious! The prices here tend to be higher than you can get at other markets , but that is because this is the main tourist attraction market . It is on Las Ramblas which is a very busy street. Keep your valuables tucked away safely(It's very safe , but always keep this in mind)This market is a must see. If you don't buy anything, take photos!

Best market. Market is bustling noisy and full of atmosphere. First place we stopped to eat in Barcelona, and we were not disappointed. The food stalls sell the freshest produce in the world and the bar food is reasonably priced and delicious

Best part of our trip. If you are food lover, or love a bit of culture, then you have got to visit the market. This was easily my favourite part of my trip to Barca. We walked around for 30 minutes, but I could easily of kept walking for another hour. So many colours, foods, atmosphere.The best part was the food at the tapas bar. It felt the most authentic part of the trip, eating fresh seafood and tapas, having a few drinks, whilst chatting and listening to the noise of the market.I will definitely be back again one day!!!!!

Probably the best place in Barcelona! (tip for families in the review). This was our second visit to the fabulous market place and it is the absolute must-see (or must-be) for me. Mouth-watering food, feast for eyes and tummy. If you dread crowds - stay away. We managed to wander around with a buggy + two children. Even my older fussy eater enjoyed the superb smoothies and meaty sticks. If you are visiting as a family, I would recommend a small playground in one of a side streets, just off La Rambla where one of the parents can keep the kids entertained, whereas the other can do a tour round the stalls and buy some tasty goodies.

Fantastic fresh fruit and other delights. Don't miss this wonderful market.I recommend going for breakfast before the crowds arrive.You will find beautiful fresh fruit stalls, meats, vegetables, cheeses and creative sweets and chocolates. A foodie paradise! Enjoy

Great market, huge variety. Walked in to this market out of curiousity when I was taking a stroll, but it turned into one of my highlights of the trips.It's great to see markets like this, as they are few and far between where I live, and there was a huge variety of items available to buy and browse. Although I was unable to purchase any of the fresh meat available (I was staying in a hotel without cooking facilities and was unable to transport any back on the flight) it all looked very appetising, and if I was to stay somewhere where I could have cooked it I would have bought food from here for every meal.As well as the meat and fish on offer, there are also spices, nuts, sweets, alcohol, chocolates and many other things available to buy.As a side note, I was warned that pickpockets are quite active in the market, and although I didn't experience it it is worthing paying close attention your belongings whilst browsing. And also, although most stall owners do not have a problem with it there are certain stalls where they do not appreciate tourists taking photos of their stalls, but these are usually identifiable by the warning signs within the stalls.

One of the best public markets around!. Filled with the most gorgeous colours, smells, produce, flowers, sweets & chocolates, seafood, meat, cheese, oils and so much more! The counter top places to eat are superb for food, value and quality- we went back every day!

I could eat here every meal for the rest of my life. Food heaven. Everything you could possibly want. I hate we didn't stay closer to the market because I would have gone there for every meal. Tons of great prepared food at reasonable price and a ridiculous selection of stuff to take home and make yourself. Also, there is a stand inside that will validate your parking ticket for an hour (3€) and sells market bags (4€) which made great souvenirs to send home. I hope I make it back there soon...

Great market - excellent food and fun sightseeing. Very fun, lively and colorful outdoor market in Barcelona. A must see! Worth a visit to buy random food for a picnic. Words of wisdom...very crowded, lots of vendors selling very similar products (so check around), and be wary of pick-pockets. Plan to spend at least 90 minutes walking up and down the aisles and taking it all in. Lots to sample and enjoy! Overall a very fun experience...fresh food, great smells and sounds, and amazing deals.
hungry??. if not yet, you'll become!! Beautiful colors of fruit and vegetables, large offer of whatever you can imagine.

Colourful Market. Busy and bustling, full of colour and character. Prices for fruit , veg and meat are not bad, however one star is taken off for the extortionate price charged for 7 bonbons...€8.80!!! Beware of the chocolate and sweet stalls.

Fabulous foodie market. This market was one of the highlights for me of our trip. As soon as you walk in it's just a rainbow of fresh fruit, vegetables, meat, fish, eggs, olives, spices, sweets, chocolate... You name it, it's here!! It was, as you can imagine, insanely busy but I guess that's part of it's charm and is what this place is all about. A great place to find some goodies and souvenirs to take home; some stalls have produce at a good price although of course you can get a lot of it in the supermarket down the road much cheaper, but not the same! Loads of food stalls dishing up fresh tapas too. There are also several stands that sell fresh juices at 1€ which you should definitely try!

Foodie Mecca!!. When in Barcelona you must visit this huge market- it is an experience for all your senses!!! We frequented the Boqueria almost everyday that we were in Barcelona. We would purchase fresh fruit juices and had lunch at Pinoxto twice as well as two of the other sit down tapas bars. All the food is incredibly fresh & prepared directly in front of you. It seems to always be crowded and I can see why. Definitely worth visiting!!!

Great for a meal or just sightseeing. I wandered though this beautiful food market, then came back for a fantastic and affordable lunch. I think markets are often overrated, but this place lives up to the hype! It gets very crowded so I recommend grabbing a seat for lunch before 12:30.

One of the best foodie markets in the world. Amazing food market, great to walk around, get fresh fruit and shakes and lots of other goodies. We ate in one of the fish bars one day but another time we just walked around and bought food off the stalls like cod fish cakes, crepes, meat pies. Full of everyday produce and more high-end gourmet food as well.A must visit for all foodies in Barcelona.

Incredible collection of foods - try the fresh juices. This is a large market off Las Ramblas, which can also get very crowded. Tip: Push through the crowds at the entrance - the crowds thin out as you get deeper inside. Whatever you are hungry for, you are likely to find it here - ham, seafood, tapas, vegetables and fruits, etc. Many vendors have fresh fruit juices for sale - they are delicious, refreshing and reasonably priced.

The variety of delicious foods. If you like to cook at home you should come here for sure. If not you should come here anyway. Taste all sorts of fruits and vegetables and meat and fish and anything else you want! The prices are a little bit higher but the atmosphere is amazing!

A "Must Do" but Be Prepared for Crowds. This is a lively place with excellent food offerings but if crowds bother you then go early in the morning or late afternoon. We went at 3:00 and it was jam packed but when the left at 4:30 the crowds had thinned out (but still crowded). By 11:00 the place is packed. The food displays are beautiful and the variety of offerings is staggering.

If you are a foodie...this is a must do. This is a must do for foodies. Here is can try all kinds of famous Spanish foods. From cups of Spanish cheese to amazing olives to seafood, this market has everything. This is a great place to pick up food for a picnic or just eat your way around. Make sure to bring cash. Also this place get crowded so don't expect to do this in 5 minutes.

Picture Perfect Market. Be sure to go early, shops will begin shutting down slowly about midday. Be prepared to fight the crowd, but it's worth seeing all the sights (especially the colors), sounds, and smells. If you see something you want to eat or get, buy it when you see it because it isn't always easy to remember where you saw it the first time. The market is a nice free place to kill time while soaking up community commerce at its finest. I advise against trying to navigate this as a group, but rather set a meeting point and time instead of trailing everyone and potentially losing someone.

OMG the food!. I have made a point to visit La Boqueria on my two visits to Barcelona. I've told my friends and acquaintances to go here and none have been disappointed. We all wish we had something like this at home.If you can eat it, you can probably find it here. And mostly healthy, too. Though it is a bit crowded, people are friendly and helpful. Take your time to look around; the displays are artful. You can taste your way through or enjoy a whole meal. Buy some things to take along for snacking later.

Explosion of colors. This iconic market that's been here for centuries and always my go to place when I'm in Barcelona. I spend my morning here for breakfast and always enjoy the explosion of colors from fresh fruits and produce from the sea. If you love to cook and with interest to photography, this is the place to kill time. I always go to my hang out place, a small stand in the middle of the mercado to order my breakfast of the day. I never get tired spending my time here.

Great for fruit and juices. Good place to visit, great for fresh fruits, smoothies and juices - but don't just buy the juices/fruit pots from the stalls near the entrance, they are half the price at other stalls further inside.

Superb Experience!!. The market is full of colour and vibrancy! Any fruit or vegetable you could ever imagine is sold here for a very cheap price. They sell delicious fruit smoothies, fruit cups, fruits juices for under €3. There are countless spice and charcuterie stalls, fish stalls will fish I didn't den know people ate! It is truly an experience and I would recommend going. Don't forget to pick up a fruit cup when you're there!!!
Tasty food. Best meal I've eaten in Barcelona. Gorgeous grilled vegetables and fish. Simply prepared. Bloody lovely.

From foie gras to butchered lambs' heads, you find it there. What a fun market! You find anything you ever wanted and some food you don't. What a great place to shop if you have a kitchen available. Definitely worth a visit.

Best Market ever!!!. Living in Oxford I am lucky to have a covered market on my doorstep. However now I have visited Barcelona I am very jealous.This market is fantastic for any food lover or people watcher. You can sit and try Tapas at various places around the market and of course you know you are eating some of the freshest food you can. For €1 you can sample a cone of cheese or the local speciality iberico ham, have a freshly made juice, pretty much anything you want to eat.

Colorful. It is packed with tourists. But it is very colorful with all kinds of foods. Just be careful with knowing the prices of things. Got a couple pieces of chocolate (a handful )and came out to 12 euros!!! We didn't see the price per weight,but didn't think a handful of chocolate would cost more than a freaking meal. Other than that get some juices, ham, candy, and enjoy

Interesting to look at, very busy. Just of Las Ramblas means this market is packed of tourists.Worth having a look at the produce: fruit and sweet stalls look impressive.Bought some tasty, huge strawberries.Recommended.

Worth the experience. We planned to visit on a monday morning but couldnt as the market was closed for Easter holidays.Should try the juice and fruits on offer. The fried calamaris etc. were decent too. Tips:1. Better to buy stuff from the shops little on the inside as you tend to get better rates2. You have an option of requesting the sellers to warm the fried calamaris etc. 3. Liceu metro station has a direct exit leading to the entrance of the market
Great open air food market!. The colors , smells and activity puts you in overload! The booths are full of delicious beautiful foods! What a great market for the locals and restaurants to shop from!

So awesome, great food. Visiting La Boqueria was so great, especially for my inner-chubby-mind. This place is full of meat, cheese, fish, fruit, desert..you name it. The vendors are always willing to barter, and the four of us ended up getting 4 cups of fruit for 2€, when usually one cup is 2.5€. There are places to sit down and eat fresh fish, which makes the experience really unique. Don't visit Barcelona without visiting this Market!

One of the greatest food markets that I've ever visited. As someone mentioned in an earlier review, this market attracts mostly tourists and may not represent a typical local market. However, as a tourist, I totally enjoyed the experience. There are all kinds of food, wonderfully displayed. There are fresh seafood, Iberian ham, all kinds of fresh fruit juices very reasonably priced, crepe vendors, etc., etc. If you are a foodie, you'll probably enjoy this.

One of the greatest food markets that I've ever visited. As someone mentioned in an earlier review, this market attracts mostly tourists and may not represent a typical local market. However, as a tourist, I totally enjoyed the experience. There are all kinds of food, wonderfully displayed. There are fresh seafood, Iberian ham, all kinds of fresh fruit juices very reasonably priced, crepe vendors, etc., etc. If you are a foodie, you'll probably enjoy this.

A site for the senses. A beehive of activity and a sensory overload. It's a fun experience to wade through the crowds at this market and see all sorts of goods for sale, from produce and candies to seafood and meat. There are several places to snack, and we especially recommend the Casa Guinart just inside the market to the right.

An Amazing Place to Visit! . This local food market attracts big crowds so much so, that tour groups of 15 or more arriving between 8am and 3pm on a Friday or Saturday will be turned away in a bit to quell a growing discord between visitors and locals.Every type of local food imaginable can be found in this market from meat, seafood, bread and amazingly coloured fruit and vegetables usr to name a few. You could spend a good hour just walking up and down the stalls seeing what is on offer. There are a few eating places in the market and beautiful fruit drinks are a popular purchase by tourists visiting this location. As mentioned at the start of my review there are large amounts of people visiting this market. As in any city and being in crowds of people keep your valuables safely on your person and out of sight of others. With the crowds of people visiting this market I can understand why the local population are probably getting a bit disgruntled, as it is the local market place that they would buy their own daily food needs and requirements.

Foodies heaven a great atmosphere. it was busy but a great buzz, amazing fresh produce fish, cheese , meat . We loved wandering around trying out some delicious cheeses and hams. Fresh smoothies 1 euro and some delicious ice cream too. We bought ham and cheeses .it was great to see locals and tourists shopping. If you love food it's a must and open till evening too .

A market mostly for tourists !. A very crowded market that attracts mostly tourists! Smelly and some places naturally wet! Vegetables, friuts, fruitjuice, fish and meat, nuts and so on! But if you want to see how genuine local markets look like, go to other markets! My wife and me visited this place recently, we did not buy anything except some big strawberries, cheap but not specially tasty ! We felt we wasted our time, we just got tired walking through the huge crowds of tourists !

Excellent experience, great place for lunch.. Our last day in Barcelona and we wanted some cheese to take home, something a little special. Looked at a few stalls then tasted some before we bought a Spanish cheese (sheep) and a Catalonian (goat ). Only specialist shops in UK have this choice. The quality and choice of the food available was astonishing. Dry aged beef for half the price it is at home and lovely fresh vegetables and fruit. Loads of tapas and ready to eat fish stalls. I opted for a Burrito with fish and seafood with salad and mayonnaise to take away 4.50€ and my partner had a mushroom Tortilla (huge portion) with salad 3.50€, from different stalls both very fresh and tasty. If we had been more hungry we would have sat down and tried the fish stew as it looked very good. All the stalls were being frequented by local purchasers. Old ladies doing their shopping alongside tourists getting a good meal. On Fridays it seems the market is open till 8pm so you could get an economical early supper.

Thriving and vibrant market place!. The market is open 7 days a week and sells fresh produce, meats, herbs, bakery items, nuts, seafood, snacks and much more. Even if you are not hungry I'm sure you will buy something. It is where the locals go to shop and meet and greet. (hold your bag closeby)

The chocolate and dried fruit stall. Seabon would have hardly been able to contain his excitement if he had been faced with this stall in La Boqueria market, which sells not just chocolate products, and nutty products, but also dried fruits. "Sick," he might say, "those dried kiwis look delicious." With this in mind, my companion and I decided to purchase a small handful of these green, gellatinous delicacies. After resolving a minor price dispute with the serving staff, whose service had been otherwise exemplary (a bag for buying the sweets had been thrust into our hands before we had even shown an interest in the stall - how did they know that the thing we had been searching for was the very dried kiwi fruit displayed at their very stall?), we were soon biting in to the most exquisite dried kiwi, flavored with the slightest hint of fish, presumably due to the kiwi fruit's prolonged exposure to the fishy air of La Boqueria market. Certainly worth trying, if you haven't already!

A great place for lunch. An experience for all your senses!Amazing bustling, atmosphere, fresh produce, tasty food at excellent prices.Make sure you take lots of change - and be aware of pick pocketsWe loved trying all the local food, which many stalls sell tapas style

interesting experience in a market!!. as soon as we entered the market, we got so fascainated the vibrant environment, the various food and the color!! We also ate at the bar inside! Very fresh seafood!

Yummy treats for everyone. Visited on Christmas Eve 2014. Just of la ramblas this market has lots of colours, smells and noises to get all the senses working overdrive. We found a stall with some very unusual sweets and chocolates that the children loved. A must for any visitor to the city.

Foodie heaven!. This market is well worth a visit for any food lovers. There are stalls selling everything from fruit, vegetables, fish, meat, confectionary, smoothies and fruit juices, pastries etc. Some of the stalls you are able to sit down at the bar and eat which is much cheaper than visiting some of the nearby restaurants. Definitely worth a visit even just to look around.

Colourful mix of Foods!. We walked into here out of Las Ramblas. As soon as you walk in you are hit by all the colours and smells around within the market. We were overwhelmed by the choice of food on offer here. It is very easy to let your guard down within the market itself and we were constantly aware of pick-pocketers and beggars who were roaming around.It was an awesome place to go and well worth a visit. Great for all ages, and cheap too!

A must for food lovers. Paradise for food lovers. The fish, fruit and vegetable stalls are particularly impressive. Lots of possibilities of take-away snacks and meals including filled baguette sandwiches and yummy pastries from the bakery, salad dishes and paella etc. also bars where locals go for breakfast including beer and seafood! I came away with a carrier bag full of herbs and spices - very good value and quality

gastronomic attraction!. If we talk about what to sell on the Boqueria market, that is to say that it is easier to talk about something that is not here!Individual deserve admiration wonderful taste freshly squeezed juices. Be sure to try the juice here as we did during a walk through the market, it's so special taste!In my opinion, hotel tables give the flavor of the market designed specifically for tourists, where they can taste or that the goods purchased. Also on the territory of the market there are several cafes and restaurants. True warn that prices in these institutions is quite high! While this is understandable - Boqueria Market is a local landmark, and restaurants, is located on its territory, recognized as one of the best in town!

Great morning walk. La Boqueria it's an amazing and beautiful market full of all kinds of fruits, meats, fishes and vegetables that you can imagine. It's a really interesting aproach to the reach variety that we have in our mediterranian diet. I really recomend to have some tapas in el "Pepito" a small bar in the right side of the market, with amazing tapas, seating in a small sqare. Delicious!

Fruit Juices and South American Pastries are a Must!. Amongst the hustle and bustle of the market are some really great foodie finds. Although many of the stalls sell the fruit juices I was eventually enticed - kiwi and coconut! Then is a part of the market with a south American feel with pastries, burritos, nachos - all looking super tasty! We got a couple of the pastries which were fantastic! Visit to eat, drink and marvel at all of the markets tasty treats.

Everything what you wanted :). Everything you wanted to try it and then what could not imagine collected here;) got here in the morning, not a lot of people in the morning, you can safely walk, try and take photos on the memory. Very interesting place, I advise)

Overwhelming and fun.. We walked Las Ramblas pedestrian street (every mindful of our wallets) and found Boqueria...it is a HUGE market with every imaginable fruit, veggie, sea creature, and land creature...including chicken and ducks with heads attached, sheep heads, pigs' feet....let's just say nothing is wasted. We bought yummy cashews and dried apricots, a fruit smoothie for only 1.50 euro....enjoyed watching people. Pay toilets available.

nice photo session. was a nice place to take the colourful settings. other then that nothing else. been to other cleaner and cheaper mercat in Barcelona and mallorca. this is just a tourist stop for picture session. won't recommend to eat here nor drink.

Don't miss. Very crowded (keep an eye on your wallet) but absolutely breathtaking. The freshness and selection of the food, as well as the way everything is displayed is like nothing I have ever seen. Grab some food for a snack or lunch. Great photo opportunities.

Feast for the senses!. This highly colourful market is brimming with fresh produce. Lots of fresh fruit juice - kiwi,banana,mango,strawberry,coconut,melon etc!! Also fresh fruit cups. The drinks and fruit are more expensive toward the main entrances and cheaper elsewhere eg fruit juice 1.50 at entrance, 1.00 inside. Also exotic fruits like dragonfruit which were from Vietnam are available.Lots of vegetables available and small cafes selling meals - everything from seafood to crepes to pizza.There are some amazing chocolates made it all sorts of shapes and creations!The seafood section is a bit smelly & the meat section a bit graphic - poor skinned rabbits complete with eyeballs :( It is just off La Rambla so definitely worth stopping. It is closed Sundays and seemed more crowded on Saturday than weekdays.

A Vast Array of Lovely Fresh Goods. This place, just off the Ramblas is well worth a visit. It's jam packed full of interesting stalls - even if you're not looking to buy anything in particular it's a feast for the eyes and senses.

Market along the Ramblas . Read this place on TripAdvisor and decided to check when strolling along the Ramblas. Locals still shop in this place in spite of the throngs of tourist...including me ;-) who flock to the area.Good place to see and taste food....see people and just enjoy the atmosphere of a different and great culture. When in the c Ramblas I think this place is a must!!

Great place. Don't miss this place if you are in the area. Such interesting sights on the meat stalls, not seen offal for sale like this ever! The fruit stalls were beautiful. Great photo opportunities at each turn.

A feast for your eyes. A colourful feast for your eyes, the taste, smell and hearing senses were not forgotten either! I very vibrant market where there is a good mix of tourists and locals shopping. Lots of food to enjoy, take a seat at one of the many stalls and enjoy the sensations!I did find it a little expensive, a tourist trap so not sure if there is a price for locals vs tourist with the mix of customers.

Must visit while at la rambla. Try one of the fresh juices and walk through the lovely market, enjoy the smells and colours. Very crowded though (there are smaller and less crowded markets in other districts).
Great market!. Definitely a must if your in Barcelona, lots to see, smell and taste! Expect it to be a bit crowded but other than that its a must!

No visit to Barcelona would be complete without a visit to La Boqueria!. After a leisurely stroll around the market marvelling at the abundance of high quality product on display we perched on stools at a cafe and enjoyed tortilla and sangria, along with many locals also partaking in great food and company. We tried to start each day with fruit from the market and any other delectables that took our fancy.

Appreciate the beauty of food and start your day here!. A breathtaking market - countless stands stacked high with gorgeous whole fruits, cut fruit cups, fresh juices, vegetables, bread, pastries, eggs, meat, seafood... it is a beautiful and energizing place to walk through first thing in the morning. Start with an espresso (or cafe con leche if you prefer) from the stand at the entrance and then start to wander through the market. One tip - the fruit stands further into the market have slightly lower prices on their fruit cups and juices. You will pay a little more to grab one when you first walk in, so take a minute and wander around first to finish your coffee before you grab something to eat.

Catering to Tourists is Great!. It is a great market. And it is a bonus that they know a great majority of customers will be tourists based on their location. I don't have the time to slice up a slab of meat or cut up a bunch of fruits and veg. Or make a sandwich. I'm on vacation! Someone else please do this for me at relatively good price. Done. This place does it. Fruit cups with sliced fruit. Meat cones with slice meat. Smoothies all ready to go. Cheeses. Crepes made for you. Sandwiches. Tapa bars. Bakeries. Candy that looks like fruits and cute things. Be careful as your money will quickly drain as you keep buying things. It is cheaper than I expected given it is a market for tourists, but still a bit pricy. You should at least go here since it is free to browse about.

One of the best markets. This market has a lot of variety from dry to wet. You can find anything from here. I am told that it is for residents, but it has become more touristic. However, you can still see a lot of local here to purchase their food needs. One of my favourites is seafood and this market has a whole lot. You can see it in my pictures. Please do not go in the evening because some of the shops will be closed. I have lunch in one of the restaurants and buy some fresh fruits which are very good. You will not be disappointed.

A must for foodies. Very jealous. I would love to live near somewhere like this. Shop every day with no need for a freezer! Everything is so fresh and bountiful. Fish is probably the highlight, but all is good.We ate at a Fish Tapas Bar (Bar Central I think) at the back -- superb!
Great and fresh food . Very cool and nice place to have lunch or breakfast. Just buy a couple of things and have a smoothie. Maybe som fruit? Sit down in a park and enjoy. Worth the visit

Worth a visit, but too catered toward tourists. Nice enclosed market area off of Las Ramblas shopping street. Walking through the market, it just seems too commercialized and too catered toward tourists. Instead of selling whole fruits, there are more vendors selling fruit-in-a-cup for 1 to 2 euros, and more fruit smoothies.
Personally, I like the market in Valencia much better.

Great market. I travel a lot and I always visit the markets. This is one of my favorite. The markets filled with a great variety of fruits,veggies,food,etc. We discovered this amazing crepe place there. Seriously better crepes than in Paris.
A lot's of different places here to have a great lunch.
Must do. We went to la Boqueria twice to walk around and eat lunch. It is huge, and there are lots of great fresh foods to snack on.

A Wonderful Market. A fantastic market filled with a great variety of fruits, veggies, candy, flowers and general food essentials. Everything looked so fresh and the vendors weren't pushy or aggressive, so it was a very pleasant way to spend a couple of hours. We didn't buy a thing but it was such a great experience. Try it, you'll like it!

Nice food market. This is one of must-see in Barcelona.
Is a charming food market. You can by anything related with mediterranean food, like meat, fish, spices, fruits, also yo can by some Takeaway sandwiches.

You must see it. If You have time go to Barcelona, when you will be there, nearby the rambla you will find it. There is also a metro station outdide this market. Open at 6 am close at 6pm. I suggest to have a lunch here. Why? You can eat all what you want!!!!! And the price are so cheap!!!! More thant 5stars

Five senses overload. If you are an adventurer looking for more than just museums and churches, then you must visit this market.
