You can learn a lot about a culture by visiting their old public markets. This is no exception. When you walk in you realize this is not for the faint of heart. There is hustle and bustle everywhere. The vendors and visitors intermingle and play a game of bumper cars (w/o the car) on the isles. The strong smells are everywhere, from the very pleasant smell of the hams, chorizos and fruits to the pungent smell of the fish and seafood. The fish are right out in front and center as are all of the products. Some defy description. There is one fish (rape in Spanish, Monkfish in English) which may be the ugliest fish I have ever seen. Not even a mother could love this fish. It is used a lot in fish stews because it lends a deep strong flavor. I loved walking among the many selections, and was almost awe struck by the sheer volume of options. It is almost like hawkers all vying for your attention. I was taking pictures as if they were an attraction. The stands each specialize in one area, such as the one that has the embutidos (charcuterie), or the one that has fritos. The selection of hams and varieties of sausages is mind boggling. I noted that my senses were getting a workout, but my wife said that she was in sensory overload. I wound up tasting many of the offerings but going across the side street to appease my wife, for a delectable ice cream and coffee. If you go midday it is basically shutting down, so go early. It is well worth it to experience.
fruits!. lived nearby and took a five minutes' walk to this market to get fresh fruits and drinks for breakfast. there is a great variety of fruits, vegetables and seafood of reasonable price.

An absolute must in Barcelona!. This vibrant market has everything from produce to seafood to fresh juices. And everything tastes as good as they look! It is nearly impossible to leave this place without one of their fresh juices for 1 euro!Tip: If possible, try to resist purchasing from the stands near the entrance of the market as they will charge a bit more than the stands located farther in.  Also, make sure you bring cash!

Great Foodie Market. Boquria is directly off las Ramblas. Huge varieties of fresh produce and delicatessens. Lots of food stalls in the market serving fresh seafood. We had a wonderful lunch sitting at the food counter watching the chefs prepared the food for us.

So much choice!. It's got every fruit, vegetable, fish, bread and drink you could ask for. If you're self catering you need to be here. There are also a couple of cafes inside for your early morning treat.

Best Market in Barcelona. This is a must for anyone visiting Barcelona. We have visited this market on several occasions and always see/smell/taste something different every time. Some of the restaurants inside are pretty good, too!

Varieties!!. Varieties of everytihg. This is the place where senses really come to life. The smell, the view, the feeling ... The market just has everything. Pick couple of slices of persutto, grab a cheese or two and a bottle of amazing local wine and just sit on the stairs and enjoy the best meal you've ever had.

A treat for all your senses. You could easily walk past this entrance as very narrow off of the Ramblas. Every type of fresh food you can think of and lots of speciality items. I few restaurants on the edge. Not to be missed.

Colours and Smells. Amazing market, with differents foods, fruits, spicies.
It is amazing the several colours and smells around the market.
You need to taste the fruits.

This market is so fun!. You'll feel the atmosphere right from the entrance, fresh colourful fruits,veggies, freshly squeezed juice, candies, fish and many other seafood, ham and meats. This place is probably my favourite during my trip in Barcelona. Buy the juice and some local snacks and just enjoy wandering around the market, if you're a foodie like me, you're probably gonna spend some money in this place (but it's worth it tho, nothing's overpriced), because you just want to buy and taste everything. my friends and I, we bought the juices, cut fruits and fried calamaries, the ham(serrano, omg!), and empanadas. definitely recommended! we went there twice, on Wednesday and on Friday, on Friday is definitely more crowded, but it's fine.

Delicious Market. A beautiful market full of everything any food lover could want. It was extremely crowded when I went, but it's well worth braving the masses. I was able to find some of the best jamon to take with me and had a really delicious lunch.

Great spot to wander. We loved exploring this market and wandered in a bit before buying some juices. Everyones juices have added sugar - we didnt find any wihout. We ate a seafiid sampler at the back of the market and enjoyed the freshness and service. We went on a Friday and I'm glad because when we dropped by on the saturday the place was even more packed!
Lots of fresh produce. This market is beautiful, located on Las Rambla. There is so much fresh fruit here and it is displayed beautifully. You can also buy lots of nice spanish meats.

Beware! Impulsive food shopping awaits!. This place is really awesome. Colourful salls selling all things worth trying from cut fruit/juice through pasties, ham, seafood to sweets. We really enjoyed the look of all the stalls that sell fresh seafood, but there is plenty of things prepared, ready to eat there. I think it's best just to wander in when you have some appetite, and try different things. Who wouldn't want a small whole squid fried, on a stick? ;)

A must for foodies .... I have visited this great place and I was overwhelmed by the variety of great food that you can find here : "Jamon", cheese, oysters, fish, seafood f.e. and a big choice of fruits & vegetables. This all in a fantastic setting. If you like food and want to discover something new you must visit la Boqueria !!!!

Lovely Stroll. My boyfriend and I happened to walk past this lovely market on our stroll from Plaça de Sant Josep Oriol. We tried a few things from the stalls. One of our favourites was the sample sticks of different varities of meat for 1€. Despite the fact that the market was full of tourists, walking through the market made you feel like a local. We definitely would go back here if we are ever in Barcelona again.

Packed, for obvious reasons. Food is excellent in this market, and all the fresh food restaurants around it are delicious. They're pricy but - for example - the paella is cooked with shellfish fresh out of the water; really tasty. Was quite surprised that mine had octopus in it but was cooked just right - it wasn't as tough as when I've had it elsewhere, was definitely more meaty and flavoursome. At €20 or more a pop, mind you, you'd expect it to be good. We picked up a few of the fruit smoothies on the way out, as a desert. They were grand too.
Beautiful and colorful!. As in the title, market is living its own, noisy life. Full of fish, seafood, fruits, and sweets. You have to visit this place!

Food heaven! . An absolutely incredible food market, there's something there for everyone whatever your tastes may be...from meats and fish to cheeses, chocolate and sweets. Just go!Aside to the produce there are also a selection of cooked food stands where you can grab a quick lunch such as tapas and a crepe...wish we'd known this before we went, we'd already had lunch!Quick tip: the fresh juices are well worth getting, they're delicious. Head to the back corner though as they're half the price of the stands that sting you at the front door!

Nice & touristy!. The Mercat de Sant Josep de la Boqueria is just off the Las Ramblas in the El Raval district (close to the 'sea' end of the Ramblas). It is colourful, active and bustling (beware of pickpockets). The usual tourist stuff is available (artefacts, trinkets, food etc). Worth a visit when you are wandering around the Ramblas area.
Beautiful but unfriendly sellers. Worth visiting but ppl who work there look like they hate tourists, speak only their language etc.. they destroy my image of the mercat

Highly Recommended!. Las Ramblas and the Mercat are musts in Barcelona. They are not the biggest tourist attractions in the traditional way. There are touristy things for sale but if you want street food and authentic experience of Barcelona. GO HERE. I would love to have stayed in this district. I cannot express my love for this area enough. I really suggest going on a Saturday afternoon or very early evening. The Mercat was closed on Sunday when I was there. Also, bring cash as I do not remember an ATM anywhere near here off the top of my head.

Fresh market, great food, a tad too touristic. If there's one place to visit near the Ramblas, it's this old food market. Everything is so fresh and luxuriant. The places nearest the Ramblas are designed for tourists and their prices too. Be sure to get past and in the end of the market (past the fish booths), and you'll find the same products with more acceptable pricing. And great bodegas to eat tapas on site.

Plenty to buy, eat, drink & enjoy.. Going through this market was great fun. The first jamon shop on the right near entrance was amazing. We got a free lesson and tasting before buying. Don't eat the deep fried food at the stalls inside, but instead go to Kiosko Universal to eat because it was amazing!!!

my favorite place in barcelona. This market is a must! Try everything and be ready for a truly Spanish culinary experience. Check out this blog post dedicated entirely to the market http://www.jadescapades.com/mercat-de-sant-josep-de-la-boqueria-and-my-favorite-stall/
Very cool. This was a stop each day after we found it. Fresh food, good restaurant inside the market. I would highly recommend stopping in and walking the market.

Great Market. This is the most colourful market i ever been, Very crowded so if you don't like too many people around then don't go. But many little snacks and bright colour fruits. I love the place. If you like market you got to visit there, I'm not a market person, but i enjoy it very much. Must go if you around ramblas.

Best Market in Barcelona. Literally everything you could possibly want to eat or browse all in one place. Whether you want fresh shrimp, Iberico ham, or freshly pressed fruit juices, you can buy it, eat it, or shop for it here. Definitely browse before deciding which stand you want to buy from and if you want to eat in the market, my favorite place is El Quim where there are locals alongside the tourists. You can also buy snacks like cones of shaved Iberico ham or skewers of seafood to snack on as you wander around for half the price of the tourist traps on Las Ramblas a block away.

Cool Market Overshadowed by Tourist Traps. This was the first market we visited while in Spain and I was blown away- it was huge and the stands offered an impressive variety of things being sold. We stopped at one of the surrounding restaurants facing the market for a very expensive drink. I get the feeling that most things in this market are much more expensive than in other markets due to the fame. Overall the experience was pleasant, and if I were on limited time and in the area or in a group that was stopping on La Rambla I would definitely go again. However, if you are spending more than a day or so in Barcelona, I would highly recommend the Santa Caterina Market near the Cathedral (which should also absolutely be on your list). Santa Caterina has all the hustle and bustle of la Boqueria but without the tourist trap feel.

What an amazing market. Had a great couple of hours walking around this market. So much to see and take in with the different stalls of fish,meat and all kinds of food. It's nothing like you will see in England so well worth a visit.
yum!. Everyone must stop by this market! Great place to people watch and pick up any kind of food you can imagine. Awesome smoothies with creative flavors for only 1 euro.
The best market in Europe. Make sure this is your last stop of the trip, you don't want to carry 10 bags around with you around Barcelona. Fantastic!

Amazing . Amazing colourful food market selling everything from fruit, vegetables, meat, eggs, salads, quiches, samosas to a huge choice of fruit smoothies! This is a really nice place to see and the fruit and the smoothies are all at a great price and are delicious!

Fantastic market. It's right off la Rambla, and you really ought to make this part of your visit to Barcelona. It's free to walk through, of course, and just packed full of life - people, sounds, colors, smells - and all kinds of food. Fruits, meats, fish, nuts, sweets, breads, wines - all in beautiful displays at varying prices, and all packed in together in a vibrant, cheerful, hustling and bustling - but surprisingly clean and orderly - market. Have a snack, buy a meal, or get something for later. Go see for yourself.

Fabulous (December 2010). This place is off the charts for foodies. Hectares of fresh everything, plus restaurants, food stalls, wine, candy, deserts. I could go on and on. Everything you could ever need to cook just about anything, all fresh, clean, good. If I lived in Barcelona I would shop there every day, or eat there every day. How about both?
Perfect market. This place is magic. You will love it. The smell, the colors, the flavors. Everything is unique and full of life. La Boquería will always be one of my favorite sites in Barcelona.

Overwhelming Market. Full contact food shopping so you have to push your way through the aisles.Great selection of foods.....almost wish we had an apartment to cook in during our visit.We went there about 3 times during our week in Barcelona. Once for late afternoon refreshment of cups of fresh fruit, once to buy provisions of bread, cheese and sausage for a lunch in the Parque de la Citadella, and once to buy dried fruit and nuts for the trip home.Note that there are bathrooms with attendants in the market at the back and downstairs. You have to pay but my wife says they were spotless and worth it.

It was worth it!!!. After watching so many shows about Barcelona, and so many travel and food personalities comming here it was my turn, and let me tell you it was great... there are so many stands and it was very crowded but take your time and try diffrent things.. chorizos, jamon iberico, cheese, fresh fruits and juices is not expensive at all there are sample size (tacos) nothing to do with the mexican stuff for 2 euros and up....DON'T waste your time and money in Dunkin' Donuts outside the front entrance.

Love this place. Love this place. My husband and I went here at about ten on a Saturday morning and it was buzzing. We had various things from different stalls for breakfast including some Chinese spring rolls, little meat pies, chorizo and fresh fruit juice. It is a delight to wander round and take in the sights and smells. Will definitely go back.

Nice place to visit. Definitely a must see in Barcelona. I was amazed with the quality of the fruit and fish. Nothing too expensive. Way cheaper then in most places in Barcelona, with a bit of everything.

Go hungry, there is loads to try & buy. Amazing displays of fresh food, your eyes will be blinded by the colourful displays. Gets very busy so go early. Tiny tapas bars through out frequented by locals. You will see every fruit vegetable meat fish cheese egg under the sun. Well worth a viewing

Excellent food, very crowded. We arrived to the market at around 4PM and some of the shops were closed.It looks like they close early…We did manage to get some taste of the market, but most of the open places were for sweets only.On another visit during lunch time it was very crowded and it was very hard to get a seat at the recommended places.Your best shot will be away from weekends and before 1PM..
Great fresh food selection. Great selection of fresh foods and confectionary but very crowded. Definitely worth a look if you are in the area, I wouldn't make a special trip out there.

One of the best produce markets on the world. Very visual for foodie tourists,Incredible selection including good value hams and spicesFruit incredible, great for refreshing snacksNot all stall holders have much tourist patience thoughThere is superb fresh fish grill bar at the back of the marketNot the greatest value, but after all this is ultra freshBe patient and don't expect other than dazzling fresh fish on the griddle simply presentedThe razor clams looked superb as did the hakeI had a choice of gambas and langoustineGood patas bravas, nice spicy dip slipped down well with icy EstrellaFriendly but their really busy

Great experience. Get there early to beat the crowds and admire the displays of all kind of local -and exotic- food : fruit, vegetables, seafood (all kind of crabs, octopus, shrimps...) sausages, hams, giblets, etc. A must-see! Free entrance. Closed in the evening.

A little bit of everything, its a perfect market. They have a little bit of everything, fresh fruits, fresh seafood, very nice things that will make you want it all. Its a extremely colorful place, its perfect for taking the most amazing pictures of the wide variety of things they have there. Loved the tropical fruits juices and some mexican cones full of meat and fries, was awesome!

Has lost its luster and appeal!. Certainly a "must see" if on your first trip to Barcelona. Repeated annual visits show you the same displays, with the same merchants, in the same stalls, etc. I know part of the appeal is the sameness and sense of history you get when you visit one of these markets. This place, however, needs a "pick-me-up." It's in need of a new look and new energy.

wow!!!. For me... the definition of market. Has absolutely everything, a very large variety of fast food, including vegetarian and traditional spanish meats, smoothies, fruits, cocktails, you name it. The merchants are very friendly and you can taste everything before buying. Definitely one to be ticked when you visit Barcelona.

This Market Has Everything. The juice smoothies here are great! The market is really fantastic! There are a few tapas bars but they were so crowded we didn't stop at one. Next time. Bought cheese, chorizo, chocolate, and spices!

Never seen a market like this....wow!. The colours, the smells, the people doing there daily shop, the butchers, shop sellers trading their goods. What a place, so much to see. A foodies paradise, with all sorts of seafoods, so fresh, so appealing. People eating in the small stalls, the hustle and bustle, the colourful stalls from chocs, to poultry, to fruits smoothies, to pizza's....its all here under one roof. Taking pictures was great as no stall holder batted an eye and it felt normal to just take pics rather than to buy. Best market I've ever seen.

One of the world's best. My wife can't visit a city without seeking out the market. La Boqueria is in our top twenty.The most obvious difference of this market are the large stalls with hanging Jamón ibérico; Iberian ham. Fresh seafood abounds including pulpo, squid, cuttlefish, crawfish and uni. Also in great quantity are fresh mushrooms, nuts and, of course, olives of uncounted varieties.

World of food. Ideal place for food shopping. Plenty amount of seafood, live prawns and shrimps and ... many other exotic creatures, tones of different meat, colorful sweets ... Just amazing world of tasty food! Everything looks so tempting that you easily forget about the prices, On the other hand if they are above your pocket, this place is interesting just for visit and rainbow views.

Foodie heaven!. We went here as part of a walking tour, apparently the stall holders don't like large groups as they know you are not buying anything, just looking. Anyone who has the slightest interest in fresh, local, seasonal food needs to visit here to learn how the Spanish do it - amazing is all I can say. Every type of fish, meat, bit of animal you can eat was laid bare in front of you. Vegetables bigger and fresher than you would ever see in a supermarket.

Incredible Market. This market is incredible. Fruits, nuts, meats, smoothies, candy, vegetables, you name it and there is a stunning display to see of each. In our 3 days in Barcelona, we visited the market several times. Thinking about it now has me salivating to go back. If you are in Barcelona, it is definitely worth the trip to check out this market.

So lively and colourful. You must go here, the stalls are so colourful with fruits,cheeses etc. everything is laid out so well on stalls with an amazing array of produce. There are cafés all around selling the days produce as well. If you want fresh food you have it here in abundance
Always great. Wonderfull place to wonder around, lots of food, fruits and vegetables, nuts, breads, and above all many fresh fruit juices of all colors to taste.

Great fresh affordable food. Amongst the action, as you get further away from the La Rambla entrance the prices drop (fruit juices become 1 euro instead of 2) came here every day I was in Barcelona.Liked: good for getting a fix of fresh fruit and veg (something that can be hard as a backpacker!) Dislike: of course this is a major tourist attraction and has the annoyance of crowds, also watch out for pickpockets.
Its unbelieveable the choice of food here. This is the market to visit, not only is there really nice things to buy there are a load of places (tapas) to eat. Don't miss this place if you like food.

Love the fresh food!. We visited this farmer market when we were walking through the La Rambla. It is a very busy place. Many tourists came to this place daily. They sell variation of fresh food, from fruits, meat to the best handmade chocolate to bring home & the biggest dates. You can also have a great lunch or some snacks here.

Simply Complet and Beautiful. It´s a wonderful place to visit, look at the beautiful colours of the stained glasses, but mainly to buy lots of fresh products, such as exquisites fruits, fishes and seafood, the marvelous Spanish Ham, and so many others.You can also try the juices and combinations of mixed fruits made at the blender.In other words, it´s a paradise for anyone that is a gourrmet.

Excellent!. Before I go any further I should warn that this isn't open on Sundays!! We loved it so much on the Saturday that we planned to go back and buy up large on the Sunday but it was shut! Anyway, this place is amazing. Everything you could possibly want in terms of really good quality food you'll find here. My favourite was of course the fresh fruit cups and juices, but the cheeses, chocolates, ice cream, pastries, tapas, seafood, meat... it was all amazing, and there was so much of everything. Cheap too! This is a one stop shop (or market, rather). Honestly. It's right on La Ramblas so super easy to find and is a great place to stop by to grab some breakfast or lunch. I would recommend heading there in the mornings as after noon it gets very busy and hard to move around. A great thing to do is to head down there and stock up on picnic style foods (we went for fruits, juices, baguettes, jamon and cheese, then head to the beach or the park and enjoy a picnic! Ideal! Highly recommended.

Fascinating!. Try to visit La Boqueria market just off Las Ramblas. It's full of local fresh produce, eg fish, fruit, veg, meat, charcuterie as well as local bakery products and handmade sweets. An absolute delight for foodies and if you were self catering in Barcelona, this is where you would go for fresh produce.

Must See for Foodies. A true feast for the senses. It was a spur of the moment decision to visit the market. We spent the entire morning exploring, observing, eating and photographing our way through the market. Anyone visiting Barcelona should make the time to visit the Mercat de Boqueria.

Fascinating!. Okay, now, I wish I had something like this near me! Great little snacks to go, fresh and ready meals, nice wine selection, and place to see. The area is surround with restaurants and bars, pricey, but the market is a cool spot to visit and see what it has to offer.

A fabulous feast of colourful food....and some strange delicacies. Situated on Las Ramblas and well worth a visit, delicious looking fruits (very reasonably priced at 2 Euros a pot), veg, meats, sweets and some very scary local delicacies, sheeps (I think) heads, brains, innerds, Octopus etc...."We're not in Tesco's Toto!!"

Great food & Drink. Wow, what a place to eat fresh seafood cooked by the market stall stand.Get there early to ensure you get a seat round the market's tapas bars. After a good feed a great and cost effective glass of wine and one of the wine cellars. Far cheaper than La Rambles main stretch and this is where the locals will eat & drink so you know you're not eating at a commercial outlet.You will kick yourself if you discover this place on the last day of your holiday. Get there from day one and you'll certainly will be satisfied!

Interesting Las Ramblas detour.. Historic Barcelona market is worth a detour while on a stroll along Las Ramblas. Colorful display of fresh produce, seafood and meat products and occasional hustle by vendors makes the visit memorable. A selfie here is a must.

LOVED this place. Not only the food, but for people watching and photo ops. We weren't hungry, so we did not buy anything to eat or drink, but I feasted on all of the lovely stalls visually and took a TON of photos. It is so different from what we are used to here in the States. Around every corner was a new discovery, and I wished we were not passing through on our way to another destination. I would have loved to buy some things and COOK... Still regretting not buying the 5 grams of Saffron for 15 euros. I did buy some chocolates that were to die for. Even if you don't really want to eat, take a trip through this place and see the things they have. They cater to the tourist crowd, so there are a lot of things in handy packaging to go... Still wish I would have tried one of the fresh made juices for 1 euro... they looked delish. We skipped it last time we were here 10 years ago... I should have listened to my husband then and gone in... It was a real treat!

UNbelievable!!. While waiting 5 days for my Spain tour to start I stayed in a Nice B&B exactly across the Ramblas from the enterance to this UNbelievable market under one roof. I live in the Florida Keys and seafood is a major business, But I have never seen such a variety. It figuratively Blew me Away, the produce, pastries. Unbelievable. Planning a trip to Spain in '16 & will make sure to visit several times.

Fantastic. Brilliant place to visit if you are a foodie. The fruit smoothies are terrific and there are lots of options to choose from. There is a stall for pickled olives, different kinds to sample, the olives stuffed with sun dried tomatoes were awesome. Right at the end there's a catalyunian food stall which was great. Must visit.

One of the must visit places. Situated in Las Ramblas that means a very touristic but still a wonderful place to visit. A great market to visit and to enjoy the colors & smells.Very well organized and clean.

COLORFUL! . A touristy place, for sure, but well worth a visit. The emotions you feel looking at colorful stalls at every corner can't be explained if you never visited it. We came here to grab a quick launch on the go and we weren't disappointed! An excellent place to get the vibrant side of Barcelona.

must be seen at least once. Yes it is touristy... yes it is overdone. Nonetheless, its beautiful bouquet of colors and variety must be seen. I actually purchased some marzipan to bring home for my daughter simply to show her how elaborate it was. Overall, it is worth seeing at least once.
Worth seeing it!. Very touristic because its situated in Las Ramblas. But maybe one of the best markets in the world. Very Rich, Well organized, great presentation but pricey.

My favorite part of my Barcelona trip. Visiting the Market was my favorite part of our Barcelona trip. I loved seeing all the fish, fruits, veggies, and prepared foods on display. The whole room is buzzing with energy.

A nice market to view, not to buy.. The market is beautiful and colorful. However, don't buy there anything but a nice smoothie or fruits.It is very very expensive and in other places near by like the Santa Caterina market, you will find the same stuff and much cheaper.We bought prosciutto for abou 2Euros in another market, and saw it here in 21Euros!!!.So enjoy the walk and the colors, don't buy.

Everything fresh and brilliantly displayed. If you are on Las Ramblas in Barcelona a visit to this market is well recommended.Not only do they seem to sell every foodstuff known to man but it is all fresh and beautifully displayed.Just walk up and down the rows of stalls marveling at the different products on sale.

Just Mouthwatering!!!!. The best place to take a good tasty of what Spain is really like, gastronomically speaking. Endless offerings of meat, fish, fresh bread and vegetables. Who needs restaurants when you can have a three meal course right on the spot?Great value for money!!!

VIBRANT COLORFUL DELICIOUS FEAST FOR EYES AND STOMACH. This market was gorgeous. A pleasure to wander through, from all the colorful fruit, to the gruesome cuts of meat at the butchers, to the delicious smells wafting from the few cafes sprinkled throughout the market. I saw a platter of mixed wild mushrooms at one of these cafes, and decided I had to eat there. I patiently waited for a spot at the counter, and I wasn't disappointed. It was a blast--and the mushrooms were delicious, as was the octopus dish I enjoyed.

A Feast for the Eye. This is a must visit when in Barcelona and Las Ramblas. Take a walk through the market and experience the fish market, Meat market, Fresh Fruits and everything in between. Have a cool fresh juice, or buy yourself a cup of cut fruit. At every stall you pass there is something to eat or drink from fresh seafood to a sit down tappas restaurant all under one roof. The variety is vast. The pricing good and the goods are fresh as can be. This is a delight for the eye as well as the tung.This is an experience not to be missed.
Very good!. In this outdoor market in the center you can find all kinds of goodies. Everything from tapas and beer to fresh fish and juice and sweets!

Beautiful place to visit!. Stumbled across this market and was so glad we did! It's perfect for photos and an easy way to see all the wonderful things Barcelona has to offer..We brought a few things all of which were of wonderful quality!! However we paid a little to much for something's so just be careful.

Brilliant!. You can't say you've been to Barcelona and not stopped by La Boqueria. The fruit juices you see seducing you as you walk in are great but a tourist trap- walk a little to the right and they are cheaper and better. OK on the other end of the La Ramblas entry is a seafood restaurant with stools around it... I can't remember the name but you'll know when you see it. Eat there, its phenomenal. Sample cheese and Jamón until your stomach tells you to get out of there, seriously... you need to visit this place.

a must visit pale in Barca. If you are ever in Barcelona, this is the place to visit....Located very conveniently on las Rambla so very easy to get toSuch a vibrant market place full of colour, smell and sight....few of cafes selling tapas and excellent coffees, the fresh fruit and veg is to die for....full of hustle and bustle of a proper market placeall the stall owners are very helpful and cheerful we tried the smoothies, cheeses, olives and all were awesome .....amazing place...

The Market to End All Markets!. We stayed around the corner from La Boqueria and loved perusing the amazing stands and stocking our apartment with fruit, wine, jamon and other delights. It's not a 5 because at times it was too difficult to navigate due to the crush of tourists.

Interesting marketplace worth swinging through. This is a very busy (and very touristy) market conveniently located off the Ramblas. There are a host of fruit stands selling all kinds of fruit (of various degrees of freshness), as well as natural fruit juices for 2 euros (sugary juice mixes are less). You're probably better off sticking to a supermarket if you want any traditional Spanish fruit (eg oranges) but if you're looking for a ready-to-eat dragonfruit plate for example, this is the place. There are also some very busy (and relatively expensive) tapas places in the market that we walked by but did not try given wait times and prices. It was an interesting (and crowded) experience to just walk around and see everything being sold.

Don't miss this, even if you just stroll through. Amazing colorful market with an abundant variety of everything from candy to rabbits......it is a visual feast as well as culinary if you choose to brave the crowds and eat/drink there. Don't miss this are you are "rambling through the La Rambla" area!

A Feast of Sight, Sound and Aroma . . . A Best Marketplace in Europe!. As we've travelled thru Europe over the years, one of our conitnuing pleasures is visiting the local main market. The Boqueria in Barcelona is absolutely at the top. Dressed game and pheasants hanging side by side with the massive Spanish hams; seafood counters spilling over with all sort of just-caught Mediterranean sea life; vegetables and fruits from near and far. Best yet, the Boqueria is indoors, organized, polite and clean. Pathways are wide; vendors helpful . . . not always the case in these places. Even if you don't purchase anything, it's a wonderful gateway to the Catalan way of life. TIP: Don't go too early . . . this market really doesn't get going until 10 a.m. or so.

Nice colourful look. Well as you are already in the rambla, stop by to this market. This is obviously a touristic attractions, there are better market to visit. However the colour of the fruits and vegetable, the look and feel of the place is extraordinary.

Great Variety of Food Options!. La Boqueria has an amazing variety of food options - smoothies, fruit, meat, nuts, chocolates, candies, fish, etc. Come prepared to explore all the options and bring your money! We went on our first day and hadn't converted all our money yet, so unfortunately we didn't get to maximize our experience. We tried the smoothies and they were awesome!
Feast for the eyes! . These food markets are amazing! Take your wallet, empty stomach and camera and you will not be disappointed!
What a Market!. This is what a market must look like! Everything very clean and with very friendly stall merchants. Great for a walk around..

Fun atmosphere. While strolling down Las Ramblas, definitely pop in here for a quick food recharge. There are a lot of shops/little food stalls, so you can really take your pic. A tip is that the fresh juice/smoothie stands at the front of the market are more expensive than the ones in the back, so hold off and get them for 1 Euro near the back of the market! Definitely try the iberico ham, so delicious!!

Eat like a local. I had read about this in my Lonely planet guide to Barcelona. This was an amazing find. There are myriad shops and restaurants in this market right off of Las Ramblas. There are shops that sell nuts, meats, a fish market and one of the best Tapas places I could find in Barcelona. The place was awesome, because they cook right in front of you and the seafood from the Mediterranean is very tasty. The shrimp, the razor clams and also the octopus. We also tried cuttlefish, which tasted like tender coconut. The food was just too good here and to die for.The market itself was amazing. However it was closed on New Years day, just like a lot of other places, which sucked.

Fun experience. Located at Las Ramblas, this is a must-do for every foodie. The food selection is great, albeit not that cheap. Shame though they don't offer free samples like they do in so many other markets around the world. Definitely have a fruit smoothie, they taste heavenly.

Must go!. A must see place, very fresh fruit they also have fresh vegetables dried fruits, ham and empanadas.
Oh how can I forget chocolates!!!!!!
Fresh juice for 1 euro.

They have tons of food here. This is a great place to go shopping and buy some snacks. If you have an apartment, this would be a great place to go and pick up some food. The only thing challenging we found was not knowing how much to (or how to) order items. We were not sure how to say - 1/4 pound of cheese since they use the metric system.
Great afternoon of local shopping. There are fourth generation shop owners in this market. A must see for tourists, the food and local color are terrific!

A must visit in Barcelona esp if you are a foodie. Barcelona is a city if colors and La boqueria is a market filled with spectrum of colors. The location sis fantastically located at the la rambla street and few steps away from from Liceu train station. Aside from walking around the market, Please do yourself a favor by eating at one of the seafood counters and drinking sangria and the fruit juices. We ordered a variety of seafood (prawns, cray fish, mussels, clams, cod fish, octopus) and they were all so fresh and tasty. The fruit juices were also priced reasonably at 1 euro each. This is a place which I will visit again and again in our future visits to catalunya.

The Catalonian way of life. The heart of catalonian food and their way of life. A must visit if you're a food hunter. Chill and order some authentic spanish tapas at the abundant bar restaurants around.

Beautifully Inspirational. I love food and cooking with great ingredients so this market is absolutely awe inspiring. It's a completely visceral experience, colours, smells and textures of thousands of basic ingredients for creating the most beautiful food. It's hardely a wonder that restaurants around Barcelona creat such great food and no doubt many visitors from across the world do too after visiting this market. The fantastic thing is you can experience some of its produce right there directly from restaurants and bars in the market itself. The seafood it to die for! Go immerse yourself in this great market.

Fruit heaven!. During our 4 day trip in Barcelona, we visited Mercat de Sant Josep de la Boqueria third times. It was very charming place with fruits, fruit juices and other dining options. It immediately became our daily routine to visit the Mercat de Sant Josep de la Boqueria and grab our yummy fruit juices. We tried different flavors each day and every single of them was great!
So much variety. There is something for everyone... From sandwiches to chocolate to sweets to all kinda of meats and fish.This place is totally worth passing by

huge market. **Mixed fruits(1-2euros),fruit juices(1-2euros),vegetables,fresh fruits(that you might not found in your country),different kinds of fishes,meats,chocolate,candies,and the very famous SPANISH HAMS are enormous in varieties and in sizes,just about everything you will find in this market.**Worth stopping by....**Tapas bars are in all corners...**So accessible,it is beside La Rambla..HOW TO REACH; Subway line 3: LICEU

Great atmosphere. When you have enough of the street vendors at Las Rambla head to Mercat de Sant Josep de la Boqueria. Look at all the fresh fruits fish,and serrano ham ( do not look at the prices!) I bet you will get hungry too, but no worries , try the empanadas , stuffed baked or fried pastry with tuna or chicken.A great appetizer before going out for dinner.

Don't pass up La Boqeria. This old market off Las Rambla is an exceptional market with all kinds of vegetables and meats. This old market is truly a view into the past. Besides the market itself there are restaurants on both sides where they serve amazing seafood meals and tapas. The prices are reasonable and the food plentiful and delicious. As you enter the market, on the far left is a tapas restaurant with blue tablecloths next to a seafood restaurant. We cannot remember the name but they serve only tapas and it is amazing. Not only is the food great, but the waitress is so friendly and helpful. You will love her. Don't pass this dining experience up if you go to La Boqueria.

I can still taste the flavours. Went here to lunch with family on Sunday afternoon, and the place and experience are incredible, we had fish, peppers, al-i-oli, all well prepared and carefully presented in any place in this market. Will definitely go back

The real side of the city. When I travel I prefer searching for the local hot-spots. I hate the touristic sight-seeings or shops. I want to be a local as long as I stay in a place. If someone go to Barcelona without visit the open market of Boqueria, will regret it...

A Must Visit Market. This old market is where you can find all kinds of fresh vegetables, fruits, fish, meets...etc. if you are a tapas lover, you can sit & enjoy tapas with a glass of red wine.There is also some cafeteria aside from the market. One of them served tempting Catalonian sausages . Don't miss this destination if you visit Barcelona

Awesome! A Must-Visit!. My husband and I absolutely loved our experience at La Boqueria. I love markets. My husband, not so much. But even he had a fantastic time there. You would be remiss not to visit while in Barcelona.

Awesome!. You simply have to visit!I've seen some markets in my time and especially seafood and fish markets but this has to be the best!Make sure you eat at one of the several bars within the market itself.

Great market. This is a great market with lots of variety of produce, gourmet food, and eateries. Definitely worth going when in Barcelona. Do be hungry when you go, there is a lot of stuff you will want to try.

A morning well spent. La Boqueria located near to our hotel so we went there one morning for breakfast. The place is clean, bright, and amazing. Some stalls are beautifully decorated, we just could not resist not to stop and see stuff they sell. We had fun looking at all sorts of food and bought quite a lot because the food there looks really fresh and yummy. Food is great but not cheap.

A must for Foodies. Markets, bars, cafés and restaurants are one of the best places to learn and enjoy cultures. This famous Barcelona market does not disappoint. Vibrant and bustling with an array of produce (and people!), sample the many good things Spain has to offer and bring some home (if you can). Enjoyed some good jamon iberico, bacalao, manchego and bought spices, olive oil, etc. Just make sure to keep your belongings close to you as you go around.

A lot of pigs have sacrificed many legs...... The market (and arguably Barcelona's foremost tourist landmark), La Boqueria, opens up to Las Ramblas and is a great walk-thru and place to buy all sorts of food stuff, from raw to cooked, from sweet to savory, from aged to fresh, from pungent to fragrant. Very crowded when we visited at 9 AM. Sit down at any of the dining stalls and simply point to something that looks good. Vendor samples are offered. Items are pricier at the entrance. A lot of pigs have sacrificed many legs to provide all this enjoyment. Literally, a feast for your eyes and belly!

An attack on your senses..... In a very good way...... Coming to Spain everyone told me this is a must....And they were right. But it's not cheap. That being said, the sights and sounds and smells are just amazing.Color all around and amazing food!Watch out..... Lots of pickpockets here!!!

Bustling but beautiful.. This market is incredible, the smells, sights and sounds are an adorable assault on the senses. It was teeming with people when we visited (Saturday afternoon) but this just serves to illustrate how popular this market is with locals and tourists alike. Well worth a visit.

A variety of colors, shapes and tastes. This is a must-see Market. Such a variety that splashes on your sense of sight and smell, touch and taste ... They have conveniently packed some items into smaller sizes so that it appears cheap and light on expenses.

An Explosion of Colors and Flavors. I had always heard so much about La Boqueria Market in Barcelona and once there I was very curious to visit it. I was not surprised, everything I heard was true and I was very excited to be in the market. The colors and flavors were so vibrant and inviting that I felt I didn't want to leave. Prices are a bit high, but where else other than in La Boqueria, would I find the same food? I looked at all the curiosities, like the percebes, the pitahaya roja, took a lot of pictures, but I also tasted an incredible amount of food. I liked the Jamon Ibérico and I really enjoyed the various icecream. What a treat !!! Food prepared at the various bars is delicious, there are many varieties of tapas and finger food, the choice is infinite, but the ordering boards and menus are all in Spanish. The market is not so loud, I expected it worse, since I have visited other markets in the world and often I had to leave because of the noises. At La Boqueria I felt at ease, people are friendly and answered all my questions in Spanish, most of them don't speak English, be prepared. Be also very careful of your belongings, it is a place frequented by a lot of tourists and as in all markets, unfortunate opportunities are around the corner. Nothing happened to me, but I am always well aware of my surroundings. Valentina Interior Designer
The cleanest and well-maintained market. Although i have visited some markets in Europe, but this market is the best i ever visit. it is very well-maintained and clean.

Give yourself a treat. I love to visit markets in Southern Europe, it’s different than North American ones. This market did not disappoint me. When you see the colourful vegetable and fruit stands, the smell of the pastries and cooking of food in the restaurants, the taste of the fresh fruit juice, all these can put a smile on your face. Some of the fruit juices have sugar added, but some are not. €1.50-2.50 each, so shop wisely. We bought some chocolate, €60 per Kilo, but I found it’s too sweet for me. Right beside the market are a few restaurants. Locals eat there so it must be good.This market is located in La Ramblas, between Carme and Hospital.Happy Travelling!

Big food fest. It is without a doubt one of the most amazing bazars I have ever seen.You can get everything by amazing pricesFrom seafood to a variety of fruits And while you are there you can enjoy some traditional food in restaurants around there.Dot forget to try the smoked pork, shrimps, mushrooms and my favorite Torros!
Love the place!. It's crowded, but it's local. The place is must to visit if you're in Barcelona. Fresh products with reasonable price. Go and see yourself!
O.M.G. It's similar to our St. Lawrence market, but much bigger. A wonderful mixture of everything you could want to eat!

Touristy but also local. Very nice market in the middle of the centre of Barcelona, right on the Ramblas. Even though many tourists visit this market, it is also visited by locals and the quality and prices of the food sold is good. It gets vert busy and crowded inside, so if you do not like small spaces, this is probably not the best place to go.

Touristy, other markets within easy walk are equal or better. This market is famous and right off Las Ramblas, thus heavily regarded as a tourist destination. It's pretty to walk through particularly if you can go during the set up or lower traffic times when it isn't crazy crowded. I enjoyed a couple of the other markets just as much or more and they were an easy walk from there (for example santa caterina). Nice to say I have been there but I went elsewhere to pick up items I needed.

A must!. Despite the inevitable degradation of the market because of the tourism, this market is still a must on the Barcelona to-do list. Stalls of fresh fruit, meat and especially fish are worth seeing in all their splendour - and is the basis of the top restaurants in the city and further afield. Take your camera, but watch your bags! There will be a crowd, mostly tourists but also locals doing their shopping, especially at the weekend. Go very early (0800) or later at about 1400 and then have a meal in one of the little restaurants in the area - there are some good ones.

Feast for the senses. Highly recommend a wander through La Boqueria it's a feast for your senses. A wonderful mixture of everything you could want to eat, from fresh fruit, vegetables, meat, sea food to lollies the list goes on. Stop and have a bit to eat at one of the many food stores you will not be disappointed or sit down in one of the Tapas bars located at the entry. The Market is located on La Rambla I would recommend you include this as part of your day on La Rambla. A must for market lover...

High prices but still a must. Prices were very touristic, but the variety of products was very interesting and amusing, a fun experience and worthy of going through it more than once, which we did...Dont by chocolates there, go to the chocolate museum for better and cheaper chocolates.

nice for fruit breakfast . this market is busy and colorful. a bit touristic, still worth visiting.didn't liked that all counters are mixed which means they can sell fruits next to meat products. to my mind a bit unorganized. here you can find fruit, seafood, sweets, nuts, spices and more. wouldn't say it's cheap. it depends.for example normal sweets prices can be more than 60€ per kg. we bought small portion of chocolates (to have it with coffee) for 5€. while fresh juices and fruit boxes cost 1-2,5 €. better to visit in the morning (till 12pm).closed on Sunday.

Must-visit!. You cannot not visit this little market off Ramblas! It's easy to miss but please try not to. It's a perfect place to eat for the budget conscious. From tapas to pizza to buying olive oils, wines, cheese, meat and truffle, it has something for everybody. The range of food available is great and easy to eat on the go.

The best place for cheap and diversified meals!. In the middle of the Ramblas street, you can have a diversified meal in La Boqueria. Don't expect anything really fancy, after all is a market, but you have a bit of everything at really low prices. Loved it. Recommend it for travellers with tight budgets!

Don't miss it!. This huge food market is located right off La Rambla and is easy to miss, but try not to!There are many food and fruit stalls and everything is colorful. You can grab a bite on the go or take food out. There are also stalls serving tapas. We grabbed fruit cups for 1 euro and had a refreshing snack while absorbing the scenery.This market is closed on Sundays.

Very busy!. Probably the best food market I have visited after Seattle.The fresh juices they sell are the most colourful and exortic that you can imagine. Fruits are sold in small portion so that you can eat while taking a wander. Fruits and veg are so beautifully displayed. I am a regular at wet market but is such an eye opening experience. Do visit with a hungry stomach as you can stop for the 2 popular restaurants inside.The market is closed on Sunday and many continue to do so on Monday so avoid these days.

Funny breakfast. eheheheeh......not a market but THE MARKET!
and you know what? We had the best BK in Barca!!!!
Just go!

Vibrant. Visited twice , the atmosphere is really vibrant. Obviously some of the stalls are touristy , but seeing the fish markets and the smells was really great. if you lived locally you would buy your produce from here.

must visit. somebody will say, that it is tourist place and i will say also yes, but still!!! you need to visit it, while its offers a great experience and emotions (especially when you are entering meat and sea food sections)...one of the best things to do, to go to market closer to the end of the day and enjoy all freshly done juice and fruit salad selection - 2 glasses for 2 or 1 euro or 2 fruit salad boxes for 2 euro...

Good but only in certain stalls. Visited this place as recommended. At first was very impressed as there's lots of fresh fruit, seafood stalls etc. In my opinion, slightly overrated in hindsight as prices are higher than outside restaurants for seafood. Chocolate from stalls are very pricey, 60 euros per kg means you only get 5 pieces of chocolate for 4 euros. I think El Corte Ingles basement appears to sell lots of similar items but for less.

A must see market in Barcelona. Excellent market just next to La Ramblas ( indoors and outdoors) with big variety of fruit, veg, spices, meat, fish ( loads of it) oils, tapas...Everything is very nicely presented !!The atmosphere is electric, lots of locals - which gives it a real local touch. Obviously many tourists as well. Drink one of the freshly squeezed juices or have a taster of the local ham.

Don't miss it. We went more than once. So much to see at all the stalls. - fruit, meat, fish, sweets, spices. Goodness knows what some of the offal was on offer. It's a busy place so you need a long time to get around it all. Absolutely fascinating

La Boqueria is a visual Feast. I had heard so much about the Market both good and bad so I wanted to form my own opinion.I didn't need anything from the Market which helps if you just want to observe the bustle of the market place and look at the produce. I ended up wandering around for a couple of hours!In that time I bought some great sweet smoked Paprika, a quantity of as it tuned out excellent Sobrasada ( I sampled some different qualities on some bread offered by the stall holder until I settled on a premium product made from Iberican Black Pig and top quality Paprika. It was just great). Maybe because of the nice manner of the stall holder, I also purchased some cured Iberican black pig Jamon and two Manchego cheeses in different states of maturity (again I tried quite a few chunks too). All this was wrapped up really well so I could take it home. The stall name I don't remember but it is in a relatively quieter part of the market. I don't know how cheaply I could have purchased this produce elsewhere but I do know looking at the airport Duty Free prices, I was more than satisfied with my impromptu purchases, as were my family at home in Wales!I sat down at one of the stooled Tapas bars and had a beer and some grilled octopus, bread and olive oil, it was delicious and yes a bit pricey for a "market stall" but I guess they pay big Euros for the space. All I can say is I didn't come to Barcelona to moan about anything and everything, I came to enjoy it and I must say I did enjoyed my couple of hours and didn't feel ripped off as some have commented.I will pay La Boqueria another visit and will certainly go and stock up on few of its tasty products again soon.

Full of food and energy!. This market reminded me a lot of Reading Terminal market in Philadelphia. So many stalls, so much to try, so many people, not enough time. It's also good place for people watching, not only the people in the stalls, but the people who come to visit. We went mid-afternoon and by then, some of the stores have closed. However there was still a lot of activity. It's also very easy to get a quick lunch here. I had some empanadas, some fresh juice, topped off by gelato. Don't miss this place.

So much to see!. We wandered into the market not sure what to expect as this was the first European market we had ever been to. Everything was amazing to look at. If you love food you must come here. There are vendors selling sausages, fruit, candy, spices and so much more. You can buy items to eat immediately or take home...we found a sausage sampler vacuum packed to enjoy with family that couldn't join us for the trip. There is also a bar where you can sit and eat while enjoying a beer and the atmosphere of the market...if we had more time we so would have done this.

Photogs Paradise. One of my favorite things to do while traveling is visit outdoor markets! I loved La Boqueria! We all got snacks and coffee for breakfast. Very busy and crowded so be careful with your possessions and stick with your group!

Lively and colourful...... Just off the Ramblas, this vibrant market is choc-a -bloc with all kinds of fresh and cooked goodies. It's a good idea to make one's way here at lunchtime after roaming around the city centre. Freshly cut fruit, juices, crepes, empanadas, chocolate covered strawberries and jugs of Sangria are among a host of foods here. You're spoiled for choice. As all markets it tends to be noisy, but the rewards are in the eating......

yummy !. Great place to buy some delicious seafood, meat, fruit, spices, nuts, chocolate, cake, smoothies and fruit juices... Soooooo tasty! And all arranged in a very eye-catching way. And surprisingly not that expensive! Definitely worth a go!

LOVED this place!!!. My first time here and I was impressed!! So colorful with all the fruits and smoothies and candies. The smoothies are delicious!! I had 3!! And the crepes with Nutella are great! The empanadas were very tasty too. A must see if you like food/ cooking. They have a few restaurants here where you can sit on barstools. Also meats and fresh fish, olives, nuts.

Favourite place in Barcelona. We visited the market twice during our stay in Barcelona and weren't disappointed either time. One morning we enjoyed a breakfast of fresh fruit smoothies, followed by a vegetarian curry taco, which was amazing, then finished with some chicken on a stick. Walking past the various venders was a treat for all the senses. Take some time to watch the butchers at the various meat stalls then take time to observe the merchants in the fish section. There is so much amazing produce for sale and lots of preserves too. Many restaurants are also set up within the market and surrounding it. A must do when it Barcelona!

Weekend trip to Barcelona . Not particular tasty because it's only grill with pesto and olive oil for all the seafood.Service is nice. Sangria is good. But food is not that special. Only thing I appreciate is a lot of seafood right in front of you it's pretty appetising and colorful.

night market lovers!. Since I am from Taiwan, I love the market here. It's energetic, and lots of food you can try on the site. So much fun to see traditional food in Barcelona. But not sure if it's expensive cause many tourists visit.

Very, very, fun!. You can you tube dozens of videos about the Mercat, and they are all accurate! Food everywhere! Just walk around and see what you like. My advice, if you like it, buy it. It may be hard to find your way back again!

I fell in love with this place. I can stay there forever! All kind of fruits, meat, fish, frutti di mare. Food which i had never seen in my life, milions of flavours. If U love food, cooking - this place will be perfect for you. I didn't expect such magic in this place.
Impressive food market. To see a typical Spanish food market with impressive displays of cured meats, chocolates, sweets fruit and fruit juices and market eateries you must visit La Boqeria.

My saving grace. Having a gluten allergy makes traveling a bit tricky. Except when I find places such as this spectacular market. Lots of ready to go food. Got food here pretty much every day of my 9 day trip to Barcelona.

Foodies' nirvana. Having an apartment was the catalyst for frequenting here a few times during my recent visit.
Ate well every visit.
If only I could take samples home.
Go hungry as the array on offer is akin to a child in a lolly shop !

Tasty. La Boqueria is a great place to try a variety of foods, and drinks. there are so many vendors asnd all the Spanish "staples" are well represented; empanadas, olives, fruits, seafood, and jamon! It can get a little crowded but it is still a must stop if just for a half hour break in your stroll down La Rambla.

A must-experience as you ply the Ramblas. We enjoyed it so much, we ate lunch in a couple of places, at El Quim and at Bar Boqueria. The colors, the taste and the variety are amazing. Get some fresh grilled sardines, some chipirones, try the different longanizas. Enjoy!

Oh Yes. Yes indeed! All fresh... Fruits, vegetables, fish, meat, chorizo, incomparable iberico... You can also eat in the bazaar! I love going there in the morning, having my breakfast and shopping afterwards.

Fabulous market with some great sights!. Wow this was the best market I've ever seen, fresh fruits, fish, meats, eggs, bakery, sweets and cafes. I absolutely loved walking around taking photos and taking in the atmosphere.
If you on la rambla you cannot miss this market experience.

Worth a Quick look or a long visit. Great to pop in for a snack, meal, stock up on supplies or get your fruit fix.Located just of La Rambla the crowd and your nose will lead you there.The stalls are filled with every type of fresh food you need. Seafood. fresh fruit, smoothes, juice, lollies, nuts, pre made meals and tapas bars. Do your self a favour and pop in for a visit. If i was in Barcelona for more than a day I would have had lunch here. The food is clearly fresh and priced well.Tip head in deeper tot he markets the smoothes and juices are a bit cheaper.

A nice break to eat or drink fruits. It is nice to walk around the market to smell and to see all the products. You will be able to drink tasteful juices or to buy fruits, empenadas, turon, meat, fish etc. not all the cooked products are nice (especially cold empenadas, ask for them to be warmed or take it home).
Top market in Barcelona. one of the nicest public market in the world( doesn't beat San Francisco's ferry building though). Walk around the stands to get a feel of what people eat in Catalonia.

The largest market in Barcelona. Food - fruits, vegetables, fish, cheese, meats, dried fruits, nuts, spices, candy - it's all here.We came at the end of the day, many of the stalls were closed or packing up, but many were still open. It was crowded - hard to imagine what it would be like during the day-time. This is the place to go to experience "The Market". We decided to do our shopping at the nearby Mercat Santa Caterina. We went there on Saturday - full of locals buying staples, not so many tourists.

Love food? A required stop!. La Boqueria is simply astounding, a covered market with hundreds of vendors. It dates to the year 1217 when farmers sold their produce on the outskirts of the old gated city. Today’s vendors artfully arrange their goods, a feast for the eyes to tempt the belly. Each vendor has its specialty. Spices sold by the kilogram. Eggs sized from tiny quail eggs to softball-sized emu. Iberian ham stalls where the butchers patiently explained the origins of the much-coveted pork while carving paper-thin slices. Pate stands. Beautifully packaged salt flavored with provencal herbs or chilis or lemon. And of course more veg and fruit stands than you could count.For more: http://grassrootsgardening.net/2014/11/02/la-boqueria/

A Visit to Barcelona is Incomplete without a Trip to This Market. Walk down Las Ramblas and you can't miss the market. When we went in the middle of a weekday, it was bustling with tourists and locals alike. Buy some freshly-squeezed fruit juice (so many flavors to choose from), walk around and see the many vendors' stalls piled high with fruits, vegetables, etc. and find a place to eat. It's a crazy place, but a real treat. Watch your pockets and bags.

interesting and picturesque. I loved walking there and staring at the variety of tropical and not only fruit, vegetables, all king of fish, meat, jamon... It's so bright and picturesque that everyone can find something for himself. The plus is that they sell

beats tesco any day!!. What fantastic place to get a feel for what the people of Barcelona eat! Had to go to Tesco this morning on my return to the uk and what a disappointment. The produce in Barcelona is so colourful, intriguing and fantastically arranged...not a box, packet, or plastic wrapper in site. I saw things I would not have the faintest idea of how to cook like a whole sheep head complete with eyes...intriguing and scary all rolled into one...you must go...an experience not to be missed.

Spanish market right off Las Ramblas. We came upon this by chance but really enjoyed walking around for an hour or so. Walk down Las Ramblas from Catalunya Sq towards the sea and the market is about a third of the way down. Many lovely food stalls and a great place for a snack or a drink.

Magnificent Mercato Boqueria. An absolute must, it is bursting with the most fabulous produce, market stall holders with oodles of character, go early in the day, have breakfast at one of the many eateries, buy your picnic to have on the beach later in the day - highly recommended

One of the Best Markets in Europe. la Boqueria is a fascinating market on las Ramblas in Barcelona, so many things to see, buy, and taste with many good and fresh seafood eateries in the market. It is a very busy market and travellers have to beware of pick pockets. My wife bought a piece of clothing at Desigual nearby and took the Desigual bag with her to eat at the market. She was purposely distracted by three teenage girls while waiting for me to order food, and the Desigual bag was gone! Fortunately it was not an expensive piece of clothing. Despite being jacked, we still had a good visit at Mercat la Boqueria.

It's busy but a feast for the senses.. We stop at La Boqueria at least once every time we are in Barcelona. The smells, sights and non-stop action never ceases to amaze me. The mini restaurants with limited seats are always packed with patrons. There seem to be less bakeries than there used to be but there are more stalls selling juices, fruit cups, nuts and candies. The stalls selling fish and meat which cater to the locals close earlier than the others. It's nearly always busy but spend the time to make a thorough walk-through to see everything.

Go, you must see this!!!. It is a beautiful place. The way the vendors arrange their product makes it very appealing. Walk around, try the different food stuff they sale, drink natural juices, seat on one of the restaurants that surround the Market. You will love it!The market is CLOSED on Sundays!

Must See and Free!. This is still an astonishing collection of the freshest produce, seafood, poultry, meats and every other food item you can imagine. The food stalls are packed with locals buying the very best and they are all surrounded by small cafes cooking up those very items. This is the source of so many great meals to be had in Barcelona. Bring a shopping bag and bring your appetite as you get a sense of the vibrancy of this great market. It offers a real insight into the life of Barcelona.

You Gotta See This. Great entertainment! We enjoy markets in different cities and this is one of the best. The sheer volume of unusual foods is jaw-dropping. Everything from smoothies to sheep's heads for sale. And all the fresh fish looking at you! Many things we did not even recognize. We had just gotten off our long flight so didn't feel brave enough to eat at any of the places here, but they were popular with the locals. There aren't many things in BCN that are free to do that are this entertaining.

Very busy place with local wares. I was surprised how crowded it was. We walked around and it was fun watching locals buying fresh produce and meats. Many good places to eat.We were here on a Saturday so maybe that was why it was so busy.
Go there hungry. Amazing market. Every time I go back La Boqueria is one of my first stops. Fruits, juices, seafood and all the local favorites. It's a must see/eat market.

If only there was a market like this in my town. This market is unbelivable! The best of everything, it is a swirl of colors and tastes sensation. I could have stayed there eating all day. A must see and do while in barcelona

Go for the seafood, freshest in our memory. We tried 2 different seafood places...they cooked the clams and prawns right in front of you. We loved the place so much we went there for lunch consecutive days.

Interesting market. Very crowded, very busy market. Saw some interesting stuff for sale. We bought fruits and chocolates but prices were a lot more expensive compared to supermarkets. Must stop to at least take a look if you are at Rambla de Mar.

Great colors, odors and rumors . It is very crowded but I think it should not be missed in a visit to Barcelona. This food market has great variety, from seafood to meat, vegetables and sweets. Disregard the first stands and go deeper, try some juices, an oyster, and cod fritters.

Great tourist trap. What can I say about one major attraction of Barcelona. It is a hugh and colorful market with many stalls selling repetitive items. This market is more catered to tourists than locals and there is nothing wrong with that concept. Travel shows and TA has made this place what it is. There is lots of excitement in the market. Definitely a must visit in Barcelona. It is closed on Sundays.

Just love this place. After seven years I revisited the Boqueria and I still love it. It's crowded, packed with tourists and some stands are really focussed on selling juices and fruitshakes to all these tourists. But still it's totally worth it. So colorful, such a diversity. We felt like kids lost in the candy shop. If it's your first trip to Barcelona, don't miss it. Later on you can always do your regular shopping in less crowded markets.

Possibly the best market in Europe!. This market is amazing and really great to walk around to escape the heat and the tourists and also to grab a bite to eat. It's perfect to go in the morning for breakfast and you'll find yourself surrounded by all types of amazing food and drinks, included fresh juices. This was a genuine experience of the real Barcelona!
Great market. If you are strolling at la Ramblas, visit this open market to grab a bite or juice. Nice to see all these different products.

Fun, Eye-Opening Market!. When I travel I always try to visit the marketplaces, and this is definitely a market that one must not miss! It's more for tourists than locals, but it's a fun experience for your sights and other senses. You hear, see and smell the fresh food being cooked at the bars/stalls (I recommend Pinoxto), so bring your appetite with you. Be sure to buy some of the take-out jamon at the entrance to the market.The market is filled with fresh fruit stalls (that also has freshly squeezed juices, and cut-up fruit with a fork for take-out), fresh seafood stalls, and meat stalls (selling internal organs of beef, lamb, and pig), mushroom stalls, egg stalls, and other fast-food stalls. The candies, chocolate, and turron stalls were also very inviting!Best time to visit is soon after it opens (between 8:30 and 11) so you have more space and room for walking and pausing to explore the various stalls.

The Best one in Barcelona. In my opinion, this is more than Guell Park or Familiar cathedral. Once you put your foot here, you'll face real Barcelona. You need to make your stomach empty before getting here. I regret my dinner before here. Gladly I found a fruit stall whose picture is introduced in Pocket Lonely planet Barcelona.I asked the guy at the stall to check out the picture. He called his mother, who is in the book. She looked at the book and smiled (-:That was funnyTasting fruits and walking around, we recharged ourselves with pleasure.

My favorite place in the city.... This food market has to be my favorite place to visit in all of Barcelona. What makes it so amazing is just being able to wander and get lost for hours discovering different kinds of food and being able to snack along the way. Considering that it is located right in the heart of the city the prices are amazingly fair. This market is a maze of food ranging from fresh fish, meats, veggies, fruits and so much more. There is something here for everyone and every taste. Here you can pick up small little bites or stop at one of the little restaurants which serve everything from tapas to seafood. The market is full of vibrant colours, smells and every kind of food you can imagine. The best thing to do is just wander around and sample as much as possible :-)Enter with an empty belly and roll out :-)

Wonderful Market. It is a true experience, to see wonderful produce and taste some of it as you go by. We had an amazing fruit drink (coconut and mango) juice. Picked up some saffron and gourmet salts as gifts, people who know about cooking really appreciated this. Sampled some dried fruits and nuts. And best of all, there are a variety of restaurants were you can eat and get to sample all that fresh produce.

What a magical place - vibrant and colourful. The Boqueria Market in Las Ramblas was one of the highlights of my visit to Barcelona and will say in my memories forever. The vibrancy, culture, colours and characters of the market make it very special. This is a very old and traditional market. Enjoyed fresh fruit drinks of many flavours, nachos and a miscellany of food for our picnic. Fresh fruit and chocolates are in abundance. Tapas is available at the bars. Fish, meat, fruit and veg are readily on offer with stalls selling unusual fruit and veg - varieties of mushrooms and black potatoes and tomatoes for example.
Must visit to feel local life. Market was packed with locals and travellers at Saturday lunch time. Very good place to feel locals' life.

If You Like Food Prepare to Be Blown Away!. My wife tried to prepare me but once I entered "La Boqueria" I was blown away. I immediately wanted to start picking up fruits, spices and produce to take home and start cooking but we were on vacation. We enjoyed our morning wandering around the market drinking fresh squeezed fruit juice, local pastries and empanadas. Don't stop in the front of the market make sure to go all the way to the back since you will miss the meat and poultry section. At least go once and enjoy the view!

the first attraction to visit!. This market is absolutely incredible. You can have lunch and dinner with good prices finding foreign plates and fruits. I suggest the fruit mix that can be easily find in every corner of the market!

Feast for the eyes and the stomach. If you want to enjoy this visually to its full extent go early. Plan to eat there - fritatas with espresso and fruit salads abound for breakfast but you can get other food as well. For lunch the options are vast but we did fresh calamari prepared to our order--wonderful. However, even if you are not hungry, the care the vendors take with their displays is beautiful to see.

What a colourful sight. I like the idea of visiting markets, but the sight and smell of meat and sea food is usually a bit too much for the vegetarian me. But not this market! There were so many stalls selling veggie produce. And there were some meat ones, but not many! Loved wandering around here. A number of stalls sell colourful fruity drinks and smoothies. In our experience the stalls towards the back of the market had better ones compared to ones at the entrance.

Mouthwatering selections!. What a great market. Luckily it was just a few minutes away from where we were staying as I visited it more than a few times. Fresh drinks and a massive range of fresh fruits etc. Many, many selections of meat and cakes and breads and fillings and pastries etc.I got strawberry and pineapple pieces in a cup. They were my favorite and I kept going back for more. Mouthwatering fresh fruit – absolutely delicious.
something you have to see. totaly breathless experience, wish to have this at homeBest time to visit is in the morning and lunch time.
Colorful Market. Its worth to see this place.. and if you are a food lover .. please be there with empty tummy.. to try different types of friuts n nuts.. and juices

Colorful and fun, especially before the crowds. We stumbled upon this wonderful market as we were exploring Las Ramblas one morning. We were ahead of the crowds, surrounded by what appeared to be locals getting their food for the day. I can imagine it could be a very different experience later in the day..... We were entranced by the colorful displays of fruits, veggies, meat, fish and candies. Very artistic and great to photograph! If you can step back to see the structure, that is a special bit of architecture as well. We only bought a bit of fruit to try, so it was a great FREE attraction, and one of our favorite spots in Barcelona, which we only discovered by happy accident!

Colourful market. We didn't spend too much time at La Boqueria, but we managed to get through the crowds to gaze at all that magical, exotic fruit! We desired so much more than we purchased. A cup of fruit including figs, melon, berries and mango for 1.5€ felt like a steal and they tasted quite nice and pretty fresh. Also a nice package of dates for 1€ weren't too bad either. The crowds were, as to be expected, ridiculous and although it's not the best city market I've ever been it, I really loved the variety of fruits, juices and cheap to-go cups. I would absolutely go a little further in the heart of the market if given more time.
Don't miss to visit this.. A great (food) experience, lots of food, fresh fruit, smoothies, candy etc. Many tourist and local people.

Always Fun & Interesting. We love to go to La Boqueria every time we are in Barcelona. It is a great place to eat breakfast, grab a snack, take pictures, and absorb the local flavor! This time we picked up empanadas, jamon, and some unusual juices for breakfast! Not to mention it's good for the budget instead of paying the hotel or a restaurant inflated prices for breakfast! Go- you'll have a great time!

its worth a visit. the first time I visited this place was 2012, my sissy and I were there in the morning, so it was not crowded, even the 2nd time we had our brunch there this year was not crowded, my hubby and I enjoyed the place, for us its unique, a market where you can have breakfast or lunch.we had beer, wine and Spanish food. its worth a visit. :) for the sake of experience, why not? :)

You have to visit.... Damn if you do, damn if you don't:Way too many tourists, but as a tourist you have to behave like one: so, I'm afraid you have to visit like I did.And yes, it's a very nice, way too popular market.Damn those tourists like me for spoiling the place. :-)

HORRIBLE TOURIST TRAP!. Thousand of "cheap" tourists tours like invaders in that famous market.. Practically no real food but only junk ice etc... for the 1 €uro they want to spend and polluting the "real thing".A catastrophy! Don't go, it's an attack on Culture.
ITS A MUST!!. I loved the place, it has a lot of food and its very pretty. You can eat there very cheap and there are a lot of options.

nice city market. Nice city market with plenty of variety of fruita, fresh sea food and meat, grains and so on. There are restaurants there but they tend to be crowded (specially sea food ones). I ate on a restaurant that served tapas on the right side - nice and fun, not unforgettable. If you're looking for fruits go to the stores in the back- their price is much better as tourists tend to stay on the ones nearest to the entrance.I recommend it - good place specially when you feel like running a way from the ramblas

Amazing!. Full of colours, people, smells and flavours. It's wonderful to walk around (if possible, because it's usually very crowded) and try different foods. I've seen no other place in the world as colourful and diverse like this one. It's definitely a MUST DO in Barcelona.

Despite the tourists this is a place you should visit. While viewing thousands of Iberian hams that you can not take home becomes a little tedious, do try some it is delicious.
