I would also try some of the seafood restaraunts in the market and on the edge of it. They are truly outstanding both in quality and value.

Way too crowded. The Boqueria is a huge market with lots of interesting products and even an excellent restaurant where we ate. The problem is that it is just too crowded with tourists. If you don't like crowds consider going to the nearby Santa Catarina market, which is an excellent market on its own and much less crowded.

Chose day and time wisely. An impressive food market for sure. A tad touristy for my taste given the ample stalls selling fruit juices and fruit salad right at the entrance. We were unlucky as the fish/sea food stalls were not open when we visited (Monday morning around 11)

All the bounty of Catalan spread before you!. I went here on the last day of my trip and I got so many beautiful photos. I liked the photos but wished I had gone here at the beginning of my trip because a place to come back to again and again for great food and people watching - bring your smartphone or camera for photos and go hungry! There are a number of places right in the market where you can sit and eat food directly from the market itself - lovely place!

Brilliant Market. La Boqueria market on Las Rambla is definately worth a visit, just for the sights and smells alone.This market sells everything from fish, meat, flowers and sweets and chocolates.The way the foodstuffs are displayed is amazing.It does get very busy, so watch your bags!!!!

Worth visitng. Don´t miss it if you happen to be in las ramblas. The colourful fruit shops and the wide choice of fishes in the fish market is a very interesting sight for the foreign visitor. You can round the visit with a fruit juice or some food of the wide array present in the market. Bear in mind that it can be very crowded, particlarly in high season.

La Boqueria. This place was amazing! The colors or all the food, the beauty of how each booth was set up was just amazing. Lots of fresh seafood, fruits, fruit cups, olives, breads, cheeses, you name it! Buy something already prepared as you stroll through or buy ingredients to make your own. Definitely worth a visit here. It is like a farmer's market turbo-charged! Be considerate of those who are actually doing their weekly shopping as we are just gawking at all the beautiful foods!

Best way to experience Spanish Culture. It is a must-go place in Barcelona. I am even more glad that i stayed just one block away from the market so I went there every single day for foodI got fruit, juices there. tried a number of different restaurants. Never get disappointed. Actually highly recommend El Quim.I also got the iberico jamon at a store there and bought some home. Very Good quality.

Fabulous market. Get street food, bar food, and fresh seafood. All the cafes serving what appeared to be really good seafood had lines and we didn't want to wait, but the dishes looked great. We ended up getting fried shrimp on a stick, crab croquettes on a stick, and cod empanadas which were just okay. But a lobster salad was delicious. Fun place to sample food and browse the stalls.

a visual symphony!. stroll through the aisles of this market and get lost among the beautiful cut fruit, fresh fish, colorful vegetables and ham (and more ham and more ham!). stop at pinotxo bar for a delicious coffee con leche (and a xuxo pastry filled with custard...so yummy). we found ourselves at this market everyday, and picked up something delicious each time.

what an experience!. Fresh fruits, meats and seafood in abundance.Crowded with locals and tourist all buying and sampling the array of fresh produce and food available. With stalls selling fresh fruit and juices, to vendors with meats hanging from above and seafood clerks and restaurants with space for a quick bite it certainly is worth making a stop and sampling the many flavours and colours and smells that are available. Seeing and smelling the spices, meats, food and fruits are all an amazing experience and free of charge. I recommend to just go an explore this unique food market.

"Amazing experience". Stumbled across Marcat St Joseph La Boqueria when strolling down Las Rambles, it is about You find La Boqueria on the Ramblas half way down (heading in the direction of the port) on the right. The place is just awesome! It is jam packed full of food purveyors, everything from fish to chocolate to meats to fresh fruit & spices and everything is displayed in a very beautiful manner. You could spend a day strolling your way through the place, most of the stalls offer small bits to purchase so you can pause while you stroll through. If you are feeling particularly hungry there are a number of great tapas bars serving everything from fresh fish to excellent meats (something for everyone), I just wish I had more time to spend in the place; but that just gives me an excuse to take a trip back to Barcelona. This place is a must for all you foodies out there; it should be on the top of the places to visit.

Very overrated and crowded!. We have eaten here on previous visits and don't remember it being this crowded. There were throngs of people even though it was late at night.We decided not to eat here because the prices are out of line and the crowds are out of control. I'm glad we did.

Seafood and colour. Mercat closed on Sunday and fish section closed on Monday. First visit on a Saturday afternoon. +++ crowded. Very colourful ... juices, spices, candy, chili peppers.The fish market was amazing with choices beyond the imagination. It was fascinating watching the people prepare the fish for sale. Well worth being part of the crowd.
fab stalls. The stalls are fab to look at I went first thing on Monday and got some great veg 1 kg of tomato's for a euro !! Its is very very busy on Saturday afternoon

Absolute must for foodies. One of the best markets I have been to in all my travels. Fresh fruit, ham, meat, pastries and much more on sale. Very busy, great atmosphere. Check opening times in advance and check out Bar Boqueria for a great place to sit down and eat.

You have to browse this market - go on a week day. We have never been in a market like this - it was an amazing experience (we lived need St Lawrence market in Toronto and it was nothing like this). There is every kind of fruit, vegetable, meat and fish you can imagine also oils, condiments and candy . There are tapas bars to get something to eat. We browsed every row. Go on a week day if you can. We went back on the Saturday as we were in the area and you could not get into the market it was so packed.

Closed Sunday/ locals do not go on Mondays. On Mondays the locals feel the fish is not fresh (left over from Saturday as the market is closed on Sunday), many of the fish stalls were empty on the Monday we visited. We enjoyed Rotisseria Ramon in the back for a small snack of grilled mini sausages- they were fresh and delicious (pinxo- 3 Euros) and we tried empanadas at Ribas, do not recommend those there. The fillings were nice however we tried the three mini empanadas on a stick and found the dough/crust to be very dry and bland. Overall a great place to visit. Lots of color, good energy and numerous types of food to try or purchase for a picnic in the park.

Tons to see, eat and drink. Amazing experience. We visited the market during a really hot month - the juices that they sell at the front were probably the most refreshing beverage I have ever tasted. There were a ton of places for quick snacks, and we lined up for a few tapas at a busy counter - we weren't disappointed. Well worth the pit stop if you're wandering down Las Ramblas. We went twice!

A must for all you foodies. Stumbled across Marcat St Joseph La Boqueria when strolling down Las Rambles, it is about half way down (heading in the direction of the port) on the right. The place is just awesome!!! It is jam packed full of artisnal food purveyors, everything from fish to chocolate to meats to fresh fruit & spices. You could spend a day grazing your way through the place, most of the stalls offer small bits to purchase so you can munch while you stroll through. If you are feeling particularly hungry there are a number great tapas bars serving everything from fresh fish to cured meats (something for everyone), I just wish had had more time to spend in the place; but that just gives me an excuse to take trip back to Barcelona. This place is a must for all you foodies out there; it should be up there on the places to visit

What an Amazing Market!. As markets go, this one the Mercat de Sant Josep de la Boqueria market is pretty spectacular. It is juts HUGE! and you can literally find everything here from fresh fish to the strangest fruit you can think of. Located not far from Les Rambles, the wickedly awesome food market should not be missed. Thumbs up from me.

Totally overrated. This is the second time we visited the market and actually ate there for the first time. For a first timer, the market is colorful; full of people and action (mostly tourist). But I find the tapas (two stores in the back) were so and so and more expensive compared to say Cervecería Catalana (the wait is almost the same). The fruits are colorful but not the freshest. You can get figs at 2-3 Euros/kg in small local groceries. Try Mercado Santa Caterina. In both places avoid Monday --- no seafood at MSC and not the freshest at MSJB (fishermen stayed home on Sunday)

An experience!. I thought the suk in Jerusalem was an adventure, but the Boqueria off La Rambla is just as much.We first went on a Mon when several stands are closed, but went back when it was in full swing.Not to be missed!

Awesome!. This is what Les Halles De Lyon Paul Bocuse wishes it was... Actually this is what I wished it was. Unpretentious, great variety of fruits, vegs, meats, food. You will find everything from lychees to animal innards for sale. This is a def must for foodies.
Brilliant Market. Such a large and vibrant Market - Lots to see, eat and drink. Cheap prices ...very authentic and a must when visiting Barcelona!

On Ramblas..the old market. This is a delight for the senses! A visual feast where you want to take home every thing in the market. The sounds of the market, the vendors, the buyers, the visiting...fabulous!

Go with an empty stomach!. Busy market with lots to eat and was amazing to see, worth a couple of photos!There were several stores selling fresh fruit juices/smoothies for one or two euro, fruit salads, jamon, baked goods, veges and meat. Great place for a snack or meal although not much seating.

Enjoy the colours and variety of produce. How markets should be, everyone should visit at least once to marvel at the produce on show, the colours and vibrancy here are amazing and expect to take pictures of paprika and pose in front of peppers. Beware though, prices here are double most markets so serious shoppers should try the supermercado first!

Do not miss it!. Fresh fruit. Cheese. Eggs. Bakery. Fish. Ham. Candy. Seafood. So many colours and smells. All the craziness and noise of all the great markets. Don't miss the belly of this beautiful city. And while you're there - stop by Bar Clemen's at the back on the left - for breakfast, or a drink and snack. A real treat.

Very cool market. One of the highlights of our trip was walking through La Boqueria (we went through it multiple times), getting jugos and paletas. Has such an authentic feel, even filled with tourists.
Barcelona Market. Deffinately worth a visit. Huge market, very very busy, everything you want in a food market, loads of stalls inside.

Colorful and interesting place to visit. We've taken the time to stare at each stand and shop in the market and it was worth it. Many interesting exotic (for me) foods, fruit and dishes. I had some bad oyster tasting experience i one of the stands, but I want to believe that at was by the hand of the chance. The paella stand in the left far corner from the entrance was very nice, it was, in fact, the best paella I had in Barcelona (including 2 restaurants).
Loved it!. Stumbled upon it while strolling the La Rambla and it was fantastic, the atmosphere was so cool, they sell only food, but still it was very interesting market to walk at.

Best spot in Barcelona. Wonderful colourful fragrant food. Crowds. Fabulous. Don't miss. A must place and if you can't get a seat at one of the stalls then simply but some food to go and wander round enjoying the atmosphere.

Attn. Foodies: Hie Thee Hither. Is this the Mother of all Covered Market Places? I think it may be!!! I've been to the Rialto Market in Venice, and it ls large and interesting and fun - with kind of a Medieval atmosphere to it. Not to be missed for Foodies. I've been to "EATALY" in NYC, and it is large and interesting and fun - with a definite "Madison Avenue" marketing atmosphere to it. Not to be missed for Foodies. I fell in love with the more modest sized Mercado de San Miguel in Madrid and wanted to buy one of everything I saw. They seemed to specialize in Tapas ('taste-sized' servings of delicious appetizers, etc) and I was very impressed with how beautifully the food was displayed and how wonderful it all tasted. Not to be missed by anyone!!Now I have visited Mercat La Boqueria and it is amazing. DON"T LET THE ENTRANCE from Las Ramblas scare you off. The entrance is small and constantly looks mobbed with people and one would think that it is equally mobbed inside. Not so! The inside is almost cavernous and once you get past the tiny entrance there is much more room and you don't feel uncomfortably crowded. The selection of foods (including Tapas) is amazing! The stalls are artistically and creatively decorated, and it is kind of a combination of all the other three markets put together. I ate there 4 times in 6 days and can't wait to get back. Not to be missed for Foodies! You will enjoy.

One of the Best Markets in the World. Even if you don't enjoy markets you will love Mercat de La Boqueria.So much to see, taste, smell and touch. You could spend hours here just watching the hustle & bustle and nibbling your way around - fruits, nuts, juices, jamon, wines, cheese, seafood, lollies, vegetables as well as places to eat lunch if you'd like.We were fortunate to stay in an apartment close by so we could cook a few meals using the market's fantastic produce.

Fantastic fruit. Absolutely bustling with a great atmosphere. Lots of places to have a snack or drink, as well as pick up something to eat on the go. The best on offer is undoubtedly the pots of fruit salad, go for a 1.50 pot and enjoy deliciously fresh fruit.

Crazy busy, colourful, noisy and inviting Mercat Boqueria. While wandering around in Barcelona my wife and I came upon Mercat Boqueria just a few steps from La Rambla. It turned out to be one of our best experiences in Barcelona. We went to the market around 2:00 in the afternoon and walked into perhaps the noisest, most colourful market we have ever experienced. Vendors of all types in every direction and as far as the eye could see. This place has everything you could possibly want to find in a market. We bought a small cone of Serrano ham (awesome) to nibble on while we walked around the market. A little later we bought a large cup of fresh cut (to order) fruit from one of the incredibly colourful vendor stands...walked a bit more...found a 12 seat lunch bar specializing in seafood...tried the grilled calamari, fried/breaded smelt...fresh oysters and a few glasses of real cold Cava to complete the meal. We came upon a candy vendor and bought several fresh made (awesome) nougat bars to bring back for friends and colleagues in Canada. On our way back to La Rambla we bought a couple of tasty glazed, pear pastries and espressos for our walk across La Rambla and into Barri Gotic. This is one place you don't want to miss when you are in Barcelona.

What a place for food lovers!!. Here is everything from fruits, honey, fisk, shellfish, meat and especially all kinds of ham. Ther is a lot of people at the entrance area and the prices are higher. Go there early and try the small business in the back, where you can buy tasty snacks and a beer. Buy some Iberico ham to take home and enjoy the smells and this unique market with all the people. It's just one of our favourite places in Barcelona!!
Nice big market in Barcelona. This market is a must for all market addicts. It's big and nice and has all you need for a nice walk around and tasting some local products and food. Nice experience

Interesting and recommended if close by. From what I understand, this market is over 100 years old, but not quite sure about its history, we passed by it and decided to check it out, interesting sights and smells and if you are next to it then you should check it out, but don't come out of your way for it.The only thing I bought here was some passion fruit juice which turned out to be very good.It gets quite crowded but isn't stuffy, didn't have much trouble walking around though, even with a baby stroller at hand.The only time you may have trouble moving around is when us tourists stop to take pictures.

A great place to go, but go when your hungry.. Really enjoyed strolling around this market. It was very busy but it was very interesting. Make sure you go there hungry, there is so much to choose from with lots of fresh products and of course lots of Spainish foods.You could spend ages just looking at all the different foods.

Dont Miss This. Even if you are not a foodie go to the market. Avoid the front entrance and go to the sides or rear. The tourists crowd the front and prices are somewhat higher.The array of foods is simply breathtaking. Every imaginab le type of Iberian ham. Get a little paper cone filled with ham to snack on as you walk around. The seafood section in the center is an education in itself. Whole tuna being sliced, live lobster, crabs and clams. Every imaginable type of shrimp. Cockles and mussels alive alive oh.Dozens of different homemade empanadas. Don't be put off by the butcher cases. The heads of pigs our lambs just tell you how fresh it is.Push your way in to one of the food counters and eat breakfast or lunch. We had the octopus and fresh mixed seafood grill.Go early in the morning and not on Monday when there is very little seafood. Great place to buy saffron and pimento to take home.

Must visit for foodies. We popped into this market a couple of times during our recent visit to Barcelona. There is plenty of opportunity to sample the foods at the various cafés dotted around the market. All the food is fresh and reasonably priced with the lovely Hussel bussel of a traditional food market

pretty market - must visit !!!. great food, people, groceries,ambiance and so much more. don't miss this market situated on the side of La Rambla, Barcelona. the colors at the entrance where the fruits and juices just brings up your visual and tummy appetites. !!! there are so many people from all over the world and the crowd is friendly and the stalls are friendly and you get to see and buy fresh seafood and vegetables and many more. no smell at all. we go back to this place every time we are in Barcelona and enjoyed it every time.if you want to enjoy great seafood for lunch and a bottle of cava to go wiht it, do visit El Cochinnillo Loco on the left side of the market when you enter.

Terrible food. Don't buy anything here. Our hotel was very close to this market so we went here several times to look, and it looks fabulous. Today we bought food there twice, and both times in was inedible. The first time we bought some fresh figs at a stall. They had started fermenting, and I ended up not being able to eat them, and trough them out. In the afteroon we went back there to get a snack. We bought some fruit cups and some hard salami. The hard salami was OK at best, and the fruit cups turned out to have fuit in them that had probably been cut up many days ago. Again ended up throwing out most of it. What a waste. Not going back there.
Taste of Barcelona!. Great market, with lots of options for fresh fruit, sweets and veg! It was such a lively place. Beautiful experience!
Amazing!. The colors, the organization, everything is just amazing, the fruits taste very good and very cheap must visit!

Great atmosphere. The market itself is a marvel. The restaurant is very seducing. We had octopus, squid mussels and beer. The food was all good. The only complain i have is that they were not cooked in grill but on that big flat iron surfaces that some times the restaurants call grill. Maybe the market regulations do not allow grill, but i would prefer that. It would have been much better. Anyway it was very good and friendly atmosphere and the food was tasty. I would recommend it.

Sweet fruit. Besides of a amazing look of sorted fruit, there is a delicious taste of passion fruit, grapes, mangos, etc.If you want to buy cheap don't rush with shopping, walk thru market and look for low prices.If you want to eat sea food it would be a very good choice because the fish is fresh and it's worth the money.Better give 5-8 euros and eat fresh and healty, rather than 4-5 euros for sandwiches and junk like that.
Form your meal. A great place to form your meal from diff places with a lot of varieties. We took our meal from there and walked to the beach and had a picnic there it was relaxing.

Great place great food. Boqueria market has the best tapas bar in Barcelona - the El Quim!Fabulous hot tapas every dish great then others.In the middel of Boqueria whit all the smells and the atmosphere of the market!

Food heave. this place is one of the best market I have ever been to. My wife and I spent a couple of hours walking around all the stores from fresh fishes to fruits, dry cure meats to deserts, cakes to candies...the place is full of little tapas places for foodies lovers...but you have to be quick with the space at these little places..get some jamon back if you like it as they are very good, but beware that prices are varied from 10 euros per kg to over 100 euros per kg...this is a must vista place!

My favourite place in Barcelona. A foodies paradise where you can not only shop for fresh groceries and artisan produce but also sit down to eat at a handful of places. Head over towards the back corner, sharpen your elbows and muscle in for a seat at the Bar (can't remember the name!). I had one of my most memorable meals here 7 years ago - an oily tangle of garlicky razor clams. I returned to relive it and it was just as amazing. Also had the giant garlic prawns and a lovely bottle of Albariño. Food this good literally brings tears of joy to my eyes. Go.
Great. Really beautiful market with great food on offer, most of which is reasonably priced. Particularly amazing selection of juices and fruit salads

Love the place, despite its gringo reputation.. Always a great experience. Love just walking in and seeing the stalls. Visually stunning and so much on offer. Only thing i don't like is the silly prices of the bars and cafe. But regardless, it all looks amazing and the skills of some of the butchers and mongers are second to none.

Food heaven - must eat tapas at El Pinotxo bar. Boqueria market has the best rated tapas bar in Barcelona - the El Pinotxo. We did our research and this bar was rated as the best tapas bar in Barcelona. We didn't quite believe it but we changed our mind after eating there. Fabulous hot tapas and easily the best we had in Barcelona. Must-try dishes include grilled squid and beans, juicy lamb/deer skew, grilled sweet pepper salad. We ordered around 5-6 dishes and every single dish was phenomenal. Brunch at El Pinotxo tapas bar: 30 euros/person (including wine, 5-6 dishes)Cherries: 2-4 euros/kgSpanish Ham: from 18 euro/kg and above. The darker the ham looks, the better quality and more expensive. Venders sell air-tight packs of ham that you can purchase and bring home. We were told the air-tight ham would last for 3 months. Put the air-tight ham packs in the fridge (not freezer) as soon as you get home.
Colourful and lively. Displays are really nice and even if you don't buy anything, it is nice to walk around. Good place to buy spices, especially cheap saffron!

Fresh...... If u walk in to this market you'll never never wanna leave. They have everything and I mean all u wanna eat. The best part is fresh, all fresh vegetables, fresh fruits all kinds. Meat and fish just excellent. To make it even better, a lot of tiny restaurants that serves all kinds of tapas, cooking fresh seafood. One of my favorite place in Barcelona.

Foodies Paradise. Just love food markets and this has to be up there with the best ever. The choice of food, from cheese, to olives, juices, pastries, amazing prosciutto and cold cuts, poultry, seafood, fruit, vegetables etc. The variety, the colours, the presentation, the ambience just wonderful. And incredibly cheap - would love to do my food shop here every weekend. The highlight was sitting having a tapas lunch and watching the world go by. Definitely a must if you're visiting Barcelona.

Mental!. This truly is a place to see, the amount of fresh produce in here is mind boggling. From meat to fish to veg to anything else you might think of. The colours sights, sounds and smells are amazing in here, you can even have breakfast or lunch at some of the stands.

loved the market,the food,the ambiance great place. we stayed in a hotel across the street from the market,what an experience from fresh fruits,juice,spices,dried fruits and nuts,meats,sandwiches and seafood. This market has it all, great place for breakfast or lunch or just walk and sip on fresh fruit juice and sample the taste of catalunya as the local call it . A must see when on the ramblas.

Boqueria of fabulous food. The Boqueria is just full of choices for food all beautifully displayed. Every kind of fresh juice you can and can't imagine is available for 2euros during the day and 1 euro near closing. The crowd there is great so you need to watch your purse for pickpockets.

Colorful crowded fun!. A mix of tourists and locals. The vendors are mostly fruit and juice stands, small butcher shops, seafood purveyors and a wide variety of small restaurants. a huge market with a friendly Catalonian atmosphere. Not to be missed.

A must to discover. Oh my! If you're in Barcelona you really have to make a visit here!! So much food,colours,drinks and practically everything you need when it comes to food. I really didn't need anything since I was staying at a hotel but just being there was an adventure. So many people,so much food,so many impressions! You could eat there since there were foodcourts. It was crowded and not that many seats but it was cheap. I tried the freshly squeezed juice and it was delicious! You don't have to go here to shop but go and explore the atmosphere! Be a part of this amazing market. I would say this is as important as to go see La Sagrada Familia!

Food without end. If you like food markets you will enjoy this one. Buy seafood, fish, snails, fruits, snacks, vegetables, jambon... You name it...it is there for you to buy. A paradise for the eye and worth to take a few pics. Do not expect tables to sit down there. Some stalls offer barchairs to sit on, but the place is crowded, so you better take a coffee somewhere else. I recommend the café elJardin only a short walk away.

Colors and Flavours. This market is one of the best all around. You can find every type of food here, from seafood, to samosas and of course... every single type of fruit juice is here. The vibrant colors and sweet smells will make you wanna stay there for hours, wandering around, eating and drinking. Highly recommend a visit.

Amazing variety. Definitely among my favorite markets in the world. This place has an amazing variety of cheeses, fruits, vegetables, seafood and meat. I particularly like the good selection of spanish hams. There are also a number of food stands - my favorite are the ones that sell Spanish pastries and other European fare.

A must go-to in Barcelona. This market has quickly become a favorite of mine in Barcelona. It's got fruit&veggies, cheeses, confections, seafood and all kinds of meat. It's also got a lot of food stands,as well, so make sure to sample some of the snacks there. My favorite was a Greek stall that sold the most DELICIOUS kalamata olives and stuffed peppers I've ever tasted. It also serves all kinds of Greek snacks from savory pastries to baklava. I also loved the turron stall, and I stocked up on delicious turrons from there. Keep in mind though that the market is always EXTREMELY busy and bustling with tourists. It is also NOT for those who care too much about hygiene. But if you can get over those 2 things and fully immerse yourself in the market, all your senses will be rewarded.

Great place to stop and shop. This is right on Las Ramblas and a great market for food, especially fresh fish and fruit. If you are out walking your can stop there for tapas or buy fruit to take with you. It is a hustling and bustling hub and well worth the visit. Closed Sundays. As always in Barcelona keep your valuables outta sight. If you do you'll have a great time.

Great fruit, meat and fish. We popped in here for breakfast and grabbed a cup of chopped mixed fruits to tuck into as we walked. The fruit was fresh and delicious and it was a great time to visit as it was quiet enough to walk aeound comfortably and see all the stall traders preparing their goods for sale. The meats and cheeses looked incredible and the seafood range was huge. A great treat for food lovers, with plenty of street food stalls throughout the market to fend off hunger as you go.

Best market. Traveling Barcelona on a budget? Want a gourmet meal I expensively? Want to see natural foods displayed artistically? Rated the best market in the world and justifiably so. Rows of stalls with fresh fish, meats, vegetables, cheeses, etc. the only place you would have to shop to prepare a simple dinner or a gourmet meal..

So much to see, smell and taste!. What was supposed to be a quick shop for a picnic later in the day turned into feast for all the senses! We drank fresh juices while we tasted meats and cheeses. Took photos while we watched seafood being cooked, tapas being created and sandwiches being crafted. We ended buying enough for three picnics as we just could not narrow things down. A foodies paradise to be sure!

If you love food, visit this place!. When exploring Barcelona and looking for somewhere to eat, wait until you have arrived here! This is the sort of place we have been looking for in our holidays. Amazing scenes and a real explosion for the senses! Don't take pictures. Just enjoy it. A real hit if you're a foodie. We could easily have spent most of our holiday in here. Masses upon masses of tasty, simple and amazingly fresh produce. We will be going back to Barcelona just for the market. Tip: the fresh fruit juices get cheaper towards the back so be patient. Also... Lots of pickpockets so keep things tight.I love this place!

The best market in Spain. If you like European markets then this is for you. Extremely busy but worth going at any time. Produce is fantastic. We bought ingredients lunch a couple of times and were not disappointed.Colour, noise, food odours, action. It's all there.

Barcelonas famous market. This is a huge market where you will find everything from fresh fish vendors to baked goods to a fantastic candy stand that the kids loved. It is a very authentic market. Not fancy at all. The real deal

Loved it. Go early in the morning around 8:00am, it is less crowded.We had a late breakfast there in a small family bar on the edge of the market. Spanish omelet, sea food salad, coffee and local bread; everything is very fresh and prepared in front of your eyes.in case tomatoes are finished and you want them- no problem. The owner will just go 5 meter to the near row and will be happy to buy them and cook for you.Don't miss fresh berries and ice cream made of the frozen juice from the freshly blended fruits.

Oh My - so much to see and try. Yes, lots of people. Yes, lots to view and take photos of. Make sure you stop and try a few things. We had lunch. We bought some wines. We bought a small serving of spanish ham slices. We look forward to a return visit now that we have been there once, we'll enjoy it even more.

Great. But go early in the morning, it's less crowded. We had breakfast there two days in the row, at a small family bar on the edge of the market. Wanted to go even the third day but on Sunday it's closed.You find everything you can dream of. The fresh juices are good but my favorite was the frozen juice ice cream.Good for having a good meal or buying great snacks for the day.
a lot of fresh fruits. you really can enjoy the fresh products. if you like sea food and fresh fruits it is a place you have to go

Crowded but good. Finding a space at any of the small bars in the market is almost impossible, but finding the ingredients for a great picnic is easy and the results are delicious: dates filled with nuts or bacon; various stuffed olives, empanadas, fruits, ...

"Must see" and "must eat" place!. Unforgettable! Never seen better market. Been ther three times; saturday (best day for visiting), sunday (didn`t work), and monday (worked, but not all the stands). Really huge choise of meals, fruits, drinks, snacks,... This place definitely should be "No1 to see in Barcelona".

Refreshing fruit and juice on a hot day. A lovely market and the fruit stands at the front are great. 1€ for a glass of juice and about the same 1-3€ for a small pot of fruit. Lots of tapas places inside the market and tasty-looking takeaways. We had a tortilla wrapped 'come' of 3 fish fingers and rubbery squid rings for 4.50€ which wasn't great but the stall on the edge selling falafel was nice. The market authority should install a few benches as nowhere to sit (sit on the ground round the back of the market and get told off) except for perching on some low doorway steps. But I assume the restaurants around the edge would not like for tourists to be able to buy takeaway and sit while eating it. You can see the stall holders take great pride in their stalls and some of the displays are marvellous works of 'art'.

Very crowded but great place to see. Very rich market offering good people watching and amazing looking food. It is crowded but if you don't mind La Ramblas walking then this is a great place to just walk through. We bought some natural juices they had in the entrance and they were great. We were there later (after 3) so not many places were open - but still a nice little stop.

too touristy. when you travel you want to see things, as other people, but when all you can see everywhere are tourists (you amongst them of course) then you know that something happennedwhere are the locals? It seems that they have been pushed away by us little by littlevendors seem to focus only on things for visitors, so you can't really get what local life is in a market there.a shame.

Can't miss in Barcelona. This market is a can't miss and most certainly a top 5 attraction in Barca. You can find most any fruit, vegetable, or spice from around the world. The meat and fish selection is astounding. This is a great place to sample jamon, and there are a number of food stalls serving fantastic food. If you love food, brave La Ramblas to get here, and you will not be disappointed.

Certainly a must see and must eat location. One of my first stops was La Boqueria, the most amazing market ever. Fresh Fish, Meats vegetables, fruits Juices. It's probably the most beautiful complete market in the world. The prices aren't inexpensive, but you get the quality that is hard to find in most places.We ate at a little restaurant counter inside, their food was good but not great. We bought fruit and drinks and took them with us. Anything you could dream up is in this market, including thousands of tourists, " not for sale though" it's orderly, no shoulder to shoulder, it's very well organized, stall to stall something more beautiful at each one.
Amazingly Authentic. What a great place, ended up here on a few occasions whilst in Barcelona. Great place for fresh produce and to grab a bite to eat along with some cava!

your first stop at Las Ramblas. this is an amzing authentic and traditional food market. it has all the fresh fruits, cheese, meats, nuts, seafood, ice cream, sweets and a lot more. the place is not that big, so it could get really crowded but it is worth spending few hours there.the fruits there are fresh and sweet. the place had several tapas were you can sit on the bar for a tapas or a small meal.the place had an extensive selection of cheese as well as jamon serrano which seems to be very popular there.

Amazing food, spices, drinks. Expected it to be crowded and noisy (it is smack bang in La Rambla after all). However enjoyed everything about it - overwhelmed by choices in food and drink. Bought spices to bring home and had a leisurely snack of fresh tapas towards the back of the markets. Definitely worth a walk-through, was the highlight of my La Rambla visit.
Fabulous to look at - but crowded!. Visited here and just stood with a glass of rose cava soaking up the atmosphere, going back again today!! Although the crowds can get too much!

Jamon, jamon!. Go to Boqueria and one of the tapas bars offers free tapas to anyone who says "jamon jamon". Only the locals know this, so don't tell other tourists. A clue, its the selling punnets of ham.

Best Market i have been too. All i can say is WOW!!! Great market where you can find everything from Seafood to sugar cravings and Jamon Iberico.... Set up in little stalls food is displayed wonderfully. The smells (sometimes of fish) wash over you like you are in a sea of flavors. I saw the largest shrimp that i have ever seen! (must have been 12 inches long) Also the Jamon is to die for. I would recommend this to anyone who is visiting Barcelona. Of course be careful with your wears as this is a high pick pocket area.

A must visit for every traveller!. The vivid colours and busy excitement of Barcelona’s most famed markets is what makes Mercat de La Boqueria truly memorable. La Boqueria is predominantly a food market, which serves up some of the freshest fruits, vegetables, meats and seafood that Barcelona has to offer. It’s a great place to catch a bite after sightseeing while people watching and soaking up Barcelona’s lively atmosphere. We visited in winter and the market was buzzing with locals and tourists. We highly recommends a visit to the seafood stall in the left hand corner after the main entrance, which serves up delicious grilled seafood. You will know which one it is because it is completely PACKED! Overall, the Spanish know how to do food well!For more photos, please check out our travel blog:http://www.wanderlustchronicles.com.au/#!La-Boqueria-MarketsBarcelona-SPAIN/c1ljw/DED69DC0-049A-44DF-9D1E-00B954F404DF

Colorful and vibrant market with a variety of food vendors. Allow enough time to make your way through this bustling market in order to engage all of your senses and explore the diverse offerings of food and beverages. Crowds were part of the fun. We spotted an organic take-out place in the far corner and after perusing through the rest of the market came back for a delicious vegetarian meal (10 euro) that easily served two. Be aware that there are not many places to sit yourself or your food down so most people that we observed, including us, found an out-of-the-way corner or leaned against a building and ate standing up.

Bustling market, a must visit. The first time I visited this market was about 15 years ago in December. So, if like me you are returning in the heat of summer, then expect a crowd! This doesn't detract from the quality of your visit, personally, I think its an enhancement. This market has everything: fruit, vegetables, meats, seafood, fish, cheese and even wine, such a shame I don't live here to be able to buy and make something wonderful.

So colourful. This place is amazing. I recently got a dslr camera so I was so excited to go to the market to take loads of photos. The smells when you walk by the stalls are great. I went at 11am and some of the fish stalls were already closing so you should go early to make sure you see everything.
must see. fantastic food market.Just off La Rambla. All kinds of food,jamon,ham,fruit,vegetables. Fruit juice drinks are fantastic value. Atmosphere great. Must see on any visit to Barcelona
nice but very stinky. little bit expensive i bought chocalate and i paid 8 € then i found same chocalete in supermarket 3 € :( u can find fresh fruit and lots of things about food nice for lunch

Fresh fruits and seafood. If you are looking for some ready fresh fruits or juices to drink, you will be spoilt for choices here. I will recommend also grabbing an awesome grilled seafood meal at the Bar Central stall located at the back of the market. They cook it right in front of you literally.

Eye-opening. We were amazed at the variety and freshness of the items for sale: seafood, meat, cheese, fruits, vegetables. Hard to believe. The kids were entranced with the candy booth. Multiple tapas restaurants at the periphery.
A must visit. Fascinating open air food market, with lots of eating places within the market. Fish places particularly good.

Do not miss this wonderful sensory experience.. When visiting barcelona a visit to the Mercat de sant Joseph de la boqueria is a fabulous experience for all the family.
With great displays of fruit,fish,and meat,coupled with local tapas bars the sights and sounds give you a wonderful insight to Catalan life- do not miss it.

Amazing, definitely worth a visit!!. I visited La Boqueria a few weeks ago on a short trip to Barcelona and was not at all disappointed. You will find every kind of stall imaginable and the produce on offer is a very high quality: very fresh and rock- bottom prices! I wrote a review of my visit and other things to do in Barcelona on my blog, you can find the entry here: http://helenasbistro.wordpress.com/2014/08/10/holiday-in-costa-brava-spain/
Worth a look. Nice market .. Fish, meat, fruit, veg etc ... Impressive looking place with fresh produce ... can even have ot cooked and eaten in same place

Must visit!. This place is by far one of the best places to visit in barcelona. Located at las ramblas, this market is filled with tourists and locals buying fresh fruits, chocolates, seafood and meat! Also u can drop by to one of the few shops for lunch over there.. its a must visit glfor those who visit barcelona!
Wander in and feast your eyes. continental markets always fascinate us Brits and this one is no exception. Plenty to see and try (if you're brave). Well worth an hour to explore

Stop, Shop here!. Having rented a flat just off La Ramblas we were advised to visit this fresh market for supplying our meals. We had a great time visiting the market every day we were in Barcelona. The prices are astonishingly reasonable and fair for the freshness and quality of fruits, vegetables, meats, seafood, breads and flowers.We especially appreciated the friendliness from most of the vendors, even though it is so busy and seemingly chaotic. It was also great that the seafood and shellfish we purchased to make for dinner was supplied with a variety of herbs and spices, just included in the sales.It became so easy to visualize living with daily access to such a market.

Unbelievable Market. This place is unbelievable. You could wander around for hours and eat here 3 meals a day!! Anything you can grow they have!!! Definitley go sample as much as you can and take it all in!!!!

Forget the tours, make your own adventure!. This market was by far one of my favorite places to visit in Barcelona. Every time we went we had a new adventure, found something interesting to eat, saw something out of the ordinary. I highly recommend you forget the tours and just block of sometime to wander the market on your own. Don't hesitate to ask questions, everyone is super friendly.We ended up going to the market almost every morning and picking up some fresh fruit and sandwiches or meat and cheese to take us for lunch that day. Made the trip a little bit more affordable and definitely made it easier for us to adventure all day long without having to worry about choosing restaurants for lunch everyday.Don't forget it's closed on Sunday!

Fabulous market. Must see when in Barcelona. This is a great market right off of the busy Rambla. It's open every day except Sunday and is ALWAYS crowded. Really crowded. But so much fun. Lots of every kind of food, awesome fresh fruit and every kind of fruit juice. Also an amazing seafood section. You have to go and taste a little of this and a little of that. So much fun. We visited many times. But get ready to fight through the crowds.

Worth a visit to Barcelona in itself. This market rivals Borough market for the quality and variety of the produce on display. You can buy amazing quality fruit, vegetables, meat, wine, as well as eat amazing tapas in the back of the market. Don't miss out on visiting this place. The offal butcher is something else; you will see parts of an animal for sale that you wouldn't of thought possible to eat. Bulls testicles anyone?

Colorful and interesting. We walked down the bustling and crowded Las Ramblas to this market. I love going to markets in places I visit, it tells you so much about a culture. The market was busy but clean. Lots of fresh fruit, fish, and interesting animal parts. There are side streets around the market that are neat to walk along. We left the market and walked toward the Cathedral of Barcelona and stopped at a few piazzas along the way.
Don't miss the market!. What an amazing experience! Loved the on the move meal! Enjoyed seeing, eating, and being! Loved this from start to finish!

Gem in Las Ramblas. Beautiful experience at La Boqueria! I would recommend a visit before peak lunchtime hours as it can get a little crowded. Wonderful sights and smells of fresh fruits and delicacies from all of Cataluña. I went to visit with my mom on the recommendation of a family friend. Very nice plaza once you cross through the market, great place to avoid expensive tourist traps.

Fresh foodies heaven!. I am a big fresh food lover so these markets were a great find!You must get a fresh juice whilst here!Make sure you shop around for things as you will find the same products at a few places. Make sure you get the best price. You will find fresh fruit and veg, sweets seafood and more! Definitely worth a visit even just to look around :)

Love love love . This market is absolutely vibrant and full of delicious food. We went here twice for fruit and cheeses and chorizo. Make sure, before you buy, to go right in to the middle of the market as everything is a lot cheaper. Also try the mango and coconut fresh juice for €1.50 it's delicious. Don't get the €1 juice it's no way near as nice.

Gem in the city center. It is like a food heaven, you can literally find anything you find for cheap to moderate prices, everything being super delicious. We went there twice because we wanted to try different things. The fruit juices are amazing, a must go! Highly recommended.

Colorful experience!. Great market in the very centre of the city. Fresh fruits, candies, seafood - everything you wish. Don't rush to buy - take a walk around, a little further from the entrance you'll find the cheaper goods. Taste ready to eat fruit mix, the fresh juices (don't buy for 2 EUR near the entrance, in the middle of the market you'll find for 1 EUR). Nice place to have a quick lunch.

Fantastic Market. This market is just unbelievable ! The hams, the fruits, the fish.... I dont know where to start actually... I suggest you go there around 9:30 when all stands are open. If you go too early like 08:00 you will see some closed counters and people still unpacking food. Go here on the first or second day of your stay so you wont regret to have found this food paradise too late as you wont shop in a normal grocery store anymore.... Try the hams !!!

Quickly became one of our fave eating places!. The market is buzzy, colourful and clean. Lovely old building - great ambience and vibe. Popular with tourists it seems but met heaps of local people there too, particularly eating at the tapas bars/counters. They told us to pay good attention to our bags to avoid pickpockets which is probably good advice for shopping in most markets in the world. The tapas places are really popular so getting seating is quite hard but worth it.In the market there's an amazing choice of real fruit juices which were all delicious (and we didn't get a dodgy tummy from them - had six diff flavours over four days from different stalls). They make quite a sight - all the different vibrant colours.The bacalao empenadas were a winner, thin pastry, not overfilled but full of flavour. Also the various seafood dishes we chose -mariscos salpicon etc, also fried cod on sticks - all fresh and tasty and available to buy 'para llevar' - to take-away, in plastic containers.We got into the habit of buying bits and pieces from the different vendors - nuts, olives, bread, ham, seafood etc and head off for a city picnic but learned early on that there are few places to sit and enjoy a picnic so headed up to Montjuic and found plenty of places up there, even picnic tables (situated just back from the Olympic swimming pool). Air was cooler and breezy and views are great.Even if you don't go to buy, the fresh seafood area is worth seeing - great variety of fresh seafood and really clean and tidy.Unfortunately there weren't many rubbish bins around so there were quite a few plastic fruit juice cups left here and there but no doubt they all get swept up at the end of the day.

Fabulous Market in Barcelona. Walk into La Boqueria and you will swoon from the delicious array of aromas, from cheeses to salamis and prosciutto, breads, fish, olives, spices and on and on. This market is massive. As a tourist you can only find yourself wishing you had an apartment with a kitchen as you just want to take home a bit of everything and go nuts cooking. One of the best experiences is to grab a seat at one of the small restaurants within the market and order up an assortment of tapas. What could be more fun than to be surrounded by the hubbub of the market swirling around you, sipping cold cava and munching on calamari, tortilla, pulpo, crusty bread drizzled with Catalan olive oil and whatever else meets your fancy.This market is a must stop while in Barcelona. It is the true flavour of Barcelona with a great serving of Catalan charm, warmth and passion.

What a Market. Mercat de Sant Josep, has to be one of the best food markets in the world. The freshness of the produce and the colour and vibrancy takes it to another level. It is easy walking distance from the Metro and just off La Rambla which is a must do while visiting Barcelona. If you are renting an apartment, it is worth visiting the central part to purchase some fresh daily caught fish; else the tapas venues around the side of the Market are just as nice.

Go ahead! Take a peek!. If you're walking down La Rambla chances are you'll stumble upon this market. Go ahead and peek in to check out the variety of fruits, snacks...everything! Grab an afternoon snack or a couple of fresh juices. Remember to watch your bags and be aware of pick pocketers

Open air food bazaar. Lively open air food market. We tried a dozen of amazing fresh fruit juices- made with a combination of two or more fruits. The ones with coconut as one of the ingredients should not be missed.

Gastronomic Extravaganza. Have been to La Boqueria twice now, the two times we have traveled to Barcelona; we love the sights, smells and sounds of this open air food market. It's about halfway down Las Ramblas off a separate street with a big sign marked La Boqueria. Huge market area with fresh foods everyday. One can sit on stools and eat lunch, snacks or just walk amongst the many booths. Great part of the experience in Barcelona

A MUST Experience. On La Ramblas - Mercat host of venders selling fresh fruits, juices, herbs, meats, pastries, candies, etc. You could easily lose yourself in the vibrant colors, delicious foods, lively sounds and bustling energy. An experience you will be glad you took the time for.

A market at its best. We visited this market early one morning and found it humming with locals and tourists. Fabulous array of food and plenty of places to get fresh food to eat. Stalls laden with fresh fruits, vegetables, fish and all parts of the animal ready to cook. Great to walk around looking while munching on a fresh bread stick filled with delicious cheese and jamon.

You got it love it!!!!. This market place is in the heart of Las Ramblas, they have everything and then some,you can lunch in one of the counters restaurants,the fresh smothies just for 1.50,hams,cheeses,fruits,vegetables,you name it they have it,walk the market and you will experience a mix of smell and colors,locals in the every day groceries shopping and turists browsing around makes the place an attraction that you do not want to miss,anyways in on your way because if you are in Barcelona you are going to walk Las Ramblas.

All the makings for a great light dinner!. Take some time to admire the tomatoes, talk to the vendor. He is so proud of his "Catalunyan" grown produce! We would have greatly offended him had we not taken his yellow and red cherry tomato samples which, as it turned out, were so astoundly good we included that in our take-back-to-our room feast! Any time there is an opportunity to connect with people on a personal level, take it. Life is all the more enriched because of these interactions.Stop at the cheese counter and, again, sample their recommendations (ours was for a mild eating cheese to accompany our vegetarian meal). Excellent again, and she was also a delight to visit with. Everyone works so hard to help us tourists overcome language obstacles and I thank them (fro the bottom of my heart) for that.We also found spinach empanadas which were most excellent (even at room temperature), as well as very nicely prepared salads. All in all, it was easy to find tasty choices for a light meal.This place is a destination, a shopping event, and don't plan on running through here (it would be a waste of time). Bring your camera an capture the uniqueness of the fish stalls, the chicken market, various produce stands, and the "as seen everywhere" ham legs (hanging from delicate little black hooves), sea food, oh, just go there. You have to see this yourself.

Beautiful and busy!. This enclosed marketplace has everything from fresh fruits and vegetables to fish and cured meats. Late in the afternoon it is abuzz with Spaniards collecting their evening meal. If you plan to buy some things for a picnic, know a few Spanish words before you buy, to help make the purchase quick for the vendor. Most of them don't speak 20 languages, including English, like "Me gustaria una rebonada,", "I would like a slice." or "me gustaria quarto kilo" which is about a half pound. I had some lovely Manchego cheese, Serrano ham and blackberries from the market, and felt pretty comfortable ordering with a few key phrases in my pocket. My translator app on my phone made it easy to prepare.

Go!. This is my Achilles heel in Barcelona. Have to return every single time I'm back in Barcelona. I'm attracted by all the colours and how the food looks and is presented. Amazing for pictures. Prices do rise between seasons though, in May the products were slightly cheaper than in July. High season...

Wished We Had More Time!. We kept putting it off because it was just a couple minutes from our hotel - we just drifted in and walked around for about 10-15 minutes. But, this is a place worth spending a little more time around - whether, it's just sitting for a drink at the Pinotxo bar or seating yourself for a meal that could be bought - the food looked fabulous - an employee was working on a gigantic fish for a couple (isn't everything here gigantic; fish, fruit etc?). Crowded, but worth rubbing elbows with some of the locals.

One of my favorites in Barcelona. I loved this place! All the colors and textures of the varied products (mushroom, hams, sausages, fruits, vegies, candy ...) made this market a delight for the senses. And you should have seen the size of the knives that the fish mongers use! It took me quite awhile to go through the entire market, so allow yourself plenty of time if you enjoy markets!And you can stop to eat here too ...

Love this market, but it's so crowded. I love La Boquería -- there are so many different foods, and actually a lot of prepared food as well + restaurants and cafes inside. But when I went in the afternoon/around lunch time it was so crowded with tourists, it's overwhelming. I've also been earlier in the morning, like around 10:30 or 11, and it wasn't crowded at all. So I'd recommend going earlier because it's definitely awesome.

Full Frontal Assault on All Senses - of the best kind !!. This was a must see on our recent trip to Barcelona .Coincidentally we had just seen Masterchef and they had bought the contestants here so we just had to come .The vibrant colours and smells hit you as soon as you walk through the gates !!I have to say this was one of the nicest and best laid out markets I've ever been to and the range of foods on sale is awesome . The fish section and of course the Iberian hams have to be seen to be believed .Everything is well set out and the foods you can buy ready to eat from some of the vendors are ace . We particularly enjoyed the myriad of fresh fruit juices and the freshly made crepe stall has to be tried - killer emmental and Serrano ham crepe - delicious . Followed by deep fried prawns ( gambas ) and Iberian ham !!Very busy and does get quite crowded so watch your pockets but if you like your food then you must not miss this place !Wicked !!

Food Oasis. I randomly found this place looking for outdoor flea markets. I saw everyone taking pictures of the infamous sign so I decided to see what the fuss was about. So many colors! The rows are filled with so much fruit and spices and meats and cheeses. There are a lot of tapas bars but good luck finding a seat. It's a very great market to buy produce and meat. I bought a cup of fruit for 1.5e. I came back again the next day and found myself with a delicious strawberry coconut kiwi smoothie. This place is an awesome experience and aesthetically pleasing.

For anyone who loves food!!!!!!!. We enjoyed La Boqueria so much that we visited it twice during our short 3 night stay in Barcelona. Admittedly, the guide books didn't really rave about this market but I feel they overlooked one of the real gems of the city. Appealing to all your senses of sight, smell and taste, La Boqueria was a kaleidoscope of everything food. Since I was not a big fan of the restaurant food in Barcelona (mainly tapas, cured meats and paella), La Boqueria had everything under the sun in terms of food: fresh fruit juices, fruit cups, baked goods, chocolates, pizzas, sandwiches and nuts. It is definitely a must see and must eat!

Big Assortment of Delicious Fresh Foods. My girlfriend and I stopped by here, and really enjoyed it. As any major tourist attraction, it is packed with people but with good reason. A local told us their natural juices are a must-have, but at the best price. When you get there, you will notice difference prices, most of them at 1.50. However, if you walk around and deeper into the market, you'll find juices for just one Euro! Anyways, make sure you come here with enough time to appreciate everything!
Absolute must for foodies.. Fresh foods of all sorts, this market is a must visit in Barcelona. We enjoyed fresh fruit juice, fruits, meats and many other speciality foods

Outstanding market. The market was recommended to us by the staff at the B&B where we stayed, so on our first night we decided to explore it. There's something for everyone in the market! Fresh fruit and vegetables, meat and fish, delightful chocolates and candies or even fresh smoothies and fruit juices. Definitely explore throughout before making your first purchases as we discovered things were cheaper deeper into the market vs at the entryway. It can be busy, but well worth the time to wander around and explore especially if you are staying in Barcelona several days as you will find many provisions to tide you over between meals.

favorite part. This was by far our favorite part of Barcelona. 1 E fresh juices, tons of fresh fruit, veggies, meat, bread, cheese, seafood, and more! So fun to walk around and just enjoy all the sites/smells. We bought some things and took a picnic out to the park. Don't miss!

Best authentic Spanish food market. My sister who lives in Barcelona invited me to Boqueria, it was amazing, very down to earh. Fresh juices, fresh seafood stand and fruits. The best of all was the cold cuts, El Jamon Iberico de 48 meses.
Nice place to walk around or to take a bite. La Boqueria is a market at the station Liceu. Fish, meat, and food stands everywhere. Really good ice cream at Puerto latino.
great market a must see on your trip!. loved this market.. great atmosphere, great food. id go early in the morning so its not too crowded. the smoothies are so yum here and only €1.. great!!

Do not miss ....must go ... One of my favourite place to explore to see the way of life in Barcelona. Every stall or place to eat ...serve you the best of everything. YOU just want to hang see, smell, taste of everything...ensure you not full from any meal. Love it and highly recommended

Beautiful & Bountiful Boqueria Market. If I had to choose one place to visit in Barcelona without doubt, it would be the Boqueria Market. It's easy to locate; approx 350 meters on the left side of La Ramblas Boulevard from the Columbus statue on the water front.You can't miss it with it's steady flow of people flowing from the various entrances.Even if you have just eaten you will not be able to resist a little something from this food treasure trove. Be it a handful of juicy plump cherries, strawberries, a fresh crunchy apple, peaches or apricots. Maybe a cup of fresh pieces of coconut or one of those delicious fruit smoothies. Actually the chocolates, No the sweeties. Gosh! look at that ice cream it's irresistible. Help me here! there are far too many choices. And we have not even looked at the savouries yet!So don't eat before your visit as many of the market stalls that sell fresh produce will also provide a small dining area, e.g. fresh fish and vegetables or maybe some cured ham and breads, etc. If you wander back into the market there are many choices of something sweet to compliment your meal. The flavours and quality of everything is second to none.If you're on a self catering holiday, there is an abundance of fresh meat, fish, chickens, vegetables, oils herbs and spices. Don't forget your Shopping Trolley!So if you want to be well satiated and uplifted this market is for you! I hope you enjoy my video of the many choices available.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-NXQSff6dxU

Something for Everyone. We live in central Saskatchewan, Canada so we don't have a chance to experience a market like this very often. There's everything one could want - fresh seafood, fruit, nuts, chocolate and meat - and that's just the short list. It's well worth walking through and sampling a few goodies.
A Food Treasury. Here you'll find an amazing amout and variety of fresh fruit, freshly squeezed fruit juices, all kinds of meat, fish, spices etc. Exepct to pay in cash. Very interesting!

Probably one of the best in Europe. I have visited food markets all around Europe, but this I must say is my favorite. It has everything I wish for in a food market. If you are in Barcelona, don´t miss this!

So Glad we found It!. This place is so amazing.It took us some time finding this gem in Barcelona.You must go there hungry!It is a foodies heaven.Freshly prepared seafood, delicious tastings,friendly people and a great variety of fresh fruit,vegetable,meat and seafood. There was even an organic kiosk. Well priced food and drinks.Clean and well maintained not like I imagined.Not a smelly place and something for everyone.Be prepared to wait for a seat.Try the freshly made smoothies and figs!A photographer's paradise,an artist's dream!Just beware of pick pockets.

Markets are fun. This market is beautiful and big. Always filled with lots of people. It has fruits, veggies, meats, and cheese as well as some more unique candy, nuts, and spice shops. The place is very colorful for taking pictures but also full of tourists so you kind of have to move along. I would go here once or twice but do your real shopping in the neighborhood markets.

Love. When one enjoys good food this is the place to go. Discussing and tasting different jamons, cheeses and everything else with inept vendors. Yesterday I had raw baby octopus and they are often willing to sample you a taste. The backside are of course the amount of tourists and pick-pockets plus higher prizes that follows. But still you stand side by side with granny that buys fish heads and livers, which makes me feel great. The furthest in, the better.

Bring Your Camera and Your Appetite. If anything says vacation its a fresh fruit smoothie in Barcelona! This market is absolutely amazing, it's a photographers dream, everything is brightly colored or horrific depending on if your looking at a fruit vendor or a meat vendor. Either way you really cant miss it! It's a bit like Pike Place Market in Seattle, but with more food and an equal amount of people.Make sure you try something new whether it be a smoothie or something you can't quite recognize....be adventurous! Wheelchair users - the market can be a difficult place to maneuver a wheel chair, and a person sitting in the chair may not be able to view all of the vendors. You may want to consider another travel alternative while in the market.

Awesome market. I was very impressed with La Boqueria! The displays of fruit were beautiful. I tried tutti fruttiix of fresh juiced fruit, it was delicious. Cool displays of exotic seafood and a large variety of hand made candies. A must see in Barcelona!

Make sure you visit hungry. This place is every foodies dream come true. When you visit, be ready to be wowed. From the fresh fruit juices at the entrance to the "paella orgasmico" at the rear and everything in between. There is SOMETHING for everyone here!!

Gorgeous fruit, fresh juice, meals. This market is just off La Rambla and was a lot of fun! The fruit and veg in June/July was incredible - fresh figs, flat peaches, heritage tomatoes, strawberries, etc., plus fresh juices you can buy and drink right there - yum! You can also find saffron (at prices similar to those in supermarkets), sweets, nuts, smoked meat, seafood, everything. There are also places to eat inside there and nearby. Definitely worth a visit at meal time!

Lots to eat and very crowded.. There are many vendors selling all sorts of food. From ham to candy to fruits to fish. The crowds are insane especially at the main entrance where sometimes you can't get in at all. There are actually two smaller entrances about a block on either side of the main entrance that are much easier get into. The one food vendor I didn't like was a vegetarian place named Organic Market. Their paella is sooooo greasy. The oil literally drips off your fork as you try to eat it. I had to make several trips to this place to sample all the different foods.

Amazing place. This market is so colorful, with lots of fruits, seafood, cured ham, vegetables and stands with tapas. I loved to see so many types of Jamon Serrano and all sort of produce. The food was great, specially the seafood. We tried Razor Clams and they were delicious. It is a very busy market with lots of tourists. The market is close to La Rambla, a long avenue full of shops, restaurants and street performers.

Wonderful place with lots of colours and smells. This is one of my favorite places in Barcelona with a massive range of food and drink on sale (meat, fish, fruit & vegetables, and packaged foods). It's a great place to stop for a snack or to take something back to your hotel room. We returned there everyday during our stay in Barcelona!However, you should be aware that is very crowded, so watch your bags! Also I found it to be overpriced and not always great value for the money, for instance, the fruit juices at the stalls were not that tasty as it seems like they added too much water in them, and they serve you microwave reheated tapas so when it comes to microwaved French fries it gives a poor result in the end.My advice: visit the whole market before you buy something because prices can vary a lot between the stalls for the same product, and more generally avoid the stalls located at the entrance aisle and go inside the market around the central aisle instead.

Fun, colorful, and a great experience. Fun, colorful, and a great experience. Just off Las Ramblas, it is full with fresh produce and meat as well as all different kinds of sweets. They also sell great fruit smoothies made in the spot. Relatively expensive compared to the supermarkets, but worth a look.

Colourful, something for all of your senses!!!. We happened upon this market by chance, tucked away next to the Dunkin Donuts shop off Las Ramblas. We are pleased we did not miss it.There are a number of markets to visit, as far as we are concerned this is the best. Saturday was fantastic, Sunday closed and Monday great but many fish stalls shut (no fishing on weekends so no fresh fish Mondays!).The colours are incredible, the stall holders competing visually with each other for your business. The noise is great, everyone talking, stall holders shouting.The smells tell you where you at anytime, fish, spice, fruit, tapas, coffee. Close your eyes and guess.The tastes are great, a good place for breakfast and to start the day before it gets too hot. The tapas bars are fantastic and you can eat anything that you can see around you. Prices are reasonable and the service quick.We were under whelmed by Las Ramblas, felt it held little originality but the Mercat de Sant Josep de la Boqueria was excellent. The number of locals eating and buying their produce there made it feel authentic and we certainly enjoyed the visits we made.

La Boqueria Market. This is so much fun. I love markets and always visit them. The different stalls offering all kinds of things. We had lunch at La Universal, they had daily menus for 10 euros and the food was delicious!!!

Great ambience. Great ambiance. We visited there after lunching. But there're a lot of nice (and not expensive) places to eat in the market, in a much more unique ambiance then can be supplied in any restaurant on LaRambla. Highly recommended.

Awesome Market. This is a must see, great market and there are a few restaurants. In the main entrance there is a vendor that sells great smoothies. Directly across is a vendor that sells great chocolates and other candies. This is a great walk through as you waling La Rambla as its a straight shot.

Worth a visit. I was nervous to enter the crowds that mobbed this place, but I'm glad we made our way here. We marveled at the stunning variety of food and beverages available. Watch your personal items here (as with any crowded touristy site). The place is definitely worth a look...and some sampling. Some of the items were reasonably priced; some not so much. Make sure you understand the exact price before you accept your goodies and hand over your money.

Big outdoor market, interesting food!. We stopped there mid morning and the place was crowded with people buying their food for the day. Extremely fresh and plentiful. It reminded me of the open markets in Chinatown in Honolulu Hawaii. Very interesting local foods, and you can also get food to eat and drinks/coffee as well. I was impressed!

Wonderful market. Wonderful market with fresh fruits, vegetables, spices, fish, meat. We went there every morning for breakfast. Fresh fruit cups, fruit juice and croissants what more could you want. There are several stalls where you can sit down to eat.
Athmosphare!. A lot of good produce, a lot of people, a lot of fun, a lot of places to eat and drink at, here, you can spend a lot of time!

Everything is good!!!!!. A stop at the boqueria is a must do in Bacelona ! Have lunch here, have breakfast here... Even dinner! Closes at 8:00pm. Everything is delicious. Make sandwiches, for picnics around the city! Have a smoothie. Try something new! Be adventurous. That's my advice! I absolutely love everything about this place!

You must experience this food market mecca!. This unique market is arguably the best part of Las Ramblas and perhaps the only part that isn't a flagrant tourist trap. The market is not far from the mid point of Las Ramblas and has a slightly ominous entrance with several additional alleyway entrances but you absolutely must walk through the entirety of the market and experience some of the truly eclectic vendor offerings. This isn't to say the entire market is unique, as you will see more than your fair share of fruit/smoothie stalls. But deeper within the market are some really unique sandwich vendors and some truly colorful specialty stands, in addition to fresh seafood and produce stands. Several sit-down tapas restaurants are toward the back, and the market itself is lined with a wide variety of restaurants and cafes. The vendors are reasonably accommodating of tourists snapping photos, but some of the vendors that rely on locals won't hesitate to shoo you along. Highly recommend getting some of the ham offerings and trying some of the fruit stands. Some very interesting candy offerings can be found near the center. When in doubt for the tapas vendors, I'd assume the more patrons the better a location. And if you do wander through the market, be sure to stop by Rita Blue (http://www.ritablue.com/) for perhaps the best sangria you'll have in Barcelona!!

Large Market, Worth the Crowds. This market was very crowded, however the vast amount of produce, fish, meat, and other goods more than make up for it. There are places in the market that can provide tasty lunch options on the go, so definitely come with a hungry tummy :)

Great market full of interesting foods and with restaurants. We walked into the market which is right on Las Ramblas, bought interesting local foods, observed the beautiful stalls from fish to fruits, from candy to prosciutto. And then we ate at a restaurant inside the market watching the crowds go by.

Amazing place to visit in Barcelona . La Boqueria is just a must see in Barcelona. Close to the Rambla, this market will surprise you with all the colors and savors you'll experience during your visit. This is a famous spot for tourists so don't go there of you want to avoid the crowd but if not, make sure to add this market to your to do list!

Worth planning a meal just so you can shop here!. Although it was too crowded when we were here, we made a special point of changing our plans so we could shop for a meal to prepare using our purchases from this market. The produce was stunningly beautiful and the selection was amazing!

A treat for the eyes and sences! But not the cheapest.. Everytime I visit Barcelona, I always make sure to take a stroll around in the marked. It is a mekka for all foodies, and the variety of cheese, meats, tropical fruit and fresh fish is immense. And they have tasty small snacks. But if you are looking for a place to buy your daily groceries, go to the smaller Mercat de Catarina in el Born (close to the cathedral). That is a real local marked with no tourists and much cheaper.

My favorite part of Las Ramblas. I was not thrilled by the touristy gimmicks that crowd Las Ramblas, but La Boqueria is an exception. Don't get me wrong, it is still mobbed by tourists (myself included) but the vendors have quality products to back it up. I had the pleasure of grabbing lunch at Pinotxo (approx €15 for their famous squid and beans and a glass of clara) and got a small fresh juice for €1 to go at one of the many fruit stands. Definitely stop by, eat and walk around a little.

Sensational experience. From La Rambla you can access this amazing market where you can see beautiful colors and smell good food (and fish) Typical market where you can stay for a lunch of just taste the local product. I recommand it

Culinary heaven or browsing fun. Fabulous marketplace with fresh… anything! Fruits, vegetables, meat, fish, mushrooms, you name it. If you are self-catering during you travel, this is a culinary heaven. If not, try fruit juices or enjoy a tapas (fresh fish/shellfish) and a glass of wine (the tapas places can be quite crowded, though). Nothing here is really cheap, but I have always been happy with the quality (dried mushrooms, foie gras, lomo, chorizo, fruits, juices).Then again you can just walk around and be amazed by what they have for sale. One of my favourite places in Barcelona!

Fantastic market, dont miss it if you're a foodie. THIS is the market to visit in Spain, they sell cones of meat for 1 Euro and all other delicious home cured treats, thousands of cheeses and fruits and all sorts. Spectacular!
Definitely a must see. Amazing market with a great variety of foods and drinks. Delicious and fresh fruit juices! Wish I had one of these markets close to home! I will definitely be going back!

Considered among the top 5 markets in the world....don't miss it!. "la Boqueria" as the market is fondly called, is a mecca of the very best of fresh and preserved ingredients for dinner TONIGHT. Incredibly high-quality ingredients are a revelation and the very best thing to do is to go there with a day's worth of menus planned, and to shop accordingly. Everyone is so helpful and will work to understand exactly what you need and ...with good humor and patience.The market is usually mobbed all day long, EXCEPT early in the morning when it opens; go then, to have the full market experience without the crowds. Don't expect to bargain; these are the best ingredients int he world, and the merchants know it. Paying the full price is part of the way you say "thank you" for bringing theses wonderful foodstuffs to the market at the PEAK of perfection. It is a virtual explosion of color,m smells, flavors, and people!Step off la Rambla long enough to gasp.

Fruit juices are amazing. Very busy, hectic experience. Food is generally cold or reheated so not the best but their fruit juices are amazing. Don't buy the 4 euro cups near the entrance, off to the side they're only one euro per cup.

Sensory delight.
